title: Communite
logline: A Creative Multiplayer City-Builder for communities to build their perfect world together!
description:
Communite is a multiplayer town building simulator! 
 Create your own village in a shared world, while helping others construct theirs! 
 Unlock new tiles as you level up! Co-operate with others to finish higher tier buildings! Build your own Home in your personal area (and invite others to visit!) Rescue adorable NPCs around the world and become their friend! Play a relaxing minigame to decompress (if you can find it)! 
 Be kind and use your creative spark to bring joy to others! PC HOTKEYS: 
 WASD - Move Camera  Num Keys (Starting right to left from 1-7!) - Place Tiles Shortcut Arrows Keys/Mouse Swipe - Change Menu Pages U - Undo J - Join Q - Quickbuild Enter - Submit Text!

title: Odd Realm
logline: Take control of a group of settlers to build a settlement that survives the passing seasons.
description:
[INCLUDES A STEAM KEY] - *Unless you buy the game through a bundle! 
 
 Features 
 4 races to start your kingdom with, each with unique playstyles 
 Unlimited procedurally generated deserts, mountains, tropical islands, and frozen tundra 
 Dynamic weather and seasons unique to each biome 
 Hundreds of plants, animals, and items 
 A research tree with options for each race that unlock new blueprints and rooms 
 Outfit individual settlers with tools, weapons, and gear 
 Manage your kingdom and view other kingdoms on an expansive world map 
 Battle raiders, invading armies, and underground horrors 
 Choose from thousands of generated landscapes to make your new home. A desert oasis? The ribcage of a long-dead giant? A magical mountain range? Where you choose to settle will determine what resources you have at your disposal, what you encounter, and how challenging your experience will be. Use the resources in your environment to build... well.. whatever you want! A sandstone castle in the desert? An underground fortress? Or, maybe, an island beach house? You decide! Dig mines into the earth to uncover lost tombs, dormant gods, and lakes filled with creatures watching from the deep. Just make sure not to go too deep! Welcome the less-than-friendly arrival of your neighbors with cold steel and hugs made of arrows. Ask questions later. 
 Community 
 Discord:  https://discord.gg/2hwG8by

title: Roses in The Flames
logline: One day you wake up in reality and the next day is a fantasy. What if that fantasy is a world full of dragons?
description:
Great news! Roses In The Flames is now free to download once more! Have fun! You can now download this game! Game banner  created by Ace 
 
   Snowy | Fandom   Magma | Fandom     Gwendolyn | Fandom     Margaret | Fandom 
 
   Saxor | Fandom 
 
 
 
   Asher | Fandom 
 
 
   Thomas | Fandom 
 
 
 What would you do if you woke up tomorrow not knowing you will be stepping into another reality that very same day? What if that reality is inhabited by dragons? You are the main character who had the mysterious fate of walking through a magical pond and only to discover after resurfacing, you find out its a world inhabited by Dragons.  At first, everything seemed so strange after meeting the first dragon, and then the second. After seeing this world for yourself you realize it's not so bad to be living in Draconia. However, living with dragons comes with its own problems. This game is a current work of progress, and the official demo version will be released.  You can support us here: Roses In The Flames  
 Follow us on Twitter, Facebook, and Reddit too! >>>  Facebook >>>  Twitter >>>  Reddit 
 Join our Discord Group! >>>  Discord   
 Wanting to donate and support the project? Donate to us either on our Patreon or Paypal! 
 >>>  Patreon >>> @Roses In The Flames/@Naomi23295  Curious about checking out our website?  RosesinTheFlames Wiki | Fandom

title: Balls, Dice & Stickers
logline: A roguelike deckbuilder with balls, dice and stickers.
description:
Hi! This is the alpha version of the game. It likely needs balancing, bug fixes and a lot more content. Please let me know if you have any issues or suggestions. Thank you for playing! 
 
 ABOUT THE GAME 
 Balls, Dice & Stickers is a roguelike deckbuilder. 
 You throw balls at dice and use stickers to trigger wild effects. 
 
 FEATURES 
 50+ stickers (more are coming) with multiple unique effects. 36 quirky characters to defeat. A lot of ball throwing. Frogs can hijack spaceships. 
 
 Please add the game to your  wishlist  and  follow  for updates.

title: Welcome to Elderfield
logline: A spooky farming RPG
description:
Synopsis 
 Nothing is usual in the secluded town of Elderfield. The townsfolk are odd, strange beings shift about in the dark and the local news reports seem more mysterious by the day. This is where you were born, and rarely do those born here leave...
 
 But, there is work to be done. Now finished with your schooling, you have an endless supply of free time and very little direction. Explore, earn money, make friends, solve mysteries, start a farm, cook food, go fishing, beseech the Old Gods, talk to the dead, cower beneath the pale moon and try not to die in you sleep. Welcome to Elderfield.
 
 
 
 Features 
 Explore a mysterious open world
 Start a farm - growing crops, raising animals and processing goods
 Cook different kinds of food to sustain your exploration
 Fight deadly creatures and bosses as you delve deeper into forbidden places
 Go fishing...
 Explore randomly generated mines with shifting layouts and hidden secrets
 Forge new gear to best tougher foes
 Explore without end - you choose when to sleep... if at all
 Interact with local townsfolk, many of which live on their own varied schedules
 Give gifts and complete tasks to befriend the locals
 Forage for materials that generate around the world
 Find randomized loot around every corner
 And much, much more...
 
 
 
 Demo Info 
 The Welcome to Elderfield alpha demo is a vertical-slice of what is to come. The demo features one area of the town, the farm and ranch, the first "dungeon" area - the local mall - and several smaller places to explore. The final game is expected to have more than 3x the town size, at least 2 more "dungeon" areas like the mall, and multiple levels to each of those areas. The final game will also include new features such as Old God alignment, calendar-based events, quality of life features and much more of everything that is already here. The demo represents roughly 1/6 of the planned finished game.
 
 Alpha updates beyond the demo will be available to play for  Patreon  members. These updates will be released as the game is developed, so Patrons can provide feedback and experience the full game as it comes together - bugs and all!
 
 Your feedback is vitally important!  
 
 Any comments left on Itch, our  Discord  or our  Patreon  page will be read and considered for future updates.
 
 Please let me know if you experience any bugs, have any game balance/pacing feedback, or if there are any changes/features you'd like to see.

title: When Civilians Dig Holes
logline: An idle game about digging a hole to the other side of the world
description:
This is a demo of my new idle game about digging a hole to the other side of the world. The game is still in development so any feedback or bug reports are greatly appreciated! 
 LATEST UPDATE: The game will ask for your consent to collect player analytics data. I am using this data to understand player behaviors and understand which features players gravitate towards! But you can always choose to opt out too.  
 TIP: if the game starts lagging, you can click the "eye" button in the top right of the 3D hole view to toggle some of the UI animation on the grid. I am working on a more robust solution to the lag now ! 
 
 Current version : 0.3.2 
 
 If you would prefer to leave feedback via Google form,  you can do so here . :-) Discord server for the game is here :  https://discord.gg/SJn88X9p  !

title: Nubby's Number Factory
logline: A game where you run a number factory
description:
Nubby's Number Factory  is a game about running a number factory. The goal is to make big numbers to level up your factory and make even bigger numbers!  
 Full release -  3/7/2025   on steam! ( Find it here! ) 
 
 
 --------- 
 Join the Nubby discord! 
 ------------- 
 Buy the full game on steam! 
 Play the demo on steam! 
 --- 
 You can enjoy the demo release of Nubby's Number Factory by downloading the file  below. As far as I know, it works well on Windows machines, but I cannot guarantee it will work smoothly on Mac or Linux machines.  In future updates, I will add support for mac and linux. I will also add localization for CIS regions / Russia, among other languages by play request. This game can only be played with a keyboard & mouse. 
 In this demo you'll find: 
 -A complete tutorial 
 -60 levels 
 
 
 -Lots of replayability value: 
 -24 unique items to be discovered 
 -17 unique perks that modify your runs 
 -5 bosses (3 encountered in each game) 
 -7 special events  
 -7 different pegboard layouts 
 -Developer console for doing crazy things (shift + enter while in game to enable)
recent_comments: I just want to say you have something really special here. I played the demo on Steam recently and bought the game the next day. Your aesthetic, sense of humor, and gameplay progression is just spot on. All I had to see is that Northernlion enjoyed the game and I know this is going to be a breakout hit; if you can get this on mobile I see this hitting Balatro levels of popularity. See you at the Game Awards this year, my friend. P.S: Good luck with your development journey! You have definitely inspired me to work on a game of my own. What engine/programming language are you using for Nubby?

Thank you for the kind words! Always has been a big dream of mine to at least attend the game awards - fingers crossed hahaFor Nubby, I used GameMaker Studio 2 and its native language, GML. From what I've gathered, it's similar in some ways to javascript. Good luck with your game development journey! It's a heck of a time for sure.

I really like a lot of the changes in this update- the new music, pegs, events, and items are all dope- but I honestly think I like the previous version more. Perks are no replacement for item traits! The de-emphasis on luck and RNG in the item shop was necessary, I understand, but I feel like there was way more build diversity when the perk abilities were tied to the items and their respective proc rates. Though it did make Flutty very broken. I think this change in direction definitely works, especially if more items and perks are added, but I will grieve my v0.25 instant board-clear build that immediately crashed the game.
Will continue to play and follow development!

title: Terraformental
logline: Try to survive and perhaps eventually even tame an unknown planet in this incremental semi-idle game.
description:
Try to survive and perhaps eventually even tame an unknown planet in this incremental semi-idle game. 
 Inspired by  Increlution , though if you've played that game, please be aware that the looping mechanic in this doesn't start unless/until you reach a certain point. So you do have to do some planning to make sure you survive long enough first time around. 
 This project is currently in early access, with a prologue and two chapters of the story available. I aim to release major content updates at least once every 2 months. 
 Discord Server:  Shady Games Discord 
 Roadmap:  Trello Roadmap 
 Donate:  Ko-Fi 
 All known bugs are pinned in the bugs forum on the Discord server. Please check there before posting bug reports. 
 If you'd like to donate to help the development of the game, I'd very much appreciate whatever amount you feel it's worth. If possible, please donate via  Ko-Fi  rather than here on Itch, as I get a much larger percentage of the amount you send.
recent_comments: I'm honestly not even mad about losing the skills in the update. I see where the dev is coming from where it will cause balance issues while incorporating timers in the late game when you have all these maxed out skills. So far, the familiarity system they incorporated instead has been great. I do feel like breaking doors should kinda be a true to each other type of thing (each door broken in a loop will make it easier to break all doors in every loop. I understand it probably will never be like that because it would be a pain in the backside to code into the game.

There will be another combined action to combine more of the rover actions, but it's unlikely to include the generator since you don't always want to bring that with you.Glad you enjoyed the update though!

Alright, this is a pretty cool update! Some thoughts-The new area was pretty cool to explore! I love how the Laurion-tier challenge of "Can you survive in the rover for X amount of time" is flipped to "Can you clear Santorini in X amount of time" which is pretty neat. I also liked how reading the logs in Santorini unlocked new stuff to do in Laurion- Excited to see more stuff like this in the future. -I'm split on the new resource system. On one hand, it does a much better job at creating a sense of progression, with long timesinks like repairing the rover and long-distance travel able to be reduced much more substantially without making later parts too easy. On the other hand, it does get a bit weird in some circumstances- what's so different between exiting/entering the rover in various locations? It's the exact same action in principle.-The new game balance in general is a bit harder than before. I appreciate that the changes   make installing the generator a viable option, rather than useless like it was before.-While the resource priority system is really cool in theory, in practice, having it reset everything to auto every loop is rather annoying, especially since this must be done at multiple points per loop as various resources are rediscovered.-Combined tasks system was really cool for the most part, but it had an issue in some cases where you'd want to do the subtasks. For example, once you unlock the gather supplies option, there's no way to enter laurion directly without installing the generator or interrupting the gather supplies action.

Glad you enjoyed it overall! To address some of your issues:- I've already planned a v2 of the familiarity system, which should smooth over most of the biggest problems with the current one (like the rover actions being different bonuses between locations) - Familiarity v2 on the Roadmap.- I do plan to add a toggle option for saving the resource priorities between loops. Personally, since the preferred priorities wherever you end a loop are unlikely to match the ones at the start of a loop, I'd rather they reset to auto so I don't forget to change them and the character does something stupid. But I can see why people would want the option.- Combined actions are also queued for an upgrade. The main thing will probably be making travel actions appear both inside and outside combined actions, so that you can still travel.

You can click on the chevron next to combined tasks to get the subtasks... with that it's fairly easy to just queue the 'exit rover, gather supplies' parts... or even just the 'gather water' part of the 'gather supplies' combined actions, etc.
Does look kinda funky with the four? tiered combined action for repairing the rover tho... so much ungrouping possible.
Ah, so you can. Not sure why I didn't think of clicking on the subtasks, thanks for pointing that out.

The relationship between "active units", "seconds", and "inventory units" needs to be clarified. It is not clear.

So how much do I need to stockpile before I fix power? Why can't I do some power work, eat/drink, do more?

You can stop to get more food/water. Your character won't do it automatically, but you can cancel an action any time you want, or you can click the 'start action immediately' button when you're half way through something else. In either case, progress on the action will be saved, and you can resume it where you left of later.That being said, I do agree that the UI needs work, and clearly it may be benficial to add a tutorial which explains things like this.

Especially with the idea of improving and learning on the next run, I actually think babying people throughout the intro would be a downgrade and something which takes away from the experience to a quite notable degreeResuming progress shows itself if you try, X and queue is pretty evident tooIt's just a case of not wanting to look at it and learn, shouldn't take it to heart much
I do tend to agree.  For now, I'll aim to improve the UI, but will leave an explicit tutorial for if/when a larger number of people have issues learning the game.

Sorry. There is no obvious queue, no obvious stop action, etc.Consider what a new player sees. They press a button, wait a few seconds, and get the result. They keep doing this -- press a button, see what happens.Your description of a queue, and improving on the next run -- that sounds like either Idle Loops, or Cavernous -- and both of those make it absolutely clear from time zero that there is a queue and a need to restart/redo over and over.Nothing like that is apparent when playing this.

Given that the queue literally has a title oh "Queue", I'm going to assume it's off screen for you for some reason. Are you playing on a phone, or a PC with low resolution? Either way, I suspect it'll be resolved in v0.2, as it scales to resolution way better than the current version.

This is going to be a long post.First playthrough was actually really fun and I'd happily see more - although the fact that your water supply would be limited should've been made more apparent sooner (in that you can't fix it), or the option to siphon a pouch into a bottle for storageInitially didn't like the rebirth and replaying the same starting segment (although did get curious about powerlevelling the destruction trait)Worth noting the exploration trait is far lower on the second run, and it's unclear exactly what the blue bars and their length mean aside from you progress quickerAs others have said, the skip derelict rover check doesn't disappear when you visit itThe 'Destroy main door' check should be shown to you to know it's an option even if you turn power on before examining the door (First run)Inventory/tasks could be a predetermined order (organising) rather than as you discover them, as well as ideally renewable sources of materials should be prioritised in consumption over finite ones (Water pouch being drunk before small water bottle -suspect it's just an order problem but it's a pain in the arse for the rover trip)Would appreciate mention of any other cryopods in either initial exploration or a second check over when your life isn't hanging in the balance, to ensure you aren't damning anyone else you're leaving behind (or hey maybe you already have some other plans for that already)Being able to harvest a resource when full to top off your metres would be good (otherwise cancelling when a full inventory is still fine- like an additional prompt to harvest despite full although I acknowledge this could be exploited regarding levels)And a prompt that "Doing this will disable other actions" would be good too, even if you want mistakes and death to be a core gameplay element (by the way- two fullscreen buttons on the browser version)Ultimately, definitely want to see more development and anticipating where this could go, certainly wouldn't mind being a guinea pig, keep up the good work, hope to see it on the front page of Itch in time

Thank you so much for the kind words and detailed response! I definitely agree that having a better indication of limited vs unlimited actions would be useful, though I'm unsure how I'd do that without making the action buttons larger to fit a done/max counter... An icon or different colour would work, but people still have to learn what it means in the first place. I'll throw a note on the list to think about for if/when I work on a content update.
I had intended to make tooltips for the skills, which would've broken down your current multipliers, but ran out of time (for my self-imposed deadline). I may be able to fit them into the bugfix patch I'll do in the next few days. That combined with the post-loop breakdown screen should clear things up.
Added note to tweak the 'Force Ground Floor Door' action in the bugfix. It was only actually hidden initially due to a technical limitation which I then fixed for the Admin Door.
I have a few plans for the Action and Inventory panels, but they'll all likely have to wait for the content update. Currently items are consumed in order of how much they restore, which honestly is just a holdover from Increlution, but Terraformental has increasingly become a slightly different style of game, so you may be right that it should change... Yeah, I'll try to fit this into the bugfix.
It can be difficult to decide how much to fit into a single log message, as I didn't want to have a single message scrolling off the screen, or generally put people off reading them. But you do raise a good point that I could add extra 'Explore more carefully' actions once you have access to all the unlimited resources and are stabilised.
As you say, harvesting when full would be very exploitable for farming XP. The closest I'd consider is if your inventory is full, but you're missing enough of the resource that you could instantly consume it, then maaaaybe? But I'd want to build up more of the game, so I have a better idea of what impact that might have on balance before I made that kind of change.
I can definitely add a 'disable other actions' warning of some kind on some actions, but it'd likely be in the content update.
Thanks for the offer - I'll be sure to keep you in mind if I get around to doing beta tests. Though if I'm honest, I doubt I'll get it to the front page (as nice as that would be) xD
If you have the conviction and dedication, it could go far, *Will* go far - all it takes is time and thought, there's no maybeYou'll do just fine

Great demo :)
Want to point out that there is exploit for some of XP in current version coming from the fact that attempting to start harvesting action for 5/5 items still advances time by small amount. So with enough amount of clicking it eventually reaches the point when item is being consumed and harvesting starts.
Ooo, very nice catch. Thanks, I'll add a ticket to fix that in v0.2!

Only just noticed this.. creative feature, got pointed out (yes I knew of it)If you are going to get rid of it i'd suggest again to consider a collecting whilst full mechanicIt felt annoying enough to do that people wouldn't try to farm it (not casually at least) but it was also a really really useful tool if you were like 0.02 units away from being able to harvest and consume another resource without some other action to queue (used it a fair bit, to top up water as much as possible before setting out- and with the collection times being so fast anyway it was not worthwhile to farm xp from it)When there's no leaderboard and if it breaks anything it would only be breaking for themselves, I think it's definitely something that could be.. accidentally overlooked, if there won't be a different mechanic to fill the holeAlternate fixes would probably be too complex to be worth the dev time for nowThought I should say something before it gets patched and makes it all *even* harder without purpose

That is a fair observation... I'd certainly be happy to allow completing a pickup action to ~99% even when you're full. But I feel allowing actually picking items up when you're full would cause people to accidentally pick things up without realising they're full.I suppose if it was REALLY wanted then I'd consider adding a button which lets you consume an item early, so long as you have space for at least 90% of it or something? Maybe have a toggle option to automatically do it when you're trying to pick up another of that item? I'll add it to the 'maybe' list for v0.2, but it may be up being pushed back to a later version depending how long things take. I'm going to try and stick to a similar schedule of working on major updates for ~2 weeks then release it, rather than end up feature creeping.

May be add new actions counter? I thought it's simplest solution. May be isn't so elegant, but useful.  (Especially in games where old actions don't disappear but still moved to archive part)
Oooh, yes. That works. Just a little indicator on the Actions title for 'X new' so long as there are any. Thanks!
Even just keeping the highlight until it's been moused over - but it doesn't seem like a particular issue when mistakes and looking around how to do things better is part of the game anyway

Thank you for the kind words!I did have plans for a post-loop breakdown, but ended up pushing it back to v0.2.0. Other than a bugfix update in the next few days, I plan to take a break by working on a different game for a short time before I decede whether or not to start on a content update for this. Neat game! Seems pretty interesting so far ( I got back to the derelict ship for the second life), but you probably shouldn't have the option to skip the derelict ship still available once you arrive at it.Also, it's pretty easy to soft-lock yourself in the first run by removing the food coupler before you finish fixing the ship, at which point you have to start over from the beginning because you won't have the food to get to the ship. Overall, a fun game though! Thanks for finding that bug with skipping the derelict - the requirements for when the actions do/don't appear get pretty tangled at times, so it's easy to miss edge cases like that. I'll have to think on it.Thanks for your comment!

title: Delectatio Morosa: A Conclave Visual Novel
logline: The conclave is over: you are still a manager
description:
The conclave is over: you are still a manager. 
 Delectatio Morosa: A  Conclave Visual Novel  is a  dating  managing sim fan project. 
 Play as  Dean Thomas Cardinal Lawrence  as he prepares for All Saints' Day.  After the conclave, the Vatican only has  one week  to prepare for the upcoming celebrations and the responsibility to manage his Curia members, and growing feelings for them, falls upon you. 
 FEATURING 
 
 Expressive character sprites 
 70k+ words of Curial management 16 original illustrations to unlock 
 "Managing" all your Curia members simultaneously (but watch out!) 
 Vatican secret endings 
 
 
 CAST MEMBERS 
 DEAN OF THE COLLEGE OF CARDINALS 
    Thomas Lawrence   Papalcule manager aka "You" 
 6 CURIA MEMBERS TO "MANAGE" 
     Pope Innocent XIV   God's official bestie 
 
     Aldo Bellini   The liberal secretary, not the drink 
 
     Goffredo Tedesco    Vaper, fascist, worstie 
 
     Sister Agnes   Silently judging, matron style 
 
     Joshua Adeyemi   Recovering misogynist 
 
     Joseph Tremblay   Gaslight, gatekeep, girlboss 
 SECRETARY TO THE DEAN 
   Ray O'Malley     Your constant companion 
 FAQ AND OTHER LINKS 
 FAQ 
 Meet the team 
 Submit a bug report Walkthrough (coming soon!) 
 "Love your neighbor as yourself." - Matthew 22:39

title: Spirits of Steel: A New Dawn
logline: An alt history simulator / grand strategy game.
description:
The world stands on a precipice as nations scramble to forge the new world order. Take charge of any country throughout historical, and alternative history scenarios. Build industry, forge alliances, and wage war to spread your sphere of influence. 
 An alt-history grand strategy game, and the sequel to Spirits of Steel. With 400+ playable countries, 8 maps based on history and popular alt history scenarios, and more. 
 Special thanks to Sonak, Damien, and Kate for testing the game ahead of release. 
 Join us on our  discord server  for game updates, feedback, and news on other projects. 
 
 Maps 
 The Great War (1914) Second World War (1936) The Darkest Hour (1941) Iron Curtain (1949) Cuban Missile Crisis (1962) Modern Day (2024) Kaiserreich Red World 
 
 Controls 
 W / A / S / D, up / left / down / right : camera controls space : open / close side bar, close decision tree escape : open menu f1 : screenshot f2 : disable / enable UI f3 : disable / enable timelapse divisions 
 f4 : tutorial 
 f5 : population statistics f6 : military size statistics f7 : region count statistics f8 : industry statistics left click : UI controls right click : division controls brackets, scroll wheel : zoom in / out

Thanks for your comment. The game did release in a very unstable build and I'm actively working on fixing crashes with feedback from the community.

The disappearing menus, allied nations not doing anything and blatantly cheating AI spawning in divisions really make war frustrating, especially when your units just refuse to move or attack as instructed. While it looks promising as a remake it could really use some work.
Could you elaborate more on your criticisms?

The AI nations seem to be able to ignore manpower constraints and also just get divisions when you declare war on them and the economy has no effect on the game beyond canals and ports. The combat overall is very unintuitive and seems to break reguarly when you fight for more then a few days, with units still having the movement lines but not progressing or damaging eachother. All of these combined make combat incredibly annoying to figure out for me.

The AI nations do not ignore manpower constraints, they just deploy more divisions when you declare war on them, as you can as well. Economy does matter, it's required to resupply divisions. Divisions will wait to go into a battle unless they are fully supplied, otherwise nothing will happen (as per why the units have movement lines but don't damage each other). You can refer to the tutorial for more details.I do agree with you however that this is not communicated well outside of the tutorial, so I will work on improving that.

I haven't tried, however, russia does have the most overpowered defensive terrain on the map, so that may help when whittling down white russia. Also, civil wars only start if your ideology does not match the nation you are trying to become, so you can skip it by changing your country to being communist first.
How did you make the province system? I am big into the hoi4 community on scratch and want to know how it works so I have the ability to potentially recreate it.

Each region has a culture associated with it. When you annex a region, it checks the culture of that region and adds it to a dictionary which every country has with the key being the culture, and the item being a list of all the regions the country owns with that culture. From that, you can get the region ids of each region in a province by just getting the item associated with a certain key within the country class.
Interesting, also, how do you get the computer to recodnize that the regions are separate? on scratch we have to copy every region into a clone. How did you do it here?

The regions are all represented by one large dictionary where the first element is a unique color associated with that on the region map, the second is it's location on the map, and the third is a list of every region which that region connects to. It works to be a very rudimentary way of implementing a graph data structure.

title: Dungeon Duel Monsters
logline: Yugioh Constructed & Draft Simulator
description:
Dungeon Duel Monsters 
 
    DDM is a multipurpose platform for 2-player Yugioh gameplay.
 
 
    Enjoy unique  Dungeon Draft  experiences or build decks for any  Constructed Format ,
    then duel against opponents in a sleek manual simulator; all in the same program!
 
 
 Join our Discord server  to explore the
     many Draft Campaigns  available to play.
 
 
 
 Constructed Duels 
  âª In Constructed Duels, you have access to all cards legal for the format you're playing.   âª You can create your own Constructed Format from a cardpool of your own creation,   âª Or try out any of the retro formats built-in to the App, such as Goat, Edison,and Tengu. 
 
 
 Duel Features 
  âª Intuitive duel interface.   âª Combo at the speed of lightpulsar dragon with hotkeys.   âª Save brain power with automatic LP & ATK/DEF buttons.   âª Dedicated "Card Rulings" button.   âª Many other quality-of-life features, such as automatic Tokens & Trap Monster Stats. 
 
 
 Dungeon Draft 
  âª In Dungeon Drafts, players build decks from scratch with cards from packs and events.   âª After dueling, return to the dungeon to grab more cards.   âª Repeat until one duelist stands victorious! 
 Create your own Dungeon Draft

title: Tungtung's Nightmare
logline: tungtungsahur is real
description:
is tungtungsahur real? 
 "This game is inspired by the brainrot meme 'Tungtungtung Sahur' from Indonesia. In this meme, if someone doesnât wake up for sahur, they will be terrorized by a creature called Tungtung.
What is Sahur (Suhoor)?
Sahur, also known as Suhoor, is the pre-dawn meal eaten by Muslims during the month of Ramadan. It is an important part of fasting, as it provides energy before abstaining from food and drink until sunset. Missing sahur can make fasting more difficult, which is why people are often woken up in creative or loud ways." 
 This game tells about 
 You stay up late and feel sleepy. Instead of having sahur (Suhoor), you decide to go back to sleep, but../p>

title: Velistra: Failed State
logline: Politics, power, and a nation on the brink.
description:
Description 
 The nation is on the brink of collapse, and youâve just been handed the reins of power. In  Failed State , you must navigate the murky waters of politics, diplomacy, and survival in a world where every decision shapes the future. This darkly satirical strategy game challenges you to hold your nation together - or let it spiral into chaos. 
 Key Features 
 Shape the Future:  Decide the fate of a divided nation with tough choices and moral dilemmas.
 Navigate Alliances:  Deal with ministers, diplomats, and the opposition - each with their own agendas.
 Unique Playthroughs:  Every decision matters. Reach every of 8 possible endings or die trying. 
 Credits 
 Code/Gamedesign:  Ivan Antsiferov Art/Covers:  Polina Antsiferova

title: PancitoMerge
logline: "Merge matching breads to create new ones in PancitoMerge, a Mexican bakery twist on drop-merge fun!
description:
PancitoMerge  is a delightful "drop merge" game inspired by the beloved  Suika Game , but with a delicious Mexican bakery twist! Immerse yourself in the vibrant world of Mexican breads, which are a cornerstone of the countryâs culture and cuisine—perfect for meals, celebrations, or a quick snack. As you play, discover and learn about each bread by clicking/tapping on them in the info panel. 
 How to Play: 
 The goal is simple: merge matching breads to create higher-level ones, aiming for the highest score possible while unlocking every type of bread in a single run. But be careful—the game ends if the breads stack up to the top of the bag! 
 Unique Twist: 
 Every 5 drops, a customer arrives with a specific bread request. Fulfill their order by clicking/tapping on the requested bread in the bag.  
 Why Youâll Love It :
 
 A charming Mexican bakery theme with authentic breads to discover.
 Simple yet addictive gameplay with a strategic customer mechanic.
 Perfect for quick sessions or long playthroughs.
 
 Help Us Grow! 
 Weâre considering expanding  PancitoMerge  into a bigger version for PC, console, and mobile. If youâd love to see that happen, let us know in the comments! 
 Technical Details :
 
 Made in Godot.
 Works seamlessly on mobile.
 Partial controller support included.
 Note : Safari (iPhone/iPad) users may experience occasional reloads; we recommend using another browser for the best experience. 
 Credits: Art by  Vanila Ryder Music & SFXs by  Rich Cervantes Code & Design by  FÃ¡yer Darumadrop One font by  Maniackers Design 
 Special Thanks :
 To all our friends, family, and the amazing communities ( Indi-Es ,  Arts Friends ,  !ScoreVG, Cacasa ,  Gamedevs Sur , and more) who tested early versions and provided invaluable feedback.
 
 Hope you have fun playing  PancitoMerge —letâs bake some high scores together!

title: Sort to 15
logline: A recreation of the number sorting challenge from Survivor Season 48, Episode 2: 'Humble Traits.'
description:
Sort the Numbers! 
 Think you have what it takes to beat this tough journey challenge? Sort the numbers from 1 to 15 just like they did on the Survivor journey! Warning: this puzzle is a lot tougher than it seems! Can you figure it out in time? 
 Inspired by Survivor 
 This game is a tribute to the memorable number sorting puzzle featured on  Survivor,  Season 48, Episode 2, " Humble Traits ." Fans of the show will love this faithful recreation of the challenge!
 
 
 Disclaimer: 
 This game is not affiliated with the show  Survivor  or CBS. It was created by an indie developer and fan of the show as a homage to this puzzle. All credit for the original design goes to the Survivor production team.
 
 How Fast Can You Finish? 
 Choose from 4 different modes -  Easy, Medium, Hard  or  Casual.  The first three give you various time limits to put your skills to the test. Or take all the time you need in  Casual  mode. Challenge yourself to complete it as quickly as possible, and share your fastest time with friends. 
 Share Your Feedback 
 Have questions, comments, or need to report a bug? Iâd love to hear from you!
 
 Reach out to me on:
 
 Bluesky:  https://bsky.app/profile/wildcockatielgames.bsky.social 
 Email: jonathan AT wildcockatielgames DOT com
 
 More Games 
 Do you like my games? Want to support me as an indie developer? Please consider wishlisting my upcoming Steam game -  Zombie Barrel Blast !

title: Draw & Slay
description:
About the Game 
 This is a  prototype for an idle card-based RPG , loosely inspired by  MineCards on Itch . The core gameplay is simple:  draw a card, and your character acts based on its effect .
  
 This is the first time I've taken a game this far in terms of completion. Iâm not sure whether this demo has the potential to grow into a full game, so Iâd love to hear your feedback!
  
 Tips & Strategy 
 Icons guide :    â¬ï¸First icon  â Buy new cards
  ðSecond icon  â Upgrade character stats
  ð Third icon  â Modify your deck (currently only allows card removal)
  ð¾Fourth icon  â Unlock new monsters
 
 First upgrade card is crucial —invest in it early. 
 Early game tip : Buying multiple  "Draw 3 Cards Immediately"  skill cards can speed up progression.
 Skill cards  (marked with a diamond icon)  increase in price  as you acquire more—plan your purchases wisely.

title: Null Element
logline: Harness the elements of a ravaged world to fight the machines and save your planet.
description:
Find Your Way In A War-torn Kingdom  
 Controls can be customized in the game settings, you can also press ESC for the pause menu! 
  Find out the truth behind your creation in Null Element! An  EPIC  action adventure through a vast post-war civilization of cute elementals and scary machines! Explore abandoned factories and mystical fire forests, beat bosses and encounter unique characters, in this classic pixel art  M etroidvania  experience!  
  Made for the  MVM 27 Game-Jam  by  Project Null . We highly recommend you play the windows version over the web version. This game is a work in progress and is scheduled to continue development post Game-Jam! 
 
  Game Features  
  Classic Metroidvania with all the modern luxuries  
  Carefully fine-tuned controls. Jump and Dash your way through anything the machines throw at you.  
  Explore 2 carefully handcrafted zones with unique bosses waiting for you to confront them.  
     Make your way through diverging paths and numerous secrets.  
      Turn into different elements like Fire and Air that alter the way you play  
     Evolve with powerful new skills and abilites. Blast your way through walls with a Gooey Hammer, or set enemies and vines ablaze with the Fireball.  
      Find tons of different upgrades that make you stronger and tougher. Will you find them all? 
     A cute cast of elementals to befriend and machines to beat brought to life with frame-by-frame pixel art animation  
      Solve numerous puzzles and navigate through platforming challenges.  
     Beautiful pixel landscapes with carefully made parallax giving you a sense of depth  
     Donât forget to use your map, in case you get lost in this interconnected world.  
      An atmospheric, nostalgic score to accompany you on your journey of self discovery, echoing lost peace and the ever bright hope for the future. 
 
  Screenshots  
 
 
 
 
  CREDITS  
 
A  Project Null  Game 
 Team Members 
 
 Colin C. (Funky Fresh Fellow)  - Writing, UI Design, Sprite Work  
 Jose Ayala  - Team Lead, Sound Design, Game Design 
 
 Leona Stajkovic (SavQ)  - Tile Set, Asset, Background Art  
 Manuel Sambour  - Original Music 
 Marvin Kn.  - Programming Lead, Game Design  
 Milivoj Stankovic  - Game Design and Concept, Level Design  
 Ray G. (Maladaptive_M)  - Art Lead, Character Design, Animation, Assets  
 RoyalPizza  - Enemy Programming 
 Special Thanks to 
 Zacchary Dempsey -Plante  - Font

title: National Park Girls: Love Our Parks Edition
logline: All 5 episodes of National Park Girls in one release + improvements!
description:
ð² National Park Girls Complete ð² 
 All five episodes of National Park Girls in one complete release! We've updated the game to the "Love Our Parks" edition, which contains the full NPG story, plus numerous new improvements and features.
 
 If you already owned "National Park Girls" as a release from Studio Coattails, go check out that game page to get a free download of the Love Our Parks edition. 
                          
 
 All Eve ever wanted was to protect and preserve the land, but after  five years of being a ranger in Yosemite National Park, sheâs just about  ready to throw in the towel. The people are careless, her co-workers  are annoying, and thanks to an increasingly tight budget she can hardly  do her job. Fed up and burned out, Eve lashes out, but after being  transferred to a remote cabin post in return, she only finds herself  more uncertain of the value of being a ranger.
     
 Soon after arriving, three strange girls corner her in the cabin. Not  only do they claim to live there, but they also say theyâre the  manifestations of Zion, Yellowstone, and Yosemite National Parks! Are  these girls really who they say they are? Why is Yosemite so obsessed  with her research? And why does one of them have a volcano on their  head? Follow Eve as she gets closer with these spritely cuties that put  the ânaturalâ in âsupernatural,â and maybe even discovers a new kind of  love for the parks.
     
                              
 
 Fully complete story with all 5 episodes of National Park Girls, plus multiple improvements to the UI, art, and direction
 New bonus features like a trivia game Adorable character art and CG art from Satchely and a new key visual by Konett 
 Beautifully rendered backgrounds featuring several famous American landmarks
 Original soundtrack by Sarah Mancuso ( Please Be Happy ,  Heart of the Woods )
 FULL English voice acting! 
 National Parks come to life as cute girls!
 
   
 
 ð² Follow us on... ð² 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Bluesky   â¥   Discord   â¥   Newsletter   â¥   Patreon

title: Death of a Wish
logline: THE NEO-SANCTUM SHALL FALL. A hack-and-slash action-RPG where style is salvation.
description:
Death of a Wish  is a vicious action-RPG set in a nightmare filled with horrifying monsters and terrifying people.  
 Play as Christian, a Marked child raised by a cult and struggling to escape indoctrination, as he bands with others to challenge their oppressors. By taking down the four Sanctum Faiths: Father, Sister, Cardinal, and Priest, they will upend the order of the world. 
 
 CHALLENGING, REWARDING COMBAT 
 Rend your foes asunder with magical combos called Arias in a demanding combat system that emphasizes tactical aggression. Enhance your abilities with powerful perks that significantly alter your approach to battle and the rhythm of combat. With a limitless array of ways to fight stylishly, build your character your way to destroy your foes. 
 THE POWER OF GRACE 
 Christianâs Corruption will constantly rise throughout his journey, pulling him towards a tragic end. He can hold back the Corruption by achieving high ranks in combat and performing long, graceful combos. Only by mastering battle and fighting with true elegance will he stand a chance against the Nightmares.  
 A DARK ADVENTURE 
 Explore a bleak dreamworld filled with surreal new characters, encounters, and stories. The theocratic city of Neo-Sanctum sets the stage for a struggle to determine the shape of society, and the fates of Christian and his companions. Delve into the secret underworld of the esoteric and abandoned to meet new allies who will aid you on your journey.  
 SURREAL AND SPECTACULAR 
 Christianâs world is rendered with a visual style like no other. Battles come to life in an animated spectacle of blood, light, and motion. Nicolo Telescaâs chilling score mixes electronic sounds with live instrumentation to unite the game with tense anxiety and crackling catharsis.

title: BigLittle: A Story of Ups and Downs
logline: A small little RPG
description:
When a strange turn of events causes MacKenzie to end up somewhere he never thought he'd be, he must put together a collection of others to set things in the world right and find a way home. 
 
 BigLittle is a aiming to be a full scale RPG ,  currently only the Prologue is available at about 30-45ish minutes of game play. 
 The game has size-change elements and while t he current release has some shrinking and other small tidbits , in the future content warnings will be added as needed! 
 I'm a solo dev and I've dabbled in making a little game here and there, so now I'm trying my hand at something full fledged. The goal from the start was to call back to the days of PS1 half sprite/half 3D RPGs. Made in RPGMakerMV, the intention was  to tell a lighthearted story of party hijinks. I'm creating all the CGs myself and you can find more examples using the links below to my DA and other social media sites! BigLittle will be a  FREE  game for all to play, with major updates coming to Itch.io while my patreon will see the smaller, more rapid testing releases between major chapters. 
 
 More consistent updates and news can be found on my socials as well as the discord! 
 Patreon! 
 DA   Twitter   BlueSky   
 BigLittle Discord Group!

title: Sunny Smiles
logline: A psychological horror with elements of exploration and techno-anxiety.
description:
After a mysterious incident at an abandoned toy factory, the companies involved are desperate to bury the truth—but lost data keeps resurfacing. As an operator, your job is to decode looping signals from the past, but the deeper you go, the more you realize… the factory hasnât forgotten. And it doesnât forgive. 
 
 Gameplay 
 Record coordinates sent by your superiors.
 Upload them into the factoryâs system and wait for rendering.
 Analyze the generated images, which may reveal traces of the incident.
 Explore the area and compare images to reality.
 Survive if something goes wrong...
 
 Iâm a solo developer, and this is my first 3D project, so please donât judge it too harshly. The game is still in early development, and any feedback or bug reports in the comments would be greatly appreciated! 
 
 Inspired by  Poppy Playtime  and  VotV , this psychological horror blends signal decoding with unsettling discoveries. 
 
 Note 
 The shift starts at 9 a.m. on Day 0, and don't pay attention to the coordinates.

title: JetPac Miner
logline: JetPac Miner
description:
JetPac Miner 
 
 El juego de plataformas donde TU haces las plataformas 
 
 Ha vuelto a pasar. Nuestro amigo el minero Willy se ha ido de vacaciones a Mallorca y se ha gastado todo su dinero en casinos y mujeres de dudosa reputaciÃ³n. Y ahora sus acreedores amenazan con quedarse con su mansiÃ³n a no ser que pague las 10.000 libras que les debe! 
 Pero no todo estÃ¡ perdido. Nuestro valiente protagonista se ha vuelto a poner su casco de minero, y ha comenzado a excavar en el jardÃ­n de su mansiÃ³n. Esta vez contarÃ¡ con la ayuda de un JetPac para recorrer la mina, asÃ­ como un taladro de alta potencia. 
 Tu misiÃ³n, si deseas aceptarla, es ayudarle a encontrar los suficientes minerales preciosos para poder pagar la deuda. 
 Controles: 
 Arriba: saltar, mantener pulsado para usar el jetpac Izquierda: correr a la izquierda Derecha: correr a la derecha Disparo + direcciÃ³n: taladrar en la direcciÃ³n seleccionada Recover: permite volver a la tienda si te quedas atascado, pero pierdes todos los minerales que hayas recogido hasta ese momento. 
 Puedes seleccionar tres niveles de dificultad. Los mÃ¡s fÃ¡ciles te darÃ¡n algo de dinero al inicio de tu partida. 
 Contadores:  
 A la derecha encontrarÃ¡s los indicadores que deberÃ¡s vigilar durante tu partida: 
 
 LEVEL : Nivel de la mina en el que te encuentras Depth : Profundidad actual Money : Dinero que tienes. Necesitas llegar a  10.000 para ganar la partida. Life : La vida que te queda Fuel : Combustible restante. Ojo, tanto el jetpac como el taladro gastan combustible Bag : Es donde transportas los minerales hasta  que los vendes en la tienda. Si estÃ¡ llena los minerales que intentes recoger se destruirÃ¡n. Lights : Necesitas una luz por cada nivel que desciendas, o no podrÃ¡s ver la mina. Minerales : Cantidad recogida y precio de venta en la tienda. 
 En la superficie del nivel 0 encontrarÃ¡s la tienda en la esquina superior derecha. AcÃ©rcate para entrar. 
 
 Cuando entres en la tienda automÃ¡ticamente se venderÃ¡n todos los minerales que lleves en la bolsa, y se te ofrecerÃ¡n mÃºltiples opciones: 
 1) Rellenar vida 2) Rellenar combustible 3) Aumentar un 50% tu vida total 4) Aumentar un 50% tu combustible total 5) Aumentar un 50% la capacidad de tu bolsa 6) Duplica la velocidad del jetpac y reduce su consumo 7) Duplica la velocidad del taladro y reduce su consumo 8) Comprar luces El precio de los artÃ­culos aumentarÃ¡ segÃºn aumentes su nivel! 
 En tus aventuras por las minas encontrarÃ¡s distintos objetos, unos agradables y otros no tanto.  
 Tierra : En rojo y magenta en este nivel, puedes (y debes) taladrarla para buscar minerales. Pero ten cuidado! Si taladras sin pensar, tal vez no puedas volver a la superficie. Bajar es fÃ¡cil, subir no tanto. Y ten cuidado con las caÃ­das. Minerales : En azul en la imagen. Tu objetivo no es sÃ³lo recogerlos, sino regresar a la tienda para ganar dinero. Rocas : Esas bolas blancas, estÃ¡n esperando la mejor ocasiÃ³n para arruinarte el dÃ­a. Tu deambular por la mina harÃ¡ que se desprendan en el momento menos adecuado. Puedes romperlas con el taladro pero son mÃ¡s duras que el terreno. Y no intentes romperlas con la cabeza, perderÃ¡s. Ratas topo mutantes de mediana edad : Esos encantadores ojillos. No son muy listas, pero sÃ­ pueden ser molestas. TÃ­rales una roca encima para ganar un bonus. 
 
 Agradecimientos: 
 Boriel por su maravilloso compilador Dr Gusman y Duefectu por el entorno ZX Basic Studio y librerÃ­as Arda Erdikmen por el editor de pantallas de BasinC 
 Notas:  
 Se ha utilizado I.A. Ãºnicamente para el dibujo de la portada, pero todo el coloreado se ha hecho a mano, sin ningÃºn retoque adicional. Por eso tiene esa apariencia cutre, porque lo es ð El juego se puede jugar en 48k, pero no funcionarÃ¡ la mÃºsica. El cÃ³digo del juego estÃ¡ incluido por si quieres aprender como programar, o hacer tus propias modificaciones. El juego estÃ¡ inspirado en " A Game About Digging A Hole " de steam (que os recomiendo), mezclado con el boulder dash (que aprendes a valorar cuando intentas programar algo parecido).

title: Night Maniac 2: The Legacy Of Blood
logline: The Red Valley Killer returned! and is now in GreenFord!
description:
NIGHT MANIAC 2 HAS RECEIVED AN IMPORTANT UPDATE! WE RECOMMEND THAT YOU UPDATE IF YOU HAVE THE FIRST VERSION! 
 AND IF YOU UPDATE AND YOU DON'T SEE THE LANGUAGE SELECTION SCREEN AFTER LOADING, GO TO OPTIONS AND THEN CHANGE THE DIALOG LANGUAGE. 
 
 Terror returns in  Night Maniac 2: The Legacy of Blood , diving even deeper into the darkness that haunts Red Valley. Years have passed, but the scars of the past never truly fade. Now, a new wave of blood threatens the town, echoing a horror many believed was long buried. 
 Obsession and fear walk hand in hand as mysteries unravel, revealing that some shadows never disappear—they only wait for the right moment to resurface. Face the terror head-on, uncover dark secrets, and fight to survive, because the blood legacy is far from over.
 
 The game is available in the following languages: 
 
   English   Portuguese 
   Spanish 
   French
 
 
 Contact email:  studionoxus021@gmail.com
 
 
 Special thanks to CaseOh and his community

 The music and sounds in the game are not copyrighted.

title: LIMERENCE
logline: a conversation over dinner.
description:
limÂ·erÂ·ence 
 /ËlimÉrÉns/ 
 the state of being infatuated or obsessed with another person, typically experienced involuntarily and characterized by a strong desire for reciprocation of one's feelings but not primarily for a sexual relationship. 
 - 
 a short story of a captive and a captor chatting over dinner. not so much horror but more a tense, uneasy atmosphere and an imbalance of power.  named after the  yves tumor song  of the same name. 
 made for the  O2A2 jam.  this jam has restrictions that require 1 cg (or sprite and background), 1 sound effect, 1 bgm, and 1k words.  
 this game is about 5-10 minutes in length. 
 for additional information, check out the 500+ download devlog listed below! 
 contains: 
 977 words one choice one bastard who won't stop staring at you 
 music is by  makoto hiramatsu  under  CC BY 4.0

title: Heisenberg
logline: Explore the Breaking Bad universe in a brand new way!
description: Explore the Breaking Bad universe in a brand new way. Taking place during the events of Season 4, the story picks up as Walt is called to the Lab and told that some of the product in Jesse's care has been stolen! Help residents around town with their requests and, with Mike's help, discover the location of the stolen product.

title: POOT and the Mysterious Signal
logline: The alien from Uranus.
description:
Controls 
 Arrow Keys/WASD : Move POOT
 Z/J : Interact/Confirm
 X/K : Cancel SHIFT:  Menu ESC : Pause Game 
 POOT and the Mysterious Signal 
 
 About 
 POOT and the Mysterious Signal  is a 1-bit adventure game inspired by GameBoy classics and games like Minit. Play as POOT, a young alien inventor from Uranus who discovers strange signals interfering with the town's toilets. Team up with the eccentric Professor Gaseous to build a device capable of decoding these mysterious transmissions!
  
 
 Explore a charming town, solve puzzles, and uncover the beginning of POOT's grand adventure in this first installment of the POOT saga.
  
 Features 
   Classic 1-bit Aesthetic : Crisp black and white visuals inspired by GameBoy classics and Minit
  Intriguing Story : Unravel the mystery of strange signals and discover POOT's family secrets
  Exploration : Navigate the town, docks, caves, and abandoned power plant
  Puzzle Solving : Collect parts and solve environmental challenges
  Hidden Secrets : Find journal fragments and special items throughout the world
  Mini-games : Unlock POOT Runner once you complete the game 
 Development 
 POOT and the Mysterious Signal is the first in a planned series of games exploring POOT's adventures. Created by a solo developer with a passion for pixel art.  Music 
 Special thanks to beatscribe for the awesome music packs! 
 https://beatscribe.itch.io/ 
 Software 
 Made with GBStudio and Aseprite! 
 https://www.gbstudio.dev/ 
 Connect 
   Twitter:  @pootcoinsol

title: Sailing with Stans - Chapter 1 - A Sea Grunks Dating Sim
logline: Stan and Ford stumble upon an anomaly at sea which turns out to be you. While they patch you back up, romance blossoms.
description:
Welcome to Chapter 1 of the full game!  
 For updates on Chapter 2 and beyond, find us on  Tumblr  <3 
 SUMMARY 
 Stan and Ford stumble upon an anomaly at sea which turns out to be you. While they patch you back up, romance blossoms.
 
 FEATURING 
 A brand new game menu layout! Updated sprites and new emotions New illustrated backgrounds Three new special scenes! Pronoun selection! Easter eggs?? 
 CREDITS 
 --  Chapter 1 -- 
 VICARTLESS : Writing/Sprites/Special Scenes/Opening Illustration/Programming
 
 Kiwicartwheels : Lead Editor 
 LINUXVALOARE : Background Artist (Stan O' War II) 
 
 Music (In Order):
 
 Sailing with Stans Title Screen - VICARTLESS 
 Untold Journey - The Pirate King
 
 Johnny Easton - Deep Blue
 
 FOLLOW THE GAME 
 
 Follow the game's progress on  Tumblr!  Please also feel free to message us/give feedback on what you thought! 
 Stay tuned for Chapter 2 and the other talented creatives on our time. Release date to be announced. <3 
 MOBILE USERS 
 Because the game is optimized for browser/download, some elements are not as polished on mobile devices. We apologize for the inconvenience! We hope to improve this in the future!

title: Pool GAMBIT
logline: Chess + pool with jazz. Enjoy!
description:
Chess + pool?! 
 Thinking about the game I decided to break the concepts of chess and billiards to create something new)  Besides these two games, I was also inspired by games like: Balatro, Peglin and Shotgun King 
 
 Tips: 
 1. Develop figures - look for places where you can most advantageously place a figure 
 2. Have an attack plan! - each figure has unique properties, use them with maximum benefit (this can be read on the "About Figure" button) 
 3. Use bonuses - by knocking out enemy pieces you get points that you can spend on doubling your attack, turning a pawn into a queen and other useful features! 
 4. Remember - your goal is to knock the enemy king into the pocket 
 
  Aim precisely to hit the figure or win positionally!  
  This game was made in 10 days for a jam by one person. Enjoy and be sure to leave a review! Thanks.

title: ALPEN GHOUL: Prologue
logline: Run. Hide. Slide.
description:
Lost, confused, alone, and hunted. You need to reach the top but a relentless creature bears down on you, and all you have to protect yourself are your wits and skill. Youâll need to try different approaches, honing your strategy as you play—but be careful, mastery of this game leads to discovery, and some things are better left unfound.
 
 Don't find it. Don't let it find you. 
 It's trying to control you.  
 You have been warned. 
 Follow us for more!    YouTube    |    Twitter/X     |    Patreon    |    Ko-Fi    (DEV NOTE IMPORTANT! - This game is a completely different experience from AM. It's much harder and unforgiving when starting out, but it's fun once you master it. Be prepared to die a lot. If you are struggling and don't mind spoilers we have a written guide for you  HERE . Good luck!)
recent_comments: i Did full escape of Alpen Ghoul Amazing Game Still Exploring for new secrets
Very cool and atmosphere, made you feel like you were actually up there.
Ok BrocBois, I need you to drop more games, you guys scare me too much, especially at 21:00

I hate it when the enemy knows where I am!

If you are struggling HERE is a guide you can check out to help. Some quick tips are that it can hear your footsteps, will use sound to track you, and can see the light from your flashlight. Be incredibly cautious when it is close by or use your fast sliding movement to create openings for yourself.

I'm sneaking around without a light. I'm using shortcuts, but the monster is definitely heading towards me. It's not looking for me randomly. I hear his quickening footsteps as I leave the shelter, because he knows when to attack. All things considered, it's a good game. The only downside to a hide-and-seek game is that you can't sneak normally. I think we need to give the monster a conscious zone. So that it's close but doesn't know exactly where to go.
This game is genuinely so scary. Being chased by something that fast made my skin crawl!! Any support on my video and channel is GREATLY appreciated!

I played it for a while. I think the chase mechanics are really cool and the environments look really nice, but I had no clue where to go after finding the tape in the cave and I had frequent performance drops.Also, why in the name of all that is holy is V-sync forced on?

Exploration is key. Try different routes and inch your way to victory. If you want to beat Alpen Ghoul, youâll have to earn it. Itâs one of those games. Your playstyle is up to you, but I recommend staying crouched, keeping your flashlight off, and searching around the mountain slow and safe until youâre more familiar with it. Once you have an idea of whatâs out there, crank up the speed and aggressive sliding. Sliding is the fastest way to move.Beyond this advice I can't help you. It's up to you to pull off a win. The mountain is cruel and there is no easy way to beat it... but it is beatable.

Legitimately impressive what 3 people can put together in 4 months.An expansive area with a handcrafted, maze-like cave system, game-influencing collectibles for you to find (that stay persistent between deaths/playthroughs), NG+ and hard mode, satisfying to control mobility that hasn't glitched out on me in the 2+ hours of play, dynamic music used as audio cues for enemy alertness, and, speaking of, a cunning yeti that makes RE2make's Tyrant look like a newborn kitten.Reaching the summit ends the game, but the real goal actually lies below it. The death counter on the end screen kinda gives away the devs want you to treat deaths as a learning experience, instead of "failure." There's quite a bit to map out, and there's even one secret lying in wait in the caves... I figured out the cypher, but haven't found "it" yet!I loved this. I'm done hiding in lockers. Let me swooce away from monsters at breakneck speeds down snowy slopes. Only feedback I have is it's maybe too easy to end up in the same death trap at first, and progress could maybe be represented visually a bit to help players feel like they're on the right track/made it further "this time."

Thank you so much for the kind words! Trying to help players with navigation ( hopefully in subtle ways ) is at the top of the list for future updates. I want people getting lost a little, but not for the wrong reasons like areas looking too similar. Like you all, I'm experiencing a learning curve of my own. Enjoy the tape hunt!-update- I changed the intro area to have a place to chill right after you respawn and adjusted some elements in the level. I've been working like crazy trying to update it and help players without it losing its core Player vs Monster feel. I love this stuff. Dissecting what works and what doesn't is what got me into trying to make a game in the first place.

MY  BOYS  WE  IS  PLAYINIG  13   RANDOM  HORROR  GAMES  THIS  GAMEPLAY  IS  3  HOURS  LONG  I  HOPE  YOU  ENJOY. THE  RANDOM  SCARY  GAMES  ARE  FREAKING  AWESOME  THANKS  CREATORS  FOR  MAKING  THESE  EPIC  GAMES!!!!!!  KEEP  UP  THE  GOOD  WORK  WE  NEED  MORE  PEOPLE  LIKE  THIS  IN THE  WORLD  MAKING  AWESOME  GAMES  LIKE  THESE  I  LOVE  YOU  ALL AND  BE  SAFE  AND  PLEASE  PRAY FOR  ME  THINK  I  MIGHT  BE  SICK  HAVE  NOT  BEEN  FEELING  GOOD  LATELY  AND  LIKE  THE  VIDEO  IF  YOU  ENJOYED  IF  NOT  I  TOTALLY  UNDERSTAND  I  KNOW  I'M  NOT  REALLY  A GOOD  YOUTUBER  BU T I  REALLY  TRY  LIKE  EVERYONE  ELSE ON  THE  ITCH.IO/YOUTUBE  PLATFORM  BUT  IF  YOU  HAVE ANY  GOOD  TIPS  FOR  ME  ON  MAKING  MY  YOUTUBE VIDEOS  BETTER  PLEASE  TELL  ME  IN  THE  COMMENTS  IMMEDIATELY  YOU  WILL  REALLY  BE  A  GREAT  HELP  TO  ME OTHER  THAN  THAT  HOPE  YOU  ENJOY  THE  VIDEO  AND  SEE YOU  LATER  IN  THE  NEXT  VIDEO!!!!!!!!!!!

Legitimately impressive what 3 people can put together in 4 months.An expansive area with a handcrafted, maze-like cave system, game-influencing collectibles for you to find (that stay persistent between deaths/playthroughs), NG+ and hard mode, satisfying to control mobility that hasn't glitched out on me in the 2+ hours of play, dynamic music used as audio cues for enemy alertness, and, speaking of, a cunning yeti that makes RE2make's Tyrant look like a newborn kitten.Reaching the summit ends the game, but the real goal actually lies below it. The death counter on the end screen kinda gives away the devs want you to treat deaths as a learning experience, instead of "failure." There's quite a bit to map out, and there's even one secret lying in wait in the caves... I figured out the cypher, but haven't found "it" yet!I loved this. I'm done hiding in lockers. Let me swooce away from monsters at breakneck speeds down snowy slopes. Only feedback I have is it's maybe too easy to end up in the same death trap at first, and progress could maybe be represented visually a bit to help players feel like they're on the right track/made it further "this time."

Thank you so much for the kind words! Trying to help players with navigation ( hopefully in subtle ways ) is at the top of the list for future updates. I want people getting lost a little, but not for the wrong reasons like areas looking too similar. Like you all, I'm experiencing a learning curve of my own. Enjoy the tape hunt!-update- I changed the intro area to have a place to chill right after you respawn and adjusted some elements in the level. I've been working like crazy trying to update it and help players without it losing its core Player vs Monster feel. I love this stuff. Dissecting what works and what doesn't is what got me into trying to make a game in the first place.
This game was so much fun and so hard. I really enjoy the difficulty. It really adds to the tension and makes the creature seem really threatening. Great job! Keep it up!
Thank you. We are hoping every victory feels like a real accomplishment and that those final moments approaching the building are always tense.
Nice game !

Intensity levels higher then expected, yet the AI - too BUFFY! I loved the concept of this game. Rarely do I come across the indie project, which has this level of detail, quality and hard work put into it. The sound design and atmosphere shine brightest, same as the visuals and that creature - looking terrific! Yet, the game has its issues. For the demo, the project is brilliant. I would say adding the difficulty level/meters for other players can create less confusing gameplay or maybe making the checkpoints/saving system just in case something goes wrong. The map overall looks neat, yet at some corners the player might glitch and end up in the creature's hands. Those improvements would benefit the game for sure. Best of luck with the development and will see what you can make out of it. Cheers!

I think I just need to communicate better that too much running is basically an instant death because he is tracking you and hears you. I have learned so much about level design in the last 24 hours from watching people play the game. This guy is the only person to pay the game as I saw in my head.  He might be the first person to enter the building though the intended path. I'm thinking of ways to get more people on the right track and help people get over that initial hump. Thank you for the feedback! No monster AI nerf just yet. The full game will have safe rooms double as checkpoints and allow for the player to have ways to escape the monsters grasp. I think the high difficulty of the demo helps condense all the feelings of what I want the full game to feel like but in under a few minutes.
It's just the demo version so if some players can't beat it, that's totally fine. The full version will be a bit more forgiving because I want everyone to be able to get through that version.
Again, thanks for the feedback! This is the exact type of thing I was looking for. I would love to hear from more devs.

With all due respect, I disagree with you. The intent of creating a playable application, let it be demo or a full version is to consider the outside perspective. People should not and won't play the game the way "you want". If 1 person out of 10 finds the same path, that means just that. Sorry, but you are making the general players feel guilt and frustration and defending your game as if they "should" play it the way you want. Sorry, but no. When I make games I always consider that some players might walk or run or do that and this. It is a big mistake. Watching other people play can improve your development unless you are willing to face the criticism and be humble. It is your choice, do what you want, but if the marketing of the game is "monster too fast and hard to complete" they won't come back for more. And just because 1-2 people out of 40-50 play the game as you say "correct", means nothing. Good Luck.
w game
That Hairless Yeti put me back on life support.

This game has so much potential! I thoroughly enjoyed this game and trying to navigate the mountains from The Alpen Ghoul! I will say though, I did glitch out of the map a few times. I know Alpen Ghoul is meant to be difficult and he "knows the area" etc. But I couldn't help but notice that he knew where I was a handful of times, even when trying to sneak from him. Also he is ridiculously quick which gives the player no chance to escape for the most part. I do think a difficulty option would help with this game! Other than that, I loved this! GREAT JOB!

The creature devours another youtuber LET'S GOOOOOO. Thanks for playing, you actually got really far and were way closer to the end then you realize. I am monitoring the difficulty but I don't want to nerf him too quickly. A lot of the deaths come from its ability to hear footsteps and see the flashlight.  Your playthrough was actually closest to the intended design. He is made to be a real antagonist and not feel like a jump scare Roomba.

description:
ð Free Sale & Special Offer     
 
 Due to multiple player requests, We are making the game  free on sale  for a limited time! Additionally, anyone who has already purchased the game will receive our  next game for free  as a thank-you for their support!
 
 
 
                       Story  
 When Daniel inherits his uncleâs remote estate, he expects an old, empty house—not strange whispers and unseen movements.
 
 Dr. Adrian Lowe, a famous neurologist, disappeared without a trace, leaving behind a house full of secrets and a hidden  bunker that was never meant to be found.
 
 
 As Daniel searches the dark halls and the depths below, he uncovers the truth about  Project Strosh —an experiment to extract and save memories. But something went wrong. The memories didnât just stay.  They became something else. Something alive. Something hungry. 
 Daniel must uncover the truth before he becomes just another trapped memory—lost forever in his uncleâs final experiment.    
 
 
 Key Features 
 ð¹  Psychological Horror  â Lose yourself in a nightmare where memories twist reality. Whatâs real? Whatâs just a stolen thought?
 
 ð¹  Exploration & Puzzles  â Uncover the houseâs dark past, solve mysteries, and unlock hidden paths to the truth.
 
 
 ð¹  Supernatural Encounters  â Shadows move, whispers grow, and something watches your every step.
 
 ð¹  Multiple Endings  â Your choices shape Danielâs fate. Escape the nightmare—or become part of it. 
 Gameplay Time  â 18.35-24.45min

title: Monochrome Pixels
logline: Can you bring back the colors into your life?
description:
Diana, a Senior Game Designer from Mad Lobster Interactive, deals with burnout, night terrors and work harassment at the hands of her narcissistic boss, Godric, on a daily basis.  
 One morning like any other, without paying any mind to her already busy schedule, Godric tasks her with mentoring their new employee: Enya, an upbeat and passionate newbie who's yet to see the struggles of the game development industry.  
 Very much at her wit's end, Diana has to make an important decision that may affect not only her career but her life as a whole. Will she mentor Enya in her own way and get to know them better? Or will she be at the service of Godric and her own inner demons? 
 
 
 
 
 Although the characters and story of Monochrome Pixels are fictional, the issues of abuse and mistreatment in the games industry are not. This game contains the following content: 
 Toxic workplace Abusive and oppressive boss Struggles with mental health/depression Nightmares Burnout
 Harassment Misogyny
 
 
 29k words, roughly 1.5 - 3 hours depending on reading speed! 3 Endings 4 CGS An original soundtrack Partial Voice Acting A cute, budding friendship between co-workers (depending on your choices!) Developer notes Accessibility Options! Font options Change UI Colors Sound & Image captions Reduce Animations This will disable bright flashes Self-Voicing 
 
 Project Lead, Writer, Programmer : Kristi "HusbandoGoddess" Jimenez [ Twitter  |  Tumblr  |  Carrd  |  Patreon  |  Ko-Fi ] Co-Lead, Writer, Beta Tester : Pri Karin  [ Twitter |  Tumblr  |  Carrd  |  Patreon  |  Ko-Fi ] Sprite & CG Artist : SummerOrigins [ Twitter  |  Tumblr  |  itch.io  |  Ko-Fi  |  VGen ] Background Artist :  MoKuzuu GUI Artist :  skai2blue4u Logo Artist & Misc. Graphics :  1kesoda Food Art, Animal, and Easter Egg Artist :  Florisam Composer & Sound Designer :  Eric Jeffrey Tan Editor :  Vivi Contrast GUI Programmer & Additional Art  :  theominute Voice of Diana :  Kay Reilly [ Carrd |  Twitter ] Voice of Enya :  Wyatt Toloczko [ Twitter |  Instagram ] Voice of Godric :  Mikee Joaquin Voice Director :  Branden Loera Audio Engineer :  Eric Sheffield Special Thanks :  Bluenova Studios  for getting the audio team together! Image Tools for Ren'Py :  Feniks Ren'Py Auto Highlight :  Wattson 
 
 
 If you enjoyed Monochrome Pixels, please consider  leaving the game a rating ! Ratings greatly increase the game's visibility. 
 As mentioned above, although the game's events and characters are fictional, the topic of mistreatment in the games industry is not. Please, support game developers however you can.  Listen   to   their   stories , let them know how much their work has impacted you, and show them that you're by their side.
