title: Levania [Open-World Adventure RPG][Early Alpha]
logline: True open world adventure.
description:
I've been working on this off & on for a few years. The main idea of the game is to be a large true open world adventure with unique quests with different ways of completing them. 
 What do I mean by true open world? Anywhere that you see on the map can be explored. You see a forest? You can go in there. You see a mountain? You can explore it. I try to keep the map as open and explorable as possible. 
 For the quests, I want them to have different ways of completing them depending on factors like stats/party members/items/ how the quest was started/etc. The quests don't take into consideration all of that stuff at once but usually one or two of them. 
 Some features of the game right now include: 
 5 races & 8 Starting classes to choose from 24  companions to recruit and join you VisuStella FTB Combat (FTB A.K.A. Free Turn Battle means you get a pool of actions and you can choose which member uses them.) 2 cities and a small town, 6 forests, 5 dungeons, 7 small replayable dungeons Each class has unlockable skills as they level up Each class has access to 4 weapons that can be upgraded to a +5 (+16 more that can only be upgraded to +1) an assortment of accessories Not much in the way of armor right now Several items in the form of potions, bombs, and materials 5 marked quest from the Adventurers Guild & 5 untracked quests on the map several more secret areas that I wouldn't consider quests I'd say at least a few hours of gameplay 
 I don't plan to make the game story focused and prefer a more souls-like approach where the story and world building are through environment and item descriptions. Not that there won't be  a story for the game, but I prefer to keep it light. I personally hate how much reading and cutscenes there are in JRPG's and RPG's in general because they always seem to drag on and I start losing interest real fast and just start skipping it all. Ideally, any interactions in my game that happen will be no more than a minute or two to get through.  
 While the game is in early alpha, it doesn't mean  there isn't much in the game right now . It just means that compared to what the full game will be, this is basically just a taste of what to expect.   The core mechanics and gameplay are somewhat there.  Things change and get added as I get ideas, but the main idea of what the game IS, is there. 
 Why release it now?  Well, it's in a playable state and I'd like to get feedback on what others think about it. Plus, It keeps me motivated to see interest in the project. 
 What about the future of this game?  I'm going to keep working on it for the foreseeable future, after all, I'm really only scratching the surface for what I want this game to be.  There's currently two quests that are partially complete that aren't in the game. I need to finish those up and I've got at least 2 more classes that I want to add to the game when the balance is in a better place.  I'll keep working on it as long as there's an interest in it. 
 Will I start charging for the game?/ What's the financial model ?  It's my belief that incomplete games shouldn't be charged for. I remember back in the day when a game was complete when you bought it, and so I won't be charging anything for this until it's complete. At least until there's a full bug free experience to be had. The earliest I would start charging anything would be when I completely finish the Aquanis area (the region of the map that the playable area takes place in) and even then it would only be a couple bucks.  But any donations are greatly appreciated, it lets me know you really believe in the project. 
 How buggy is the game right now?   Well, I can't say it's bug free or without it's problems. The combat balance is an on going process with the game.  There always seems to be something that comes up with random softlocks or things not working properly in rare cases. I try to take care of these as soon as possible if they are a major issue. 
 "I really enjoyed the game & concept, how can I help?"  Honestly, Just letting me know what you thought, giving suggestions, and letting me know of any bugs is enough. You can also share the page around wherever you want to promote it. The more people that know of it the better. Otherwise, unless you want make artwork for the game, bug test,  or provide plugins, just showing support is enough to keep me motivated. 
 " I really didn't enjoy the game."  Well I hope if that's the case, you'll let me know why. I know the game has it's issues right now,  but I want to make it the best experience that it can be. It's gonna take some time to get there,  but I'm committed to getting it there. 
 The game is too ambitious. Are you going to cut back the amount of content?  I don't plan on cutting back on my vision for the game, that's the problem.  I know that the game is going to be incredible when it's complete so I can't bare the idea of cutting any of it out.  If I can make a game that surprises people with how good it is from the amount of quality content, my role as the game developer will be fulfilled and I can be proud to call this my creation.  
 Will saves carry over to future versions?  You can move your saves to newer versions and they should be compatible but I can't guarantee it. The only problems that would occur would be if a quest softlocked you (in this case if you have an older save from before then, it might be recoverable), if a future quest relied on new code added to old quests that can't be repeated (in this case I can just add a way to get whatever was needed) or if an old area was reworked and you got stuck in an immovable spot (In this case you could use the travel scroll to teleport out of it). 
 How often are you going to release updates?  Short answer, I don't know. If there's a game breaking bug discovered, then I'll try to get an update out as soon as possible. As far as additions of new content I can't really say. I really want to make sure the core gameplay is solid first before going all out with new content.  I'll try to get new updates out whenever they're ready, maybe an update every month or two.  
 Summary: 
 It's in early alpha but the main mechanics are there I'm releasing it now to get feedback and to motivate me I'm pretty sure most of the major game-breaking bugs are fixed (fingers crossed). The game will continue to be free until there is a full experience to charge for. Love it or hate it, I'd appreciate the feedback so I can make it better Expect updates to fix game breaking bugs, main updates about every month. 
 If you make a video on the game, let me know, I'd love to see it. 
 Discord Server:  https://discord.gg/GXHucC4HHC   Copy and paste the link, I don't know why the hyperlink won't work. 
 *BTW I have no idea if the Mac version works because I don't know anyone with a Mac to test it on and nobody has said it hasn't. Please let me know if there's an issue.*

title: MERP The Game
logline: The most adorable game of wack-a-mole.
description:
Download the game to save your highscore and recommended for some levels. Known bug with Web version : UI elements may not size properly in some browsers. Fullscreening sometimes fixes it, otherwise, please download the game. 
 
 
 You find yourself standing in a white void. What is this place? How did you get here? Doesnât matter, a Sergal is standing before you and itâs looking up at you, asking for pets. 
 
 
 Are you just going to stand there and not boop the Sergals snoot? Of course not! So you do, and it merps at you in response. It scampers off only for another Sergal to appear and ask for a boop, and you do. But for every Sergal you boop, two more seem to show up. It looks like this void isn't so empty after all.
   
  
   
 In the most adorable game of whack-a-mole, you must boop the snout of each eager Sergal that comes up to you. But be quick, as Sergals can be somewhat impatient, and if you leave them waiting too long, they'll walk away.
 
 
 The Sergal herd is coming, and you'll only have 60 seconds before they run off again. How many can you boop before time runs out and you're left alone in this void once more? 
 
 
 Plenty of Sergals to boop!  Enjoy an abundance of adorable Sergals to boop! Test your reflexes and see how many you can pet within 60 seconds. Can you set a new record?
   Boop Sergals with Precision!  Perfectly aimed boops build combos that rack up even higher scores. How long can you keep your streak going?
   Watch out for Protogens—they're not as boop-friendly!  While Sergals love the attention, Protogens require extra caution! Their digital screens are delicate, and a misaimed boop could end your streak with a sharp penalty.
   
  
   
 Credits
   
 Original inspiration by  Tytolis . Programming, art, and design by Stick Shift Games.
   Fonts from Fontspace and Dafont.
   Sound effects from Freesound.

title: Cards of the Abyss
logline: A game about slaying monsters with some cards
description:
Fight your way through a mysterious dungeon in this roguelite deckbuilder adventure game. Build a strong deck of different attacks and defences as yout try to reach the Abyss! 
 FYI: There are some bugs and balance issues as the game was literaly made in two days. But I will update it soon enough. In the mean time, try to reach the end! Because not even I could yet LOL. 
 And leave a comment if you can. I'd love to have some feedback ^^ 
 This project was an undergraduate teaching assistantship test for my games university course. The assignment was to create a roguelite card game in approximately two days.  
 The game was made in Construct 2 using free assets from itch.io. All of the programming and game logic was made by me. 
 
 LInks for all of the assets used in this project:  
 Enemies:  https//zerie.itch.io/tiny-rpg-character-asset-pack   
 Characters:  https//pixel-poem.itch.io/dungeon-assetpuck   
 Music and SFX:  https//leohpaz.itch.io/minifantasy-dungeon-sfx-pack   
 Cards:  https//cafedraw.itch.io/fantasy-card-assets Font:  https://kushion.itch.io/neolithic-font

title: Hacking Clicker Protocol
logline: Hack, upgrade, and dominate the system with every click in this thrilling incremental hacking game.
description:
Hacking Clicker Protocol  is an incremental game where you hack computer systems with simple clicks. Earn bits, buy upgrades, and automate your progress to build an ever-growing network. Simple, addictive, and easy to play!
  
 Support the Game:  If you enjoy the game and want to support its development, consider joining my  Patreon . Even a small contribution helps a lot.  
 ð  https://patreon.com/MayamaMaicez?utm_medium=unknown&utm_source=join_link&utm_cam... 
 
 Leave a Comment:  Do you like the game? Have any suggestions? Leave me a comment with your opinion. Your feedback matters!

title: FS25_GoldenDriller
description: Placeable RMC  version of the Tulsa Golden Driller Statue.

title: Marlow (ZX Spectrum)
logline: Malow in Apocalyptic Acid World is a platform game for ZX Spectrum 128k, inspired by "The Great Giana Sisters."
description:
Now you can also buy this beautiful Cassette release by Teknamic:  https://teknamic.com/product/marlow/ 
 
 Marlow in Apocalyptic Acid World is a platform game for ZX Spectrum 128k, inspired by "The Great Giana Sisters." What? You thought the inspiration came from a certain mustached plumber? No way… 
 Navigate this vast apocalyptic world by jumping, stomping on enemies, collecting crystals, throwing molotov cocktail, and breaking blocks with your head across 4 worlds, in a total of 17 levels and 5 Boss battles. 
 You can donwload the Beta Demo for free to test the game before you buy the full package. 
 Marlow Key Features: 
 5 Bosses and 17 stages Spread through 2 Episodes (2 programs) 7 catch sound tracks (more info on readme.txt) 10 Full screen illustrations (loading, title, intro cutscenes and endings) Fluid gameplay mechanics in a style rarely seen on the ZX Spectrum 
 
 This project was only possible thanks to MPAGD Gen2, modified version of the engine by Xavisan, that expands memory usage beyond the 48kb, without which the complex title screens, introduction, and ending, as well as the large number of music tracks, screens, and code, would not have been possible. 
 More info on teh Readme.txt file that cames along the game package. 
 Have fun! 
 
 Find me on social media  
 facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/amaweks 
 Instagram:  https://www.instagram.com/amaweks_/ 
 Bluesky:  https://bsky.app/ 
 Twitter:  https://twitter.com/amaweks 
 
 Website:  www.amaweks.com )

title: Friend of a Slime Demo
logline: Coop survivor-like action rpg with a slimy companion.
description:
Friend of a Slime is a  survivors-like   action rpg  where your best weapon is your slimy companion. 
 
 
 Stranded at the shore of mystic woods you will join the troops of slimes to defeat hordes of enemies threatening the kingdom of Holy Slime. But no worries, you won't fight those battles alone. Your cute, little, yet combat ready companion will help you with your mission. 
 
 Play together  on a single keyboard or with gamepad controllers! 
 * Feedback is appreciated will be considered. 
 * The release is planned for July 2025. 
 * Donations will directly be put into the development of the game.  Thank you! 
 * The top 10 itch.io donators will be mentioned in the Credits of the final game. 
 
 steam wishlisting  is really appreciated, thank you!

title: Trapped in the Tomb
logline: amiga game platform action adventure
description:
As you opened the ancient tomb's gates, you unknowingly triggered a mechanism that sealed you inside. Around you stretches a dark labyrinth filled with mysteries, traps, and riddles of the past. To escape to the surface, you must find crystal skulls that will unseal the closed passages. Every step is a race against time and your own fear, but somewhere in the darkness lies the path to freedom. Will you uncover the tomb's secrets and break free from its grasp? 
 The tomb is never the same twice—each time you enter, the artifacts are hidden in different locations, and your journey begins from a new starting point.  
 Purchase the Boxed Version Here 
 The digital version of this game is completely free to download and enjoy. However, if you'd like to support the developer and own a special boxed edition (includes a floppy disk and USB drive). 
 The  Box Edition  of  Trapped in the Tomb  is a special collectorâs set for true retro gaming fans. Inside, you will find:
 
 ð¹ï¸  A floppy disk  with the full game, delivering an authentic Amiga experience. ð¾  A USB pen drive , featuring:
 
 The  ADF version  of the game, ready to play on the  A500 Mini —just plug it in and start your adventure.
 The  HDD version  of the game for those who prefer a hard drive setup.
 A  custom Amiga emulator , allowing you to launch  Trapped in the Tomb  with a single click on  Windows and Linux  (available in versions for x86-64 and ARMv8).
 The  full game soundtrack  by  Shadowolf , with extended versions of the tracks used in the game. ð  A paper instruction manual , providing essential details about the game. ð¨  A collectible sticker  to complement your retro collection. ðª  A commemorative token , designed like an ancient coin with a skull motif—a small treasure from the tomb itself!  
 
 The  Box Edition  is available for purchase at the following links: At the moment, all units have been sold out. However, a new batch has already been ordered and will be available soon. If you were planning to purchase one but didnât get the chance, please donât worry â more are on the way! We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience and appreciate your patience. ð¹  Poland: :( ð  Worldwide (including Poland): :( 
 Before purchasing, make sure the game works on your computer - the digital version is completely free 
 Are you ready to uncover the secrets hidden within the tomb?   
 
 WHDLoad  version by Amiga Vault Team FB Page:  https://www.facebook.com/AMIGAVAULT FB Group:  https://facebook.com/groups/amigavaultproject 
 Hardware requirements 
 minimum : Amiga + ECS + 0.5mb Chip + 0.5mb Slow + 68000 + kickstart 1.3 + fdd recommended : 68020 processor, hdd 
 Game Controls 
 Movement  left / right  - move left or right down + fire  - shoot up or fire + left / right  - diagonal jump up or fire  - jump up Jump near a rope to grab it automatically. 
 Movement on rope left / right  - drop or grab a nearby rope up / down  - climb up or descend the rope 
 Special keys F1 / M / LMB  - view map and status F2 / R / RMB  - reset position ESC  - exit to menu 
 Game Modes 
 Hold My Hand Infinite lives and unlimited ammo. Perfect for casual fun or learning the game! 
 Start Easy 21 lives and 12 bullets. A gentle introduction with room for mistakes. 
 Go Balanced 9 lives and 6 bullets. A fair challenge for experienced players. 
 Face the Challenge 3 lives and 3 bullets. Only for the brave â can you survive? 
 Credits 
 Programming, Concept, Graphics   Marggines Music   Shadowolf Testing Gajaada Adamzeku - Polish Amiga Floppy Preservation Group Saberman Stoopi 
 
 Special Thanks 
 
 I would like to express my deepest gratitude to the creators of the game  Fred  for the ZX Spectrum. Its unique atmosphere and the unforgettable charm of the 1980s were a major source of inspiration for me during the development of this project.
 
 Fred is a game that showed me how powerful creativity and ingenuity can be in crafting memorable experiences for players. My project is a tribute to that era and to everyone who contributed to its legacy.
 
 Thank you for inspiring me and for showing that even the simplest ideas can leave a lasting impression in the hearts of gamers.

title: Hell Breaker
logline: A new puzzle game for Game Boy Color
description:
Pre-release alpha demo of Hell Breaker, a new puzzle game for the Game Boy Color. 
 Every century since the dawn of man a battle has taken place between Heaven and Hell over the souls that get lost between the realms. Each side nominates an angel to fight and the winner collects these souls for their side.  
 In this, our year 20XX, dark angel Lilith enters the puzzle arena to battle light angel Muriel for the title of Hell Breaker. 
 How to Play:  
 Score points by making matches. Lay gems of the same type and color in sets of 3 or more to make a match. Create combos for extra points.  
 Controls:  
 - D-Pad/Arrow Keys = Move 
 - A/B Buttons or Z/X Keys = Rotate Piece  
 Coming Soon:  
 - Character select.  
 - Revised scoring system inspired by character action games like Devil May Cry and Bayonetta . 
 - Leader Board.  
 - Difficulty Options.  
 - And more... 
 Credits: 
 - Mike Leisz : Game Design, Programming, Art.  
 - Tara Touzie : Game Design, Production, Sound FX.  
 - Original Music by  Robotmeadows   
 - Additional Music and Sound FX by  Tronimal   
 
 Made in GBStudio. 
 Brought to you by Technofantasy. 
 Thank you for playing! Feel free to leave a comment :)

title: Guivo.io
logline: Competitive Match-3 with Elo ranking
description:
Guivo: Competitive Match-3 
 Enjoy Guivo.io, a competitive Match-3 game playable directly in your desktop or mobile browser. Battle players worldwide, strategically destroy ice and climb global ranks in fast rounds.
 
 Forget ads and pay-to-win! Guivo emphasizes skill with its Elo ranking system, similar to chess, ensuring fair competition. The better you play, the higher you'll rank up, and if you win, your name will be displayed in the banner.
 
 Key Features: 
 
 Competitive Multiplayer:  Battle players globally in real-time
 Strategic Match-3:  Simple to learn, with depth in controlling ice
 Elo Ranking System:  Fair ranking based on skill
 Fast-Paced Rounds:  Quick and engaging gameplay
 No Pay-to-Win:  Focus on skill and strategy
 Play Anywhere:  Accessible in your browser on desktop and mobile
 
 Challenge yourself and climb Guivo leaderboards! 
 
 Play Guivo now:  https://guivo.io 
 
 Install Guivo as an App:  Open guivo.io website in your mobile browser and look for the install menu. It canât be installed directly from within the itch.io website.
 
 As a passion project developed over many years, community feedback is valued. Let me know your thoughts and suggestions for improvement.

title: Fabled Warlords 2: The Winds of Magic
logline: Lead powerful factions in a turn-based strategy game, where tactical mastery and unique units shape epic battles.
description:
A turn-based fantasy strategy game of war, magic, and shifting alliances. 
 The war-torn world of  Fabled Warlords  stands on the brink of chaos. As ancient powers awaken and new alliances are forged, factions across the lands of  Alderon, Kyrondor, Thistlemere, and Astralis  must fight for survival, conquest, and vengeance.
  
 âï¸  Rebels Campaign : Lead Kaelen Thorne and his freedom fighters as they resist invaders and overthrow Stormguardâs rule.  
 ð®  Arcanist Campaign : Defend the ancient mage kingdom from agressors. 
 â ï¸  The Fallen Campaign : Wield forbidden dark magic as Varax the Exiled, a sorcerer seeking revenge after centuries in exile.  
 ð¿  Primordial Campaign : Aid the mystical beings of Kyrondor as they flee from a growing war and return to Thistlemere.  
 ðº  Beastmen Campaign : Reclaim a lost homeland and unite the Beastmen tribes against old enemies. 
 Key Features 
 ð¡ï¸ Tactical turn-based battles with faction-specific abilities.  ð° Territory control and strategic resource management.  ð§ââï¸ Unique units, from Arcanist mages to Beastmen trolls.  â¡ A deep, evolving story shaped by war, magic, and destiny.  ð¡ï¸ Strategic variety in every battle with different game modes like: conquest, capture the flag, survival, and battle of attrition. 
 Will you rise as a hero, or will the  Winds of Magic  reshape the world in darkness? 
 Controls:
 
 Left Mouse Button  - Select, give move and attack orders to selected units. Double-click a tile to inspect terrain properties.
 Right Mouse button -  Right-click a tile to inspect terrain properties.
 W,A,S,D or Arrow Keys  - Move the camera
 Z  - Zoom in the camera
 X  - Zoom out the camera
 R  - Open the unit recruitment panel
 F  -Toggle on/off the faction ability panel 
 T  -Toggle on/off the faction time cycle panel 
 I  - Toggle on/off the unit details panel
 M  - End your turn
 ,  - Select previous unit
 .  - Select next unit 
 
 
 Windows Build 
 For those who want to download the game and play it on your windows machines, you can do so by downloading the zipped file below and extracting it: Windows Build Please note that this build is an experimental version of the game and may have bugs or other problems that I am not aware of. This version of the game is optimized for browsers only.

Your only goal is to survive. Dodge tricky obstacles, overcome challenges, and keep moving through a world full of surprises. Can you make it through the journey and bring the farmer back to reality?

title: Agent Pupil
logline: Be the unseen eye. Your mission: Infilitrate the office building without leaving a trace.
description:
"Good evening, Agent Pupil. Our friends at the  EYE have another job for you. Your latest mission: infiltrate Tress Corporation's office building and retrieve sensitive documents belonging to the company's vice president. Our sources indicate that they are located in his personal office on the third floor. The corporation has recently tightened their nighttime security, so take care not to be noticed. The EYE must remain unseen. Good luck." 
 
 All controls are on the keyboard. Use WASD to navigate the menu and Space to select menu options. Press Esc to go back or pause the game.

description:
This my first project. there may be some bugs or incorrect grammar. apologize ! TT 
 You wake up in a garden, unable to remember what happened. but you receive an invitation to a tea party—set to take place in seven days.

title: aftr img.
description: After going through the loss of his lover, he aimlessly wanders the city with their camera to reminisce about the memories they had. But as he takes a picture he gets transported through time to relive his memory and when the memory ends, he is left with an afterimage to remember their relationship and slowly come to terms with his loss, realizing that she is not truly gone but still lives on in his memories. Collect these âafterimagesâ (polaroids) of your time to grieve your loved one, with focus on the depression and acceptance aspect of the 5 stages of grief.

title: Septic Tank Sam
description:
A normal night of gaming takes a wierd turn when a strange, quirky individual joins your lobby, known only by the alias of Septic Tank Sam. 
 CONTROLS

 ESC - to pause 
 E - to interact 
 RMB - to zoom

title: The Climb
logline: An indifferent feeling sacrifice's climb for a long neglected ritual.
description:
A sacrificial lamb ascends up the sacred tower to fulfill his destiny of maintaining the ritual of the sun.  
 Now with multiple endings! 
 This  indie rage game was made by  tunarex ,  Hoebie ,  LukaCoolAwesome  and  rainbowpills  and took part of an ALUO Gamejam-esque workshop hosted by  Brin Å½van .

description:
Made in  bitsy . Controlled with wasd or the arrow keys. 
 
This game is part of a trilogy of games made in 3 different engines. The others are  
 Four Letters  (Releasing on March 24th).
 
 and

To play the games early,  learn about the bizarre production of these 3 games, gain access  to source code, ost, and more, and to support my future development  of games, consider buying  the  ...

logline: A movement-shooter where you play as a steampunk wizard.
description: Steampunk. Wizard. Do we really need to say more?

title: Lemonade Apocalypse: The Great Filter (Prototype)
logline: Lead the world to apocalypse with lemonades in this incremental clicker, with branching gameplay and stories!
description:
This Prototype contains the first stage of the story driven incremental clicker Lemonade Apocalypse: The Great Filter. 
 SUPPLY & DEMAND SIM 
 At its core is the supply and demand mechanic. Use dubious means to manipulate the sales.  
 
 ENVY THE NEIGHBOURHOOD KIDS 
 All your friends has a bicycle, and you want one too.
     
 
 
 HUMBLE BEGINNINGS OF GREED 
 After getting a bicycle you realize that this can become a business.  Choose between Cheap Lemonade, Aesthetic Lemonade and Sugarfree  Lemonade. Each with its unique twist on the gameplay, and affects the  story! More choices in the Factory stage and End Game!      
 
 HANDDRAWN ART 
 All art is drawn by hand with a unique style.
 
 PRESTIGE 
 This Prototype has a separate prestige system so that you'll be rewarded for trying the different paths, and playing through multiple times.
 
 PLAY UP UNTIL THE FACTORY 
 Once you get the factory you'll prestige in this prototype.

title: CDawgVA in: Sumimasen!
logline: A Crane Game Challenge VS Connor Himself!
description:
WARNING! 
 This game features some loud noises, flashing lights, cartoon violence, light gore, strong language, and, worst of all, a Welsh person! 
 Have you ever been so parasocial about a YouTuber playing Japanese crane games that you made a game about him just so that you can come close to replicating the feeling of playing with him? 
 Can't say I have, but if that sounds familiar -  DO I HAVE A GAME FOR YOU! 
 In this comedy  horror  game you join CDawgVirginia on a trip to an arcade filled with fun and challenging crane games! Do you have what it takes to beat them? 
 By accepting this challenge you will: 
 Turn everything you can into a crane game!  (Even yourself..?) Get to experience the average SeaDog commenter's dream! Meet actual real life  Connor Marc Colquhoun ! 
 (For legal reasons it should be clarified that the mentioned individual did not at any point participate in the process of development of this video game and a meeting will NOT be arranged with any individual that plays through it.) 
 Overthrow the government! Be blown away by all of the art and animations made by  me ! 
 Vibe to the  BANGING ORIGINAL SOUNDTRACK  by  qourxkk !
 Try to survive... 
 This is a love letter to the communities of  CDawgVA  and others that continuously inspire me and help me get through it all! I even got an interview at the best uni in the country 'cause I showed them my last game about Connor! That's insane, right?  
 Btw, please watch the trailer I worked really hard on that thing!
 
 You can follow me on my  youtube  and  twitter  or you can support me on my  boosty !

title: FAR WEST (ZX SPECTRUM 128K)
logline: No Guts no Glory
description:
NUEVO JUEGO DEL VIEJO OESTE 
 (Spectrum ZX 128K) 
 Estimados amigos del ZX Spectrum: 
 Estoy encantado de anunciar esta pequeÃ±a joya para nuestro querido ordenador clÃ¡sico: un juego del oeste, creado con mucho cariÃ±o y dedicaciÃ³n. Aunque el gÃ©nero del oeste cuenta con numerosos tÃ­tulos, espero que este juego se distinga por la pasiÃ³n y el esfuerzo personal que se han invertido en su creaciÃ³n.
 
 Far West es el resultado del trabajo de un principiante inquieto, nacido del amor por los videojuegos y el deseo de aportar algo especial a la comunidad ZX Spectrum. Sin fines comerciales ni ambiciones desmedidas, este juego es una obra de desarrollo personal que espero disfrutÃ©is tanto como yo al crearlo.
 
 Me siento muy orgulloso de poder presentar esta novedad homebrew y confÃ­o que os darÃ¡ horas de entretenimiento y nostalgia. Â¡Espero que os guste! 
 
 Antrilles. 
 
 PRESENTATION 
 I'm excited to present a new western game for the ZX Spectrum 128k, created with a lot of love and dedication. As a hobbyist with no commercial ambitions, this project is a personal effort. I hope you enjoy the game as much as I enjoyed developing it. 
 
 INTRODUCCIÃN 
 ExtraÃ±os crÃ­menes en la frontera norte de RÃ­o Bravo, obligan al Virreinato de Nueva EspaÃ±a a enviar a un agente a las minas de Santa Fe. La desapariciÃ³n de unas antiguas reliquias indias han provocado una revuelta apache. Encuentra las diez monedas doradas para resolver el enigma y restaurar la paz en la frontera. 
 PROLOGUE 
 Strange crimes on the northern border of RÃ­o Bravo force the Viceroyalty of New Spain to send an agent to the Santa Fe mines. The disappearance of some ancient indigenous relics has sparked an Apache revolt. Find the ten gold coins to solve the puzzle and restore peace on the border. 
 
 COMANDOS 
 Far West se puede jugar en el hardware original del ZX Spectrum 128k o con un emulador como Fuse o RetroVirtualMachine en Windows. TambiÃ©n tenÃ©is la opciÃ³n de descargar unos ejecutables para Windows y Linux. 
 Y para quien le guste jugar en el mÃ³vil tambiÃ©n hay emuladores para Android. 
 Puedes usar tanto el teclado como un joystick, incluyendo los modelos Kempstom y Sinclair.  
 En el teclado, las letras que debes usar son: 
 Q  : Arriba - Up A  : Abajo - Down P  : Derecha - Right O  : Izquierda - Left Espacio - Space  : Disparo - Fire 
 
 MECANICA 
 
 
 
 
 
 HISTORIA 
 En el salvaje y desÃ©rtico confÃ­n de Nueva EspaÃ±a, donde las arenas del tiempo se mezclan con leyendas de oro y peligro, se encuentra Santa Fe, en la frontera difusa de Nuevo MÃ©xico. Una sombra se cierne sobre las vastas y misteriosas tierras del norte. En las entraÃ±as oscuras y laberÃ­nticas de las minas cercanas, rumores de extraÃ±os sucesos han comenzado una circular: mineros desaparecidos, ecos inexplicables y sombras que parecen cobrar vida alimentan el miedo y la supersticiÃ³n de los lugareÃ±os. 
 Los rumores sobre antiguas reliquias apaches y leyendas de tesoros ocultos, como las mÃ­ticas diez monedas doradas, han avivado las creencias y temores en la regiÃ³n. Alarmado por estas historias y por una serie de crÃ­menes y eventos inexplicables, el gobierno de Nueva EspaÃ±a decide enviar a uno de sus mÃ¡s valientes y astutos investigadores. Su misiÃ³n es doble: desentraÃ±ar los misterios ocultos bajo la roca y el polvo, y restaurar la paz y el orden en estas tierras indÃ³mitas.
 
 A medida que el agente se adentra en las profundidades de las minas y en la intrincada red de leyendas locales, descubre que las fronteras entre la realidad y la supersticiÃ³n son mÃ¡s borrosas de lo que imaginaba. DesentraÃ±ar los secretos que se ocultan en las profundidades no solo implica resolver los enigmas que afligen a Santa Fe, sino tambiÃ©n enfrentar fuerzas desconocidas que han permanecido ocultas bajo tierra. 
 
 AGRADECIMIENTOS 
 Este videojuego ha sido posible gracias a  ZX Spectrum Game Maker , un programa gratuito creado por  Juntelart  y con la colaboraciÃ³n desinteresada de muchas personas. Quiero agradecerles de todo corazÃ³n la oportunidad que me han brindado, ya que no tengo conocimientos de programaciÃ³n. Crear un Juego de Spectrum es un sueÃ±o cumplido.
 
 Â¡AnÃ­mate a crear tus propios videojuegos con ZX Spectrum Game Maker! 
 Si yo pude hacerlo, tÃº tambiÃ©n puedes.
 
 https://gm.retrojuegos.org/ 
 
 
 Tambien quisiera expresar mi agradecimiento a  Beyker , quien desinteresadamente ha prestado la mÃºsica para este videojuego. Al que considero un nuevo amigo, ya que no dudÃ³ en ofrecer su talento y apoyo sin conocerme. 
 Beyker no solo ha contribuido con su mÃºsica, sino que tambiÃ©n me ha animado a continuar creando, mostrÃ¡ndome la enorme comunidad que hay detrÃ¡s del spectrum. 
 
 Seria injusto no mencionar a  Flopping . La primera persona que se paso el juego en 2 sentadas y que es un autentico entusiasta del viejo ZX Spectrum. Su increÃ­ble labor como beta tester, su dedicaciÃ³n y paciencia al identificar y reportar errores han mejorado sustancialmente la experiencia de Far West. No dejÃ©is de ver sus trabajos en:  https://flopping.itch.io 
 
 Y por ultimo  agradecer a mi familia y amigos la paciencia infinita que me han tenido . Pero no por mi ausencia, sino por la turra mÃ­tica que les he dado. 
 
 CONTACTO 
 Â¡Gracias por Jugar! 
 Si te ha gustado el juego, te invito a que me dejes tus comentarios, sugerencias, o incluso tus felicitaciones. Â¡Siempre estoy buscando mejorar y disfrutar de nuevas colaboraciones!
 
 Contacta conmigo en:  antrillessoftware@gmail.com 
 
 "Este pueblo es lo suficientemente grande para que quepamos todos... y tus comentarios tambiÃ©n."

title: SuperHold`em
description: Super Hold`em  is a variant of poker. You get three cards in your hand that you can replace. Three more cards are on the table. You must make a combination of 5 cards using 3 cards in your hand and 3 cards on the table.

title: Horror project
logline: Just a simple horror game to use what I have learned
description: Recently, there have been many consecutive disappearances in the town. The police were confused and did not know who the perpetrator was and what the motive for the crime was. However, a strange rumor appeared at the same time as the disappearances took place in the town. They say there is a haunted house that will kill everyone who dares to enter it. As a reporter, you have a responsibility to venture into the house and bring the truth to the light... or be stuck in that house forever.

title: Roguecraft (Amiga)
logline: A modern roguelike for the Commodore Amiga!
description:
SCENARIO 
 
 The dungeons of Moredecoom await... 
 For time immemorial, legend has told of a dark, deadly dungeon containing unimaginable horrors and riches beyond belief. Enough riches and magic to make you a king... or more... 
 You have searched for this dungeon ever since you stumbled upon the legend in an Egyptian library many years ago. It started with the rumor of an ancient dark being and a magic amulet. The legend tells of an awakening and of unspeakable horrors to come. Your search carried you across the world, one riddle at a time. 
 Through many trials and perils, you are now standing at the entrance of a dark and mystical dungeon far from where you started. You, Zendar, a fighter, a mage, or uh, a rogue, are ready to defeat the monsters and gather the riches waiting below. 
 You just need to take a leak first... 
 
 FEATURES 
 Fully procedurally-generated levels A unique experience with every playthrough A plethora of potent potions and pickups Glorious pixelated isometric graphics Atmospheric soundtrack by Jogeir Liljedahl Gruesome sound effects by h0ffman No easter eggs - just lots of chickens. 
 
 WHAT THE PRESS SAID 
 "The Lovecraftian look has been achieved splendidly. The dungeon levels ooze with atmosphere, and characters have charm and bags of personality. Roguecraft will definitely not disappoint!" - Amiga Addict 96% 
 
 
 "With gorgeous graphics, an atmospheric tune, and irresistible gameplay, this is one game that you'll certainly want to return to." -  Retro Gamer 90% 
 
 CREDITS & ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS 
 
 RICKI SICKENGER Programming 
 HENNING LUDVIGSEN Graphics 
 JOGEIR LILJEDAHL Music 
 HOFFMAN SFX 
 ANDY ROBERTS Production & Inspirational input 
 
 PLAYING THE GAME 
 The downloadable Amiga digital version is an ADF file designed for use with an Amiga emulator. For best results, we recommend playing the game using the  WinUAE  emulator.
 
 Alternatively, use a suitable utility such as "adf2disk" to write the ADF file to a floppy disk to play on real Amiga hardware.
 
 
 
 
 COMPATIBILITY 
 PAL version. Supports A500 (ECS Agnus), A500+, A600, A1200, A2000 (ECS Agnus), A3000,
  A4000, and CD32. Requires 1MB Chip RAM + 1MB Other RAM or 2MB Chip RAM.
 
 
 
 PHYSICAL VERSION 
 The physical version of Roguecraft comes in multiple flavours and includes a glossy box, CD32-compatible game CD, game manual, Roguecraft postcard, Thalamus sticker, and much more! Click  here  to visit the Thalamus online store.

title: I Miss Piggy: A Kermit Story
logline: My first project in my college programming class, Keep kermit the frog entertained and alive after his divorce
description: Kermit The Frog has been having a rough time lately, Miss Piggy is leaving him, and taking the kids, while he awaits the impending divorce papers, its up to you to keep him alive and entertained! This was the first project in my college programming class.

title: MILK
logline: I'd like to formally apologize for this project
description:
Made for the RPG Maker 10 Day RTP Challenge #1.

 - WASD / Arrow Keys / for movement.

 - Mouse controls available. Click for movement/OK, Right click for Cancel. 
 Fullscreen available from options. Menu is completely irrelevant otherwise. 
 Game will autosave at appropriate moments and will eat Slot 1, so use another slot if for some reason you want to.

 Let me know if you find any bugs!

title: Hyperspace: Quantum Fracture
logline: Blast enemies in  this sci-fi bullet hell! A hardcore shmup adventure in space!
description:
Hyperspace - Quantum Fracture: A Sci-Fi Bullet Hell Shmup Survival Game 
 Embark on an epic journey through the cosmos in Hyperspace - Quantum Fracture, a sci-fi shmup combining roguelike progression, bullet hell chaos, and intense auto-shooter action. Face relentless enemy waves and test your survival in the depths of space. 
 Key Features: 
 ð Relentless Waves of Enemies â A True Shoot 'em Up: 
 Brace yourself for an escalating challenge as swarms of enemies, from agile fighters to massive laser ships, attack from all sides. Only skillful dodging and quick upgrades will keep you alive. 
 ð§ Upgrade & Customize Your Ship: Level up and choose from powerful upgrades to enhance your shipâs abilities. Adapt your build each run to survive the unforgiving onslaught. 
 ð¥ Roguelike Bullet Hell Action: Every run starts fresh—no second chances. With permadeath looming, each decision matters as you push further against endless waves of enemies. 
 ð¯ Auto-Shooter with Reflex-Based Dodging: Your ship automatically targets the most dangerous threats, allowing you to focus on skillful movement to evade enemy fire in true bullet hell fashion. 
 ð¥ Adaptive Difficulty & Survival Challenge: The longer you last, the tougher the enemies become. Defeat foes, gather experience, and unlock stronger upgrades to push your limits in this intense survival game. 
 How to Play: 
 ð¡ï¸ Survive â Dodge waves of enemy fire and stay alive as long as possible. â¡ Upgrade â Collect XP, level up, and enhance your shipâs power. ð¾ Conquer â Face massive bosses and push your limits in this thrilling shmup adventure. 
 A Sci-Fi Roguelike for Every Player 
 Whether you're a fan of shoot 'em ups, permadeath survival games, or high-intensity bullet hell action, Hyperspace - Quantum Fracture offers a rewarding experience for both newcomers and seasoned pilots. 
 Playable on mobile as well as PC, landscape & portrait supported. 
 Follow GameFizz on X 
 https://www.gamefizz.com

title: Frostfang Fighter 2025
logline: A fighting game that was designed by students in Game Animation class at Shenkar College of Art, Design and Engineering.
description:
Frostfang Fighter 2025  is a collaborative project from the Game Animation class, instructed by Zach Cohen at the School of Visual Communication, Shenkar College of Art, Design, and Engineering. As part of their third-year coursework in the Gaming and Animation track, each student designed and animated their own unique character, creating all assets and bringing them to life within the game. 
 Participants:  
Alina Sidlenikov, Ayala Avganim, Bar Markovich, Chen Bor, Eyal Hochberger, Itamar Matalon, Liam Palmorm, Noah Avni Platnick, Omer Nachmias, Ron Tamir, Rotem Feldman, Sarah Lerner, Noa Lev, Yotam Liberman, Zoya Klinovski

title: Poop Killer - Flush or Die!
logline: The real trash horror of the 80s!
description:
THE POOP KILLER IS BACK… AND THIS TIME ITâS PERSONAL! 
 Get ready for a  (disgusting) dive into true 80s horror trash!  "Poop Killer - Flush or Die"  brings back the filthiest killer of all time, now in a crazier, bloodier and absolutely hilarious experience! 
 With authentic VHS visuals, a disgusting horror atmosphere and a ridiculously disturbing story, this game is a tribute to the golden age of trash horror, mixing scares, courage and bathroom humor like never before! 
 
 SYNOPSIS: 
 Bob and Case just wanted a quiet night in… but fate (and a clogged toilet) had other plans. 
 In the suburbs of New York in 1985, two pot dealers spend the evening eating, smoking and settling a few scores. But when a clueless friend ignores an important warning and decides to take a dump in a broken toilet, the nightmare begins. 
 The Poop Killer has escaped from the asylum. He's out there. And he doesn't forgive. 
 Now, Bob and Case must survive a night of absolute insanity, where one wrong move could be their last. 
 FLUSH… OR DIE! 
 
 GAMEPLAY: 
 Basically an atmospheric and immersive walking simulator with combat and first-person shooter elements. A throwback to the trashy horror movies of the 80s, with nostalgic visuals.

title: Egbert
logline: A classic  Commodore 64 game rewritten on Nintendo's Gameboy handheld console by WLS.
description:
This is a homebrew game, run on Gameboy DMG. Original version: Alan G. Osborne - Games Machine Ltd. , 1983 - Commodore 64. Created with GB-Studio 2.0.0 beta5!
 
 Also available for download in .CIA format for the Nintendo 3DS virtual console!
 
 
 A fast Arcade Action Game for all the family to play.
Egbert works on the production line at 'LEYSPACE'. It was comfortable life until the invasion of the TEBBITES from the planet TOR. Egbert's union has been exterminated and the Tebbies have left their deadly Pets and Items running wild in the workplace. 
 
 As if wasn't enough, the evil invaders have forced Egbert to take care of an Egg - damaging the Egg will have fatal consequences for poor Egbert.
 
 Egbert is now on piecework - can he earn a decent wage? Can he even survive?
 
 WARNING! You may get an ulcer by playing this game.
 
 SEVEN levels of SKILL
 
 1. Novice
2. Average
3. Good
4. Excelent
5. Gentleman
6. Wizard
7. The God!
 
 Anybody who can do level 7, should write and let us know! :)
 
 
 
 Start the game :  Start
 
 Move : Cursor Keys
 
 Information:  Select
 
 
 
 Start the game :  Start
 
 Move:  Arrow Keys 
 
 Information:  Shift
 
 
 
 Egbert - Lemon64 
 
 You can download the ROM file of the game from the  WLS  website!

title: We Have You Surrounded
logline: Get da bag and scram! The fuzz are after ya!
description:
WE HAVE YOU SURROUNDED 
 You're a goon on the loose, but the fuzz are hot on your tail!  Survive for as long as possible and collect as much loot as you can before you're done in. 
 press the [X] key to start, and arrow keys to move.

 The game tells the story of the Jupiter complex, where a person suddenly disappeared and the lights went out. The head of the complex decides to hire a night guard (the main character) until the situation is resolved.

 In the game we will be pursued by various animatronics. If they come close, you need to close the door. In the game you also need to control a robot that does something around the building. For each completed task you will be shown a VHS tape with a storyline

title: Reviving An Angel
description:
How do you revive an angel?  
 
 Reviving An Angel is a turn-based RPG set in a world where Archangels, the greatest creations of the Almighty, are in a path of war. Wanting to revive his beloved, Harold, a young Fallen Hunter, saw himself facing an Archangel as he challenged the limits of his mortality. 
 Wishlist now on Steam! 
 Reviving An Angel promises to offer a different experience derived from the older classics with a unique turn-based system, engaging storylines, and interesting characters. 
 
 Utilizing Critical Effects provides a new strategy for players during combat. And along with Haroldâs unique Next Effects and Counter Effects to customize, Reviving An Angel competes with its one-of-a-kind and intriguing combat system. 
 
 Join Harold in exploring the Regalia Continent, where a war with Archangel Lucifer imbued the lands for thousands of years. Collect artifacts, learn powerful skills and craft the best equipment while relishing unforgettable storylines full of twists and turns. All to Revive An Angel! 
 
 Wishlist now on Steam! 
 
 
 
 * Developer *
 
 Hi, Iâm SolemnGravity! Iâm pretty much a solo dev inspired by Final Fantasy games and this is my first game. Iâm a writer first developer, and right now, Iâm struggling to obtain assets that will complete the story in my mind. If you think the game has potential, you can donate funds for me to afford commissions and complete the game by clicking the Support This Game button. 
 
 Donations are very much appreciated!

description: This demo was created in Unity without writing a single line of code.

title: Neon Hopper
logline: Jump and run! This dynamic 2D platformer is packed with tricky levels. Can you make it to the finish?
description: In this fast-paced and challenging 2D platformer, you take on the role of a hero who must conquer deadly levels filled with traps, moving obstacles, and precision jumps. The gameplay is intense, and every death is a lesson that brings you closer to mastering each stage.

title: Neptune's Caverns - Enhanced (Commodore 64)
logline: Text adventure game
description:
An undersea text adventure game. You have found the magic plug that belongs at the bottom of the sea, and your quest is to put it back before the waters all drain away... 
  This is an improvement on a BASIC text adventure that was an example game from the book "Creating a Database Adventure Game" by Steve Rodgers and Marcus Milton (1985). Check the docs on the disk for more info on the improvements.

title: Cow Milker
description:
Game by minindo and Nacho, in order to learn Python and Pygame. 
 Graphics "by" minindo and Nacho 
 Music by minindo 
 
 Welcome to Cow Milker! 
 The US government has identified a mutant cow, Barbara, which can produce infinite milk at extremely high speeds. They are looking for a new director for the DMC (Department of Milk Collection) to optimize the milking of Barbara.  
 Prove to them that you are a better milk collection strategist than their computer algorithm. Click on Barbara to begin collecting milk! Milk can be spent on 5 different items that collect milk automatically. Items further down the list collect milk more efficiently, but are (at least to start) more expensive. 
 With each purchase, the cost of an item increases by a constant factor. Reach 1 million milk before the computer to win! 
 Notes: 
 - Play with sound for full experience! 
 - Clicking is strange with trackpad. Use of mouse is recommended. 
 - The general concept for our game is taken from the classic "Cookie Clicker" game.

title: Eggtastic
logline: Puzzle
description: EggTastastic  is a tricky and satisfying puzzle game where you must paint, and cover your egg in the right order to match the target design. Experiment with different colors, patterns, and masks to recreate the perfect look. Plan carefully—one wrong step and you might have to start over! With increasing complexity, can you crack the code and master the art of egg decoration?

title: Dungeon Descent -Pico8

This  Pico-8 multicart project  is part of a university project and was originally designed for a  three-screen arcade table . 
 Play solo or team up with up to  three friends  for  four-player action !

title: JM Ranked
logline: 3D Multiplayer Shooter
description:
JM Ranked 
 Fast-paced multiplayer arena shooter where you face off against both players and zombies in intense combat! Team up or go solo as you battle through waves of the undead while competing against other players. 
 KEY FEATURES: 
 â¢ Competitive & Cooperative Gameplay - Fight other players while dealing with zombie threats 
 â¢ Dynamic Weapon System - Multiple weapons with unique recoil patterns and ADS mechanics 
 â¢ Upgrade System - Spend your hard-earned points to upgrade your sprint speed 
 â¢ Pickup System - Find weapons, ammo, and health around the arena to stay in the fight 
 â¢ Smooth Movement - Fluid player controls with adjustable mouse and ADS sensitivity 
 Grab your weapons, watch your corners, and don't forget - the zombies aren't your only enemies in this arena! 
 Controls: 
 â¢ WASD - Movement 
 â¢ SPACE - Jump 
 â¢ Left Click - Shoot 
 â¢ Right Click - Aim Down Sights 
 â¢ E - Pickup items 
 â¢ U - Upgrade sprint speed (when available) 
 â¢ ESC - Toggle cursor 
 â¢ TAB - Leaderboard/Chat 
 Tips: 
 â¢ Keep moving to avoid both zombie and player attacks 
 â¢ Watch your ammo count and look for ammo pickups 
 â¢ Use ADS for more precise shots at range 
 â¢ Save points for sprint speed upgrades to outmaneuver enemies

title: EDEN
logline: CREATE THE PARADISE ON EARTH
description:
KEEP ALL SPECIES ALIVE 
 MAINTAIN BALANCE 
 CREATE PARADISE ON EARTH HASA DIGA EEBOWAI 
 
 CONTROLS 
 
 
 
 HOW TO PLAY 
 The game works in an "influenced autoplay way". Every animal and plant acts depending on several rules, but you can influence said rules by grabbing and dragging the animals to different positions.  
 Rules: 
 1. Grass expands into adjacent tiles. 
 2.  Grass dries up after a long time. 
 3. Animals need to eat to not starve to death 
 4. Animals may procreate when there is enough room and 2 of 'em are together and both are not too hungry 
  5. Sheep eat grass. 
  6. Wolves eat sheep. 
  7. Thunders kill animals and set the grass on fire. 
 8. Fire expands to nearby grass. 
  9. Fire expands faster through dried-up grass. 
 10. Fire kills animals. 
 11. Animals die by old age after a long time.

title: BOLF: A Golfoxing Game
logline: Golf and boxing combined at last - it's Bolf, baby!
description:
BOLF: A Golfoxing Game 
 Two polar opposite sports meet at last - it's Bolf! 
 Box your golf ball and try to hit it as close to the hole as possible - only one stroke per hole. Watch for wind, water and bunkers - careful not to get knocked out! Play 9 or 18 holes. 
 
 Controls 
 This game is controlled entirely with the mouse. Click buttons on screen to perform actions and progress. 
 Players can also hit the [R] key to give up and go back to the main menu; intended for hardcore golfoxers going for a good score. 
 
 Credits 
 All music, the font, and a large portion of sounds are original. All outside sounds and images are licensed under  CC0  and have been heavily edited. 
 
 Software Used 
 Godot - Game Engine Adobe After Effects - Graphics (yes, really) REAPER - Sounds/Music PixelForge - Font Editor 
 
 Desktop Version 
 The core game is exactly the same between the web and desktop versions of the game. The only differences are in the options - such as additional settings for graphics and the game remembering your settings. 
 
 This game was made for the  2025 Code Ninjas Sensei Game Jam !

title: Piko Quest
logline: This game is a fantasy RPG.
description:

 This is a puzzle-filled RPG with quests. Complete quests in each town, acquire weapons and armor, and master magic, while aiming for the castle where the Demon King is.

title: I Forget to Avoid
logline: Use hand movement to trace and trap runaway thoughts!
description:
Title:  âI Forget to Avoidâ 
 Created for the one day Geidai x USC game jam in Tokyo, Japan (March 2025) By Samuel Tang, Bernice Wang, Kang Xue Ning  
 Music by Ari Sol 
 How to play: 
 This games uses webcam to track hand movement. 1. Raise any hand to control the pink line 2. Loop the pink line around the moving marble to capture. Listen and see the âthought mapâ youâve created! If there is too much brain activity, the mind explodes… and you have to start all over again.  
 About: 
 Some thoughts are more difficult to articulate than others. â I Forget To Avoid â uses webcam to track the path of a players hand. Players trace, loop, and reveal the thoughts of this personâs mind.  Our experience visualizes chasing after runaway thoughts, some of which are funny and easy while others are introspective and harder to reconcile with.  The more a player moves, the more activity is tracked… and too much, means the mind overheats. When the pink bar fills all the way up, we start again from an empty brain to retrace her thoughts. Will you be able to understand this personâs mind?

 Thank you so much for checking out our game! We worked really hard on it. Gramary is Ryan's first project in Godot, and a lot of the one month dev time was spent learning the ins and outs of the engine. Some areas were rushed and are visually half-finished, and there are a couple of minor bugs. But the game is complete experience, and we hope you'll enjoy the meticulous pixel art, authentic SNES-hardware soundtrack, and our first foray into a new fantasy world.

title: Wandering Okali
logline: Discover magical creatures while exploring a whimsical fantasy world.
description:
Kalops' dream has been writing an encyclopedia on Okali's fauna and flora, ever since she became old enough to read on her own. One day, early in the morning, she decides to depart the village she's never left before, and meets a strange old lady, who seems to know a bit too much about the world. 
 
 Wandering Okali  is a visual novel with strong focus on fantasy creatures and their biology, which lets you follow Kalops, her best friend Saspi and strange lady Gloria on a world trip around Okali, discovering and learning about unique animals, magical plants, and even mysterious entities. 
 Each chapter is expected to be around 10k words or more. 
 This VN is a kinetic novel. This means there is only one main narrative, and any choices you are presented with will only have very short-term consequences. 
 
 What you can expect: 
 Lots of art:  Feast your eyes on the many painted CGs and backgrounds, the field notes in the style of old scientific illustrations, and the many silly doodles that complete the visuals of the story. Perhaps even an animation or two, once in a while~ 
 Immersive worldbuilding:  With the story's focus on the natural world, you will learn about the tiny bugs and the grasses unique to this world, as well as the giant magical beasts and the ethereal landscapes.  
 Girls, girls, girls:  Most, if not all the characters will be girls (or girl-adjacent). And lesbians, most likely.  
 A bright and whimsical atmosphere:  You can expect to see lots of beautiful, vibrant colors and intricate details! 
 
 Chapter 3 is out! 
 Get updates, previews, and extra lore and concept art in the Tumblr blog! ðª² https://wanderingokali.tumblr.com/   ðª²

logline: A psychological horror game set in a rural Philippine town in the 1980sâwhere the past never stays buried.
description:
THE HOLLOW SHIFT 
 A psychological horror game set in a rural Philippine town in the 1980s—where the past never stays buried. You arrive to visit your  grandfatherâs cabin , hoping for a quiet stay and a chance to earn some extra funds by taking a  night shift at Litoy's small sari-sari store in rural quiet town . 
 But as the nights pass, something feels… off. Strange noises. Odd occurrences.  Whispers of the past that refuse to stay buried. 
 
 What begins as a simple job soon spirals into a terrifying mystery—one that forces you to  confront the horrors hidden in the dark  and uncover a truth that was never meant to be found.
  
 Features: 
 ð¯ï¸  Classic Psychological Horror  â Slow-building tension, eerie atmosphere, and a creeping sense of dread.  ðï¸  Authentic 1980s Provincial Setting  â Explore a small rural town, a  grandfatherâs old cabin , and other unsettling locations inspired by real-life Filipino provinces.  ðµ  Retro Horror Aesthetic  â Inspired by  PS1-style visuals  and atmospheric horror games, with a  classic music box soundtrack  that holds more secrets than it seems.  ðï¸  Puzzle-Solving & Exploration  â Search for clues, uncover hidden objects, and solve  environmental puzzles  to piece together the horrifying past.  ð»  A Story of Tragedy & Regret  â The past never forgets.  Can you escape the nightmare, or will history repeat itself?

title: Game, Set, Fetch!
logline: Dog Tennis
description:
About 
 Game, Set, Fetch!  is an arcade-style sports game inspired by the fast-paced tennis games of the SNES/N64 eras. It can be played single-player against a CPU, or with a friend via local multiplayer. Gameplay is twitchy, and each player has their own physical attributes and play-style. 
 Note: This game  requires  a gamepad with analog sticks (and an additional gamepad if playing multiplayer). 
 Features 
 Two unique playable dogs. Singleplayer against an AI opponent with three difficulty settings. Two-person local/couch multiplayer. Customizable match length. Two camera options (single-player only, multiplayer always uses an overhead camera). Two distinct shot selection modes Button input: traditional tennis game inputs, where each button maps to a type of shot (topspin, backspin, or lob). Stick input: in this novel mode, shot selection is done by manipulating the right stick, similar to inputting commands in a fighting game. Tricky to master, but it's a little more immersive and can be a fun change-up from button mashing. Silly ragdolls! Getting hit in the face is fun again! Perhaps it always was. Practice mode: a pressure-free session with the ball machine. A full interactive tutorial teaching  everything you need to know to play a match. 
 Tested on Steam Deck, works well on medium graphics settings.

description:
It's a normal Sunday morning. You roller skate to the nearest Jack-in-the-Box to try out its new "Jackburger", only to realize you forgot your wallet (whatever). Except somehow... you get involved in a huge conspiracy involving cults, Olive Garden, and... the FBI? 
 Controls: 
 â¤ WASD or Arrow Keys to move the player 
 â¤ Click on things to interact 
 â¤ X to advance dialogue 
 â¤ Z to eavesdrop (when told) 
 There are two possible routes in this game. Choose wisely; the fate of countless people lie in your hands. 
 If you are unsure what to do, watch the WALKTHROUGH:  
 
 
 
 Play Saturday Morning first if you haven't!  https://scratch.mit.edu/projects/411199002/ 
 If you got the Pastafarian ending, watch this 
 
 
 Tips 
 â¤ Read through all the dialogue carefully. It gives you hints for what to do next 
 â¤ Memorize all the character's names 
 â¤ Remember which room is which 
 Credits 
 â¤ Shannon "Alyelle" Wang (referred to as "Berricake" in project) - Programmer, Graphics Artist, Scriptwriter 
 â¤ My sister hiohbye - The person who came up with the beautiful plot 
 â¤ Gameplay Music (Kubbi - Up In My Jam) 
 â¤ Ending Music (Jack Stauber - Buttercup, 8-bit cover by Mooph) 
 â¤ Main References: Jack-in-the-Box, Olive Garden, the Church of the Flying Spaghetti Monster 
 â¤ Special thanks to Jonathan and Anjini for repetitively playtesting this!

title: Panzerjaeger (C64) by Sander Alsema
logline: [BASIC 10Liner 2025] [PUR-80]
description:
--- Panzerjaeger --- 
 Written by Sander Alsema for the 10-liner competition 2025. 
 Language: Commodore 64 Basic v2 
 Category: PUR-80 
 --- Description & Instructions --- 
 The days of peace are a distant memory. Intense fighting on both sides has led to a death toll of unprecedented proportions. Somewhere in all this carnage a tank battalion was on manoeuvres. Unfortunately however, during the night it was ambushed and decimated. The few remaining tanks managed to take up defensive positions, but the battle is lost, let there be no doubt about that. Less than a handful of noble heroes are left standing against an overwhelming enemy. Determined to give them a run for their money, it is up to you to take out as many enemy tanks as possible before capitulating. 
 Move your joystick in port II left and right to move your tank back and forth. Press the fire button to fire a shell. 
 You've got plenty of shells, but you can fire only one at a time. Whenever you destroy a tank, it will make the others more daring, and they will approach quicker. If a tank reaches your line, then your tank is lost. After losing three tanks you have no option but to surrender. 
 Press any keyboard key to play again. 
 --- Code Explanation --- 
 Line 0: Read string data from somewhere else in the program, namely: 
          - Spaces above enemy tank that erase it when moving down. 
          - Enemy tank barrel facing right. 
          - Enemy tank barrel facing left. 
          - Player's tank. 
          - Bottom part of enemy tank. 
         Set a variable with an often used value to save code space 
         elsewhere in the program. 
         In a loop build the vertical orientation string and initialize 
         the registers of the sound chip. 
         Set the horizontal position variable of the player's tank. 
         Set the number of player's tanks (lives) to three. 
 Line 1: Clear the screen, display the score and number of player's tanks. 
         Set the horizontal position variable of the enemy tank. 
         Set the horizontal destination variable of the enemy tank. 
         If all player's tanks are lost then display "SURRENDER", wait 
         until a key is pressed and restart the game. 
 Line 2: Move the enemy tank towards the horizontal destination. 
         If the enemy tank was hit or has reached the player's tank then 
         decrease number of player's tanks (if enemy reaches player), 
         clear the direction variable of the enemy tank, increase the 
         score (if enemy was hit), clear the vertical position variable 
         of the enemy tank, clear the keyboard buffer, clear the boolean 
         tank-was-hit variable, and jump to line 1. 
 Line 3: If the enemy tank has reached its horizontal destination, then 
         calculate a new one with a formula that works like this: 
          - Pick a random horizontal position. 
          - Determine the difference with the current horizontal position. 
          - Divide this by a number greater or equal to one, depending on 
            the score. 
          - Finally add this to the current horizontal position. 
         This will make an enemy tank spend less time moving horizontally, 
         as the score increases. Therefore approaching quicker, and making 
         the game harder. 
         Calculate the new horizontal direction. 
         Move enemy tank down. 
         Use the string variable of the tank barrel facing right. 
         If the horizontal direction is left, then use the string variable 
         of the tank barrel facing left. 
 Line 4: If the vertical position of the shell was set, then erase the 
         current position and move the shell up. If the vertical position 
         is still set, then display the shell. 
 Line 5: Display the enemy tank. 
         Read the joystick values. 
         If the fire button was pressed and the vertical position of the 
         shell is clear, then set the vertical and horizontal position 
         of the shell to the barrel of the player's tank. 
 Line 6: Display the player's tank. 
         Set the boolean tank-was-hit variable when the character above 
         the shell was not space, and the vertical position of the shell 
         was not at the top of the screen. 
         Set background colour to black or yellow if enemy tank was hit. 
 Line 7: Use the joystick values to calculate the horizontal direction of 
         the player's tank. 
         Use this value to calculate the new horizontal position of the 
         player's tank. 
         If the enemy tank was not hit then jump to line 2. 
         This line also contains string data. 
 Line 8: Clear the vertical position of the shell. 
         Set sound chip register to white noise. 
         In a loop gradually decrease the volume of the explosion. 
         Jump to line 2. 
         This line also contains string data. 
 Line 9: This line only contains string data. 
 ---

title: Alice in Public Domain
logline: Alice is back and ready to save Wonderland
description:
Experience an unprecedented adventure where public domain favourites like Alice and Pooh Bear come together for the first time, each bringing their own quirks, challenges, and stories into an interconnected narrative. In this satirical action adventure, Alice is ripped from the real world back into Wonderland, this time through an  i nternet rabbit-hole.  
 
 She must save not only Wonderland itself but the Public Domain as a whole. TV-headed brutes run rampant causing chaos and destroying the art that once was. Have conversations with characters like Shakespeare and Mad Hatter, and use abilities such as shrinking, smashing, grenade-throwing, and rabbit-hole destruction.  
 Itâs an unmissable, improbable combination of classic childhood characters that have grown alongside us and a call to AI usage in todayâs art market. Fantasy, nostalgia and public domain art meet adult humour and unrelenting fun. Come join the Public Domain, youâll join us 70 years after your death anyways, might as well see what youâre in for! 
 
 Supports both controller and keyboard & mouse! 
 
 
 
 
 
 
                     Alice is an experience card thrower, making her aim lethal against the average man.  Quick, witty, and nimble, Alice's game-play is fast-paced.  
 Personality-wise, Alice is a 23 year old fiercely creative soul with an attitude as sharp as her artistry. She never wanted to be a hero, but it seems history repeats itself and here she is again. She wouldnât even think about hinting at her heart of gold, sheâd rather insult you instead. A bee that craves to sting and a sense of humour that she finds hilarious, but does anyone else? 
   
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
                     Bulky, strong, and cuddly, Pooh dons a giant honey mace that deals huge damage to his enemies.  His massive, weighty game-play makes him the perfect companion to the blonde agile heroine.  
 Personality-wise, Pooh is a life-sized teddy bear that cares about honey and honey only. He doesnât like tight spaces but is simply unbothered by everything else Wonderland has to offer. Heâs on the hunt for something sweet and wonât stop swinging at brutes until he gets it.

title: MUKKE (Technical Playtest)
logline: MUKKE is a story-driven music RPG. Dive into Mukke City's wild music scene & make your own tunes!!
description:
MUKKE is a story-driven music RPG! 
 (this is a technical playtest version only working on Windows systems) 
 
 Explore the  80s  in the  West-Berlin inspired  Mukke City and dive into its music scene! Create your own music, meet new friends & get your tapes on the radio!  
 MUKKE is a mixture of  music creation tool  and  narrative game ! 
 
 This is a technical playtest version of the game MUKKE! Play the first chapters of its story & get acquainted with its music creation! Complete quests, unlock new music features & enjoy your new life in Mukke City! 
 Help us create a smooth experience by testing all of MUKKE's systems, mechanics and finding any bugs, technical problems or just elements that you personally don't like! Submit your feedback and hardware specs  [here]  to help us with the development! 
 And if you've enjoyed your time, feel free to wishlist the game on  steam  & join our  Discord  for development details, feedback opportunities & more! 
 Thank you very much! 
 
 Who are we? 
 We're APETENSE Interactive, a small indie game collective based in Berlin's south-eastern district of Treptow-KÃ¶penick! 
 We're dedicated to making creative & meaningful games that we hope will inspire you to be creative yourself!   
 Thank you for being part of this journey!

title: Pjusk
logline: A small Amiga puzzle game
description:
Trapped in a treacherous dungeon. 
 
 Every step is a puzzle - every battle a test of strategy. 
 Defeat enemies in the right order, collect power-ups and carve your way to the exit. 
 One wrong move, and the dungeon claims another lost soul.
 
 
 Choose your path wisely. 
 
 This is a small puzzle game for Commodore Amiga 500 KS1.3 (+512 slow mem) and upward. (Note: The WHDLoad version have slightly higher requirements.) 
 Bump into enemies to attack them but be careful because some are strong, and some will weaken you to the point that you can't continue. 
 Use pick-ups to your advantage in your fight against evil dungeon-dwellers. 
 Can you complete all 24 levels? Good luck :) 
 
 
 Code & graphics: zooperdan Music: mA2E / dSr 
 The WHDLoad version was kindly put together by the  Amiga Vault  team. 
 
 
 Note: This is a remaster of an  original concept  made for PC by Robert Alvarez ( rob1221.itch.io )

title: CTRL
logline: Literal Space Shooter
description:
Here's an explanation of the provided HTML game code: 
 This is a cross-platform shooter game implemented in HTML5 Canvas with modern web technologies. Let's break down the key components: 
 ### Structure 
 - The game uses a single HTML file containing CSS styles and JavaScript 
 - Employs a responsive canvas that fills the entire viewport 
 - Features both desktop and mobile controls 
 ### Visual Elements 
 1. **Background Elements** 
 - Stars with twinkling effects 
 - Two layers of cities (large and tiny) with parallax scrolling 
 - Buildings with gradient effects and lights 
 - Mode7-style perspective scaling for depth effects 
 2. **Game Objects** 
 - Player ship with rotation and movement 
 - Enemy ships that chase the player 
 - Laser projectiles with glowing effects 
 - Explosions with particle effects 
 - Muzzle flashes when shooting 
 ### Controls 
 - **Desktop**: ESDF/Arrow keys for movement, mouse for aiming/shooting 
 - **Mobile**: Dual virtual joysticks (movement and shooting) 
 - **Gamepad**: Supported with analog stick controls 
 ### Technical Features 
 1. **Performance Optimizations** 
 - Request Animation Frame for smooth animation 
 - Delta time-based movement 
 - Efficient canvas rendering with minimal state changes 
 2. **Audio System** 
 - Web Audio API for sound effects 
 - Dynamic sound generation for shots and explosions 
 3. **Collision Detection** 
 - Precise hitbox calculations 
 - Scale-aware collision detection for Mode7 effects 
 ### Game Logic 
 - Score tracking 
 - Enemy spawning system 
 - Projectile management 
 - Particle effects system 
 - Pause/resume functionality 
 The code demonstrates modern web game development practices with attention to cross-platform compatibility, performance, and user experience.

title: Future Fronts (EARLY PLAYTEST COPY)
logline: Custom-Mecha Action Game
description:
Future Fronts (working title) is a custom-mecha action game built in the Godot Engine, in this early playtest copy you can build your mech from a selection of playtest parts and weapons and play through five missions as well as three challenge arena fights. Your part choice effects your stats and the handling of your mech. 
 Send feedback to this email address: futurefrontsfeedback@gmail.com 
 THIS IS A VERY EARLY ROUGH BUILD OF THE GAME MEANT ENTIRELY FOR PUBLIC PLAYTESTING AND FEEDBACK, IT IS NOT REPRESENTATIVE OF THE FINAL PRODUCT 
 A tutorial is available in-game but important information for the user interface, the control layout and stats can be found at the bottom of this page.  Currently controllers are not supported, controller support will be offered in the next playtest build.  Currently there are no weight or generator capacity limits on your build  so you can freely equip anything(however a heavy weight will still make you slower). This will change in the next build as well. 
 Not all mechanics are completed or finalized, some stats and systems haven't been integrated. A few of these systems will be designed based on playtest feedback. Some of these stats/systems are the following 
 Armor and Resistances
 Arm Recoil Reduction
 Energy Weapon interactions and Power Distribution System mechanics
 Targeting Evasion and Targeting Interference
 Extension Modules Maximum weight burdens for arms and legs, maximum energy load on generator 
 Feedback is highly encouraged and valuable for the development of this project, below are a list of known issues, they will be addressed before the game is complete 
 "The sound is bad" -Yes it is, it is entirely placeholder and will be replaced with custom sounds in the future. "The Main Menu UI is bad" -It sure is, it is also mostly placeholder. If you have specific recommendations for how to change the UI however, do send them. "There isn't enough Melee" -Melee has been on the backest of backburners, currently there is only one melee weapon but there will be many options in the future. "There should be build saving" -There will be in the future. "The head choice doesnt change my stats" - Heads are purely asthetic and don't have stats. 
 
 UI CONTROLS : 
 To enter the customization menu, click on the HANGAR button on the main menu. Cycle through parts using the buttons on the left side of the screen, changes to important stats can be tracked on the right side of the screen and part stats will be displayed anytime a part is changed.  To confirm a part change make sure to click the CONFIRM button in the upper left portion of the screen. To cancel any changes and revert to the last saved build press CANCEL.  To switch to the paint menu click the PAINT MENU button and click it again to switch back to the part selection. Similarly there is a CONFIRM and RESET button in the paint menu. To switch which part of your mech you are currently painting, use the buttons on the left side of the menu. There is a  SIMPLE  mode which will let you paint either the entirety of your frame or the entirety of your weapons and an  ADVANCED  mode which lets you paint each part seperately. The UI is pretty bad looking, will be fixed in the eventual UI rework. 
 GAMEPLAY CONTROLS: 
 WASD : Controls movement F : Toggles boosters on/off. When boosters are off you will fall at a normal rate instead of gliding.  Moving with boosters does not consume energy. SPACE : Jump and UpwardBoost while in the air LEFTCLICK/RIGHTCLICK : Use your equipped left and right hand weapons Q/E or 1/2 : Use your equipped left and right back-mounted weapons (IT IS RECOMMENDED TO USE A MOUSE BUTTON SETUP FOR THIS) R : Action key, this has a few different uses. If you hold down the action key and use any of your reloadable weapons you will manually reload them. If you hold down the action key while moving against a wall and jump you will execute a wall jump. C : Overboost toggle. SHIFT : Quickboost, use this to dodge and dash around. 
 STAT TIPS: 
 Your quickboost has technical properties based on your part stats. It has a duration, given by your thrusters, an impulse time given by your thrusters and a peak time given by your power distribution system. During the duration of your quickboost your velocity will approach the maximum speed of your quickboost based on your impulse time(the lower the faster) and then stay at that speed based on the peak time(the higher the longer) before decreasing back down to your normal speed during the remaining duration. 
 Your power distribution system is a component that applies modifiers to your generator properties and tweaks the performance of other systems, currently the PDS only affects thruster and generator stats.  
 Your thrusters have an acceleration value, this determines how quickly you reach your maximum traveling speed while moving.  This also affects how quickly and snappily you can switch from moving in one direction to the other.  Your thruster acceleration will start at its base stat and be reduced based on how heavy your build is. You can counteract this reduction with the MANEUVERABILITY stat that is on your frame's legs. A heavy frame with low maneuverability will feel weightier and require more mindful control. 
 Your targeting system has an ideal range and a range spread. It also has an acquisition level and acquisition rate. When you lock onto a target your aim will initially not be on them perfectly but it will improve by your acquisition rate over time to a particular level. This lock level is improved greatly if you have your target within the range spread of your ideal range. There are three playtest targeting systems, one for each range.  You will know your lock level as your lock box and reticule will turn from white to green and then red when you are above a 90 percent lock quality. At higher quality locks your frame will lead it's shots.

title: Wake UP
logline: Accentuate the positive, eliminate the negative, and WAKE UP to a world that's better than it was. For Red Pill Jam
description:
The world is bad. People are evil. Good things happen to bad people. And bad things to the good ones. Page after page, headline after headline, rumour after rumour. 
 Did you know? 
 That crime is actually going down? That world hunger is ebbing off? That reforestation is on a good way? That we harvest more renewable energy than ever before? That there are more kids in school, for longer, and more are vaccinated? Some cancer types are about to go extinct. Polio will be, soon. 
 Who is telling you the world is bad? And,  cui bono  - who profits from you believing this? Open your eyes. It is  not  pointless,  not  fruitless, it  does  work, it  is  worth the effort to make a future, a better future. 
 
 
 
 
 An arcade shooter. Fire with mouseclick, pause with P; Q to quit. Let only the good thoughts through, blast the negative! 
 
 Audio:  CormalvaMusic 
 Art, game design, programming:  Jennifer S. Lange 
 A jam game by Make it a Triple, 2025. Get in touch:  Bluesky  |  Mastodon  |  Discord 
 Created for Red Pill Jam 1.
