In this game, you are playing as an escaped lab rat. Your mission is to scurry through the maze-like lab and find a way out. You must be careful as traps are set, and scientists roam the halls looking to capture you.  
 Experiment 10-74 was developed in a 10 week course. The game circles around the core verb "Scurry". With no fighting mechanics the only way to escape the lab is to scurry your way to the exit.  Similar to how rats are tested on in mazes in labs, the entire map is set up like a maze.

 First step 
Get to the area on the right from central room with a dragon monument and collect a card there.
 
 
 
 Second step 
Using a card from previous step, get to the area below central room and collect a card there.

Using this new card climb a ladder to the castle on the upper part of the world.

logline: Keep the restaurant running!
description:
Controls

 About 
 Your grandpaâs memory hasnât been the same lately. Step in and help him keep the restaurant going until he retires in 10 days.   
 This game plays around with procedural level generation, so each run feels fresh and different. Itâs also a nod to the reality of aging—how memory fades and conditions like dementia can affect loved ones. Instead of resisting or avoiding it, the game is about embracing that reality and finding ways to support the people we care about. Hopefully, it sparks a little reflection on how we can be there for each other. 
 @grosgg |  oklm.xyz

title: Potion Punch
description:
Potion Punch  is a small one-button action game that was developed during the  PULS GAME JAM .
 The theme was âKaputtâ.
  
 Kaputt (adj.) Broken, damaged, or destroyed to the point of being unusable. 
 
 Henry has unfortunately fallen out of favor with his superior, Miss Dragonfly. After the little goblin has once again spilled the coffee in the backmost corner -which nobody can see anyway- he is now expected to clean up the whole store. Henry has had enough! It's time for a loud,... but perhaps secret rebellion. Push all the potions down the shelf to really get back at the old dragon. It would only be for the best if she didn't catch him while doing so. 
 Hit SPACE to punch and move forward - simple as that. :) 
 Vincent Will 
 Linda Adelmann Fabian JÃ¶dden Sharon Sacks Vincent Will

title: FlightGear
description:
After many years of work, the new stable release of the free open-source flight simulator FlightGear is finally here! FlightGear 2024.1.1 now replaces 2020.3 as our supported, stable version. 
 The 2024.1 release series will only receive relatively minor updates, as development efforts are being focused on the  next  major release that includes a new rendering pipeline!
 
 As always thereâs also internal improvements to the flight models and other simulation systems, bug-fixes, and performance improvements.
 
 To get started straight away, visit the  download page .
 
 Feature highlights 
 
 
 Thereâs been a  ton  of changes since the last release, but hereâs a few particularly interesting ones:
 
 Real-time dynamic shadows and lights
 Added preliminary support for VR headsets using OpenXR
 Added a preview of World Scenery 3.0, a new scenery system that uses multiple levels of detail to provide higher frame-rates and lower memory occupancy at higher visibility ranges
 Fixed a large number of crashes, bugs, and memory leaks, as well as a high-severity security vulnerability ( CVE-2025-0781 ).

title: Schmorgus and the Quest for a Sandwich
logline: A comedy, action-adventure RPG about a sandwich
description:
Dunglandia, a kingdom ruled by King Dung III, is at constant war against the evil Dark Prince. There's only one hero who can stop such a fiend. That hero is none other than the king's son, SCHMORGUS. Schmorgus is destined for greatness, and now should be the time when his journey begins 
 but first... 
 HE NEEDS A SANDWICH 
 Travel across the kingdom of Dunglandia as Schmorgus and his party as they learn more about the world around them, get to know new faces, and most importantly, get the last sandwich in ALL OF EXISTANCE (or at least until Sandwich Man restocks the club sandwiches). 
 
 So who is this band of rascals? 
 Schmorgus (19) - The Headfirst Homunculus: While quite the opposite of rude, Schmorgus's title of Brash comes from his tendency to go into every conflict headfirst (literally). He's very soft spoken, and enjoys very simple things. Definitely not the kind of guy to be a main character of a video game. 
 Aaron (19) - The Brave Swordsman: Aaron loves going on adventures, and never goes anywhere without his trusty sword. Wherever Schmorgus is, you can always count on Aaron being right next to him. They've been best friends ever since they were little kids and since then have never left each other's sides. They say there's a friend that sticks closer than a brother, that's true in their case. 
 Wifey (18) - The Quick-Tempered Mage: Wifey is the daughter of the great mage, Abra Cadabra, so she's for sure got a lot to prove. She doesn't really care about that though, she just wants to find love (although "love" is a strong word). She's only a part of this party in order to get closer to  Schmorgus. Maybe she'll be able to romance him and they can have some "fun" together. Good luck with that, Wifey 
 Mavrik (27) - The Heroic Gunslinger: Sheriff of the city Sandima Bralls, Mavrik is the best gunslinger this side of Dunglandia (and an even better cook). When he's not having showdowns with delinquents, he likes to spend time at home with his wife and kids. He quickly becomes Schmorgus's mentor in being the best hero he can be. He joins the party just cause it seems like a fun getaway from the Bralls. What could be more fun than going on a quest for a sandwich? GRAHAHAHAHAH! 
 
  JRPG style turn based combat Interact with and complete missions for civilians 6 different cities to explore Plenty of side quests and secrets 
 
 Currently only for Windows. Mac version planned
 
 Arrow Keys - Movement
 
 Esc - Cancel/Back
 
 Enter - Confirm/Select
 
 Shift - Dash
 
 Space - Skip
 
 If you experience ANY issues AT ALL let me know immediately. I will resolve the issue to the best of my ability 
 Feedback on the game is greatly appreciated

title: Shoddy Architect
logline: Build wobbly structures and accelerate their downfall
description:
Why take the time to make a perfect structure when you can spend the time to destroy an imperfect structure? Although it is a fun sandbox to mess around in for a couple of minutes, this project is really just a proof of concept for procedural destruction in Godot. It is a good foundation for more intense forms of destruction, so perhaps I add to it in the future. 
 How to Use 
 Select one of the three tools from the expandable list in the bottom left and drag the mouse while holding the left mouse button to use it.  
 Slice Draw Rectangle Draw Circle 
 Pressing the right mouse button will delete the object under the cursor. Holding the right mouse button and dragging the mouse will create a box wherein every object will be deleted. 
 You can press TAB to toggle the list visibility and press left and right keys to toggle between different tools. Changing the size of the window will interact with your objects by pushing them around, though it's a bit delayed. Not to mention, if you fill the screen with too many objects and shrink the window, it leads to some... unrealistic... results.

title: Street Empire: Neon Tycoon
logline: Trade, evade, and conquer in Nova Grid's procedurally generated cyberpunk underworld. Build your neon empire.
description:
Not mobile friendly... Yet. 
 
 In the neon-drenched streets of  Nova Grid , youâre a trader saddled with a debt to a ruthless mob boss. Your mission? Buy low, sell high, and scrape together enough cash to pay off what you owe. But every deal comes with a catch—each trade increases your  "static,"  a measure of unwanted attention from the authorities. Hit 100, and youâre done for. 
 Explore six procedurally generated districts, from the shadowy  Rust Slums  to the towering  Sky Nexus , each pulsing with its own risks and opportunities. Trade exotic, futuristic goods like  Spark Leaf  and  Prism Mist , but stay sharp—random events like market crashes or watcher patrols can flip your fortunes in an instant.
  
 Assemble a crew to tip the scales:  traders  to widen your network,  enforcers  to keep your static in check, and a  crew car  to zip between districts. Upgrade your cache to haul more goods and outmaneuver your rivals.
  
 With multiple difficulty levels and endless replayability,  Street Empire: Neon Tycoon  is a text-based strategy game where every decision counts. Will you pay off your debt and claim your place as the ultimate neon tycoon, or will the static swallow you whole? Step into Nova Grid and find out.

title: Sharpshooter

A young archer stands before you â and you are the only one who can turn him into a true legend! Upgrade his aiming skills, increase his shooting speed, and achieve the perfect shot! Every target hit grants crystals, which you can use to buy better gear and powerful upgrades. 
 Will you reach the point where every shot lands perfectly in the center?  Start now and train the world's greatest archery master! 
 This is an indie-developed project of the idle genre, featuring hand-drawn graphics.

title: BATHROOM GURLS (2023)
logline: A short visual novel bullet hell about why girls always go to the bathroom in groups.
description:
BATHROOM GURLS (2023)  is a short high school project made by Shannon Wang, Sunny Huang, and Minsui Tang, with strong Unity contributions from SwiftKraft. 
 This was my first time using Unity and it was pretty rushed for the deadline. As this project has not been completed after its submission, it is very unfinished + glitchy --- only has half-assed "boss battles" implemented, soundtracks fsr not stopping, like literally no settings/UI, and if you die you have to restart the entire game... but enjoy what we have I guess :) oh yeah, that "coming to steam 2023" thing in the summary video ... long story short it was kind of a joke 
 This game tells the story of 4 girls who initiatally disliked each other, reluctantly going to a field trip to their school's only bathroom. Throughout their adventure, they set aside their differences, realizing they've only "hated" each other for petty reasons. As us three developers were all high school girls, we have resonated with this theme throughout our social lives growing up, as the problem of internalized misogyny has been a huge obstacle in our girlhood. Some girls have grown with the toxic mindset that other girls are "competition". BATHROOM GURLS explores the consequences of that narrow mindset such with self-destruction, loss of self-identity, and the missing out on strong female friendships. Ultimately, the game outlines the importance of the "girls supporting girls" culture rather than "girls putting each other down".  
 [ PLAYMODE CONTROLS & MECHANICS] 
 
 - WASD or ARROW KEYS to move
 
 - MOUSE1 to dash
 
 - 1 to switch to CECILE, MOUSE0 to shoot projectiles. Your shooting cooldown is 1 second.
 
 - 2 to switch to LILITH. MOUSE0 to swing her bat.
 
 - 3 to switch to ATHENA. MOUSE0 to give the player a temporary shield for a few seconds. You can only activate this ability upon switching to ATHENA for at least 2 seconds.
 
 - 4 to switch to LEAH. MOUSE 0 to shoot a paint beam that does a lot of damage. You can only activate this ability upon switching to LEAH for at least 10 seconds.
 
 - ESC to pause during PLAY MODE. Press ESC again to unpause
 
 [ VISUAL NOVEL CONTROLS ] 
 
 - MOUSE0 to advance in dialogue
 
 - MOUSE0 or MOUSE1 to skip dialogue
 
 - CTRL to fast-forward dialogue 
 
 [ CREDITS ] 
 Shannon "Alyelle" Wang  - Director, Thumbnail Artist, Player Sprite Artist, Soundtrack Composer, Programmer, Scriptwriter. Listen to the OST here!  https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL5LDaKVL3jSTc22QNPlD7KSj8hHvA_bFo 
 Sunny "Sunnie" Huang  - Visual Novel Character and Background Artist (essentially drew everything visual novel-related), Scriptwriter 
 Minsui "Jenni" Tang - Background Sprite Artist, Scriptwriter 
 SwiftKraft  (volunteer) - Programmer + Thank you for teaching me Unity!

title: Stickyban
logline: A bite-sized puzzler about pushing sticky blocks
description:
Stickyban is a short puzzle game from the creator of  Ouroboros , that can be played on the  Playdate  handheld. It's a Sokoban style game in which you have to push blocks in order to press switches, with the twist that the blocks stick to you and each other. This completely changes the way these types of puzzles normally work, and various aspects of this concept are explored in increasingly tricky puzzles. 
 Features 
 15 puzzles. Manageable to finish in one or a few short sittings. Unlimited undo's. Straightforward controls (D-Pad to move; B to undo; A to redo); can optionally use the crank for undo/redo as well. 
 Enjoy!

title: Egg Hunt REMASTERED
logline: An Easter Themed horror game with an evil bunny hunting you down, this time remade to be a lot better.
description:
Egg Hunt is a game where you wander through a forest, trying to collect eggs, while an evil easter bunny hunts you down and tries to kill you. You must collect 50 eggs in order to succeed, and for every egg you collect, the bunny becomes more and more alert of you. 
 Also, if you are ever struggling with getting around the bunny here is a tip: you can hide behind trees and the bunny will lose track of you (just throwing that out there lol) 
 
 For a while now, I've been wanting to remake the 2 day version of this game, and here it finally is. This is I'd say like 2 months of work compared to 2 days.  (and yes I know it's not that good I'd still consider this my first horror game despite this technically being a remake)

title: Operation "Earth Shield "
logline: Earth is under attack by relentless Space Invaders, and you are humanityâs last hope!
description:
Welcome to Operation Earth Shield! 
 Mission Overview: 
 Earth is under attack by relentless  Space Invaders , and you are humanityâs last hope! Defend the planet across  3 intense levels , each with unique challenges. Unlock  Level 2  and  Level 3  by achieving victory in the previous level.  Level 3  features  2 stages , complete Stage 1 to advance to the  final showdown  and save Earth!
   
 How to Play: 
 
   Level      Conditions: 
 
 Level 1:  Eliminate all Space Invaders and protect Earthâs defenses.
   
 Level 2:  Survive waves of invaders while repairing critical systems.
   
 Level 3: 
 
 Stage 1:  Defeat the invading fleet.
   
 Stage 2 (Final):  Destroy the mothership to secure victory!
   
   Controls: 
 
 On-Screen/Keyboard:  Move with arrow keys (or on-screen joystick on mobile), shoot with left ctrl (or on-screen button), and use special abilities with designated keys/buttons/joystick.
   
   Tips      for Success: 
 
 Dodge enemy fire, collect power-ups, and strategize to conserve resources.
   
 Pay attention to mission briefings for level-specific objectives.
   
   Prepare for Battle! 
 The Space Invaders are relentless, but Earthâs survival depends on you. Complete all levels, defeat the final boss, and become the hero of  Operation Earth Shield !
   
 Level 1: Defend Earthâs Perimeter 
 
 Objective: 
 Protect Earth from the invading Space Invaders by destroying them and achieving the winning conditions.
   
   Gameplay Details: 
   Player      Stats: 
   Max       Lives:  5
    Starting       Lives:  3
    Lose       a Life:  When you collide with an enemy.
     Scoring      System: 
   Destroy       an enemy:  +10 scores 
 Gain       an extra life:  +20 extra projectiles  when your score reaches       a multiple of 200 scores.
     Projectiles: 
   Starting       Projectiles:  50.
    Use       them wisely! Running out of projectiles makes it harder to defend       yourself.
     Winning      Conditions: 
   Reach  500       points  AND have  5 lives  to unlock  Level       2 .
     Game      Over Conditions: 
   Lose       all lives or become out of projectiles before meeting the winning       conditions.
     
   Tips for Success: 
   Avoid      collisions with enemies.
   Aim      for high scores to gain extra lives and extra projectiles and ensure      victory.
   Manage      your projectiles carefully to avoid running out.
  
   Prepare for Battle! 
 The Space Invaders are closing in. Destroy them, protect Earth, and unlock the next level to continue your mission!
   
   Level 2: Fortify Earthâs Defenses 
 Objective: 
 Hold off the relentless Space Invaders and strengthen Earthâs defenses to achieve the winning conditions.
   
 Gameplay Details: 
 
   Player      Stats: 
 
 Starting Lives:  5
   
 Max Lives:  8
   
 Lose a Life:  When you collide with an enemy or are hit by their laser beams.
   
   Projectiles: 
 
 Starting Projectiles:  100
   
 Bonus Projectiles:  Gain  +20 projectiles  for each extra life you earn.
   
   Scoring      System: 
 
 Destroy an enemy:  +10 scores. 
 
 Gain an extra life:  +20 points  when your score reaches a multiple of 100 sores.
   
   Winning      Conditions: 
 
 Reach  300 points  AND have  5 lives  to unlock  Level 3 .
   
   Game      Over Conditions: 
 
 Lose all lives or become out of projectiles before meeting the winning conditions.
   
 Tips for Success: 
 
 Dodge enemy laser beams and avoid collisions at all costs.
   
 Use your extra lives to replenish projectiles and stay in the fight.
   
 Focus on scoring points to gain lives and projectiles for a stronger defense.
   
 Prepare for the Onslaught! 
 
 The Space Invaders are more aggressive than ever. Defend Earth, achieve the winning conditions, and unlock the final level to save humanity!
   
   Level 3, Stage 1: The Final Stand â Part 1 
 Objective: 
 Survive the relentless assault of the Space Invaders and achieve the transition conditions to advance to  Stage 2 , the final battle!
   
 Gameplay Details: 
 
   Player      Stats: 
 
 Starting Lives:  1
   
 Max Lives:  5
   
 Lose a Life:  When you collide with an enemy or hit by their  laser beams .
   
   Protection      Mechanic: 
 
 Activate  5 seconds of protection  by pressing  Left Shift  (keyboard) or tapping the  Shield Icon  (on-screen) on mobile.
   
 Cost:  Losing  1 life  (you must have  â¥2 lives  to activate protection).
   
   Scoring      System: 
 
 Destroy an enemy:  +10 scores. 
 
 Gain an extra life:  +1 life  when your score reaches a multiple of 100 scores.
   
   Stage      Transition Conditions: 
 
 Reach  300 points  AND have  5 lives  to advance to  Stage 2 .
   
   Game      Over Conditions: 
 
 Lose all lives or become out of projectiles before meeting the transition conditions.
   
 Tips for Success: 
 
 Use protection strategically to survive intense enemy waves.
   
 Focus on scoring points to gain extra lives and build your defense.
   
 Avoid collisions and enemy laser beams at all costs!
   
 Balance offense and defense—donât waste lives unnecessarily.
   
   Prepare for the Ultimate Challenge! 
 The Space Invaders are stronger than ever. Survive, achieve the transition conditions, and advance to the  final stage  to save Earth!
   
 Level 3, Stage 2: The Final Showdown 
 
 Objective: 
 Destroy the enemy  Mother Ship  to save Earth! Be prepared for its defenses, including  mines ,  child enemies , and its powerful  immunity shield .
   
 Gameplay Details: 
 
   Player      Stats: 
 
 Lives:  3
   
 Starting Shields:  5
   
 Shield Protection:  Activates for  5 seconds  when used.
   
 Lose a Life:  When you collide with or are hit by:
   
 Child Enemy  (small spaceship that shoots projectiles).
   
 Main Enemy  (Mother Ship).
   
 Mines  (stationary defenses in front of the Mother Ship).
   
 Child Enemy Projectiles  or  Main Enemy Laser Beams .
   
   Controls: 
 
 PC: 
 
 Shoot:  Left Ctrl 
 
 Activate Shield:  Left Shift 
 
 Mobile: 
 
 Move:  Joystick 
 
 Shoot and Activate Shield:  On-Screen Buttons 
 
   Enemy      Mechanics: 
 
 Mother Ship: 
 
 Has an  immunity shield  that activates for  20 seconds  and has a  10-second cooldown .
   
 The shield can withstand  5 hits  before breaking.
   
 Child Enemies: 
 
 Small ships that attack you directly and shoot projectiles.
   
 Mines: 
 
 Stationary defenses placed in front of the Mother Ship.
   
   Winning      Condition: 
 
 Destroy the  Mother Ship  to win the game and save Earth!
   
   Game      Over Conditions: 
 
 Lose all lives (lives = 0).
   
 If you lose, you must restart from  Level 3, Stage 1 .
   
 Tips for Success: 
 
 Use your  unlimited rockets  to destroy enemies and mines.
   
 Activate your shield strategically to avoid losing lives.
   
 Focus on breaking the Mother Shipâs immunity shield during its cooldown period.
   
 Watch out for child enemies and mines—they can overwhelm you quickly!
   
 Prepare for the Ultimate Battle! 
 
 The fate of Earth rests in your hands. Destroy the Mother Ship, overcome its defenses, and become the hero of  Operation Earth Shield !

 Play as an elephant that is tasked to fix the lights in an office building. Try not to break more stuff! Please! Leave the office as clean as possible. Keyboard controls:

title: I hate this F@%$^ car
logline: get away with your money
description:
You hate your car.  Very much. You need a new one. But cars are expensive, aren't they? But there is a simple yet elegant solution. To rob a bank. 
 Drive your rickety car using  Mouse  to run away from cops. Beware! Cops may be on foot, but your car is not what it used to be. 
 Don't leave your budy-in-crime behind! He's important for maintaining your damaged old vehicle. Use  WSAD  for moving around and  Space/E  for interaction. 
 
 Controls: 
 Mouse  - driving a car 
 WSAD  - movment of masked man 
 Space/E  - interaction with parts of vehicle 
 
 Hints: 
 - Masked character can jump into the car. Stand behind the car when the trunk is open and jump in using W. Try not to be to close to the car before jumping. 
 - There is a hole in the ceiling of the car. You can use it to get into and out of the car without opening the trunk. 
 - You can stand on the rack on trunk door when it's closed. From it you can easily get on the ceiling of the car. 
 - Every gear has hardcoded range of speed it can be used on. Ranges of consecutive gears overlap slightly but these overlaps are not generous. 
 - Auto Kaputt! - you can kill your engine irrevocably if you drive on high speed for to long (gear 4 or higher). Try to not overuse high gears. 
 
 PATCH NOTES
 
 As stated by the Host of the Jam, we were allowed to update our game and page after the shortlist voting. We fixed a rare but major bug that could potentially completely destroyed experience and made little improvements to audio-visual layer. To stay within the rules and remain transparent, hereâs what we changed:
 
 - Fix occasional bug allowing player character fall behind left edge of screen and be completely lost.
 
 - Change money font.
 
 - Add car shaking effect.
 
 - Improved audio feedback of the engine for better feel of the gearbox
 
 - Improved visuals of upper "minimap"
 
 - Moving steering wheel (just visuals, no effect on gameplay)
 
 P.S. Above disclaimer was inspired by similar one from Mind the Glitch page ( https://sherlocklini.itch.io/mind-the-glitch ).  :)
 
 
 Made for PULSGameJam by: 
 Adam NieÅ¼urawski 
 Jakub OrliÅski 
 Jan Zygmunt

title: !CAUTION! WET FLOOR
logline: It's a clean time!
description:
The floor is dirty and only you can make it clean and shine. 
 
 
 WASD  - movement Space  - interact Left Mouse Button  - wash 
 Hey, hello! Don't walk by, but watch your step, as we have a WET FLOOR here!
 
 Welcome to visit Louis - a hard-working and rather modest janitor. Every traveler passing by leaves a figurative mark not only on his heart, but also a literal one - on the floor, which Louis diligently cleans day in and day out. Louis's main dream is for all the travelers passing by to be in good spirits and have a cheerful disposition when saying goodbye to him and moving on. This warms his heart and brings a sweet smile to his face.  
 
 Louis runs using WASD to keep up with all his duties while travelers go about their business on their WAY. When saying goodbye to Louis, travelers rate the place that Louis strives to keep clean and calm.  
 
 Speaking of cleanliness. Dirt disappoints other guests when they walk on such an UNCLEAN floor, and it lowers their level of JOY. But for Louis, there are no impossible tasks! He CLEANS the floor using the LMB so that such incidents happen less frequently.  
 
 Speaking of calmness. Usually, guests are not known for their grace and often slip on the wet surface, epically falling to the floor. This is accompanied by cries of discontent, which lowers the guests' level of JOY. To prevent such incidents, Louis places a sign on wet areas of the floor that reads "Caution! Wet floor!" Upon seeing the sign, guests navigate around the marked hazardous area and return to their WAY without worrying about their falls or the dirt under their feet. To take the sign from one spot and place it in another, Louis uses the SPACEBAR.    
  
 
 Louis also has a time-tested cleaning device: the SPONGE. If the sign "Caution! Wet floor!" is needed in another place, and a traveler is dangerously close to the wet area, then a sponge can always be placed on the wet floor. It quickly absorbs water and prevents slips. To dry the sponge and use it again, Louis runs with it to the BUCKET and WRINGS it out using the SPACEBAR.  
 
 Together with Louis, keep an eye on the visitors and the environment in the room, clean the floor in a timely manner, and try to prevent travelers from falling, so that tales of Louis's hard work and care continue to inspire urban legends! Have a great game!

title: Vance Adventures
logline: Patriotic Platforming Challenges
description:
Fullscreen recommended for optimal experience. 
 JD Vance is on an adventure to find Donald Trump! Navigate through 6 difficult platforming challenges to become a true United States patriot! 
 Use Arrow Keys or WASD to move and jump, press any key to continue to next level.

title: Star Story I - The Goddess
logline: A space themed jRPG game. To boldly go where no RPG player has gone before.
description:
Episode I - The Goddess 
 
 2999 AD humanity is exploring space, and we are part of the IF (or Interplanetary Federation). Here we meet Wendicka Lovejoy, (adopted) daughter of admiral John Lovejoy and her surrogate sister Crystal McLeen finishing their training to be officials in M.E.T.E.O.R. The job every young boy and girl dreams of. But it goes horribly wrong, and Crystal would have died if an unknown person didn't kidnap her to turn her into a cyborg. Both girls retire from their dream job as a result. 
 
 One year later Wendicka is an engineer working in the maintenance of Excalibur, the most important space station of the IF, the symbol of the IF's "invincibility" (it was named after King Arthur's sword for a reason). Crystal works as a barmaid in a bar within the same station. But then the station, always believed to be impenetrable gets invaded, by Astrilopups (an alien race enemies of the IF) and mindless cyborgs wearing implants pretty similar to Crystal's. What is going on? Is it connected with how Crystal became a cyborg herself?  
 The answers are out there, somewhere in space. Can you help the two girls find these answers? 
 
 
 
 Cast: 
 Wendicka Lovejoy (Adopted) daughter of admiral John Lovejoy. Wendicka does not know anything about where she came from. She's a tomboy with a very straightforward and tactless personality, and Crystal often comments she shouldn't be so "rude". Wendicka has the very bad habit to go into a complete panic when things do not go the way she planned. She always means well though, and is very intelligent, and an astounding engineer. Her skills with technology bely her age. Wendicka suffers from a condition she calls a "curse" (due to lack of a better word), causing her to be unable to eat and drink, and allowing her to feed on electricity. 
 Crystal McLeen Crystal has been Wendicka's friend since she was an infant and the two girls consider each other as sisters. Crystal became a cyborg due to an otherwise fatal incident. Nobody knows who turned her into a cyborg, but whoever did saved her life. Crystal is in all sorts of way the calmness contrasting Wendicka's tomboyish behavior. Although Crystal is a bit naive compared to Wendicka she often acts more mature than her on the moments that count. Crystal is a vegetarian. 
 Experimental Human Replica Unit (ExHuRU) ExHuRU is an android programmed to protect Wendicka, much to her displeasure, as she doesn't want to be protected. As a robot ExHuRU lacks all sorts of emotion and is also unable to comprehend human irrational thoughts. Wendicka tries to get rid of him all the time, and she often acts extremely rude an offensive towards him, although he has no understanding of her rudeness (and ignores it as a result).  
 Yirl, son of Astrolon In a bar somewhere on a forgotten planet the girls meet Yirl. Yirl is a a bounty hunter of the Klargin race, who makes a living by doing a lot of "dirty jobs" and winning people's money. He's hated by the IF and the people he won from. Yirl insists on taking Wendicka under his protection and Wendicka suspects he knows very important stuff. 
 Foxy Firefox Foxy is a carefree Vulpin girl, making a living as a thief and prostitute. Foxy joins Wendicka and friends for fun out of lust for adventure. Foxy is actually a very bright and courageous woman, although she never took life too seriously. Foxy has a little "dragon", called Reggie, who was born in a laboratory when mad scientists were trying to play god. They did manage to create a dragon who is even able to breath fire, they only neglected to teach him manners, and as a result Foxy has a hard time keeping his rude behavior under control. 
 Xenobi Xenobi is a Ji knight, ordered by the grand master to take Wendicka and friends under his protection. His devotion to "The Power" allows him to do many supernatural things (think of it as "magic" if you want). Xenobi is falling in love with Crystal from the first moment he laid eyes on her.  
 Rolf van den Broek Rolf is a civilian of the former Dutch planet colony Nizozemska. As a result he has a lot of trouble speaking English properly. Rolf is a typical no-nonsense kind of guy who does what he has to do. 
 
 Other Characters: 
 Sean Briggs Briggs is Wendicka's and Crystal's commanding officer during their first mission. He's very strict and business-like. 
 John Lovejoy Wendicka's father by adoption and he does not have an easy relationship with his daughter. John is a very religious man, and Wendicka is an atheist, and Wendicka believes that is the reason for the awkward relationship, although she never realized that John always said that God have her the freedom to think for herself and to belief what she wants to believe (in other words, he never oppressed his religion onto her). The true reason is that John is overprotective, in Wendicka's views, and she's in fear of getting "caged". 
 Admiral Johnson A female admiral. This 78-years old woman is not a woman to toy around with. She's very extremely strict and she's known for her authority, and some people in the IF think of her as an "iron lady". She does have a softer side though, and Wendicka will eventually find out. 
 Reggie Ryuda Foxy's companion. Created in a laboratory. He's very extremely rude, and cracks bad (often sexually offensive) jokes, only to get kicked for it by Foxy. Still he's very intelligent and he DOES care for his friends, although he gives you a hard time acknowledging that. 
 Banika An alien female traveling merchant who got lost during her travels. If you can get her out of her trouble, she will eagerly go with you and sell you her wares at a "special rate". 
 Sue McLeod Rolf's girl-friend and she's basically everything Rolf is not. Like Rolf she lives on Nizozemska, and she's a first-rate blabbermouth and always extremely cheerful. When she gets mad she really goes berserk only to forget about it in a few minutes carrying on like nothing happens with the same cheerful mood. She is a hard worker and allows herself pretty little time for entertainment and rest. There is however more about her than you would initially think. 
 
 Additional links:
 
 Video with developer's commentary 
 Game Script source code

title: Friday Night Crunching
description:
Story :  
 As a corporate worker, you need to put in overtime to earn the extra money you desperately need. To progress, you must complete various mini-games around the office while avoiding your boss, who is determined to send all overtime workers home. If he catches you, it's game over—so stay alert!  
 Your goal is to dodge the boss, complete as many tasks as possible, and earn the extra money you need to succeed!  
 This game was created in just 3 days for Indie Game Dev Jam 6. The theme was "over time".  
 Credits : 
 Programmer  - Glitch ( https://glitch1101.itch.io/ )  
 Art  - Marcello Carlino ( https://marcello107.itch.io/ ) 
 Music  - Darya Goudarzi ( https://x.com/arcdarmusic )  
 Sfx  -  FreeSound ,  OpenGameArt

 ____________ 
 IN ACTIVE DEVELOPMENT, NEW VERSION 
 LAST TRANSIT 
 ABOUT THE GAME 
 Last Transit  is a dynamic first-person shooter set in a dark post-apocalyptic world. Navigate electromagnetic maglev lines, switch tracks and jump between rails while battling an army of robots assembled by AI from the remnants of civilization.
  
 STORY 
 The world has suffered a series of catastrophes, culminating in an artificial intelligence uprising. The AI deceptively lured surviving humans into an underground maglev metro network, which became humanity's last refuge.
  
 You are a professional courier with a vital mission: deliver a power reactor capsule to a remote colony of survivors before they perish from cold and darkness. The only path lies through dangerous tunnels filled with hostile robots.
  
 FEATURES 
   Unique movement mechanics:  slide along maglev rails, jump between lines, and use momentum to overcome obstacles
  Modifiable weapon:  switch between three firing modes — standard, automatic, and explosive
  Diverse enemies:  from simple patrol bots to dangerous Bibi units with tactical AI that can change combat styles
  Dynamic combat:  combine rail movement speed with precise shooting
  Atmospheric world:  explore the dark tunnels of an abandoned metro where each station holds its own story
  
 ENEMIES 
   Gvozdik (Nail)  — basic patrol robot, flees when low on health
  Shpuntik (Pin)  — slides along maglev lines and fires at you
  Puzatik (Belly)  — heavy tank with powerful armor
  Bibi  — dangerous scout with two behavior modes
  
 CONTROLS 
 Basic Movement 
   WASD  — character movement
  Shift  — sprint / dash
  Ctrl  — slide
  
 Weapon 
   LMB  — shoot
  RMB  — special weapon mode
  Q  — change firing mode
  R  — reload
  
 On Rails 
   W  — accelerate
  S  — decelerate
  Space  — jump off rails

 Click to advance dialogue. Place sticker on the items. To use the hammer hold space-bar and release at the correct moment 
 
 Dein Papa hat sich heute nicht so gut gefÃ¼hlt, also musst du jetzt die Werkstatt Ã¼bernehmen.  
 Normalerweise bringen die Kunden ihre Dinge mit und wollen sie angepasst haben. Wie jedes Kind weiÃt du schon, wie man einen Hammer benutzt - mit einem Hammer lÃ¤sst sich alles machen!  Your dad felt sick today so you have to take over the repair shop. 
 Customers usually bring their items and want them modified. As a child you already know how to use the hammer - everything can be done with a hammer! You might not have the exact parts the customers need but an abundance of stickers to do the job!

title: UnstoPablo
logline: You maybe are unstoppable but others not so much
description:
UnstoPablo is a game made for LKGW(Liceum Kreacji Gier Wideo) gamejam in 24h and topic was "Unstoppable". The goal of the game is to defend living tacos with your body from desert villains. 
 This game won the third place. 
 Story: 
 Your name is Unstoppable Pablo (UnstoPablo) and you are completely indestructible, but your dear friends - living tacos, are frail and prone to dying. Evil outlaws want to get rid of every single of them. You can't save them all from never ending waves of enemies, but you can do you best. 
 Controls: 
 You never stop, you are always on the move. Althougth you can control your speed using "W" key to go faster and "S" key to slow down. There is a dash ability that can activate by clicking left shift, to kill enemies by smashing yourself through them. 
 There are two types of enemies; 
 Parprika Wrestler Their goal is to get in melee range of living taco and attack them. Don't let them do that! Cactie Shooter Their goal is the same as Paprika, but instead attacking tacos close range, they shoots spikes from long distances. They never move. 
 Credits: 
 Tadeusz Gab Programing, Design Franciszek Wieczorkiewicz Programing, Design Grzegorz Stachurski 3D, Textures, Audio & Music MichaÅ Stachurski 2D art, Animation

title: CÃ­clicO
logline: A Jam game about aiming while spinning. Don't get stuck in a loop.
description:
Este jueguito fue creado para la Mermelada Jam #4 en 7 dÃ­as.   Â¡Gracias a todos los participantes y organizadores!   Â¡Fue divertidÃ­simo!   
 Tema: 
 - El tema fue  "CÃ­clico"  y el ingrediente fue  "Nunca es suficiente" .   
 DescripciÃ³n: 
 " CÃ­clicO se esfuerza mucho, pero nunca es suficiente... 
 AyÃºdalo apuntando y disparando a diferentes objetivos mientras controlas la velocidad de giro de CÃ­clicO. Cada aceleraciÃ³n y golpe reduce tu llama, y si te quedas sin ella...  
 Pero no... Â¡no puedes detenerlo por completo! Y sigue intentÃ¡ndolo, asÃ­ que quizÃ¡s la prÃ³xima vez sea suficiente. "  
 Controles:  
 -  AceleraciÃ³n/desaceleraciÃ³n del giro : Teclas 'Izquierda' / 'Derecha' o 'A' / 'D'. 
 -  Disparar : 'Barra espaciadora' (teclado) o 'Clic izquierdo' (ratÃ³n)  
 CrÃ©ditos:  
 "Este juego se creÃ³ en Godot 4.4 (Â¡gracias, godoteers! Amo este motor).  
 Otros programas utilizados fueron: Krita, Gimp, Material Maker y Reaper.  
 El juego completo fue creado por mÃ­ (@enlazador) en una semana (del 10 al 17 de marzo de 2025). 100 % libre de IA." 
 
 
 ---- (English) ---- 
 This litle game was made for Mermelada Jam #4 in 7 days. Thanks to all participants and organizers!    It was so much fun!   
 Theme: 
 - Theme was "CÃ­clico" and the ingredient was "Nunca es suficiente" ("Cyclic" and "Is never enought"). 
 Description: 
 " CÃ­clicO is trying hard, but it is never enought...  
 Help him by aiming and shooting different targets while control the spinning velocity of CÃ­clicO. Every acceleration and hit drops down your flame, and if you run out... 
 But no... you can't stop him completely! and he keeps trying so maybe the next time will be enought. " 
 Controls: 
 -  Spin acceleration / deceleration : 'Left' / 'Right' or 'A' / 'D' keys. 
 -  Shoot : 'Spacebar' (keyboard) or 'Left Click' (mouse) 
 Credits: 
 " This game was made in Godot 4.4 (thanks godoteers! I love so much this engine).  
 Other software used was: Krita, Gimp, Material Maker and Reaper. 
 The whole game was made by me (@enlazador) in the span of a week (10th - 17h of march, 2025). 100% IA free. "

title: Steel Carnage Arena
description:
Gameplay Mechanics: 
   You start with  40 bullets  in your gun and  120 magazines  available for reloading.
  Your character has  3 health points (HP) .
  Each time you are hit by a robot, you lose  1 HP .
  If you lose all HP, you  respawn at the initial start point  and gain temporary invincibility.
  Robots have  3 HP  each and are destroyed after being shot  3 times .
  At the  initial start point , you will find  3 magazines  for reloading your gun.
  These magazines  respawn at the start of each round .
  
 Controls: 
   Move:  WASD
  Shoot:  Left Mouse Button
  Jump:  Spacebar
  Sprint:  Left Shift
  Reload:  R
  Interact:  E
  
 Winning & Losing Conditions: 
   There is  no final victory , as the game is based on survival.
  The longer you survive, the higher your score.
  You lose if you can no longer defeat the robots due to running out of ammo or losing too many rounds.

title: Rope Climber
description:
This is a small game made for the "One Shot Showdown" game jam.  
 Climb as high as possible by using your rope and hook. Throw the hook by clicking and swing by holding down the mouse button. You only have one throw of the hook while in the air, so make it count.
 
 Game jam theme fulfillment:
 
 One button controls
 You only get one throw of the hook while you are in the air, if you miss you fall down to you death
 
 This game was made in microstudio ( https://microstudio.dev/ )
 
 Fun fact: this game was developed during my 11 month old sons naps

title: Lady of the Forest
description:
Lady of the Forest is a fantasy-romance VN which follows Milo, an apprentice healer, as he and his Mistress come to the town of Brookhaven to evaluate a mysterious illness.
 
 Inspired by the tale of  Beauty and the Beast , this story plays with ideas like role reversal, hurt, and forgiveness. Your choices determine Miloâs path and the fate of Brookhaven. 
 There are about  3 hours of playtime  for a completionist playthrough (depending on reading speed)   and  5 endings . 
 Content Warning:  This story explores dark themes and contains graphic violence and self harm. Player discretion is advised.
 
 
 
 Credits
 
 
 
 7CatBag:  Writing, Art, Programming ( Itch  |  YouTube  |  BSKY )
 Backgrounds:  Unsplash, Google, and  Pixel It 
 Music:   SoundImage.org , Pixabay, and YouTube
 
 Want to donate cash towards my next project? Buy me a  Ko-Fi ! 
 
 
 AI Disclaimer:   Lady of the Forest  is a passion project that I, 7CatBag, wrote and developed over a year. While the story, characters, and overall creative vision are my own, I did use AI assistance for brainstorming, refining dialogue, and helping with grammar. Iâd say this is  90% human made . If you prefer to support games without AI involvement, I understand and respect that choice! Otherwise, I hope youâll enjoy the world and story Iâve created!

title: O5tium
logline: A short game about a room.
description:
O5tium is a short narrative game in which you spend 5 days in a room. Try to find a way out.  
 Credits :  Game Design and Level Design :  Mewaska, Wav_le_hib, valnobdago, Eli, Antoine Belliard. Programming :  Wav_le_hib. Music :  Legende_urbaine. https://m.soundcloud.com/legend-urbaine/o5tium-in-game This game was made as a student project.

title: Sky Dweller
logline: Unity Project College Assignment
description: This is a game I made for my `Programming for Computer Games' assignment, using spritesheets. :D

title: The Lurker
logline: Is something lurking in this old place?
description:
Made with  BITSY 
 A WIP game about a police officer off the clock, going to explore his rundown old workplace - EI LABS -  little does he know, someone, or, something is watching him. 
 Mostly improv.

title: Chunk Miner
logline: A mining game inspired by old flash game classics. Mine for ore, sell, upgrade, repeat.
description:
Chunk Miner is a game inspired by old flash game classics like Mega Miner or Motherload. 
 The project is also fully open source and can be found on  GitHub . Controls: Right or Middle mouse button to rotate camera WASD for movement (dependent on camera direction) 
 Left mouse button or Shift to dtrill

title: Sweetheart of the Song Tra Bong (2022)
logline: Game adaption to Tim O' Brien's "Sweetheart of the Song Tra Bong" in his novel The Things They Carried.
description:
English 11 Honors final creative project. The text is slow so that you actually read it. From the chapter "Sweetheart of the Song Tra Bong" from  The Things They Carried  by Tim O'Brien. There may be a few glitches due to the tight deadline :') 
 Mary Anne Bell is a seemingly innocent high school graduate who was invited to spend some time with her boyfriend Mark Fossie and his fellow medics in the mountains of Chu Lai during the Vietnam War. What could possibly go wrong? 
 Controls: 
 - space/tap to advance in dialogue. 
 - arrow keys to move around when instructed to 
 - other instructions given in game 
 Youtube Playthrough Video:  
 
 
 Listen to the original soundtrack:  https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL5LDaKVL3jSR2Ou26nNDjlFC_Q5D2XYzD 
 Credits: 
 - adapted from Tim O'Brien's novel  The Things They Carried 
 - all graphics & animation & programming by Shannon "Alyelle" Wang 
 - OSTs 1/6, 2/6, 3/6, 5/6, 6/6 composed by Shannon "Alyelle" Wang 
 - OST 4/6 composed by Shannon "Alyelle" Wang 
 - Mary Anne Bell voiced by Sunny "Sunnie" Huang

title: Inner_life
logline: An adventure of hate and love.
description:
Move around with wasd or arrow keys and use the number keys 1 2 3 and 4 to select from the multiple choice options. You can use 1 2 3 and 4 or the mouse to click on the buttons in the main game. 
 Try to get all 3 endings :) 
 DOWNLOAD:  please download the game if you want it to be faster and higher quality and fullscreen! 
 Thanks for reading and I hope you enjoy my game!

title: An Airport Lounge For Game Devs Currently Overtaken by Xalavier
logline: More of a shitpost than a game tbh
description:
Can you match wavelengths with the lead developer of Peculiar Platforms, an indie game studio known for its particularly odd elevator pitches? More of a shitpost than a game tbh  Thank you Xalavier Nelson Jr of  Strange Scaffold  for being a good sport and letting me use his likeness for this game. All dialogue is entirely fabricated, having been stitched together from conversations being taken wildly out of context. 
 Made in a 4 hour session because I could only afford to lose one night of sleep to this. Time To Complete: < 1 minute Time To Get All Endings: < 1.5 minutes 
 This is purely a fan project for Wheel Jam 2025. Other than the template provided for the jam,  most assets used are Creative Commons. Non-CC0 are listed below: 
 Airport Lounge: Screenshot from  An Airport for Aliens Currently Run By Dogs   Screenshots and Sound clips taken from  Xalavier Nelson Jr on the Full Time Game Dev Podcast by Thomas Brush More screenshots  stolen  liberated from  Xalavier's TikTok 
 
 Tools Used: 
 Audacity 
 Godot 4.4 
 Microsoft Snipping Tool

title: Plug&Play
logline: Cozy and nostalgic device repairing.
description:
Your favorite console broke down? Fear not! Our 24/7 device repair service is here to help you! Al Controls: Space Bar: Opens up the device Mouse Wheel: Zoom/ Move the device nearer Right Mouse Button: Hold it to rotate the device in the air Left Mouse Button:  By clicking, you can test the sounds of the buttons. Do you find the one that sounds odd? Fix it by replug cables or create new ones by clicking the contacts and drag a cable from it. (This might not always work ^^') 
 This game is an entry to the PULS Jam 2025. All used 3D assets were made by the amazing  JackFoxer ! Used soundfiles where taken from:  https://uppbeat.io/

title: Oh Mis Diozes
logline: Clicker donde tienes que conseguir adoradores
description:
Oh Mis Diozes  es un clicker donde tu deber es conseguir suficientes adoradores para que los dioses te escuchen. 
 Artemisa 
 
 Artemisa, diosa de la caza, los nacimientos, lo salvaje y la virginidad, es tambiÃ©n la patrona de la luna. Su llegada al mundo estuvo teÃ±ida de sufrimiento, pues su madre, Leto, vagÃ³ sin descanso por la tierra, maldita por la furia de Hera. Fiel a su naturaleza indÃ³mita, Artemisa jamÃ¡s tomÃ³ marido y se asegurÃ³ de que ningÃºn hombre osara tocarla. 
 Afrodita 
 Afrodita, diosa de la belleza, la sensualidad y el amor, nunca conociÃ³ la infancia. NaciÃ³ de la espuma del mar, cerca de Pafos, emergiendo adulta, desnuda y de una hermosura incomparable. A pesar de su influencia sobre el amor y el deseo, su propio matrimonio estuvo marcado por la infidelidad, pues traicionÃ³ a su esposo en incontables ocasiones. 
 Poseidon 
 
 PoseidÃ³n, dios de los mares, los terremotos y los caballos, es hermano de Zeus y Hades. Tras derrocar a su padre, reclamÃ³ el dominio de los ocÃ©anos. DisputÃ³ con Atenea el control de Atenas, pero fue derrotado cuando la diosa hizo brotar un olivo, sÃ­mbolo de paz y prosperidad. Junto a Apolo, levantÃ³ las imponentes murallas de Troya, cuyo destino quedarÃ­a sellado en la guerra. 
 Zeus 
 
 Zeus, rey del Olimpo y soberano de los dioses, es padre de innumerables deidades y hÃ©roes. Dios del rayo y el cielo, fue el destructor de Cronos y el liberador de sus hermanos, poniendo fin a su tiranÃ­a. Aunque estÃ¡ casado con su hermana Hera, su deseo no conoce lÃ­mites, y sus innumerables amantes, mortales y divinas, suelen quedar marcadas por la furia implacable de su esposa.

title: Numb
description: Everything around you feels like a dream. Your surroundings are littered with distant memories. But you know you don't belong here. And you need to escape before you are trapped here forever.

title: Vakulchik Hates Mercedes
description: Vakulchik Hates Mercedes is an adventure game where you have to avoid Mercedes because you are playing as the protagonist (Vakulchik) who hates Mercedes. :D

title: Iron Requiem
description:
Dive into this adventure to help a malfunctioning little robot restore peace on Earth! Infiltrate an organic factory, created and self-sustaining by a virus that takes the form of a metal mountain! Solve puzzles, fight enemy robots, explore the different areas of the game, and try to dismantle the factory's system in order to stop the proliferation of this threatening mountain ! 
 
 
 
 Move - ZQSD/WASD Jump - Spacebar Dash - K / Left Shift Interact - L Pause - Esc 
 
 
 Move - Left Stick Jump - A (Xbox) / B (Nintendo) / X (Sony) Dash - X (Xbox) / Y (Nintendo) / â¡ (Sony) Interact  - B (Xbox) / X (Nintendo) / â² (Sony) Pause - Start 
 
 
 
 Game Design -  Rizvo, Louis Reyniers Level Design -  Louis Reyniers Art -  Dave Barbosa, Louis Reyniers Programming -  Rizvo Sound Design -  Alfie Loxdale Music -  Thomas Steggles â ï¸â ï¸â ï¸ Unfortunately, we couldn't finish the game in time for the jam, but we hope you still enjoy exploring this broken world of machines.
  
 We're currently working on an update to add everything thatâs missing, along with new content and features.

title: LampGuard
logline: Tense, dynamic horror â pressure builds with every second.
description:
React fast — your life depends on it. Get 2599 scores to WIN!   A monster can appear on either the red or blue side. Pay attention — if itâs on the blue side, place a blue lamp. If itâs on the red side, use a red one. Simple rules, but deadly mistakes.
  
 Controls: 
 
 WASD  — Movement
 E  — Pick up a lamp from the floor / Place it down
 Q  — Place a lamp on the stand / Take it off
 
 â ï¸ You can only place lamps  behind the yellow line on the floor .
  
 This is a horror game with fast reaction and memory elements. Stay focused — the monster wonât wait.  
 
 â  Known Issues: 
 
 If two lamps overlap and get stuck — please restart the game.  This bug  doesnât happen  if you place lamps  behind the yellow line , as intended.
 At the start, click  Left Mouse Button  to activate camera movement (look around).

title: The Case of Akane Hamaguchi
logline: a mystery based on danganronpa
description: mystery game

title: Samurai - The Final Jump
description: Small Jump N Run game, made for the SOG Cologne

title: Termite Terror
logline: Destroy luxurious property as a tiny termite!
description:
Play as a critter embarked on a path of destruction to conquer back untouched nature.  Relentlessly attack a beautiful house and score the highest number of vandalized properties in termite history! Future levels might be added later. Performance is subject to be optimized; it currently works best when using Chrome Browser. 
 Submitted for  PULS GameJam 2025  with the topic "Kaputt"  (German term for "destroyed").  
 Music was generated with Mureka.AI and Wukong AI and altered in Adobe Premiere. Game development was done using Blender, Photoshop, and Unity. Skybox Asset by  Render Knight  from Unity Asset store.

title: Scary House
description: Rhan and Daniel enter an old house, where Daniel gets trapped. Rhan meets a mysterious woman, Miss Kemboja, who is a spirit disguised as a human. She uses her powers to create traps in the house. Rhan must solve puzzles and prank Miss Kemboja to find Daniel and escape.

title: project rizzy
description: There doesn't appear to be anything hereâ¦

title: The Salvage - Demo
description:
The Salvage is a FNaF fangame made by thereally. Survive the shift, but can you survive the salvage? 
 (Demo. "Night" gameplay only available. Full version coming soon.)

title: Undergrowth
logline: Protect the sacred grove from outsiders
description:
WIP for  Godot Wild Jam 79 - Growing  including the Wildcard "One-Handed" 
 Works on Mobile! 
 
 As a druid, it is now your century to guard the sacred grove from outsiders. 
 Build (grow) plants using mana in order to defeat the invaders. Spend more mana on individual plants to boost their stats and earn more mana by defeating invaders. Will you last the full century? (Currently 15 waves) 
 Click on a plant on the top right to start building Click on an already-grown plant to grow it further or sell it Right-click to deselect everything

title: What Remains of Me - Orbserver Boss Fight
logline: A single boss fight for an upcoming chapter of What Remains of Me
description:
This Game is Downloadable for PC, MacOS, and Linux.  
 
 
 What Remains of Me  is a puzzle platformer where you awaken as Atlas, a reactivated robot in the depths of an abandoned, high-tech facility. As you explore the remnants of a post-apocalyptic world, you'll upgrade your abilities to navigate the desolate landscape, outmaneuver hostile AI, and piece together the truth behind the labâs downfall—and your reawakening.
 
 
 
 Discord 
 
 Want to stay up to date on  What Remains of Me  or learn more about our team? Join   our Discord  and be part of the journey!
 
 
 
 User Research 
 
 Interested in contributing the Games@Northeastern:Studio's user research efforts? Please take the playtesting survey! 
 
 https://forms.gle/f6JFeDsCo6q9Ar6s5 
 
 IMPORTANT NOTE:  If you are not part of an official play testing group, please choose any 10 character code to use as an ID number, and please use the same code on both the game and the play testing survey if you choose to take it!
 
 PLEASE NOTE: What Remains of Me  logs information about your play session to our database, including you public IPv4 address and metrics about how well you were able to traverse the level. This data is collected anonymously and in a secure environment, and is used for user research purposes only. It helps us make a better game!  If you do not consent to having this data collected, please refrain from playing What Remains of Me, or play the game while not connected to the internet. 
 
 
 
 About Us 
 
 This game was developed by Games@Northeastern: Studio,  a student organization based at Northeastern University's Boston campus. Our mission is to support students with the skills and experience needed to succeed both academically and professionally while contributing to the visibility and reputation of Northeasternâs cross-disciplinary game design and development programs
 
 
 
 
 For best results,  use 1920x1080 (16:9) full screen resolution when playing

title: The Blaze's Pet: Puzzle Figther
description: You, as the player will be playing Akira, a local hero on his journey to rescue his beloved pet, Mao who was kidnapped by one of his enemies, Professor Xeno. A cold and mad scientist who always wreaks havoc on the Bara City's peace. Your mission is to chase down the professor and rescue Mao.

title: MuyoQuest
description:
Priscilla returns to the hometown of most of her friends as she rescues another damsel in distress from a mysterious evil.  
 CAUTION:  The following content although references events in Skybound Dreamers Gaiden and Harold Origins is not canon to Skybound Dreamers proper or any of the Haroldverse games!

title: Pixel Transit DEMO
logline: A game where you construct a transit system in an infinitely vast
description:
Pixel Transit is a game where you construct a transit system in an  infinitely vast, tile-based world. Your goal is to design efficient  transportation networks that enable people to reach their destinations  as quickly as possible. 
 
 WHAT IS THIS GAME? 
 Pixel  Transit is a game where you construct a transit system in an infinitely  vast, tile-based world. Each tile serves a distinct function—for  example, sidewalk tiles allow pedestrians to walk, train track tiles  guide trains, and road tiles accommodate cars.  
 TRANSIT MECHANICS 
 When a  new person is introduced to the world, they begin by randomly searching  for a building on the map. If they locate one, they will attempt to  reach it as fast as possible using the network of sidewalks, trains, or  cars built by the player. So, people like to choose to get on trains  even when the train route is longer than the walking path if they think  it's more efficient.  
 HEALTH AND RECOVERY 
 Every  person has a health meter that, if it falls below zero, results in  death. Reaching a building fully restores their health. Additionally,  resting rooms can help recover health, though their capacity is limited.  Since walking rapidly decreases health, it is advisable to keep people  on trains or cars—or to build plenty of resting rooms to ensure their  survival.
 
 ABOUT THE DEMO 
 There are several differences with the demo release and the full release. The demo release has 
 Map restriction (80x80x3 whereas the full release one is 4294967296x4294967296x4294967296) No save/load mechanism 
 If you want full release, you can always click "Purchase!" and it will bring you to a steam page or just click  here !

title: The Room
logline: Text based adventure game where you try to escape, alive or not, its all your choice.
description: You wake up in a room. You don't know who you are, where you are, or what's making that metal creaking noise. Find out more by playing.

title: ALONE IN THE FOREST
logline: You alone be careful of them
description:
English : 
 "Scarecrow Hunter: Shadows of the Haunted House" 
 
 Immerse yourself in a world of pure terror in "Scarecrow Hunter: Shadows of the Haunted House," where you embody a brave ghost hunter tasked with cleansing a haunted mansion from sinister forces. These aren't ordinary ghosts; they are malevolent scarecrows, capable of possessing the bodies of the innocent and spreading dread in every corner.
 
 
 
 Your Mission: 
 
   Explore the haunted mansion, uncovering its dark secrets.
  Search for essential tools and artifacts, your key to vanquishing the scarecrows.
  Be wary, for the scarecrows are swift and cunning, capable of unleashing deadly toxins.
  Monitor your sanity meter, as the scarecrows' poisons will affect your mind, driving you to madness.
  Rely on your sole source of light, your trusty flashlight, to navigate the pitch-black darkness.
  
 Game Features: 
 Immersive Horror Atmosphere:  Plunge into a meticulously detailed haunted mansion, filled with chilling sounds and eerie shadows. 
 Thrilling Challenges:  Collect items, solve puzzles, and evade the malevolent scarecrows in a race against time.
  Unique Gameplay Mechanics:  Manage your sanity, utilize your flashlight wisely, and plan your moves strategically.
  First-Person Horror Experience:  Experience the terror firsthand, feeling the fear creeping into your heart.
  Increasing Difficulty:  As you progress, the scarecrows become faster and more dangerous.
  
 A Note from the Developer: 
 
 "Scarecrow Hunter: Shadows of the Haunted House" is my first foray into the world of game development. I've poured my heart into crafting an enjoyable and thrilling horror experience, despite the limitations of my hardware. I hope you enjoy the game and share your feedback and suggestions for future improvements. Thank you for your support!
 
 Call to Action: 
 
 Are you ready to confront the scarecrows in the darkness of the haunted mansion? Try "Scarecrow Hunter: Shadows of the Haunted House" now, and uncover its dark secrets!

title: Broken Reality
logline: Flip gravity, fight glitches, and survive the chaos in this first-person puzzle platformer!
description:
Broken Reality  is a glitch-filled, first-person puzzle platformer where nothing works the way it should. Dive into a world of chaotic physics, corrupted entities, and unpredictable controls as you navigate through a maze-like environment.
  
 Made for the  CrazyGames Jam , this game embraces the madness with bizarre mechanics and a world that's constantly breaking apart at the seams. Flip gravity, fight glitchy enemies, and solve puzzles where reality itself is the enemy. Each level introduces new ways to break the rules, with randomized controls, erratic physics, and visual distortions that push the player to the brink of madness.
  
 As the corruption builds, the glitches get worse—objects distort, the world flickers, and every step feels like a bug in the system. Can you survive the chaos long enough to escape, or will the glitch consume you?
  
 Key Features:
  
   Gravity-flipping mechanics : Walk on walls and ceilings to solve puzzles and avoid hazards.
  Randomized controls : Your movement and jump inputs are shuffled every level, making each run unpredictable.
  Corruption system : Glitchy visuals and distorted sounds increase as you encounter corrupted entities, pushing you closer to game over.
  Unique enemies : Face off against glitchy stalkers and corrupted data clouds that disrupt your every move.
  Puzzle-filled levels : Navigate traps, hidden passages, and spinning saw blades in a maze of chaos.
  
 Created for a jam that celebrates the unpredictable and the absurd,  Broken Reality  pushes the boundaries of what it means to be "finished." If youâre ready to dive into a world where the rules donât apply and chaos is your only companion, youâve come to the right place.
 
 
 Credits: 3D Modeling: Squid_Hell 
 Programming, Level Design, Grey-Blocking: Johnny's Games 
 Voice Acting: 
 - Johnny Shumway 
 - Scott Calahan

title: Make It Home
description:
ABOUT 
 There's nothing better than finally going home after a long day of work. You can almost see it: a warm bath, pajamas, some hot cocoa... if only there wasnât such a long walk to get there. The path is dark and lonely. No, not lonely. Not when so many weird people try to strike a conversation. Just remember this: donât look back, no matter what.
 
 âMake It Homeâ is a 3D horror, first person walking simulator in which the player must make their way back home, being careful with the strangers they meet. They cannot look back â that is the main rule. There are monsters pretending to be human along the way, but the player can also meet a helpful homeless man. Itâs up to them who they will or will not trust; the point is to create a scary environment, giving the player recollections of how they feel while walking in the dark.
 
 
 CONTROLS 
 W  - Walk 
 Mouse  - Look around 
 W  or  S  - Select a dialogue option 
 E  - Go to next line, choose option 
 
 CREDITS 
 Clara Gavinho -  Game Design, Narrative, Sound Design 
 Jazmine Wilson -  Team Manager, 3D Character Artist, Sound Design 
 Luis Martell -  3D Environment Artist, Shaders 
 Siena Kammavong -  Programming

title: Eyedventure
logline: A Thrilling Endless Jumping Arcade!
description:
Have you ever imagined yourself inside a block puzzle game?  
 ** Travel Through Magical Worlds ** 
 Jump into Eyedventure, an endless arcade challenge where reflexes and luck decide your fate!  Explore mystical worlds where bubbling lava flows below, falling puzzle blocks crash from above, and tricky traps are ready to take you down. 
 ** Jump, Collect & Survive ** 
 Play as a fearless adventurer with one mission: reach new heights! Hop onto towering blocks, grab falling fruits, and smash ice blocks.  Leap through hazards and build collections of rare artifacts.  
 Only the fastest can survive! 
 Eyedventure Features: 
 Unique game mechanics â Experience a block puzzle game from the inside! Simple one-finger controls â You need only one finger and one eye to play. We'll give you the second eye! Endless Jumping Adventure â Hop between falling blocks and donât stop moving!  Defeat your enemies â  Attack first. Every second counts! Fast-paced action â The longer you last, the harder and faster it becomes! Build Your Collection â Fill shelves with unique artifacts and earn powerful bonuses! Atmospheric Soundtracks â Enjoy immersive music!    Play offline â No internet connection needed to enjoy the game. No Ads â Just pure fun! 
 How High Can You Jump? Let the adventure begin, jump in!

title: Goblin Storm
logline: Cutesy Goblin Roguelike
description:
--You MUST protect the Castle-- 
 The goblins are coming!  Oh my, there are so many. 
 
 Goblin Storm is a  roguelike survival experience  where the player must defend their castle at all costs. As the game progresses, the attacking goblin forces will grow stronger and stronger. Will you protect the realm? Or will you fall to the Green tide? 
 ---Game Features--- 
 Weaponry: Over 50 unique weapons to arm yourself with! From simple bows, to maces, katanas, land mines, and even flamethrowers. Each weapon has a unique attacking style, and some have special bonuses, such as the Katana applying a bleed DoT effect, or a Great Hammer having enormous knockback. 
 Mix and match your armory of weapons to come up with satisfying combos, find counters to certain enemies, and maximize the strengths of your characters. 
 
 Classes: The game features three unique classes. The Knight, the Ranger, and the Mercenary. Within each class, there are different playstyles. For example, as a Knight, you may decide to heavily boost your melee capabilities, or decide to become an unkillable tank instead. 
 The Ranger  is a swift footed archer, focusing on boosting a variety of ranged weaponry, setting traps, poisoning and slowing enemies, and unleashing devasting volleys from afar. 
 The Knight  is a sturdy bastion, destined for the front lines of war. They excel at close quarters combat, shrugging off enemy blows and even healing themselves. Oh, they can ride a noble steed too. 
 The Mercenary  is the jack of all trades. They are able to utilize any weapon effectively, seamlessly weaving between ranged and melee, turning invisible, and even dual wielding. They also have a focus on extra gold gain, and an easier time obtaining exotic weaponry. 
 
 The Castle  is your base of operations. You can upgrade it according to your desires. Install a variety of traps, including spiked pits and cauldrons of boiling oil. Build huge towers to give you better vantage points, add automated archery systems, and even operate a ballista. You can also focus on passive upgrades, such as extra gold or HP every round. 
 Unearth  extra treasure and gold from mining. However, be wary, for all this extra wealth will surely just attract more Greedy Goblins!   You also might release some exotic new types, such as mushroom goblins. 
 
 The Goblins!  They are coming. The game features over 40 different goblin types. From goblin grunts to self-detonating goblins, ninja goblins, flying goblins, pirate goblins, spider-riding goblins, and even goblinapults. Learn their patterns well and you may be able to survive another day. 
 
 The Bosses.  They mean business. Every ten waves, a powerful Boss goblin will arrive on your border. The all have unique, interesting mechanics, such as eating their underlings, or launching cannon barrages. Your resolve will be tested. 
 
 Goblin Storm is a  roguelike , featuring randomized waves and weaponry options. Try a variety of different builds, classes and weapons to see which playstyle you like most. The game is designed for  re-playability  and will eventually feature a meta currency that is saved between playthroughs. 
 
 CO-OP  is currently enabled locally, and the game has controller support. Call over some friends and save the realm together. Design synergistic party compositions to get the job done. Online multiplayer is currently under development too. 
 
 So, what are you waiting for?  THE GOBLINS ARE COMING! Get onto the battlefield and save your lands from falling to  T he Goblin Storm. 
 Join the community Discord! https://discord.gg/UcGwJhku 
 Wishlist on Steam! https://store.steampowered.com/app/3543260/Goblin_Storm/

title: Legend of Skillet
logline: Parry enemy attacks with your trusty skillet.
description:
Legend of Skillet is a short but thrilling parry action game. Depending on your skill, you may clear the game in a few minutes, several hours, or perhaps an eternity. Move left and right, parry enemy projectiles, and fight your way to victory. 
 
 SAGA 
 When time had come, from darkness born was light, And darkness fled as light became a knight. His sword he melted, forged a skillet bright, A cook he was, who fed the starving wight. 
 When time had turned, from light did shadow rise, And dark did swell beneath the golden skies. The cook, once knight, did grasp his blade anew— No sword in hand, but skillet strong and true. 
 
 Control 
 LEFT and RIGHT key to MOVE. SPACE key to PARRY.

logline: A "Papers Please" Inspiration
description:

 The air is thick with smog, nearly unbreathable. Materials used to supply technology and AI have consumed most available oxygen globally.  
 To surpass this, government agencies have issued an Oxygen Dispatch protocol, providing their citizens with clean air to those who need it most. 
 You work in this system in the United States, and in a "paper-please" fashion, you decide whether people will be able to breathe in the upcoming months.

 This stranger knows far too much about you… and it seems theyâre playing a deadly game. Solve puzzles, follow their cryptic instructions, and try to escape the nightmare youâre trapped in.
 
 But what if youâre just a pawn in a game where nothing you do matters? Can you uncover the truth before itâs too late?

title: Kult Rising
logline: A backrooms exploration game
description:
Kult Rising 
 Welcome to the first public playtest of Kult Rising [v 0.1.6]! This is a short demo of the upcoming alpha, showing a few of the levels we have finished so far. There are currently 2 playable gamemodes, the Backrooms Exploration, and the Sandbox. 
 Check the full roadmap  here ! 
 Backrooms Exploration 
 The Backrooms Exploration currently consists of 3 Playable levels. The first cluster, which is predominantly Level 0, with a few bits of Level 1 and Level 37, and then a smaller Level 0 map, and a small Level 1 map. These levels will be expanded and more doors will be added as development progresses. 
 There are no entities to chase you in the Backrooms (for now). You can explore freely at your own pace. 
 The Sandbox 
 The sandbox currently consists of the Backrooms cluster 1, along with the basics of our upcoming Horde mechanic which will be the first major content update of the game after our Steam release into early access. For now it just has template guns and a placeholder zombie enemy. 
 You can also view some of the upcoming SCP and Character models in the sandbox as well. This area will also grow as development continues. 
 Known Issues/Bugs 
 When loading into the main gamemode (selecting "Kult Rising" as the level in the map selection screen) your camera will sometimes get stuck above the ceiling when you first load in. To fix this simply open and close your inventory by pressing Tab. 
 - In the exploration sections, the pause button is Numpad 4 instead of ESC 
 - Doors in the backrooms exploration levels work the "E" instead of "F" 
 - Custom Keybinds will be coming soon! 
 Controls: 
 - WASD to move 
 - "T" to toggle your flashlight 
 - "F" for interact (doors in the Backrooms are bugged and work with "E" instead) 
 Version 0.1.5 Showcase

title: GERINGI
logline: A stylized open world horror game about a road trip during the apocalypse
description:
What is Geringi? 
 GERINGI is a solo developed, stylized open world survival horror game where you explore a post apocalyptic world that has been invaded by creatures that arrived 10 years ago with a mysterious fog. 
 
 The story revolves around David, a survivor of the apocalypse, and Wes, a mysterious young boy who lost his legs in an attack before David met him and took him in. Together, they embark on a road trip to Blackridge, a rumored safe haven where the remaining survivors can live in peace. 
 
 In this demo, you can explore the first map, Ashford Island, and experience the first 3 days of this story, as well as side missions that will grant you new weapons and upgrades. You can meet mysterious strangers, save people in need, and speak to voices beyond the physical world.
 
 Key Features 
 Stylized open world
 Driving mechanics
 Numerous weapons to master
 Enemies to fight
 Camps to raid and loot
 Demo Playtime: â¼1 hour
 
 Cover art by Ezgi Candemir 
 
 The main theme, also written and performed by me: 
 Deniz Demir Â· Mechanical Sadness

title: Undercover Shot NES Edition
logline: A light gun based 2 player social deduction game for the Nintendo Entertainment System (NES)
description:
****THIS GAME REQUIRES A NINTENDO ZAPPER OR SIMILAR LIGHT GUN **** 
 
 This is an NES/Famicom ROM file. You will need an  emulator  or an actual Nintendo to play this game. 
 The Nintendo Zapper Controller does not work on modern screens. This game requires a CRT Television or an emulator that supports mouse input for the Zapper. 
 A Rat is undercover in your crew! Figure out his identity and take him out quickly!
 
 Undercover Shot is a simple 2 player social deduction game that uses one standard controller and one Nintendo Zapper controller.
 
 Player 1 (The Rat) uses the directional buttons on the controller to select a character. Once the game starts, they have to try and blend in with the computer characters, and mimic their behaviors.
 
 Player 2 (The Boss) need to observe all the characters on screen to try and deduce which one is controlled by Player 1.When Player 2 thinks they know who the rat is, then they must shoot that character with the Nintendo Zapper.
 
 If Player 2 hits the right character, then they win! But if Player 2 shoots the wrong character, then Player 1 wins.
 
 Setup Instructions 
 PC Setup 
 To play on PC, you must use an NES Emulator that is compatible with Mapper 30 ROMS. 
 Download Mesen, the recommended emulator,  here 
 If you are using Mesen as your emulator, go to Options>Input>Controllers and change player 2 to "Zapper" 
 NES/Famicom Setup 
 If you are playing on Original Hardware, plug a standard controller into port 1, and a Nintendo Zapper (Or comparable light gun) into port 2. 
 Your NES/Famicom must be hooked up to a CRT Television for the Nintendo Zapper to work. This is a limitation of the Nintendo Zapper Hardware. This game is compatible with EverDrive NES/Famicom cartridges 
 NES Hardware Clone Systems/Emulation Systems 
 Undercover Shot works on most hardware clones, and FPGA systems, but it is impossible for me to test on all clone devices. 
 Undercover Shot will only work on software emulation systems that support Mapper 30 NES ROMS.

title: Saparkour
logline: Mr. Sapo needs to parkour his way to his goal - how fast will you take him?
description:
Saparkour, my second game, is the result of a 14-day-long game jam I had the opportunity to participate in.  
 With this game, I had the objective of creating a new experience. I wanted the player to have bigger stakes on his or her actions when playing a standard, cute-looking platform game. This is why you both need to get the right amount of jump force by holding the jump button and you cannot move on air, meaning you need to aim well where you want to go. Also, if the frog hits something on air (say, a wall), it will bounce on it, creating new possibilities of movement for each player. 
 However, I still wanted the player to be able to have fun and just chill playing the game should he or she want to. This is why I made this a speedrun game (for those who want to compete and tryhard) but also a game with checkpoints, which don't restore your time but allow you to progress on your own pce. 
 With the mindset of creating different experiences, I wanted the player to be able to vary their challenges, which is why I created an exception to the on-air movement system: the frog has a grappling tongue. With the tongue, the frog can move mid-air, which allows for many new acrobacies.  
 
 This game had some inspirations in its design: 
 TrackMania: inspired me to create mechanics and levels where precise movement is necessary, but with low stakes on each error (in both cases, you can just restart). 
 Fall guys: inspired me not only on the looks but on making a on-foot racing game 
 Jump king: inspired me to raise stakes on the jump mechanic 
 Getting over it: the final level's name is no coincidence. It is made to be challenging and to make the player test his or her resilience - just like in the game. 
 Elden ring: a hard game, where every move needs to be calculated. In both games, if you want to be competitive, you know stakes will be high. Also, both games feature many but a little cryptic tutorials, made purposefully so in order to let the player enjoy the process of realization.

title: Pixel Platformer
logline: Gems Jump
description:
As part of my Game Development studies, I designed and developed a 2D platformer game, âCollect All the Gems to Winâ using Unity.        
 This included: 
 
 â¢ Level design : Created structured environments using Tilemaps.
   
 â¢ Animations : Implemented character animations for a smoother gameplay experience.
   
 â¢ Coding:  Developed core mechanics and interactions using C#.
   
 â¢ Gameplay features:  Added a double power jump and a collectible gem system that updates the UI in real time.
   
 â¢ Scenes & transitions : Built an intro and outro with smooth scene transitions using Timeline.
   
 â¢ Visual effects:  Enhanced immersion with Particle Effects System.
   
 â¢ Audio management : Integrated a Sound Manager to control music and sound effects. 
 How to play :

description:
My second game using GB Studio. Once again had problems with creating a save. but I think I have finally made a decent auto save function this time. I leart a great deal regarding adding colour and scripting this time around too.  
 The title screen is AI-generated, I know people don't like AI, but I couldn't draw the hand. It's much better than I could ever create and AI doesn't really bother me. 
 The game is basically a rip-off of the WarioWare mini-game Butterfingers. I added an extra life mechanic to make it a bit different. 
 If you enjoy the game please think about donating and have fun playing the game. 
 I hope you enjoy it. Play in the browser and if you like the game please support me by buying the Gameboy for $1. Thank you,
