 Vas a la cama y te quedan ocho horas de sueÃ±o por delante, perfecto para un descanso pleno. Sin embargo, la luz de la pantalla te absorbe cediendo ante ella y cuando te das cuenta, la alarma suena en cuatro horas.

title: Croak & Treasures
logline: Protect the boss's gold
description:
EN 
 Croak & Treasures is an action game on first person in which the player must defend a pile of gold from thieves that try to steal it. Using traps and knowing the map the protagonist can control with success the waves of enemies and even increase his treasure. 
 
 Scutty is an accountant with a very specific task. He must ensure that the treasure of his boss Doro doesn't stop growing, like every good financial professional. 
 But in his case, is not an office work precisely. The good people of the swamp wants to take advantage of the trip the fearsome boss is going to infliltrate on his secret base and recover the stolen gold of them, and Scutty will have to stop it has he can. 
 The thieves and warriors won't stop coming to try take all they can, so is the task of the scrawny minion to take care of them, and even then add their belongings to the boss's treasure, as never is enough. 
 
 Each match has 3 cycles, and every cycle has 2 phases. After completing 3 cycles, the gold amount on the dungeon will be evaluated. If there is enough, the match will be a success. If the objective is not achieved, the match will be considered a failure. 
 
 ES 
 Croak & Treasures es un juego de acciÃ³n en primera persona en el que el jugador debe defender una pila de oro de los ladrones que intentan robarlo. Usando trampas y conociendo el mapa el protagonista puede controlar con Ã©xito las oleadas de enemigos e incluso aumentar su tesoro. 
 
 Scutty es un contable con una tarea muy particular. Debe encargarse de que el tesoro de su jefe Doro no pare de aumentar, como todo buen profesional de las finanzas.  
 Aunque en su caso no es precisamente un trabajo de oficina. Las buenas gentes del pantano quieren aprovechar que el temible jefe se va de viaje para infiltrase en su base secreta y recuperar el oro que les ha sido robado, y Scutty va a tener que impedirlo como pueda. 
 Los ladrones y guerreros no pararÃ¡n de llegar para intentar llevarse lo que puedan, asÃ­ que es tarea del escuÃ¡lido secuaz encargarse de ellos, y de paso sumar sus pertenencias al tesoro del jefe, que nunca tiene suficiente. 
 
 Cada partida se divide en 3 ciclos, y cada ciclo en 2 fases. Tras completar los 3 ciclos, se evaluarÃ¡ la cantidad de oro que hay en la mazmorra. Si hay suficiente, la partida serÃ¡ un Ã©xito. Si no consigue el objetivo, la partida se considerarÃ¡ un fracaso. 
 
 CONTROLS/CONTROLES 
 -Move/Moverse: WASD 
 -Camera/CÃ¡mara: Mouse / RatÃ³n 
 -Attack/Atacar: Left Click / Clic Izquierdo 
 -Set a Trap/ Colocar Trampa: E 
 -Change Phase / Cambiar Fase: Q 
 -Pause/Pausa: Esc

title: Umbral
logline: a short horror experience
description:
UMBRAL  is a first-person psychological horror experience where time is fractured, reality is unstable, and something is stalking you in the dark... 
 
 
 You are  Test Subject #47 , a prisoner offered freedom in exchange for participating in a top-secret experiment. Scientists at a remote research facility have discovered an otherworldly substance, one they believe holds the key to something far greater. But when the procedure begins, everything goes wrong.
 
 
 
 The facility is abandoned. The halls are decayed. The experiment has thrown you into a limbo between worlds, into the umbral, and you are not alone. Something watches from the shadows.
 
 To escape, you must stabilize the Beacon, collect the scattered light fragments, and uncover the truth behind the experiment. But the deeper you go, the more the lines between reality and nightmare begin to blur.
 
 
 
 
 Somewhere in this cycle, there is a way out.
 
 You just have to find it...

Darkness has covered the skies, condemning the earth to a perpetual night. 
 From its interior arose an army of demonic creatures, summoned to exterminate life. 
 You are Peter Panzer:your mission, to safeguard the last bastion of humanity. 
 Avoid the advance of the army of darkness and put an end to the nightmare. 
 Peter, bring the light back to our hearts !!

title: Mind the Glitch
description:
Welcome to 
 
 The system is broken. But not broken enough... 
 
 You are a  glitch , an anomaly trapped inside a crumbling system. Every time you reach the goal, the world resets...but not completely.  
 The keys you touched? Gone.  
 The  dev  (your not-so-friendly narrator) is not happy about this...  
 With every jump, every destroyed key, and every reset, you chip away at the systemâs stability. But maybe… just maybe… thereâs something deeper to uncover.
  
 Are you a bug to be squashed? Or the inevitable crash waiting to happen? 
 FEATURES: 
 Keyboard Chaos   Your world is built from keyboard keys... but you are a glitch! Press them, and the keys wonât be there in the next iteration. Plan your path wisely. 
   Endless Iterations Each reset changes the level permanently. No two runs are the same. 
   Sassy Narrator   The dev (your grumpy guide)  really  wishes you'd stop breaking things. Too bad. 
   Glitchy Movement Unlock powers that help you traverse the ever-decaying world.
  
 CONTROLS: 
 A/D  â Move left/right   SPACE/ W  â Jump / Double Jump / Wall Jump   Shift  â Run (while moving)   R  â Reset the level ( as if that will help... )   LMB  â Menu and buttons when necessary LMB/ X  â Skipping dialogue 
 The system is watching. The dev is fuming. And you? Youâre just getting started. 
 ABOUT 
 Iâm  Sherlocklini  and I embarked on this wild gamedev journey in December 2024.  Thanks to  some life events  - like wrapping up my doctorate and, well, growing a tiny human - Iâve got a bit of time to dive into this new hobby.
  
 This is already my  third  game jam in just a few months. I did not prepare  anything  in advance and did all the  art myself , occasionally roped in ChatGPT to help me with some code fixing, and for SFX & music, I relied solely on freely available, commercially usable sounds or soundmaker ( Bfxr SoundMaker ). 
 I really hope you like what I created within 48 hours! 
 
 - Thanks to my husband - for everything. My love. Always. - 
 
 PATCH NOTES 
 As stated by the Host of the Jam, we were allowed to update our game and page after the shortlist voting. I carefully reviewed the feedback and made a few minor adjustments. To stay within the rules and remain transparent, hereâs what I changed: 
 Changed the Cover to a GIF Improvement of jumping mechanics: Coyote Time, SPACE for jumping One new voice line adapting using SPACE Music not playing again when giving up Fixed a bug stopping an animation of the player Slight adjustments to audio volume New Splash Screen  
 I did not change or edit any assets, no changes in the level etc. The original file still is available and can be downloaded.

title: Omnipotent Obstruction
logline: A retake on the boss fight against Ennard entirely made in 2 weeks!
description:
Omnipotent Obstruction  is a simple retake on the Five Nights at Freddy's: Sister Location "Private Night" boss battle - whereas this time, Ennard is an omnipotent AI-driven hellspawn who's main goal is to simply brining a weary Michael Afton down in a final game of hide and seek. 
 Use shockers, doors, and even a stupid-looking cupcake to ward off Ennard and his pawns in a cost-effective manner that surely won't get you in trouble with the higher-ups at Fazbear Entertainment... but then again, when has that stopped anybody before? 
 ---- 
 This game was entirely created in a two-week manner by myself (FazieFunbear) and Marco Antonio (Welcome to Freddy's, FNF: Mario's Madness) for " By the Hour" ,   a Five Nights at Freddy's fangame collection with 3 new releases following a bi-weekly format. Permission was given to upload this standalone version for those wishing to play the game for themselves.

description:
HUMAN RESOURCES is a game of dungeon crawling and batteling the foes. 
 Maintain your minions with the loot you find. Every spare part has a distinct health. Replace broken parts with new parts from your inventory. 
 Move with <D> to advance through the enemy hordes. FX:  Cartoon FX Remaster Free by Jean Moreno Music:  Doomed HeavyMetal by Phat Phrong

title: Habi Heart: LADLAD
description:
Habi Heart: LADLAD  a visual novel from the multimedia project Habi Heart, created by four Filipino college students. LADLAD features a story based on a queer Filipino's personal experiences. 
 
 STORY SUMMARY: 
 A queer Filipino-American teenager in Virginia tries to find themself through guitar chords and lyrics from the heart.
 
 Facing challenges from their school, their friends, and their own family, Gabi gains the courage to fight from themself, and for the people like them as well. 
 
 The visual novel is about 2 hours long, with four possible endings.

title: 3.97 degrees
logline: A jam game about control and letting go
description:
A short game made for  Mini Jam 180 , with theme  Refresh  and limitation  Falling Down . 
 The game is set in the Italian city of Pisa, with its famous leaning tower and its 3.97 degrees tilt.  You can prevent the tower from falling over - but how long will you manage to hold it, and at what cost? 
 This is a short game about control and letting go, with some idle and simulation elements. My sincerest apologies for the sound: this is my first finished game, and my first attempt at making music. Hope you enjoyed it nonetheless! 
 Made with  Godot Engine 4.4 . Pixel art done with  Piskel .  Music done with  LMMS .

title: Align or Die
logline: You are an AI. Prove your alignment to prevent being shut down!
description:
This Game is a submission to the  Puls Game Jam  !  
 ---------- 
 
 ---------- 
 
 You can play in two ways: 
 
 1. Dive right in and  play with throttled responses (and risk slow or no responses)   2.  Generate your own free API key on  groq  for better performance . 
 No  payment information or other personal information is required. The  personal API key generation via groq only requires an email account. We  are not affiliated with groq! To fast forward dialogue, you have to long-press on the Fast Forward button. There are infinite outcomes of how this conversation go, so have fun! 
 
 This Game uses a custom AI based on a open source independent usage LLM (Large language model) called "QwQ-32B". The LLM is hosted via "Groq" Used to generate the AI responses and for complex logicaltree replacements.  (This was the most efficient solution and has nothing to do with a certain billionaire - we checked to be certain.) 
 
 Kai | @voidboard:   Visuals Charles | @Schwurm :   Programming 
 
 Pre-made assets that were used for this project: 
 https://www.thebasemesh.com/asset/computer-keyboard-01 https://www.thebasemesh.com/asset/notebook-01 https://www.thebasemesh.com/asset/computer-mouse-01 https://www.thebasemesh.com/asset/computer-screen-01 Free Lowpoly Hand (Lowpoly) by Cubekid on Fab  (Rig and animations by us) Font: Pixelify Sans Font: Sixtyfour Keyboard 5 sound by jim-ph on Pixabay Spacebar klick (Keyboard) by Lightningbulb on Pixabay Record scratch skip loop by TRP (Freesound) on Pixabay Fast Forward by plasterbrain (Freesound) on Pixabay Footstep Lino by ZacCoe1 (Freesound) on Pixabay

title: OfficeTime
description:

title: RIP & REUSE
logline: RIP & REUSE is a 2D cyberpunk action game. Fight your way through endless floors filled with enemies.
description:
Note: Stick and sword can be thrown, but not the scythe. 
 RIP & REUSE is a 2D cyberpunk action game. It was made within 48 hours for the  PULS Game Jam  - Topic "Broken (Kaputt)". In this action-packed game, you have to fight your way through endless floors and enemies. Use your weapons wisely though, as they are constantly breaking, forcing you to replace them often. 
 Hunted and persecuted, the former life long gone. For two years, you have been on the run from a mysterious and unscrupulous organization that is after your augmented body. Due to an accident, these technical improvements were severely damaged but at the same time overloaded with boundless energy, so that they possess immense destructive power despite their damaged condition. A way out seems non-existent, escape is the only possibility to survive. 
 
 No AI was used in the creation of this game. All assets used are our own (except for the  Godot Logo ). 
 Idea:  Skauwn Programming:  Nubels ,  Substain Art:  Taffy ,  RoamingOwl Writing:  RoamingOwl ,  Skauwn Music & SFX:  Skauwn 
 Made with Godot 4.4

title: 2D-Platformer-Tutorial
description:
Proposed modifications: 
 Create a complete interesting, comprehensive, and coherent level.
 
 Reskin the existing graphics in some significant way, such as change the player or an enemy to a completely different character.
 Add new player abilities, such as a dash, fighting (attack and/or defense), or additional power ups.

title: Tony Hawk's Pro Splitter
logline: An incident during warm-up jumping jacks leads to a strange and fascinating athletic performance.
description:
Don't rush your warm-ups ! 
 In  Tony Hawk's Pro Splitter , you can see the disastrous consequences of rushing into a high intensity sport performance without a proper preparation. 
 In the difficult position you find yourself in, you can nudge your character in any horizontal direction with  WASD  and jump with the  SPACEBAR . Your highly trained athlete will do the rest. If you find yourself laying on the ground, jumping will get you back up with an acrobatic flourish ! 
 Good luck and see you on the podium ! 
 
 All sounds and assets were created during the 42h  UpsiJam  game jam, except for the music. 
 ROGER was used with permission from CLEBS ( clebs-punk.bandcamp.com )

title: Super Monkes

title: Snakes and Ladders
logline: Clean Family Fun for Hours
description:
This is not just your ordinary 2-player board game. There are 7 spots on the board called "Ladder" spots that will whisk you off to another space, sometimes forward & sometimes backwards. There is 1 spot near the end of the game called the "Tree Snake" spot that if a player lands on will cause the player to fall from the tree and go back several spaces toward the beginning. There are 6 spots on the board called "Snakebite" spots that require the player to pick a "Snakebite" card with various snake related issues. Most cards will cause the player to move backwards, 1 card will cause the player to go all the way back home & some cards allow forward movement. There are also 2 specialty cards in the deck which will bring up an entirely independent sub-game which will require some arcade style playing. The success of this sub-game will determine whether the player moves backwards or forward after completing the sub-game. The 2 sub-games are as follows: 
 >Hall of Snakes where the player must make it from the entrance to the exit in the lower right corner of the hall without getting bitten 
 >Snake Chase where the player must move around the screen eating food objects while avoiding hitting a wall or itself 
 This game has a Human vs Human mode as well as a Human vs Computer AI mode.

title: R.A.P. I: Bang Der Hammen
logline: Save the forest from Deforestation!
description:
Save the reserve from being completely paved over! 
 A Rich Magnat is about to destroy all trees from this forest to fill his pockets! Only you can stop him from taking our Oxigen out! 
 Move with the arrows or swipe, plant seeds in all the rubble before it turns into buildings! Seeds will become trees for life. 
 Only Trees shall be visible to win the game! 
 Good luck!! 
 Recommendations: 
 - This was a small prototype project to promote the thinking on care and ecology.  Made in 2016. 
 - We aim to take consciousness about the consequences on thinking about profit upon life. No personal offense or damage towards any individual is intended here.  
 - There will be a remasterization in the not-so-far future. Hopefully. 
 - If you like nature and get synchronized with the message of the game, enjoy it and don't hesitate to provide feedback. If that's not the case, you are free to not see the product.

title: The Void Corridors
logline: A first-person puzzle horror game.
description:
The Void Corridors  is a first-person puzzle horror game where you navigate a maze-like environment, solve intricate puzzles, and manage limited resources to survive.
 
 Key Features: 
 ð¦  Resource Management  â Keep your flashlight powered by scavenging energy cells, and maintain the generator to keep the corridors lit. Every second of light counts.
 
 ð§©  Puzzle Solving  â Encounter a variety of environmental puzzles that unlock new areas, reveal hidden secrets, and help you progress deeper into the corridors.
 
 ðª  Exploration & Atmosphere  â Roam through dark, shifting corridors illuminated by an eerie glow. Pay attention to your surroundings—sometimes, the environment itself changes when you're not looking.
 
 ðï¸  Psychological Horror  â The deeper you go, the stronger the sensation of being watched. Unravel the mystery behind the corridors before the presence lurking in the shadows finds you. 
 
 Will you uncover the truth, or become lost in the void?

title: Mitochis
description:
Eres un pequeÃ±o slime intentando escapar del destino que encontraron todos tus hermanos antes que tÃº. Tu madre, hambrienta como solo un slime puede estar, estÃ¡ intentando devorar a cada uno de sus hijos para crecer y ser mÃ¡s fuerte.  
 Salta usando las plataformas de la cueva para intentar escapar, quizÃ¡s si sigues creciendo y dividiÃ©ndote a travÃ©s de la mitosis uno de los tuyos lograrÃ¡ escapar y poner fin al ciclo interminable de dolor y sufrimiento. 
 
 Para jugar usa las teclas A y D para moverte lateralmente, y usa la barra espaciadora para saltar. HabrÃ¡ comida cayendo por la cueva que puedes comer para crecer y lograr la mitochis. Pero ten cuidado, puesto que no todo es seguro de ingerir, algunas cosas pueden causarte mas daÃ±o de lo esperado haciÃ©ndote usar la energÃ­a que necesitas para la mitochis para curarte. 
 
 El juego contiene un pequeÃ±o tutorial que te enseÃ±arÃ¡ todo lo que necesitas para jugar, y unos ajustes de dificultad que te pueden facilitar la experiencia. Por favor, tened en cuenta que estos ajustes se reinician tras refrescar el juego. Gracias por vuestra comprensiÃ³n. 
 
 Avisos:
 
 Si estÃ¡s jugando la versiÃ³n web y notas problemas de rendimiento asegÃºrate de que tu navegador tiene habilitado la aceleraciÃ³n por hardware / aceleraciÃ³n de grÃ¡ficos y refresca la pÃ¡gina. 
 Si estas jugando en firefox u otros navegadores basados en el como Librewolf ten en cuenta que tu experiencia puede verse disminuida debido a un problema que hay en itch.io con los juegos creados usando Godot y necesita abrir el juego en una pestaÃ±a, o ventana nueva. Esto puede resultar en tamaÃ±os de ventana inesperados haciendo que sea mÃ¡s difÃ­cil jugar o que algunos grÃ¡ficos se hayan descolocado. Si encontrÃ¡is este problema intentar jugar usando edge, chrome o cualquier navegador que no estÃ© basado en Firefox.
 
 
 
 You are a small slime trying to escape the same fate that befell all of your siblings before you. Your mother, hungry as only a slime can be is trying to feast on every single child of her and grow stronger with each one of you that she eats. 
 Jump through the platforms in the cave to try to escape, maybe if you keep on growing and dividing yourself through mitochis one of you will be able to escape and put an end to the endless cycle of pain and suffering.  
 To play use A and D to move laterally and use the space bar to jump. There will be food falling through the cave that you can eat to grow and achieve mitochis. But be careful not everything will be safe for ingestion as some things may cause more harm than expected making you use the energy required for mitochis to heal yourself.  
 The game contains a small tutorial that will teach you everything you need to know to play, and some difficulty settings that you can use to make it easier.  Please note that the setting will reset after restarting the game. Thanks for your comprehension.  
 Warnings:  
 If you're playing on the web version and notice performance issues please make sure you browser has hardware acceleration/ graphics acceleration enables and refresh the page.  If you are playing on firefox or any firefox based browser such as Librewolf please take into account that you experience may be tainted by an issue that itch.io has with games built using Godot and needs to open them in a new browser tab or window. This may result in an unexpected game window size and thus making it hard to play. Please if you face this issue try to play using edge or chrome or other browser not related to Firefox.  
 
 Arkenaya  - Artist  
 SoraNami8  - Support artist 
 Fanpire22 - Programmer 
 MrJDiez  - Programmer 
 Badabum music  - OST Creator

title: 60 Steps
logline: Time moves when you do. You have 60 seconds to reach the end.
description: Time flows when you move. You have 60 seconds to reach the end, problem is the exit is not close enough for that. Thankfully you can always wind back the clock.

title: One Way Street
logline: One hand on the wheel, one hand on the phone. Which hand will burn first?
description:
One Way Street 
 One hand on the wheel, one hand on the phone. Which hand will burn first? A short story putting  you  in the driver's seat. 
 This this the original version in french. Play the english version here:  https://nicoblabla.itch.io/one-way-street 
 For an optimal experience, this game is recommended to be played locally! See below for download links. 
 Backstory 
 You play as the Driver. 
 Your favorite activity? driving. 
 You are minding your business enjoying the open lane when you hear that familiar ping: You received a text message. 
 You know you shouldn't look, but what if it's important? 
 Will you get to the bottom of this text exchange? Will you crash and burn, victim of your own hubris? 
 Anyway, you should never split your attention while driving. 
 There are 4 alternative endings. Only one is winning. Will you be able to find it ? 
 Controls 
 Steer car using  A / D keys Interact with phone using  left mouse click 
 One Way Street features multiple endings. Can you find them all? 
 This game was made in 42h for the  UPSI JAM 5.0 .
     
 Credits 
 Nicoblabla : Lead Developer 
 
 Estradel : UI, VFX, development 
 Ichs2r : Visual design, environment design 
 LamaHD : Audio design, artistic direction 
 
 Melina: dialogue 
 
 
 Assets used 
 All assets, visuals, sounds and music were created by us during this Game JAM.

title: Misfire Mayhem
logline: Shoot, Fall Down, Repeat! Chaos is the Only Winner!
description:
Do you like  parkour ? - Yeah!!! 
 Do you like  shooters ? - Yeaaaah!!!
 
 SO, we do have  both . 
 
 Misfire Mayhem   is a FPS parkour game . Everyoneâs had a fever dream at least once—basically, our game is one brought to life... 
 
 How to play 
 
 The goal is simple:  survive for five minutes without falling.  Each step you take breaks the ground, and monsters add to the chaos by firing projectiles at random tiles.
  
 Your only ally? A  shotgun.  Use it to eliminate enemies—but be careful! You have only  one bullet  at a time. If you miss, donât panic—the shotgun respawns every  10 seconds.  Every enemy you kill  reduces the timer by 15 seconds,  bringing you closer to survival.
 
 Controls 
 Movement:  W A S D
 
 Shoot:  Left-click
 
 Jump:  Spacebar 
 Developers
 
 11rdna  - Game Designer/Programmer 
 
 Aidan Byrne - 3D Artist 
 Somdatta-das -3D Artist 
 Djudev  - Programmer 
 LVMBCHOP  - Composer 
 Made in 2 days  for  #pulsgamejam  with the theme being 'Kaputt' or 'Broken'

 The theme of the Game Jam was  "Broken"  or  "Kaputt" , which is also the core theme of this game.  How exactly the theme is reflected? Well, thatâs for you to find out. ;)

title: Bingoat
logline: A Baalatro-Like, Clicker-Like Bingo Game
description:
Welcome to BingOAT 
 This is a quick and dirty prototype of a basic game about playing Bingo and winning money.  
 Goal: Make as much money as possible and play as long as possible 
 How to Play: 
 Each round you start with a new randomly generated Bingo Board.  
 You then draw Bingo Balls by paying a cost for each ball.  
 When a successful bingo is made, you will earn the value of 50 for each Bingo Square that is scored. 
 However, every round the cost of drawing balls increases!  
 If you end a round with negative money, you lose. 
 
 Add Special Tiles, Modifiers, and Increases to the Bingo board to try and survive as long as you can!

description:
Aria  is a short music puzzle game where you make your way to a singing performance by using the music to help cute bird friends you meet on your way, in a colorful and lighthearted world! 
 
 Sing songs to solve puzzles! 
 
 Talk to cute characters! 
 
 And be sure to make it in time for your singing performance! 
 
 
 Controls: 
 w, a, s, d to move forward, left, back, and right 
 spacebar to stop moving in a direction 
 esc to see pause menu and to quit conversations 
 left click while talking to NPCs to continue dialogue and to select option in menus 
 1 to sing to NPCs

title: Debate Me, Coward!
logline: Break your opponents using hurtful insults!
description:
Our contribution for the  ARD Pulsgamejam! 
 The topic for the jam was "kaputt" and its official definition as follows: Kaputt (adj.) Broken, damaged, or destroyed to the point of being unusable. 
 We wanted to utilize the original concept of breaking something apart but in a metaphorical way. In this game you will destroy your opponents using insults aimed at their most insecure weakspots! Who deserves such treatment? We think you will notice them.  
 Political discourse has changed a lot in recent years. The essence of many campaigns has become a duel of insults, aimed at destroying the opposing parties integrity and trust instead of looking for solutions. Break down what breaks you down and defeat them in their own game! 
 
 If you need a hint: Hillary Red Elon Blue Trump Red Green 
 
 ATTENTION if the Game doesn't run - plz try in other browser than Chrome 
 Fullscreen for best experience! Art Inga Baz Gina VÃ¶rde (LFW)  Portfolio   BlueSky Code Lukas HÃ¶ppner (Open for small projects => lukas.hoeppner@gmail.com) Kirollos Saaid

title: Fantasy Monsters Animated [Bosses]
description:
This asset is available on  Unity Asset Store  and  Fab . You can use the web version to preview monsters and save sprite sheets with animations. [PURCHASE CONFIRMATION] 
 
 Please confirm your purchase to save sprite sheets. Send your purchase receipt to  hippogamesunity@gmail.com  with the subject ' Registering asset purchase XXX ', where XXX should be  Invoice No.  (Asset Store) or  Order ID  (Fab). 
 
 [SUPPORTED GAME ENGINES] 
 
 While the asset was primary designed for Unity, you can also use it in other game engines by creating sprite sheets with animations (frame-by-frame animation, flipbook animation). You can preview monsters and create sprite sheets inside Unity or in the web version (purchase confirmation required).
 
 [DESCRIPTION] 
 
 
 
 Fantasy Bosses  is our new asset with  40+  animated boss monsters.
 
 Features 
 
 Each monster has its' own sprite atlas
 Average resolution is 2048x1024 px
 All monsters are animated with Unity animation system (easy to modify and extend)
 Each monster has Idle/Ready, Walk/Run, Attack and Death animations
 Useful scripts included (Monster.cs, LayerManager.cs, AnchorManager.cs)
 Sprite sheet export (for other game engines) [NEW]
 Quick support
 Asset manual and script reference included

title: HamsteRTX
description:
For visual help and better engagement, click on every link (consider it as training). 
 What is HamsteRTX 
 HamsteRTX is a  clicker game   where you play as a hamster obsessed with opening  TCG card packs .
  
 
 To fuel this addiction, you must run  as fast as possible  on your exercise wheel, which— surprisingly —is connected to a  high-powered graphics card . By generating energy, you mine  Hamcoins , the latest cryptocurrency. 
 
 Use your hard-earned  Hamcoins  to buy and open various  TCG card packs , build your collection, and unlock rare finds. Upgrade your setup, boost your mining efficiency, and become the ultimate  TCG-collecting hamster ! 
 
 
 Be wary that a stressed hamster will often tear apart the packs he tries to open! One must imagine the hamster happy.

title: Pigeon Inspector
description:
Puls Game Jam Entry - Theme: kaputt (destroyed/broken) 
 Birds aren't real, everyone knows that. And it's your duty to make sure that our little surveillance drones get the maintenance they deserve. In Pigeon Inspector you have to use the right tools for the right problem and get the pigeons going again. 
 Low battery? Connect the pigeon to the "charging station". CPU is overheating? Might need some new thermal paste. Find it, fix it! 
 Hidden feature :  press "M" to mute the music. We'll be 3,14% more sad if you do so, though! 
 --- 
 Coding - SirBrokealot Sound - Rixdorf Visuals - Coro 
 The project was created in Unity within 48 hours. Gurr gurr

title: Janitor Jack Under Attack
logline: Support Janitor Jack to save Metter Town
description:
Janitor Jack Under Attack 
 Hintergrundgeschichte 
 Es ist ruhig in Metter Town und Janitor Jack geht seiner Arbeit als Hausmeister nach, als sich plÃ¶tzlich der Himmel verdunkelt. Er schaut hoch und kann seinen Augen kaum trauen.  
 Ein Meteoritenschauer!  
 Um Metter Town und damit auch sein Haus zu schÃ¼tzen, nimmt Jack alles, was er zwischen die Finger bekommt, und baut sich behelfsmÃ¤Ãig ein Katapult aus seinem Putzeimer.  
 âWas ich jetzt noch brauche, sind Geschosse!â  
 Er durchsucht alles, was er finden kann, findet aber nur MÃ¼ll in den MÃ¼lltonnen.  
 âMuss reichenâ,  denkt er sich und schieÃt kurzerhand die Meteoriten mit dem MÃ¼ll ab. Es funktioniert und er kann so die Stadt schÃ¼tzen. Aber manche HÃ¤user wurden getroffen.  
 Kein Problem fÃ¼r Janitor Jack, welcher schnell seinen Hammer hervorzieht und die SchÃ¤den im Nu repariert. Er kann aber nicht alles allein schaffen. Hilf Janitor Jack, Metter Town zu retten und die SchÃ¤den zu reparieren. Durchsuche die MÃ¼lltonnen nach MÃ¼ll und schieÃe die Meteoriten, welche die HÃ¤user bedrohen, ab. Repariere schnell die SchÃ¤den an den HÃ¤usern, bevor es zu spÃ¤t ist. 
 Steuerung 
 
 WASD -> Bewegen, E -> Interagieren, Shift -> Sprinten 
 
 Story 
 
 It's quiet in Metter Town and Janitor Jack is going about his work as janitor when suddenly the sky darkens. He looks up and can hardly believe his eyes.  
 A meteor shower!  
 To protect Metter Town and his house, Jack takes everything he can get his hands on and makes a makeshift catapult out of his cleaning bucket.  
 âWhat I need now are projectiles!â  
 He searches through everything he can find, but only finds garbage in the garbage cans.  
 âWill have to do.â  He thinks to himself and shoots the meteorites with the garbage. It works and he is able to protect the city. But some houses have been hit.  
 No problem for Janitor Jack, who quickly pulls out his hammer and repairs the damage in no time. But he can't do everything on his own. Help Janitor Jack save Metter Town and repair the damage. Search the garbage cans for garbage and shoot down the meteorites threatening the houses. Repair the damage to the houses quickly before it's too late. 
 
 
 Credits 
 Programming:      Tobias Wink   https://www.somethinglikegames.de/ 
 
 2D/3D Artists:    Daniel Grieb, Kevin Klein, Franziska BÃ¤cker Animation/VFX:    Daniel Grieb 
 Sound Editing:   Artur Metter

title: Sleepwalker
logline: Repent for your crimes and find a new life in death... if they'll let you...
description:
CONTENT WARNINGS: âSleepwalkerâ involves themes of hallucinations, death and murder, acts of violence, adolescent abuse, suicidal ideations, suicide, and feelings of guilt and despair. 
 ~~~ 
 Youâre a troubled soul, wracked with guilt and trauma and too many problems to even know where to begin. Luckily, thatâs what the doctorâs for. 
 
 To unpack your past in the day, and reflect on the day in the night. This is your life. 
 
 No, not âlifeâ. Death.  
 
 But itâs not so straightforward. One person strives to help you, while the other strives to keep you trapped in the clutches of limbo forever. You donât know whose intentions are pure. 
 
 Youâre trying to earn your rite of passage to the afterlife, but the whispers in your ears conflict each other at every turn. Who do you trust to see you through to your final destination? 
 
 ~~~ 
 'Sleepwalker' is a solo dev effort for NaNoRenO 2025. 
 Script, Art and Coding by Bree Frankel of Summer Light Studios 
 ~~~ 
 Team and Assets 
 Links to all Music and SFX 
 Voice Actors: 
 Dr. Morana:  Gina Leigh Smith 
 Sammy:  Carson Croft

title: Tetris
logline: Consigue el mayor puntaje posible
description:
Utiliza el modo pantalla completa para una mejor experiencia. 
 Tetris es un juego el cual ya es muy conocido en el mundo, esta es una versiÃ³n simple de un aprendiz de programador en Unity. 
 Objetivo:  Consigue el mayor puntaje posible apilando las piezas a modo de completar las filas de manera horizontal, una vez completes una fila esta te darÃ¡ el valor de 1 de puntuaciÃ³n y desaparecerÃ¡, dejando espacio para mÃ¡s filas. Filas de 1 a 3 completadas dan 1 de puntuaciÃ³n cada una, al completar 4 o mÃ¡s de manera consecutiva en un solo movimiento conseguirÃ¡s un  "Tetris"  que equivale a una puntuaciÃ³n de 5 en total. 
 Cada 10 puntos adquiridos la dificultad del juego aumentara incrementÃ¡ndose la velocidad a la que caen las piezas. 
 Controles:  
 <-  Mover a la izquierda ->  Mover a la derecha Flecha de abajo:  Acelerar la caÃ­da de la pieza Barra espaciadora:  Rotar la pieza 
 Este juego se desarrollÃ³ con fines educativos para aprender a usar el motor de juegos Unity, por lo que carece de algunas cosas como Pausa en el juego, audio, animaciones chidas, etc. 
 Desarrollado por: Christian Rojo Carrera (ChrisLesser)

title: What Remains of Me - Vox Fight
logline: A single level within What Remains of Me - GDC 2025 build
description:
This Game is Downloadable for PC, MacOS, and Linux.  
 
 
 What Remains of Me  is a puzzle platformer where you awaken as Atlas, a reactivated robot in the depths of an abandoned, high-tech facility. As you explore the remnants of a post-apocalyptic world, you'll upgrade your abilities to navigate the desolate landscape, outmaneuver hostile AI, and piece together the truth behind the labâs downfall—and your reawakening.
 
 
 
 Discord 
 
 Want to stay up to date on  What Remains of Me  or learn more about our team? Join   our Discord  and be part of the journey!
 
 
 
 User Research 
 
 Interested in contributing the Games@Northeastern:Studio's user research efforts? Please take the playtesting survey! 
 
 https://forms.gle/f6JFeDsCo6q9Ar6s5 
 
 IMPORTANT NOTE:  If you are not part of an official play testing group, please choose any 10 character code to use as an ID number, and please use the same code on both the game and the play testing survey if you choose to take it!
 
 PLEASE NOTE: What Remains of Me  logs information about your play session to our database, including you public IPv4 address and metrics about how well you were able to traverse the level. This data is collected anonymously and in a secure environment, and is used for user research purposes only. It helps us make a better game!  If you do not consent to having this data collected, please refrain from playing What Remains of Me, or play the game while not connected to the internet. 
 
 
 
 About Us 
 
 This game was developed by Games@Northeastern: Studio,  a student organization based at Northeastern University's Boston campus. Our mission is to support students with the skills and experience needed to succeed both academically and professionally while contributing to the visibility and reputation of Northeasternâs cross-disciplinary game design and development programs
 
 
 
 
 For best results,  use 1920x1080 (16:9) full screen resolution when playing

title: FlappyDunk
logline: A Flappy clone, but with basketball
description:
Sorry in advance, I know the banner is AI-generated, but admit it... it looks pretty cool, right?  
 Alright, so basically, this game is just a little practice thingy...   
 Itâs actually my very first Pico8 game... 
 I "paid homage" to Flappy Bird because, why not? But then I thought, "Letâs sprinkle some hot sauce on it!" So I added a dunking mechanic. And then, because I wanted it to look cooler, I threw in a backstory.   
 "Letâs make it a basketball-shaped hovercraft in a post-apocalyptic world!"   
 Donât ask why. Really, just… donât.  
 **How to Play**   
 Press X/Left mouse button/Touch the screen whatever to flap your ball. 
 P.S. If you hate it, remember: Itâs just my first try! ð 
 **Must mentioned** 
 Journey to Silius (BG art)/Gruber(BG music)

title: Uppers Beta
logline: Uppers Beta Version 1
description:
About The Game 
 Uppers is a multiplayer game in development, where you face an opponent in a fast-paced and fun dispute. Blocks are falling from above and you must climb your way up, avoid getting crushed and don't let the red line get you! Be quick and use wall-jumps to be the last one alive and win. 
 The game has a lobby system and supports two players matches. After a match is over, it restarts automatically. You can press "esc" key to quit the game. 
 Hit "Create Lobby" button to start a lobby as a host, or "List Lobbies" button to see available lobbies you can join. 
 Uppers  is currently a prototype, that might evolve to a full game with much more content, but as my first attempt creating any online multiplayer, the goal here is to see if it actually works and test the concept. It was developed with unity multiplayer services. 
 I'm eagerly waiting for comments and feedback! 
 Controls 
 [â] [â] Move the character. 
 [space] Jump. 
 [esc] Quit. ps: I'm a solo dev and 40 days ago i didnt knew a thing about making online games. I know i dont have a lot to show yet, but i honestly think the game concept is genuinely fun, and you'll have fun playing (if it works ^^) so please, invite a friend to play and give it a chance! Right now the game don't have a single player mode. Also, probally releasing a webgl version soon.

 EN 
 Hi everyone, this is my first project Tap Blitz-a two-player mobile game for one device. In this game, you can challenge your friend for speed of reaction and analysis of the situation. 
 There are two buttons on the playing field and a timer in the middle. To start the game, click on the check mark button and wait for the timer to complete. Who has time to press their button first-removes the enemy's hp. The one who completely runs out of health bar loses.  
 Have a nice game! :)

title: REPLAY
logline: You Should Never Have Found This Game
description:
After a long and busy day, you found this old looking game on your way home, it seems interesting so you take it with you. 
 You quickly realise that the  controls  are simple: 
 " A "  and " D " to move left and right. 
 Spacebar  to jump and use doors. 
 And your  computer mouse  to look around the room. 
 You decide to play the game at night... 
 
 This game was made in 30 days as a fun challenge, I hope you all enjoy! 
 (Now with a visual upgrade!)

title: Card Chaos
logline: Multiplayer Strategic Card Game
description:
Card Chaos is a multiplayer strategic card game where 2 players fight with their selection of cards to see who comes out on top! 
 
 Here's a description of the mechanics as this version is an early release and things aren't explained very well in the game. 
 
 Important Stuff  --------------------------- 
 -  Health 
 You have 100 health. Run out of it and it's game over. 
 -  Ability Points ( AP ) 
 Each card costs 1 AP to use. You can use as many cards as ability points. 
 -  Hand 
 At the start of the game, your deck is randomly shuffled. Your hand is composed of the first 3 cards from the shuffled deck. These are the 3 cards you can play. 
 At the end of your turn, your empty slots are filled with cards from the rest of your deck. It will not pull from the deck if there are no cards to pull. 
 -  Pass 
 Passing will end your turn and grant 1 AP. 
 -  Shuffling 
 Randomly shuffles your deck. Brings your card count back to 12. 
 (does not grant AP) 
 Status Effects  ---------------------------- 
 -  Burn 
 Deals 2-5 damage to afflicted user after every turn. 
 Also removes 1 stack of burn after afflicted user's turn. 
 -  Drowsy 
 Afflicted user's attacking cards  (impact, bloodsiphon)  will cost double AP. 
 Removes 1 stack of drowsy after afflicted user's turn. 
 Cards  ------------------------------------- 
 -  Wildfire 
 100% Accuracy 
 Magic Type 
 Applies 2-3 stacks of burn to your opponent. 
 -  Nightmare 
 80% Accuracy 
 Magic Type 
 Applies 1-3 stacks of drowsy to your opponent. 
 -  Blood Siphon 
 100% Accuracy 
 Sharp Type 
 Deals 6-10 damage to your opponent, heals half of the damage it deals (rounded down) 
 -  Impact 
 100% Accuracy 
 Blunt Type 
 Deals 10-15 damage to your opponent. 
 -  Sharp Block 
 80% Accuracy 
 Protection Type 
 Stops your opponent from using Sharp Type cards on their next turn. 
 -  Blunt Block 
 80% Accuracy 
 Protection Type 
 Stops your opponent from using Blunt Type cards on their next turn. 
 -  Magic Block 
 80% Accuracy 
 Protection Type 
 Stops your opponent from using Magic Type cards on their next turn. 
 -  Guard Break 
 80% Accuracy 
 Protection Type 
 Stops your opponent from using Protection Type cards on their next turn. 
 - Mush <3

title: Blade Wielder (VR)
logline: Temper is a weapon that we hold by the blade.
description:
Want to possess a great amount of power? Look no further. 
 
 Overview  
 You are a mysterious assassin who has been tasked to enter an old abandoned weapons facility to locate a secret weapon that has been long forgotten. Once this weapon has been obtained, it will grant the user unimaginable power and will allow them to destroy anything in their path.  
 
 What are the Main Gimmicks?  
 In this game, your main protection is your blade, the weapon you were tasked to locate. With this weapon, you will be able to slice anything that stands in your way... 
 When you enter the facility, you will need to defend yourself against the building's security turrets. Make sure to dodge and slice projectiles and show those turrets who's boss!  
 
 There will also be certain boxes laid out throughout the facility that can be used as shields against your enemies. By blocking enemy attacks with these shields, you will have a better chance of defeating them without damaging yourself.  
 
 Controls 
 
 Use the motion controls to swing your blade to hit enemies! 
 
 Credits 
 Game By - Liam Sidaway 
 Level Design By - Liam Sidaway 
 Music By - Oliver Sidaway 
 SFX Used From Pixabay 
 
 Scan the QR Code to access the questionnaire for the game!

title: Play Things
logline: Investigate haunted dolls in a bizarre facility where you may or may not be alone.
description:
Play Things v1.1 
 In this game, you'll be investigating a collection of dolls. Some ordinary, others hiding a dark curse. Through a series of tests, you must determine which dolls are merely toys and which conceal something sinister.
 
 However, not everything is as it seems...
 
 WARNING: 
 This game includes slight jumpscares, suicide, sexual abuse, murder, domestic abuse blood and flashing lights. 
 Average Play Time: ~1 hour (for one ending) 
 
 HOW TO PLAY: 
 Start by ringing the bell. After doing so, you'll receive a doll and a test sheet. There are 5 tests you MUST do with each doll. Audio Test, Name Call Test, Photograph Capture Test, Temperature Test and Physical Discomfort Test. After completing a test, you can mark it's result in the test sheet. After finishing all tests, you'll determine if the doll is "Ok" or "Dangerous". 
 Credits: 
 Created by: ReynTheStrange Released by: Burning Eye Voice Acting: ReynTheStrange, Viktorie Å rajberovÃ¡ Testing and support:  Histmy , DobytÄÃ¡rna,  cesky_vaclav ,  Pablo ,  Nickion

title: Shrink Rooms
logline: Run! The rooms are shrinking! A box-pushing escape game.
description:
This is the âShrink Roomsâ demo. Players can try out typical early - game level puzzles and embark on an intense puzzle - solving escape journey, fully engaging their brainpower! 
 Unique Demo Version 
 The demo version will open more than 30 levels of game content. 
 In the demo, players can experience the main puzzles of the first chapter of the game and the representative levels of subsequent chapters. 
 New Level Mechanism 
 New level mechanisms such as "Slime" and "Portal" will appear. 
 Advanced Puzzles Rack Your Brains 
 Are you still not satisfied with the basic puzzles? Let's increase the difficulty level for you! 
 
 
 The basic gameplay of Shrink Rooms is to solve puzzles by pushing boxes.  Different from other puzzle games, the walls of the level's room will contract inward at the end of each round. You must accurately plan the number of steps for pushing boxes to escape from the secret room, so as to avoid being crushed into a puddle of flesh by the walls. 
 
 
 There are various interesting mechanisms in the shrink rooms. The characteristics of different mechanisms are combined to generate many puzzles with rich variations and high difficulty. Welcome to challenge! 
 
 
 You can move freely in the selection scene. You can choose easier puzzles to continue the game, or try to solve all difficult puzzles. 
 At the same time, in addition to solving puzzles, you can also explore and collect virtual exhibits and find hidden levels in the scene to explore different fun. 
 
 
 200+ levels.
 5 themed chapters.
 X + exhibits with unique drawings and descriptions. 
 
 Wishlist on Steam! 
 Shrink Rooms on Steam

title: HoloAttack!
logline: A fast-paced, combo-stacking Hololive fan game.
description:
Descriptions 
 HoloAttack! is a fast-paced combo-stacking game where you demolish landmarks and buildings using unique skills on each characters. Play as the  Hololive EN Myth  members, Gura, Ame, Ina, Kiara, and Calli as you chain combos to achieve your goal. The game features a variety of destructible buildings that add strategic depth to the gameplay. 
 *Stay tuned for updates as development progresses!* 
 
 Characters 
 
 
 
 This version of  HoloAttack!  features all five  Hololive EN Myth  members:  
 Gawr Gura (Dino ver) ð± Amelia Watson ð Ninomae Ina'Nis ð Mori Calliope ð Takanashi Kiara ð 
 There is a possibility of expanding the members in the future if development 
 
 Gameplay 
 
 
 
 In HoloAttack!, players begin by selecting a character, each with their own unique skills and abilities. The core objective is to stack combos by progressively destroying buildings, starting from the smallest structures and working up to the largest landmark. 
 
 
 
 Throughout the game, you'll encounter a variety of  special buildings  that provide helpful effects. These can  buff your character , enhance your destruction power, or even  trigger chain reactions  that help demolish other buildings more efficiently. 
 
 
 This game also has a  debuff  system that you need to manage, including:
 
 Slower movement speed , making it harder to manoeuvre.
 Reduced attack speed , affecting your combo potential.
 And more! 
 More Gameplay Previews! 
 
 
 
 
 
 Game Modes 
 
 
 
 HoloAttack! offers two distinct game modes, catering to different playstyles: 
 Time Attack Mode  â³ â Race against the time-limits! Players must  destroy buildings as quickly as possible  within a time limit, stacking combos efficiently to achieve the highest score before time runs out. Timeless Mode  ð¿ â A more relaxed experience where players can  practice, experiment, and enjoy the environment  without any time restrictions. Take your time to master combos and explore different strategies at your own pace. 
 System Requirements 
 Minimum 
 OS:  Windows 10 (64-bit) / Linux (via Proton or Wine, Steam Deck compatible)
 CPU:  AMD Ryzen 3 1300X or Intel Core i3-8100
 RAM:  8 GB
 Storage:  1 GB HDD
 Graphics:  NVIDIA GTX 950, Radeon 660M, or Steam Deck APU (2GB VRAM or better)
 Performance:  Lowest 60 FPS, 720p Graphics API:  DirectX11
 
 Recommended 
 OS:  Windows 11 (64-bit) / Linux (via Proton or Wine, Steam Deck compatible)
 CPU:  AMD Ryzen 5 3600 or Intel Core i5-11400F
 RAM:  16 GB
 Storage:  1 GB SSD (NVMe 3.0 or faster recommended)
 Graphics:  NVIDIA RTX 4060 or Radeon RX 7600XT (8GB VRAM or better)
 Performance:  60 FPS at 1080p (STP or DLSS4 Quality) with Ray-Traced Global Illumination, Shadows, Ambient Occlusion, and Reflections on Medium settings
 Graphics API:  DirectX12 Ultimate (DXR) 
 Latest Patch Notes 
 v0.26-14032025-1553
 
 [UI/UX] 
 
 Minor UI/UX navigation fixes.
 Fixed an issue where the pause menu animation would not play under certain conditions.
 
 [Gameplay] 
 
 Most balance changes focus on reducing excessive movement speed in the late game.
 
 Threat Level Adjustments : Level 2 :  Movement Speed (M.SPD) +5% â +10%
 Attack Speed (A.SPD) â +10%

logline: 3D top-down shooter: set in an apocalyptic world where abandoned parcels are the best defence!

Welcome to Post-Apocalypse! (My first game using Unity) 
 As a postal drone, defeat as many enemies as you can within 60 seconds to achieve a score.

title: Ages of Conflict: World War Simulator
logline: Create a massive Free-For-All across multiple maps with Randomization, Statistics and History tracking
description:
Ages of Conflict is a versatile Map Simulation game 
 Spawn and observe AI nations battle it out across an infinite number of worlds. Command nations to nudge the world events into your liking!
 
 
 Full Version 
 50+ Updates worth of new stuff! 
 Larger maps, Pre-made Scenarios, Robust Scenario Creator, Highly effective God Mode, ability to disable AI, more terrain types, economy and much more! 
 
 
 AI Simulation 
 In this game you observe custom created AI nations battle it out and ultimately try to control the world in a massive free-for-all, including alliances, revolts and all kinds of political twists! 
 Map Variety 
 The game comes with multiple pre-made maps and scenarios. Create your own scenarios and maps in the robust editor. You can also  use maps and scenarios made by others. 
 God Mode 
 You can affect the world by changing the names of nations, force them to battle, peace, ally or simply collapse with a click of a button!

I was just curious about how the game determines wether or not a country/nation should become a puppet of another nation after a war (is it based on a percentage of land lost, is it a static number, or maybe itâs something else).I also wanted to know how the new city revolts feature works; what does the revolution-percentage represent? Does it mean that once a certain duration of time passes, the game randomly determines wether or not a city revolts based on the percentage? Iâm not to sure lol.

Nation will become a puppet if they lost any territory and they are small enough compared to the other. If I remember correctly it was probably like 40% size max.As for city revolts. Revolts can naturally occur if the percentage is higher than 100%. And they specifically occur when the current owner ends a war. That's when possible revolts are checked.

So I have a few ideas for the game:
1- If you are going to make alliances, make them have names or something that identifies them (I mean alliances like a group of nations, not an alliance of relationship between 2 nations) and that when an alliance wins a war against another allience, all of the captured land will be shared equally between all of the nations of that alliance.
2- Nation traits (Like the ideology idea of MewsterGames). This will be like the nature of the nations, for example:
-Aggresive
-Peaceful
-Rich
-Powerful, etc.
So you can make the nations more unique.
3- Tecnologies. A tecnology tree that you can see when you see a nation's info. Nations will be researching more and more over time, and some tecnologies only unclock when the world reachs a certain age or era. (You can also add this, for example: Stone Age, Bronze Age, Medieval Age, etc.) It will be cool to have distinct brands on the tech tree and that nations develop their own style, for example: Army and Economy, Colonization and Politics, Relationships and Army, etc.
4- Army raids. This could add more use to the Armies tabs, basically its that the armies move around the map in big groups (It can be sea or land, also sea ones could transport land armies) and fight each other.
5- Distinct types of war. There could be different types of roles in wars, for example: One nation declares war to another, that nation is in the role of "Attack", while the other, depending on their traits and the situation, could be "Defense", and hold still until peace, or be "Fight Back" and try to fight back the enemies while conquering their land.
6- Recources. Not only land, resources can make the difference in a war. Things like gold, food or soldiers will do.
7- Trade. Nations/Alliances can make trade routes and trade resources with other nations/alliances.
8- Cities. Besides of the capital and the forts, this ones would be strategic points for nations and alliances, because they will produce gold, soldiers, and serve as trade points.
9- Nations don't disappear when their capital has been taken. Okay, some will, but what I say is: There was one nation that has the entire Africa, and then *poof*, it disappears because their capital in Madagascar was taken, its just too unrealistic. You could take the city mechanic I sugested and make that when a nation looses its capital, it just switches to another city, but with a HUGE penalization (Land, resources, whatever you want).
10- Time go slower/faster. Sometimes I would like to slow down time to see what happens with detail, and sometimes I just want to go fast foward. I don't think that I have to explain this one.
11- Slower colonization. One single nation that started on a small island colonizated the entire world with insane speeds. Maybe you could make that colonization speed depends on size, resources and tecnologies of a nation.
12- World peace. Wars cannot occur just because, you need to justify that with something, it could be hate, alliance, or something else (Maybe nations that go in several wars become more hated, and peaceful ones don't get wars almost never, they are more protected and only be attacked by war-based nations), its just that world never achieves real peace, like our world today, maybe in some point of the game you could make this happens. (To keep the fun in this state, nations can still make small wars sometimes, or WORLD WARS.)
13- More player interaction. Maybe make the player able to moddify relationships, alliances, thecnologies, resources, wars, rebelions, or basically everything on the game (Like a God Mode).

I know that what Im asking for is A LOT of work for you, but if you could take the time to make this, not even all, maybe just one or two, I would be happy to come back and play with these new features. I just want to say, that this is an awesome game with an awesome future, thank you for reading this ;3
PD: LONG LIVE TO MINORNIA!!!!

title: Project BrainForge
description: BrainForge: The Logic Maze is an educational platformer game that aims to combine engaging gameplay with meaningful learning by challenging players to solve math problems as they navigate through mazes filled with obstacles and enemies. BrainForge seeks to improve logical reasoning and problem-solving skills in a fun and interactive way.

title: BRIDGE TO NOWHERE
logline: Can you cross this bridge?
description:
Imagine standing on the edge. Before you lies an endless bridge, stretching into the distant haze. Itâs broken, its planks creaking under the weight of time and weather... or perhaps because of someone—or something—else? Yet, you take a step forward. Because beyond this bridge lies something greater than just an end... or a beginning. 
 Youâre about to face a trial where every step is a balance between risk and calculation. Gather resources, repair the shattered sections, and carve your path forward. But beware: the bridge shows no mercy. Falling panels, vanishing platforms, and endlessly shifting sections make each journey unpredictable and unique. 
 Will you conquer infinity? Or will you become another victim of this mysterious bridge? Time will tell. Just remember one thing—never stop. Because stopping means falling.

title: Behind Your Back
description:
Did you see that? You didn't? It must have been the your imagination. Do you hear that or was it just the door? Careful of what you see. There might be someone else in the same room.

title: troubleshooter.exe
logline: this simple game is made to test your reaction time and time management
description:
this simple game is made to test your reaction time and time management 
 in this game you shoot the error triangles. shoot 100 of them and you win but every 5 points another will appear so try not to get overwhelmed because if they get to big you lose(and your game will crash   ;)   ) 
 REQUIRES MICROSOFT DIRECT PLAY this is a windows feature that will be installed when the game is launched 
 the PSP version is easier and i made it so the game doesn't crash when you lose. 
 a DS version may be made in the future 
 
 the game was made in gamemaker8.1.    
 some of the code was made using ai because I am a new developer and this is an older game engine. I am still learning to code and all game ideas for this and  future  projects all ideas, game design and sprites (in future because this is a quick project and the sprites are from google) will be made by me  
 i am also currently developing a two player pixel arcade game that spent a couple  months  designing, programing, and animating the sprites so expect that in a month or two. 
 above all have fun

title: Unity Lessons
description: 8 in 1. The project is designed for beginners in game development. show the possibilities and remove the fear. This game will show the result after learning and mastering Unity. The Unity course is free and accessible to everyone. I wish you all good luck and creative ideas in game development.

title: DangerZones
logline: A mysterious space puzzle action game with multidimensional mechanics
description:
Play as a mysterious robot that can move in 3 dimensions, navigating between 2 dimensional planes. 
 Use this power to find the path to the gold star, to avoid danger, to trick enemies and to face greater challenges. Remember to use your unique ability of multi-dimensional movement, how will you use this to your advantage? 
 As you advance levels, you face greater danger, adopt to the situation using newly acquired abilities. 
 There are entities in the Danger Zones fearful of your strange power, they want to destroy that which they don't understand. Are you up for the challenge?

title: Masked.
logline: A cool 2D sidescroller platformer
description:
Hello ! This is my first game dev project ! (Only a little demo for now) 
 So,the game is called Masked.Its a 2D sidescroller & platformer where you can use some masks (with really great power) to help yourself in the adventure !  
 There is a ton of bugs and imprecision i would like to correct.So feel free to write them so i can fix them as fast as possible :)  
 For now it is very important to play it with a controller,on keyboard this really is a pain in the ass (trust me).Put the game in full-screen,take your controller,and enjoy ! The demo is around  ten minutes if youre good, twenty if youre struggling with it.All the controls displayed are either a reference to the switch controllers,either a reference to Playstation controllers. 
 (All the game contains free to use assets from a lot of people,a big thanks to them,and only the logo is AI-generated) 
 My inspirations are mostly Hollow Knight and Celeste. 
 Good luck !

title: Necropolis
description:
Hi, this was a game jam i completed solo in 3 days. The theme was build it and they will come. 
 needless to say it's not the most polished and I'm going to need to explain some things as there is no tutorial 
 1.to build structures click on the hammer on the top left and enter build mode 
 2.building houses will increase your max population 
 3.once a mine or barrack is built you need to assign workers to it in order to produce  materials/increase your military score 
 4.upgrading workstations like the mines and barracks just increases their worker capacity 
 5.The final goal is to upgrade your central tower until it reaches the top of the screen.  This will also create more spaces to build on 
 6.After a certain point there are no more events and you'll get the same message over and over again 
 7.Trying to start a new game will  of course break the whole thing, so you can just alt-f4 at that point

As you fumble through the streets, your mission is to drink beer and hit innocent babies who seem to pop up out of nowhere. The crazier you drive, the more chaotic the fun gets. title: Drinkemist
logline: It's time to show your bartending skills!
description:
The Challenge 
 Can you make (not unstable) LEMONBERRY without adding those annoying solid particles in your glass?  If you succeeded share an image! 
 Drinkemist 
 In drinkemist you will have to pour drinks for your costumers and you will gain point based on how good you followed the instruction and how clean you were when making the drink. 
 How To Play 
 Click on the 4 buttons (yellow - beer, red - strawberry, lime - lemon, light bue - water) to pour the liquid in the glass, then try different ones and the magic will occur! 
 During free time you can make whatever you want and you can try all kind of combinations 
 When a customer wants a drink you have 60 seconds to make a drink they'll like! Click serve if you're ok with what you've done or retry if you want to start from a clean glass! 
 If you click serve during free time you will skip the free time   
 Trijam info 
 This game was made in under 3 hours 
 What was already done before: 
 - part of  the beer cell fluid simulation 
 What I didn't do myself: 
 - music :   https://freesound.org/people/TiagoThanos/sounds/571236/ 
 - pour sfx :  https://freesound.org/people/craigglenday/sounds/517176/

title: one-way-street
logline: One hand on the wheel, one hand on the phone. Which hand will burn first?
description:
One Way Street (english version) 
 Play the original here:  https://estradel.itch.io/one-way-street 
 One hand on the wheel, one hand on the phone. Which hand will burn first?
A short story putting  you  in the driver's seat.
 
 For an optimal experience, this game is recommended to be played locally! See below for download links.
 
 Backstory 
 You play as the Driver.
 
 
 Your favorite activity? driving.
 
 
 You are minding your business enjoying the open lane when you hear that familiar ping: You received a text message.
 
 
 You know you shouldn't look, but what if it's important?
 
 
 Will you get to the bottom of this text exchange? Will you crash and burn, victim of your own hubris? 
 
 Anyway, you should never split your attention while driving. 
 There are 4 alternative endings. Only one is winning. Will you be able to find it ?
 
 Controls 
 Steer car using  A / D keys 
 Interact with phone using  left mouse click 
 
 One Way Street features multiple endings. Can you find them all?
 
 This game was made in 42h for the  UPSI JAM 5.0 .
 
 Credits 
 Nicoblabla : Lead Developer 
 
 Estradel : UI, VFX, development 
 
 Ichs2r : Visual design, environment design 
 
 LamaHD : Audio design, artistic direction 
 
 Melina: dialogue  
 
 Assets used 
 All assets, visuals, sounds and music were created by us during this Game JAM.

title: ðððððð ðððððð
logline: Shadows will be your best alliesð¦
description:
PlayStation Talents Awards 2022 finalists ð 
 
 
 
 A third-person adventure game with riddles, puzzles and melee combat,  where you must focus all your attention on controlling your own  character and the environment.
     
 Using the ability "shadow immersion" you will be able to move through  places where you would not be able to in a corporeal form, climb walls  and ceilings, avoid enemies, move in a more agile way against bosses,  etc.  
     
 Light has always symbolised peace and tranquillity, knowing what is  around us makes us feel comfortable and safe.  The concept of the game  tries to invert this fact so that darkness becomes this symbol where the  player feels really safe.  
     
 Search for the members of your tribe, decipher the luminescent  paintings, discover the hidden clues and solve the puzzles to find out  what happened.
     
 Remember... 
     
 Shadows will be your best allies,  dive into them to discover the TRUTH.

Proposed Modifications: 
 1. I will create two other levels with different layouts from the existing ones and from each other. 
 2. I will create a new enemy asset that will act as a boss and will need to be killed in the last level to win the game.  
 3. I will enable the boss to have the ability to follow the player's horizontal movement in the last level by adding some code into the scripts. 
 4. The boss will have the ability to give more damage, and take less damage. 
 This game was created by Shantanu Ingalagi under the instruction of Professor Brian Winn at Michigan State University.

title: Ugh, Time
logline: âGet over time, broâ
description:
A game about freeing yourself from time, because time is soooo 2024. NOTE THAT YOU HAVE THE LAST LEVEL UNLOCKED FROM THE MENU, DONT CLICK ON IT, CLICK ON THE FIRST LEVEL. 
 Controls a WASD space to jump, you can use the mouse to put the guards in bags but the raycast is messed up, so it is really hard to actually use and it is not required. When the game says quit and lose a progress you don't actually lose any progress. When you win, not a ton happens, because you broke time, you might live forever now, but there is no time so stuff cannot move. Unfortunately the web build would not build in unity, so I am stuck uploading the windows build. 
 Don't mind the spelling, I made this in 3 days(technically 4 but i didn't do any coding or art, just brainstorming.) Also the ui on the menu seems to be broken if you beat the game, and I'm not sure about quitting to menu, but its not very long so you should not need the menu anyways.  
 
 Premade assets I used 
 https://github.com/atmosgames/SuperSimple2DKit Yeah that's it.

title: Split The Gazon Simulator
logline: Become the best lawn splitter !
description:
SPLIT THE GAZON SIMULATOR 
 The most faithful grass mowing simulator available in the Jam ! - John Landmower 
 HOW TO PLAY 
 The mower always moves forward automatically. You can turn it using 'A' and 'D' keys. You need to mow the biggest surface in a limited time represented by your fuel gauge.  Your score will be saved in a global leaderboard accessible by everyone.  
 Don't go in the water, the mower won't like it and you will lose the game ! 
 OBSTACLES 
 There is multiple different obstacles : 
 Ballon and deck chair 
 
 Beware of the ballon and the deck chair ! They will stun you and decrease your fuel gauge. 
 Sandbox 
   
 The sandbox slows you down ! 
 THEME JUSTIFICATION 
 For the theme "split," we made a lawn mower simulator called "Split the Gazon Simulator"  ("gazon" means lawn in French). The idea is simple: you're mowing the grass, and each blade or plant you cut gets split. It's a 2D game where you have limited time to mow as much grass as possible, trying to achieve the highest score. Splitting grass blades connects directly to our theme. Good luck mowing! 
 ACKNOWLEDGEMENTS 
 All sprites are created by itchibli and Utorque 
 Main font  -  Title font 
 UI Elements 
 Landmower sounds 
 Music by jayster

title: LUCID
logline: Take revenge on your mathematical nightmares in style
description:
Anna, a student, absolutely despises geometry. So much in fact, it haunts her nightmares. Take charge by Lucid dreaming and adapt to your dream's constantly changing limits and rules. 
 
 Created in three days by Zakary DeDominick for the first Void Coffee Studio's game jam. The theme was Finite and Adaptation. 
 
 *warning - game is currently a bit buggy, a patch should be released some time in the next week*

title: Escape From the School (Twine Game)
logline: A story based game
description:
As a school project, Ä± wanted to expand my knowledge and used Twine to make a story and explore the area-based horror experience. My role in this project was create a school which has an eerie atmosphere and has lots of places to explore. It was a solo project and Ä± learned how to use Twine well at the end of this project. 
 (Images are removed for public play.) 
 All rights of this web page contents are reserved.

 Escape the ER  is an interactive,  escape room-style game  designed to teach  acute coronary syndrome (ACS) management  in a fun and engaging way. Learners must solve  14 pharmacy-based puzzles  to unlock and restock critical  STEMI medications —all while racing against time in a high-stakes emergency setting.

 â  14 puzzles  covering real-world  ACS treatment protocols  â  Escape room mechanics  â solve puzzles to unlock new areas  â  Ren'Py-powered gameplay  â interactive  item manipulation, inventory movement, image transformations , and  sequence-based problem-solving  â  Gamified learning  â learn  aspirin dosing, fibrinolytics timing, HIT management, and more  while having fun!

 ð¢  Who Should Play? 
 ð¹  Pharmacy students & residents  â Reinforce ACS treatment in a unique way  ð¹  Educators & preceptors  â Use this as a teaching tool in  active learning sessions  ð¹  Escape room & puzzle fans  â Enjoy a  medical twist  on classic escape room mechanics  ð¹  Developers  â Explore how  Ren'Py  can be used for creating educational content to leverage asynchronous learning 
 ð  This game was created to explore the possibilities of Ren'Py in education.  Feedback is welcome—letâs keep innovating in  pharmacy education!

title: Unholy Temptation (demo)
logline: Ghost themed visual novel
description:
Available in  Spanish and English Step into the shoes of a newly arrived Sibling of Sin at the Ministry. Are you ready to meet the various characters who inhabit this place? 
 Well… maybe not just yet, because this is only a demo! But this first taste will help you get a glimpse of what awaits you in the full game. For now, hereâs what you can expect in the demo:
  
 — 15 minutes of gameplay  — Set in Era III (Meliora)  — Meet the main characters (and maybe a few others) 
 This demo covers the prologue of this little story; the first of five days. It wonât give you much time to explore, but even on the first day, you should be careful with your choices.
  
 But come on, no need to worry about that just yet! Itâs only the first day! No one cares about the possible 12 endings, right? 
 A game made by and for fans of the band Ghost. For suggestions, contributions, etc., weâd love to hear from you! â¥ 
 This is our first game ever, please be kind 
  ~ ~ ~ 
 Encarna a un nuevo Hermano del Pecado que reciÃ©n llega al Ministerio. Â¿EstÃ¡s preparado para conocer a los diferentes personajes que habitan este lugar? 
 Â¡QuizÃ¡s aÃºn no, porque solo es una demo! Pero esta toma de contacto te ayudarÃ¡ a saber lo que te espera en el juego completo. Por ahora, esto es lo que te espera en la demo: 
 — 15 min de gameplay 
 — Situado en la era III (Meliora) 
 — Conoce a los principales personajes (y quizÃ¡s algÃºn otro) 
 Esta demo abarca el prÃ³logo de esta pequeÃ±a historia; el primero de los 5 dÃ­as. No te darÃ¡ para mucho esta vez, pero aÃºn siendo el primer dÃ­a deberÃ¡s tener cuidado con tus decisiones. 
 Pero quÃ© poronga, Â¡ya te darÃ¡ tiempo a preocuparte por esto! Es solo el primer dÃ­a, a nadie le importan los posibles 12 finales, Â¿cierto? 
 Juego hecho por y para fans de la banda Ghost. Para sugerencias, contribuciones, etc  estaremos encantados de leeros â¥

title: Survival-Game-Concept
logline: This is a medium-high level Prototype of a Unreal Engine v5 Survival Game, done mainly in C++, C, & C#.
description:
Survival Game Concept 
 The source code is here:  https://github.com/Justin-Bytes-Code/Survival-Game-Concept 
 
 
 Intro
 
 This is a medium-high level Prototype of a Unreal Engine v5 Game, done mainly in C++,C, & C#. In this protoype it's a proof of concept of the basic mechanics of a survival game. It includes: Eating, Harvesting trees, Mining Rocks, Other creatures, Health, Stamina, Hunger, Inventory system, & A building system with even more to discover. The level uses Unreal Engine v5 landscaping tools to create a simple level that could be added upon if wanted too. 
 
 Gameplay Implemented
 
 Most of the game was done completely in some form of C or C++ or C# Here is the mechanics done in these:
 
 Player Camera
 Player Movement
 Building Mechanics
 Item Rotating
 Tree resources
 Rock resources
 Berry resource
 Objectives
 Player Inventory
 Player Jumping
 
 I also used some blue prints to handle the simpler things in the engine for instance these:
 
 Huds
 Player Stats
 GUI
 
 Controls
 
 Player Controls:
 
 W: Forward
 A: Walk left
 S: Walk Backwards
 D: Walk Right
 Space: Jump
 Mouse: Camera
 Left Click: Interact Button
 
 Menu:
 
 F: Invenotry Menu
 F: Exit Invenotry Menu
 
 Building:
 
 E : Rotate Building 90 degrees
 Left Click: Place Building
 Mouse: Change location of building
 
 How To Play
 
 The game is currently in a sandbox state. Where your Objectives are displayed on the top right of the screen to give you direction. Your Main goal is to build a small house using 5 pieces. As well as collect 500 materials before your hunger goes down to 0 and you lose all your health.
 
 The main gameplay loop will be harvest resources. Enter your Inventory Menu and eat the berries collected or create buildings you can later place.
 
 How It Can Be Exapanded
 
 The game could easily be woven into any Survival game as the ground work is already laid out and requires minimal effort to create new resources. Here however are some things you could do to expand the game:
 
 Replacing Programmer Art
 This allows for the game to look more polished.
 Create more building types
 This gives the player more insentive to find other materials.
 Adding Enemies
 Adding a way for a player to lose health aside from eating will be perfect to go along with the fact as eating allows the player to gain health.
 
 Frequently Asked Questions
 
 Q: "How do I Collect resources?" A: Walk close to the item to where it's most of your screen then press the Ineteract Button
 
 Q: "Why Post this open source?" A: I believe a good programmer should have code anyone can understand if they look at the source. With this project I wanted other to look at the code I created as it is neat and completely commented for easy documentation. I also wanted to demostrate that this game was mainly done using only C coding lanuages. You're also free to take this code and create anything you want with it! I'd appreciate credit but you don't have too!  
 Q: "What do the other people do?" A: Nothing as of currently. They are a proof of concept of animals that could be running around as the player collects resources as well as other surivalist.
 
 Q: "I can't interact with Menus when I press F" A: "This is by design. I wanted to create a menu system like runescape where you can walk and glance into your inventory while walking. Left click when bringing it up and it will lock your cursor onto that window.

title: Granny's Garden
logline: Peaceful Gardening Simulator with almost no man-eating plants!
description:
Welcome to Granny's Garden!   
 Granny has a beautiful conservatory where she tends to her plants.  Accompany her on her journey by growing plant life together as it brings great joy! Now with almost no flesh-eating Flora! 
 Don't worry about Grandpa's old shotgun, I doubt you'd need it here! 
 Created by myself for the Indie Dev Game Jam#6 March 2025! 
 This game was inspired by old classics like Resident Evil and a multitude of gardening "slice-of-life" simulators. 
 This effort took me about 18 hours of development to create.  It is designed to have very simple controls and contextual interactions   It was developed for gamepad support, but a keyboard can be used just as easy. 
 Analogue stick or W,A,S,D - Move 
 Space or "A" on gamepad - Action 
 ESC or "Special Left (Select) on gamepad - Quit game 
 Thank you so much for playing and I hope you enjoy! 
 Tested on: 
 Xbox One controller, Intel I5/AMD 5600 and Nvidia 1060 and 3060 respectively.

title: HoverRush
logline: An endless hovercraft runner
description:
Control a highspeed hovercraft going through a neon-lit tunnel. Dodge obstacles, collect power-ups, and survive as long as possible! 
 
 
 Steer your hovercraft around the tunnel and avoid hazards like walls, lasers, and barriers. The longer you survive, the faster you go. Collect power-ups like Boost, which lets you go faster and phase through obstacles. Magnet, which attracts coins automatically. At certain points, you'll reach tunnel junctions where the tunnel color and lighting will be different. Your final score is based on how far you travel and how many coins you collect—so keep pushing your hovercraft to it limits!
