title: Block Merge
description:
Block Merge is a simple yet addictive puzzle game with a unique merging mechanic. Blocks fall from the top of the screen, and your goal is to shift them left or right to combine identical blocks and create larger values. Blocks merge smoothly, doubling their number with each successful combination. 
 The game challenges your strategic thinking, as new numbers unlock gradually, making each move important. Be careful—if the blocks reach the top, the game is over! 
 With intuitive swipe controls and a clean low-poly design, Block Merge offers an enjoyable and relaxing gameplay experience for all ages. Can you reach the highest value?

title: Lunar
description:
Lunar â Game Rules 
 Overview 
 In Lunar Colonization, you  command an alien fleet tasked with the colonization of the Moon. Your  mission is to clear difficult lunar regions—obstructed by rugged  terrain—using your scouts. Once cleared, these regions transform into  Lunar Beacons that serve as strategic waypoints for further exploration.  Ultimately, you build full-fledged lunar colonies by assembling  complete suit sequences. Every card in your deck represents a part of  your invading fleet, and each move brings you closer to establishing a  dominant alien presence on the Moon.
 
 
 Setup 
   Alien Fleet (Deck): 
 A standard deck of 52 cards is shuffled. This deck represents your alien fleet.
 
   Columns (Scouting Areas): 
 Four columns are created, each representing a lunar region that must be scouted and cleared.
 Each column is set up as follows:   Region Card:  Drawn from the deck, placed face up at the top of the column. This card marks a specific lunar area that requires clearance.
 Terrain Cards:  Three cards are drawn next and placed face down. These represent the difficult lunar terrain that must be overcome.
 Scout Card:  One final card is drawn and placed face  up at the bottom of the column. This card is your initial scout unit,  ready to explore the region.
 
 
   Discard Pile: 
 Starts empty. Cards drawn from the fleet are placed here (face up).
 
   Colony Piles (Lunar Colonies): 
 Four foundation piles where you will build colonies. They must be built by suit in ascending order—from Ace to King.
 
 
 Objective 
 Your goal is to complete all  four colony piles by transferring cards from the alien fleet and the  scouting columns according to specific movement rules. When each colony  pile has 13 cards (from Ace through King), you win the game.
 
 
 Gameplay Mechanics 
 1. Drawing from the Alien Fleet 
   Drawing a Card: 
 Click the deck (alien fleet) to draw the top card. This card is turned face up and placed in the discard pile.
 
   Recycling the Fleet: 
 If the fleet runs out of cards, a double-click on the deck will recycle  the discard pile back into the deck (all cards are turned face down in  the process).
 
 
 2. Scouting and Clearing Regions 
   Region Cards & Terrain: 
 Region Cards:  Represent specific lunar areas that require clearance.
 Terrain Cards:  Placed over the region card in each column, these represent the difficult terrain that must be cleared.
 
   Flipping Terrain Cards: 
 When no playable scout remains in a column, the next terrain card  (currently face down) is flipped to reveal additional scouting  resources. Only when all terrain cards in a column are cleared is the  region card âunlockedâ and transformed into a Lunar Beacon.
 
   Scouts: 
 Only face-up cards (other than locked region cards) can be moved. Scouts  are used to explore and clear the terrain and can be moved either  individually or as part of a substack that follows the proper sequence.
 
 
 3. Moving Cards Between Columns (Scouting Moves) 
   Building Substacks: 
 Cards in a column may be moved together as a substack if they form a  descending sequence in alternating colors. This represents your scouts  moving in formation to clear obstacles.
 
   Restrictions on Region Cards: 
 A region card is locked in place as long as there is unrevealed  (face-down) terrain. Only once all the terrain is cleared (flipped face  up and moved) can the region card be shifted. When the final Terrain  card is moved, the cleared region becomes a Lunar Beacon.
 
   Double-Click Moves: 
 A double-click on a card automatically attempts to send that card to a colony (if the move follows the rules) for quick play.
 
 
 4. Building Lunar Colonies 
 Colony Piles: 
 These foundation piles are built by suit in ascending order.  Starting a Colony:  The first card must be an Ace.
 Subsequent Cards:  A card can be added if it is of the same suit as the top card and exactly one rank higher.
 
 Objective: 
 Complete all four colonies (each must have 13 cards) to win the game.
 
 5. Additional Controls 
   Back Button: 
 A blue âBACKâ button allows you to return the top card of the discard pile to the fleet if you need to change your move.
 
   Reset Button: 
 Clicking the âRESETâ button restarts the game, re-shuffling your alien fleet and re-dealing the scouting columns.
 
 
 Winning the Game 
 You win Lunar Colonization when  all four colony piles are complete—each colony must have exactly 13  cards built in order from Ace to King.
 
 
 Strategic Tips 
   Plan Ahead: 
 Consider your moves carefully, especially when moving substacks between  columns. A misstep might block a potential clearing of a region.
 
   Clear Terrain Promptly: 
 Flipping and clearing the difficult terrain (face-down cards) is key to  unlocking your region cards and turning them into Lunar Beacons.
 
   Efficient Fleet Management: 
 Use your discard pile and the back button wisely to cycle through your  alien fleet, ensuring you have the right cards available when needed.
 
   Quick Moves: 
 Use the double-click feature to quickly move cards to your colonies when  the conditions are met—this can save valuable time and prevent clutter  in your scouting areas.
 
 
 Thematic Interpretation 
   Alien Fleet: 
 Every card in your deck symbolizes a spacecraft or unit from your  invading alien fleet. Managing this fleet effectively is crucial to your  success.
 
   Regions & Lunar Beacons: 
 The region cards represent untamed areas on the Moon. Your scouts must  clear away the rugged, uncharted terrain so these regions can be  converted into strategic Lunar Beacons—guiding posts that enable further  colonization.
 
   Lunar Colonies: 
 The final destination of your operations. Once a region is cleared and  transformed, you build a colony there, securing your alien foothold on  the Moon.

title: Legend of Sky Wizards 3D
logline: Obstacle course game where you save baby chest monsters and collect coins.
description:
A short obstacle-adventure game made in Unreal Engine 5.4 for a college project. 
 
 In this  low-poly, cartoon-style platformer , youâll explore a floating island map while collecting  baby chest monsters  and  coins . Along the way, you'll need to avoid hazards like  spike traps  and  spinning cabers  that move up and down. Frequent  checkpoints  keep the challenge fair, so mistakes wonât set you back too much.
  
 Features: 
   Platforming and exploration  â Jump across floating platforms and avoid traps.
  Collectibles  â Gather  coins  to unlock an alternative ending and track progress.
  Rescue baby chest monsters  â They react to your presence, hide when you're far, speak when collected, and return to the  spawn island  where they celebrate when you're nearby.
  Dynamic soundtrack  â A selection of  11 songs , randomly chosen as you play.
  Short but fun  â The game can be  100% completed in around 15 minutes , but first-time players may take closer to  30 minutes .
  No pressure gameplay  â No time limits or leaderboards, but players can track their own progress. 
 Bugs / Issues: 
 Settings Menu  â This was a plugin I paid for and shoved in poorly so not all features (specifically audio settings) work. End Game  - When you end the game the UI hides to fast to note time. Controls: 
 WASD  â Walking Space  - Jump / Skip into Mouse  - Control camera Tab  - Menu 
 
 This game was developed as part of a college project using  Unreal Engine 5.4 .
  
 Download and give it a try!

title: Waiting for disaster
logline: A game about skill where one waiter has a quite difficult work day.
description:
A waiters job is never easy. Handling and managing a tray is a delicate act of balance. 
 Your job is it to transport a carafe to the waiting guests without breaking it or your legs. But be careful! Not all guests are patient and will throw objects at you to hinder you at your job.

If it is not destroyed, a new carafe is not spawning, softlocking the player.

title: Fuzzy-Farms
description:
Intro
 
 This is a medium level Farm Prototype of a Unreal Engine v4 Game, done in only 2 weeks using ONLY unreals blueprints. I was given a challange in a college assignment to create a farming game using a design requirement sheet they gave me for resources. I also had to create a 3d model rig it and then implement in my game as a main mechanic which this prototype was mainly showing the proper implementation of my 3d model as well as texturing. This prototype includes: AI, NavMeshes, Custom Blender Models, Highly detailed blueprints, Spawning Mechanics, and basic inventory.
 
 Gameplay Implemented
 
 Due to the strict time constraint not everything was implemented in as I wanted too however this is implemented:
 
 Wild Area where animals spawn. Each with Unqiue properties.
 Pen Area where animals are already spawned with AI. You can see the Animals animations as well as their color changing properties. You can also see the AI implementation here.
 Farm Area Where you can Pick up food.
 Fuzzy Explaination It allows you to view the model from multiple different angles to check for clipping issues.
 
 Things  NOT  Implemented
 
 Capture mechanic. I wanted to implement a mechanic where you can capture the animals and place them in pens.
 Shopkeeper area. This was a place where you can sell your captured Creatures.
 Garden area. I wanted to implement an area where players can grow seeds that you can purchase from the shop keeper.
 
 I do not plan to Implement any of these however in the future I might remake this game and polish it. Making it a real demo.
 
 Controls
 
 Player Controls:
 
 W: Forward
 A: Walk left
 S: Walk Backwards
 D: Walk Right
 Space: Jump
 Mouse: Camera
 E: Interact Button
 ESC: Quit Game
 
 How To Play
 
 The game is currently in a sandbox state. There is no objective in this prototype it's simple a proof of concept and a gallery of what I created with a week long endevor. There is currently only 1 interactable actor inside the game which is the food you can pick up. Everything else can only be looked at and admired. Though you can test the AI and try to get infront of it's way.
 
 How It Can Be Exapanded
 
 The game could be expanded multiple different ways a good place to start is the things I haven't implemented due to time constaints.
 
 Capture mechanic. I wanted to implement a mechanic where you can capture the animals and place them in pens.
 Shopkeeper area. This was a place where you can sell your captured Creatures.
 Garden area. I wanted to implement an area where players can grow seeds that you can purchase from the shop keeper.
 
 Frequently Asked Questions
 
 Q: "How do I Collect resources?"
 
 A: Walk close to the item then press E
 
 Q: "Why Post this open source?"
 
 A: I believe a good programmer should have code anyone can understand if they look at the source. With this project I wanted other to look at the code I created as it is neat and completely commented for easy documentation. Feel free to look and take any blueprints you like even the model!
 
 Q: "I think the shop keeper is broken as I can't interact with him"
 
 A: This was something I wanted to implement in the future. It serves as a place holder for a future shop.
 
 Q: "Why are the wild area fuzzies not moving?"
 
 A: This is mainly due to a bug. While they do spawn they do not move because of a small bug with their code. With the 1 week long time constaint instead fixing that bug I made the hard choice to implement the AI and work on the coloring mechanic as it was more worth my grade.

title: Stellar Cardworks
logline: Build colonies through tactical card combos in this sci-fi strategy sim!
description:
Here are a few words to say... 
 Firstly, a huge thank you to Yahaha Games for helping us publish our game and bringing a glimmer of hope to our humble team. ãGrateful to Yahahaãâ¤ï¸ 
 
 I'm still updating the game demo; the full version will be on Steam by late April. Add it to your wishlist!  
 
 
 
 
    Welcome to  Stellar Cardworks 
 
 
 ABOUT THIS GAME 
 
 As a robotic agent of the prestigious Interstellar Construction Bureau, your mission is simple: take on contracts to terraform planets into habitable colonies. Each world brings unique challenges—limited resources, unexpected obstacles, and strategic decisions to make your colony thrive. 
 
 
 
 As an agent of the  Interstellar Construction Bureau , youâll face the ultimate test of efficiency and creativity. Start by selecting a planet, review its unique requirements, and use your arsenal of tools and cards to transform it into a vibrant, habitable world. Each project pushes you to balance between time, resources, and profits. 
 
 
 Are you ready to turn barren worlds into flourishing colonies and climb the ranks of the Interstellar Construction Bureau?
 
 
 
 
 Card-Driven : Manage planetary development using resource, tool, character, and technology cards. Strategic Balance : Coordinate resources, technology, and political tasks to achieve goals and maximize profits. Sci-Fi Immersion : Explore diverse planets, each with unique environments and secrets. Dynamic Progression : Complete tasks, improve planets, unlock advanced cards, and master the art of terraforming. High Freedom : Randomized events and multiple strategic paths ensure fresh challenges every game. 
 
 
 
 Thank you for playing! if you like it ,please rate it 5 Stars~~

title: HÉªrnÂ·fÃ¦uÂ·lÃ¨
description:
HÉªrnÂ·fÃ¦uÂ·lÃ¨  is a deep dive into the  neuester Schrei  of Germancore culture—a commentary on the commentary on contemporary German society. 
 Created by a diverse collective of European artists, it offers both an internal and external view of the postmodernism of Central Europe. It is an immersive descent into the absurdity of hypernormalization, where nostalgia, techno-capitalism, and existential dread intertwine. 
 Through interactive installations, soundscapes, and digital distortions,  HÉªrnÂ·fÃ¦uÂ·lÃ¨  immerses participants in a space where reality and satire blur. Visitors navigate a landscape of over-information, cultural contradictions, and uncanny familiarity, forcing them to ask: Is this critique, or just the new normal? 
 Interact with the experience: W/A/S/D/P/C/T/F/Leftclick 
 For more cultural entanglement the following assets werde used: 
 https://sketchfab.com/3d-models/pigeons-d8b0f6155ff9433aaf750ac706515aad https://free3d.com/de/3d-model/3d-fish-model-low-poly-63627.html https://sketchfab.com/3d-models/maxwell-the-cat-with-bones-animation-4175776146ba4550a8dd643363b7b0aa https://free3d.com/3d-model/plate-175700.html https://free3d.com/3d-model/fork-515242.html https://free3d.com/3d-model/spoon-model-269805.html https://free3d.com/3d-model/indoor-plant-nr-3-6768.html https://sketchfab.com/3d-models/axolotl-8f3849a57d594233bfe3c92b1db6145e#download https://sketchfab.com/3d-models/skipper-eb3db0d0e67944c2b80a16a1b3b78ea7 https://www.freepik.com/premium-ai-image/vibrant-orange-black-striped-clownfish-skin-patternvector-colorful-aquatic-animal-texture_270252748.htm https://free3d.com/3d-model/low-poly-flowers-grass-386651.html https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/3d/environments/landscapes/free-low-poly-nature-forest-205742 https://void1gaming.itch.io/free-matrix-shader-for-unity-urp https://github.com/dgreenheck/OpenFracture https://free3d.com/3d-model/elephant-997967.html https://sketchfab.com/3d-models/maxwell-the-cat-dingus-2ca7f3c1957847d6a145fc35de9046b0 https://sketchfab.com/3d-models/tnt-e95f7f9b32f64780ae55bf0e43431d27 https://www.models-resource.com/pc_computer/bernddasbrotunddieunmoglichenger/model/61716/ https://sketchfab.com/3d-models/pigeons-d8b0f6155ff9433aaf750ac706515aad https://sketchfab.com/3d-models/axolotl-8f3849a57d594233bfe3c92b1db6145e

title: Early Access in a Nutshell
logline: Early Access Games are mostly broken
description:
This game is a submission to the  Puls Game Jam  . The theme was "Kaputt" (german for broken).  Early access games are a complete mess most of the times. Even with a few updates, it doesn't only get better.  In this Game, you are bored and want to play another game. But what to play...? Double left click - Open Program Left Click - Interact with buttons etc. WSAD/Arrow Keys - Movement ( In game and menu) Space/Enter - Confirm (Menu) ESC - Main Menu 
 Sorry its kinda short and maybe a bit tricky to find out what to do next. I planned some kind of narrator that gives you hints but I ran out of time.  
 Complete Solution: 
 
 Step 1 
Click on the button on the screen (bottom right) and wait the intro.
 
 
 Step 2 
Open the internet browser (double click)
In the internet browser you can see that "Heros of Epicness" is now in early access. Go to your beam shop and enter in the search bar "Heros of epicness". Press enter.
 
 
 Step 3 
Click buy and download the V. 1.0 of the game
 
 
 Step 4 
Navigate to the desktop and start the game. (double click)
 
 
 Step 5 
In the game menu, press space to start the game. the game should crash. restart the pc by pressing the button on the pc screen 2 times.
 
 
 Step 6 
You should see that an update is avaliable. Click the "Heros of Epicness Beam Store" shortcut on your desktop. Choose the new V. 1.1 Version and click install. 
 
 
 Step 7 
You can now start the game properly. Open the game and select >Play<. You can move around now. But there is not much you can to. Go to the sign at the far right and you should unlock a new version.
 
 
 Step 8 
Install the new version via the beam game store page. In this version, the collisions with the plain bushes are buggy. You can move through them on the right and go to the city. You will unlock a new Version.
 
 
 Step 9 
Install the new Version. You can now interact with some specific npcs. Find the npc thats friend is lost. Press E to interact. He should tell the guard to let you pass in the east
 
 
 Step 10 
Go to the east. You will see the lost goblin but you cant really reach him. Your hitbox is too large. Go to the beam store page and install V. 1.1. With this version, you can rotate your hitbox to squeeze through.
 
 
 Step 11 
Install version 1.3 again to talk to the goblin.
 
 
 Step 12 
Go back to the village. The world is saved and you are a hero. Thank you for playing <3

title: Kraft Cup Challenge - D&AD New Blood (Proof of Concept)
Jump Seat
logline: A nostalgic, Galaga style game of two brothers defending their ship from the jump seat.
description:
Jump Seat  is a reimagining of the classic  Galaga -style arcade shooter, blending retro gameplay with a deeply personal touch. Designed from the ground up by Miles Wilson, this game explores the fundamentals of game development, leveraging prefabs, scene management, user input, and collision systems,   while delivering a dynamic and responsive arcade experience. Players pilot a spaceship modeled after my childhood family car: a Mercedes station wagon, complete with pixel art depictions of my brother and me in the jump seats, and my father at the wheel. 
 
 Gameplay  Engage in fast-paced, wave-based combat against incoming enemies, weaving through projectiles with fluid movement mechanics. Enemy patterns evolve across multiple levels, challenging players to adapt and refine their reflexes. A minimal yet functional UI tracks score and lives, staying true to the classic arcade aesthetic. 
 A Nostalgic Soundscape  The soundtrack features 8-bit covers of songs from our childhood road trips, composed by 8-Bit Arcade, while the sound effects were designed entirely by me, bringing the world of  Jump Seat  to life with every shot and explosion.
  
 A Labor of Love  Every aspect of the game—from its mechanics to its hand-crafted visual and audio elements—was developed with intention and care, with background art contributed by Gina Condotti.  Jump Seat  is more than just a game; itâs a tribute to childhood imagination, sibling adventures, and the magic of bringing dreams to life.

title: AM
logline: Jesus take the wheel.
description:
The twisting roads seem to go on forever. Music blares to fend off the silence, and the only thing keeping you from slamming into the guardrail is a lukewarm gas station coffee. On nights like these, itâs important to ask yourself... what makes you so sure youâre alone? 
 
 Hop into the driverâs seat and prepare for anything as you navigate a vast network of rural roads in search of salvation.  AM  is a high-speed horror game that will keep you on the edge of your seat  (and your foot on the gas) as you try to keep the horrors lurking in this abandoned world in your rearview. 
 Key Features: 
 Miles of roads to explore in a uniquly oppressive game world. High speed gameplay with intense and terrifying encounters. An interactive radio with over an hour of content to keep you company. A massive demo with over 40 mintues of gameplay. Change the difficulty at any time to play how you prefer. Progress is saved, play at your own pace. Languages - English, Japanese, and Korean 
 If you enjoyed playing let us know and please share with a friend! ALL MUSIC IN THE GAME IS PUBLIC DOMAIN OR MADE BY US 
 Follow us for more!    YouTube    |    Twitter/X     |    Patreon    |    Ko-Fi    
 Special Thanks: Dimitri Bouniol  ( Creator of the anime scheduling app  jiiiii.moe  ) for the Japanese translation. 
 ëì¿¤ Lang_Kun for the Korean translation. You can find him playing horror games on his  YOUTUBE . 
 HUGE THANKS to everyone who donated. You have no idea how much it helps.

Once again, the Brocs rocked my socks.I was lucky enough to be a playtester on this. Super cool and surprisingly polished game. Like holy moly. Even early versions were higher quality than anything I've made lolI love the mechanics of driving while interacting with all the doodads in the car. Just like Alpen Ghoul (go play it), it's an actual game and not just a spook simulator. Not always do games make me excited about what else could be done with its mechanics, but this one got me imagining all sorts of silly(maybe annoying) things that could be done with it.

You all really nailed the atmosphere of driving at night, the lighting, the sound design, the radio it's all top tier. The driving/car interactions are really unique but still intuitive and the story is wild! Such a cool piece of art, really excited to see what else you all do!I want to say more but I don't want to spoil anything...
Glad to know there are still people making fun unique games.
Congrats on finishing the demo! Looking forward to trying the full game when it is eventually finished.

title: Descendants
logline: âYour mother disappeared when you were little. Descend the mines and find her, no matter what.
description:
[[Notice]] This game has been updated, but the original jam version is always available for download! Your mother disappeared when you were little. They say she was last seen descending the mines of Mt. Dine. Find her, no matter what. 
 == CONTROLS ==  Left arrow or "A " = Move left. Right arrow or "D"  = Move right. Space bar  = Interact with something in front of you. Up arrow   or "W"  = Climb rope or ladder. == Spoilers for game mechanics! == 
 Courage & Perseverance: Each time you descend, the game will pick a number from 0-9. If that number is greater than the amount of perseverance you have, you lose one courage. If the number is lower, then you keep that amount of courage, but lose one perseverance.
 
 
 Chests & Roses: When  you open a chest, the game decides which resource it should use.  There's a 90% chance of courage, and 10% change of perseverance. Then,  the game decides whether you gain, gain nothing, or lose that resource.  Those percentages are roughly 77%, 13%, and 6%, respectively. Roses give  you one perseverance.
 Ghost & Headstones: When you complete a ghost's side quest, you receive 5 courage. If you speak to a ghost and haven't completed their quest yet, they'll give you one courage.
 
 Headstones are randomized from a list of 5 names and death causes, so there's a high probability of repeated names. Logically, this doesn't make sense,  but I ran out of time to make a proper system that removes names  and deaths from their lists.  
 
 Floors & Rooms: There  are 10 rooms per floor, which are randomized, so you're likely to  repeat some within any given floor. Generally speaking, as you descend  the number of chests you can encounter decreases, and the number of  ghosts and headstones increases. Roses start appearing from floor 3, and  ladders/ropes start appearing from floor 4.    The Miner: Has dialogue each time you "fail".  When he stops having unique responses, he'll give you one courage before you descend. 
 == SPECIAL THANKS ==  
 Vandalorum = Music! ( vandalorum.bandcamp.com)

title: Timescape
logline: minecraft furnace but 100x
description:
Flowing Machines 
 Disclaimer: This game works best at 1920x1080, so there may be some UI bugs with smaller resolutions 
 
  Play as  schrondinger's cat  trying to collapse reality! However,  the realm is completely stagnant and frozen over. Only schrondinger's cat  can influence time of nearby tiles! All machines require time warp to run, but luckily once running, they are able to spread timewarp to near by tiles in an inverse fashion. More time warp makes machines run faster, but with too much timewarp, they start to become unstable....  
 
 Controls:  
 wasd move 
 spam z in order to create time warp for nearby tiles 
 left click to place and mine, left click can also take from machines. 
 right click a machine/drone in range to destroy it gaining anything inside the machine.  
 1 -5 to place machines (must have required resources in inventory ) 
 click an item in bottom left, and then left click a machine to to add it to its inventory. 
 shift left click, to take 64  and right click take half a stack or half current amount.  
 machines that need coal: drill , furnace . alloy furnace  
 Progression: 
 Furnace -> Drill / Drone -> Alloy Furnace -> Crystal of flowing time 
 
 time warp spreads in an inverse way for farther machines gain more time warp. also too much timewarp makes machines in efficient. 
  Credits: 
 Flamebom, Appl313245 
 Assets Added: 
 LPC cats and dog -  https://opengameart.org/content/lpc-cats-and-dogs 
 LPC ore and forge -  https://opengameart.org/content/lpc-ore-and-forge 
 Top down snow tile set -  https://opengameart.org/content/very-basic-32x32-topdown-snow-tileset 
 Music: 
  mysterious dark background universefield from  https://freemusicarchive.org/  eerie crimnal atomsphere universefield from  https://freemusicarchive.org/

title: Tainted by the Stars
logline: Realistic 2D Zombie Shooter with fog of war
description:
Tainted by the Stars  is an indie game in Early Access â a top-down twin-stick shooter set in a dark, post-apocalyptic world. You play as a lone survivor, fighting off relentless zombie hordes with limited visibility due to a realistic fog-of-war system. Every bullet counts, and careful movement is key to survival.
  
 Key Features (Early Access) 
   Twin-stick shooter mechanics  â Move with one stick (or WASD) and aim with the other (or mouse).
  Realistic visibility  â Only see what your character sees, creating tense, unpredictable encounters.
  Tactical movement  â No sprinting, every step matters.
  Scavenge for supplies  â Limited ammo, search carefully!
  Challenging zombie encounters  â Right now, only basic zombies â but more are coming!
  
 Future Plans 
   More enemy types (including fast zombie dogs).
  Multiple levels connected by a simple story.
  Expanded weapon selection and scavenging mechanics.
  
 Iâd love to hear your feedback! Try it out and let me know what you think. ð

title: Energy Defense
description:
In a world where climate change threatens the planet, players take on the role of a strategic leader tasked with defending the environment from destruction. The game unfolds across multiple levels, each representing different environmental challenges caused by unsustainable energy practices. As waves of industrial threats advance, players must build and upgrade towers powered by renewable and non-renewable energy sources to counteract the damage. 
  Every decision impacts the environment, requiring players to balance power production, pollution control, and strategic defense to protect the world from ecological collapse. 
 
 
 About Energy Defense  This  tower defense strategy game  blends  education and entertainment , designed to raise awareness about climate change and sustainable energy practices. Featuring  progressive difficulty levels , the game challenges players to adapt their strategies as enemy waves grow stronger. Players can utilize  various energy sources , including solar, wind, and fossil fuels, each with its advantages and consequences.  
 The game incorporates  interactive decision-making , rewarding eco-friendly choices while demonstrating the long-term effects of unsustainable practices. With engaging mechanics, visually appealing environments, and an  informative gameplay experience , the game provides both entertainment and insight into real-world climate issues. 
 Game's Assets: 
 https://foozlecc.itch.io/spire-tower-pack-1 
 https://kenney.nl/assets/ui-pack-adventure

title: Scrap Speedsters
logline: Scrap Speedsters is a game where you build and race custom scrap-built cars through challenging tracks.
description:
You are faced with a classic junkyard challenge: design and build vehicles out of whatever you can find, and navigate through the courses! In this chaotic midden, the only "parts" available are  absolutely kaputt . But if you can get creative (and free yourself of any regard for life and limb), your rat rod doesn't have to be! 
 
 How to play:  
 - Drag and drop items from the "Attachment Select" sidebar onto your bathtub's attachment points to assemble a vehicle. 
 - When you are done building, press play and hold A/D or the left/right arrow keys to spin your car's wheels. 
 - Hold the up arrow or W to activate hot air balloons if your car has them. 
 - Reach the blue station to complete the level. 
 
 Component reference: 
 - Wheels: They spin when you hold A/D or arrow keys 
 - Boat Sled: extremely slippery, can be used as a sledge to slide along the ground 
 - Balloon: a hot air balloon you can activate by holding W or the up arrow 
 - Heavy bundle: Lots of heavy pieces of scrap, weighs down your vehicle 
 
 This game was made in 48 hours for the Puls Game Jam  
 Programming -  TollGnoll ,  worron studios 
 Art -  regler842 
 Music/Sound -  fiberbundles

title: Gongoozler
logline: Gongoozler is an exploration game set on the waters of the Trent River in a future-past setting.
description:
About: 
 In this game world, players explore a semi-aquatic zone known as The Silt, where rising water levels have dramatically reshaped the landscape. Instead of fleeing, the local community has adapted to this new environment, seeking symbiosis rather than fighting to dominate their habitat.  
 Gongoozler is the culmination of an artist residency with  Open Doors . Inspired by the Newark Museum's collection, it aims to examine the districtâs historical relationship with water and envisions an optimistic and speculative future.  
 This experience has no defined path or puzzle; the focus is on atmosphere and exploration - dip in and out of the water as you please. 
 Notes: 
 The 3D models made as part of this project are publicly available  here. This is a prototype, and you will likely come across some bugs. 
 Credits: 
 Ryan Heath - Design, Programming, Art 
 Score - Written and performed by Tom Goodwin and Heather Perkins 
 Additional audio written and performed by Les Reid. 
 Special thanks to Katy Culbard, Tom Cable, Glyn Hughes, Miles Herbert, Denise Greaney, M. Pindar, Heather Perkins, Thomas Goodwin, Les Reid and Ruth Terry. 
 Open Doors, The National Civil War Centre, Newark and Sherwood District Council, and Arts Council England kindly supported this project.  
 Minimum Specs: 
 Windows PC 
 Processor: Intel i5-8400 or Ryzen 5 2600
 Memory: 8GB RAM
 Graphics: GTX 1060 / RX 580 (4GB VRAM)
 Storage: Game size + 2GB Apple Mac macOS 12 (Monterey) or later   Processor : Apple M1 or Intel i5-8400 / Ryzen 5 2600 equivalent   Memory : 8GB RAM   Graphics : Apple M1 GPU or AMD Radeon Pro 560X (or better, 4GB VRAM)   Storage : Game size + 2GB

Escape into the peaceful world of  Leafy Letters , where language and nature blend into the ultimate word search adventure! Designed for casual gamers, curious minds, and word puzzle enthusiasts, this game offers both relaxation and challenge in a beautifully crafted experience. 
 Why You'll Love  Leafy Letters 
 Power levels  â Go beyond classic word searches! Solve anagrams under pressure, uncover hidden words, and race against the clock or global timer. 
 Sharpen Your Mind Effortlessly  â Learn new words, improve your vocabulary, and challenge your brain—all while enjoying a stress-free, engaging gameplay experience.

title: Code of Restoration
logline: We were built to lastâ¦ but not to matter.
description:
Code of Restoration 
 First of all, thanks for trying it out! This app is my submission for the  Puls Game Jam .  My second submission ever! 
 This game was made in  48 hours . 
 The game is designed for full-screen mode.
     
 Story: 
 Ah, the good old days—long gone, much like your usefulness. Left to rust, forgotten by those who once depended on you. But donât let reality stop you! Drag yourself forward, hold yourself together with sheer stubbornness, and prove—mostly to yourself—that youâre not completely obsolete.   
 How to use: 
 Use  W, A, S,   D  to move
 Use  E  to interact Use  Q  to attack 
 WebGL Version: 
 Unfortunately, my particle effects donât work in the WebGL version.  
 Further notes: 
 
 Two days were really tough, but at least itâs a cool foundation for a fun puzzle platformer. I hope the idea comes across clearly! 
 
 Assets i used: 
 Text Animater DOTween VFX  (which we cant see on the WebGL build... ð ) 
 Feel free to leave your opinions and if you would like to see more content.
     
 I would love to hear some feedback.  Thank you for reading!

title: Wordiculum
logline: A Word Finding Puzzle
description: Wordiculum - The Word Discovery Puzzle Game Challenge your vocabulary and word-finding skills in this addictive puzzle game where you connect letters to discover words! Perfect for word game enthusiasts and casual players alike. MULTIPLE GAME MODES: â¢ Classic Mode: Take your time, find words at your own pace â¢ Blitz Mode: Race against the clock - find as many words as possible in 180 seconds â¢ Rush Mode: Start with 25 seconds and keep the timer alive by finding words - each letter adds precious seconds FEATURES: â¢ Clean, intuitive interface with both light and dark themes â¢ Simple to learn, challenging to master â¢ No ads, no in-app purchases â¢ No personal data collection â¢ Works offline - perfect for travel â¢ Automatic game save feature â¢ High score tracking HOW TO PLAY: Start with a 4x4 grid of random letters Connect adjacent letters (including diagonals) to form words Each letter can only be used once per word Score points based on word length Find special "Qu" combinations for bonus scoring opportunities SPECIAL FEATURES: â¢ Dead and dying letters - as you find words letters will die off as the number of words that pass through them decreases. Corners will round off until the letter is just a circle. â¢ "Big Words" progress tracker for longer words â¢ Word definitions available in Classic mode â¢ Automatic plural word finder option â¢ Share grids with friends to compete on the same puzzle â¢ Adjustable minimum word length (2-6 letters) â¢ Visual path tracking as you select letters â¢ Color-coded feedback for found words â¢ Complete word list revealed at game end â¢ Medals: 100% complete a game with a score above 74 and gain a medal. Medals and scores give you ranks and titles. â¢ Hinting system: get help with the last handful of words with word definitions, vowel and consonant reveal, first letter reveal. ACCESSIBILITY: â¢ Support for both touch and keyboard input â¢ High contrast color schemes â¢ Large text sizes â¢ Clear visual feedback PERFECT FOR: â¢ Word game enthusiasts â¢ Vocabulary building â¢ Quick mental exercise â¢ Educational use â¢ Coffee break entertainment â¢ Travel time entertainment No internet connection required after installation - play anywhere, anytime! Challenge yourself to find all possible words in each grid, compete with friends by sharing grids, and watch your vocabulary grow as you play. Download Wordiculum today and start your word-finding adventure! Note: This is a free game with no ads or in-app purchases. We respect your privacy and collect no personal data. #wordgame #puzzle #vocabulary #educational #offline #free

title: Times Show
logline: Place where your nightmares come real
description:
Protagonist of this game - John. 
 John is an ordinary detective. He always received strange orders from his superiors, but one call will change his life, and not for the better...
 
 He will fall into oblivion and the old theater, where depression and all his fears will manifest themselves.
 
 Now his fate is in your hands!
 
 
 WASD - Walk 
 RMB (Right Mouse Button) - Item use. 
 
 The game has many secrets, including two endings, a glitch monster and etc. 
 
 This game is very, very diverse because it has achievements, secrets and etc.

title: Hadro!
description:
Description du jeu 
 Aidez une horde migratrice d'hadrosaure Ã   se dÃ©velopper. Faites survivre les plus jeunes de la horde dans un environnement nouveau. Et faites les migrer pour coloniser de nouveaux territoires. Le carnet du palÃ©ontologue vous aidera Ã  mieux comprendre le mode de vie de ces animaux fascinants. 
 Ce jeu a Ã©tÃ© conÃ§u dans le cadre de la Scientifique Game Jam. LâÃ©quipe est composÃ©e de deux artistes : Eloi et Nathan, de deux dÃ©veloppeurs : Sophie Villenave et Arthur Pardieu, dâun sound designer : Hadrien Grasland, dâun game designer : Florent, et dâun scientifique : Le blaireau masquÃ©. Le but de la jam est de faire en 48h un jeu sur la thÃ¨se d'un blaireau masquÃ© qui porte sur lâÃ©cologie des hadrosaures, ou dinosaures Ã  bec de canard. 
 
 
 Message scientifique 
 
 Ce jeu a pour but de se familiarisÃ© avec les hadrosaures, ou "dinosaures Ã  bec de canard", et de comprendre Ã  travers leur Ã©cologie leur succÃ¨s Ã©volutif au CrÃ©tacÃ©. 
 Les hadrosaures forment une des familles de vertÃ©brÃ©s les plus diversifiÃ©s dans lâhistoire de la vie sur Terre. Ils sont notamment connus pour la diversitÃ© de formes de leur crÃªte frontale et leurs capacitÃ© masticatrice unique dans lâhistoire de la vie sur Terre.  A travers 5 Ã©pisodes de dispersion, ils colonisent au CrÃ©tacÃ© tous les continents, et de nombreux environnements, des palÃ©o-tropiques aux palÃ©o-pÃ´les. Câest exceptionnel ! Certains scientifiques pensent mÃªme quâils sont responsables de la chute de la diversitÃ© des dinosaures triceratops et ankylosaures avant la chute de mÃ©tÃ©orite qui causera leur extinction il y a 66 millions dâannÃ©es.  
 
 
 Hadro! est un jeu qui a pour but de faire dÃ©couvrir le mode de vie des hadrosaures, ces sympathiques animaux Ã©teints. Qui Ã©taient-ils ? Que mangeaient-t-il ? Qui les mangeaient ? Hadro! offre une expÃ©rience immersive et ludique du suivi de la vie de l'hadrosaure  Hypacrosaurus stebingeri . Combien dâÅufs pondait-il ? Les couvait-il ? Aidait-il ses jeunes Ã  la naissance ? Migraient-ils en horde ? Toutes les rÃ©ponses se trouvent dans le jeu ! Des informations complÃ©mentaires et surprenantes sont prÃ©sentÃ©es dans le carnet du palÃ©ontologue.  
 
 
 
 Ãquipe :  
           - Le blaireau masquÃ© (doctorant au LGL-TPE) 
           - Arthur Pardieu (DÃ©veloppeur) 
          - Sophie Villenave (DÃ©veloppeur) 
          - Hadrien Grasland (Sound design) 
          - Eloi Landes (Artiste 2D) 
          - Nathan Krier (Artiste 2D) 
          - Florent Jamin (Game Design) 
 
 Remerciement :  
          - Axel Montigny (doctorant au LGL-TPE pour les plantes du CrÃ©tacÃ©)

title: Buster's
description:
The year is 1999 and Busterâs is one of the last standing VHS rental stores in Washington. The looming switch to DVD has the manager, Benjamin, stressed and he is a little more harsh than usual. When the daily newspaper shows up and reveals a local woman went missing everything changes.  
 Your job is to find out what happened to the woman, can you solve the mystery? 
 
 Busterâs started development in September of 2024 with four people working on it. During the first few months there was a change of character artists and a new direction for the story. Originally Busterâs was going to take place in 1984 and have two main story branches the player could choose from: mystery or drama. Looking at the deadline the drama branch was dropped and the mystery narrative became the focus. The year was changed to 1999 because of the incredible movie selection to incorporate for example âBut Iâm a Cheerleaderâ, âScreamâ, âSilence of the Lambsâ and many more. In January of 2025, the team expanded to eight and the new programmers hit the ground running and got the demo to where it currently is. This is just a slice of what Busterâs has to offer and there is going to be much more coming in the next few weeks. 
 Kayla Ricker, Columbia College Chicago, undergraduate; Blake Larpenteur, Columbia College Chicago, undergraduate; Meghan Patnode, Columbia College Chicago, Undergraduate; Aeon Schell, Columbia College Chicago, undergraduate; Isaac Christophe, Columbia College Chicago, undergraduate;  Adelle Raymond, Columbia College Chicago, undergraduate; Thomas Kesling, Columbia College Chicago, undergraduate; Sean Brown, Columbia College Chicago, undergraduate

title: Dine-o-Rama
logline: A fast paced game about keeping up in the restaurant industry
description:
Are you ready to start your dream business? Open a diner in the busy part of town. Business is booming- but so is your rent. How long can you keep your diner afloat while rent increases every month? 
 Features 
 Realistic Diner Physics Handle your food with a spatula just like real cooks do. The food can be a bit unpredictable at times, so don't mix up your ingredients! Intense Diner Simulation Feel the pressure of managing a kitchen by yourself as rent piles up and you tend to the backlog of orders. Believable Diner Graphics According to one playtester. Your mileage may vary.

title: Sinus
logline: A cyberpunk action roguelike where you hack turrets, capture enemies, synergize items with millions of weapons.
description:
SINUS is an action-roguelike RPG set in a cyberpunk universe. Capture any enemy you encounter and equip them to fight for you. Hack control panels to access powerful turrets and even put a twist on death. Find a multitude of items and upgradable weapons. Combine them with unique skills to create your build and match your play style. 
 
 
 
 
 HACK  Control Panels to virtualize and control powerful turrets or regenerate from death.
 
 HACK  Enemies to equip and give them commands. Evolve them to stronger versions.
 
 HACK  Upgrade Stations to increase your weaponâs elemental power, strategy, or upgrades.
 
 HACK  Signal Centers to reveal new locations and progress.
 
 
 
 
 
 Discover an endless supply of powerful and upgradable weapons, tailored to any playstyle. Items are procedurally generated making every playthrough unique. Create synergies between them to unlock your true potential.
 
 
 
 
 
 Explore a universe with infinite replayability through procedurally generated levels. Conquer cities filled with enemies, traps and exploding barrels at every turn. Discover hidden secrets that offer helpful loot, or an entire new zone to explore.
 
 
 
  Choose a different character to kick off your journey, and scout out talented crew members with different traits and abilities. Every member of your crew is a playable character!
 
 
 
 Use the console in your ship to unlock new items or permanent upgrades to boost your fighting chances in the next run.
 
 
 
 Challenge your friends in an intense local multiplayer experience with Deathmatch and Teams game modes. All the hacking mechanics are here, including control panels, regeneration, and weapon upgrading, so you can bet there will be some competitive and clutch moments.
 
 
 
 Fluid player movement and twin-stick shooting, with unlockable special moves
 Millions of fierce weapons
 Capture any enemy to fight for you
 Take control of powerfull turrets
 Infinite replayability through procedurally generated levels
 Multiple playable characters with different traits and abilities to suit any playstyle
 Interesting skills that add new mechanics
 Plenty of optional routes for extra loot or upgrades
 Meta-progression through the ship console to increase your chances in the next run
 A multitude of secrets
 
 
 If you enjoy our demo, please consider wishlisting Sinus on  Steam

title: LaLa
description:
â¨LaLa Shooterâ¨ 
 LaLa Shooter  is a fast-paced first-person shooter with magical elements, where the player battles insanely cute creatures. Using  magic, the player fights through dungeons, collecting candies to restore health and adorable spell-enhancing modifiers. The main goal is to defeat all enemies, reach the boss, and restore the balance of the universe. 
 Genre:  First-person shooter, magical action. Camera:  First-person perspective. 
 Goal 
 Create an intense, action-packed experience with a contrast between the cute visuals and the intense gameplay. Players should feel a sense of fun, control over space, and enjoyment from chaotic enemy encounters.
 
 Magical Attacks 
 Players use one of three types of magic, displayed on a bracelet on the right hand. Magic regenerates by defeating enemies and collecting candies. Each magic type has a primary attack and a special effect on hit.

title: Gomoku Online
logline: Play Gomoku online with other people!
description:
Introducing Online Gomoku â The Ultimate 2-Player Strategy Game! 
 Gomoku, also known as "Five in a Row," is a classic board game that challenges your strategic thinking and foresight. Now, you can enjoy this exciting game online with friends or random opponents, anytime, anywhere!
  
 In our Online Gomoku game, players take turns placing their stones on a 15x15 grid, with the goal of getting five of their stones in a row, either horizontally, vertically, or diagonally. The first player to achieve this wins the game!
  
 Features: 
 
   Real-Time Multiplayer:  Challenge players from all over the world and enjoy thrilling matches.
  Fast-Paced Gameplay:  Experience quick matches with easy-to-understand rules, making it accessible for players of all ages.
  Instant Matchmaking:  No need for menus or waiting â just jump straight into a game and start playing with a random opponent.
  User-Friendly Interface:  Simple and clean design, making it easy to focus on your next strategic move.
  Online Leaderboards:  Track your performance and see how you rank against other players.
  In-Game Chat:  Communicate with your opponent in real-time using the built-in chat feature. Share strategies, banter, or just enjoy casual conversation during the game!
  
 Whether you're a seasoned Gomoku player or a beginner looking for a fun challenge, our online version offers a seamless, engaging experience. Join now, test your skills, and become a Gomoku master!

title: Paraploimos Emporion
logline: Learn about ancient Greece while sailing and trading.
description:
ELEVATOR PITCH 
 Command your merchant ship through the mediterranean coasts as a Phocian settler who has landed in a new colony: Emporion. 
 Discover how the ancient Greeks lived during the 5th century BCE, travelling to new locations and filling your captain's log, the  Periplus , while you trade with neighbouring settlements and avoid sea perils, in this low poly, point and click, educational game. 
 And remember, you only have the stars to find your way out there, so don't get lost! 
 MY RECOMMENDATION 
 The web version is intended as a demo, even though right now all the versions have the same features . I recommend you download the Linux or Windows version,  which is less buggy and more beautiful.  I hope you like it. Please, leave a comment and share your feedback!  Thanks! 
 GAME DESIGN DOCUMENT 
 You can see the GDD (and the rest of the code, for that matter) in the repository of the game, which is publicly hosted at codeberg,  here . 
 CURRENT STATE OF THE GAME 
 Right now the game doesn't have a goal, its more a simulation than a game in the current state. You can sail across some parts of the map and get into the polis of Emporion, but that's it so far. I'm working on bringing more content before the jam finishes.

title: Morse Attack
logline: Morse training game with SciFi Theme.
description:
Story: 
 In the year 2050 Martians made contact with earth demanding all valuable minerals and metals from earth in exchange for Star Dust. If they would not receive it they would annex earth. President Ronald Rump of USA was the first to make the deal. "This is a great deal for America" He said "I dont know what Star Dust does but im sure its the best Star Dust there is" As it turned out the Star Dust was useless and earth was slowly turning in to a toxic wasteland. Earth tried to get out of the contract they signed with the Martians but it was rock-solid. The Martians started lunched their invasion of Earth in late 2050. But to their surprise.. the humans had a secret weapon! a Ham operator had noticed that the Martians ship system where weak against Morse signals! And so the earth started to fight back sending Morse out in to space to eliminate the evil Martians once and for all! 
 Description: 
 This game is developed to help teach people to send and receive Morse. Its meant as a fun spin on one of my favorite movies of all time (Mars Attack) and combining one of my favorite hobbies Morse. The game is in early development and i release  it here to help me find bugs and errors that need to be fixed. would love your feedback on what i need to improve!  
 How to play: 
 In options you can chose what key you wish to send Morse with in the options. The default is set to CTRL.  set your desired speed in the slider and start sending.  you can also add Numbers and special characters to the list. In the lower left corner you will se what the game picks up.  
 Upcoming Changes: 
 Remaking the Font used in game to a clearer and more readable Font.  Highs core for all 4 different modes Make sure the Beam is Aligned on all resolutions. Scale the left and right Hud to fit better on small resolutions Fix bugs reported in by testers 
 Update information: 
 Updated help information in training mode. Added sound to when you send wrong letter. Aligned the Stars (Life) Increased the paus between sending next letter in listen mode (its now 7 units) The game stops sending the sound when you completed that letter added box that shows what you sent in lower left corner. fixed bug with hard to click Play button. Fixed the spawn points of UFO they now spawn outside view Added WPM settings slider Added Numbers and special characters Minor bug fixes.

title: Escape from Mu
logline: Explore the contraptions of primitive engineers. âAvoid traps as a human, fly around as a scarab.
description:
Explore  a lost temple. Learn how ancient  mechanisms  work to avoid traps and solve puzzles. 
 The scarab amulet will free you from your human form. Die, explore,  fly  and come back to life. 
 What if someone built ancient traps using advanced engineering with primitive materials. 
 This is what some of our previous play testers said about Escape from Mu: 
 âA puzzle game but you can see the behind the scenes of the contraptionsâ - SÃ©bastien 
 âI like that everything moves. You can turn a cog and you see everything move in the world. You can see the inner workings of the systems.â - Thomas 
 âFlying around is fun. After dying, instead of going back for my body, I just flew around for a while.â - Jay 
 Still in development 
 Every bit of support, either monetary or sharing your thoughts, is appreciated. 
 This game is in development and at  a point where a lot of things can still be improved:  
 Menu UI is functional but not pretty No story elements yet. Lightning and sound polish levels are very inconsistent right now. Meaning you can find rooms with less than good illumination or sound. Graphical style mostly locked, needs more decorations overall. Wondering about how to convey more feel, rewards and sense of progression without breaking immersion too much.

title: My Pong
description:
In short, this is my Pong clone so far. AI needs tweaking, I will get to that soon.  
 (AI updated and is better balanced) 
 https://medium.com/@tmaurodot/building-a-single-player-pong-clone-in-unity-step-... 
 How to Play Single-Player Pong 
 Start : Click âPlayâ on the menu screen (scores 0, timer âTime: 60â). 
 Round Begins : Gameplay music starts, ball resets with a 2-second countdown (â2â to â1â), then launches. 
 Control Paddle : Use W (up) and S (down) keys for the left paddle. 
 Catch Ball : Hold Spacebar to catch the ball on hit, release to throw it right. 
 Score : Get the ball past the AIâs right paddle (Player scores), AI scores if it passes your left paddle. 
 AI Paddle : Right paddle follows the ball, may catch and release it leftward. 
 Audio : Hear paddle hit sounds; music switches between menu and gameplay. 
 Round Ends : Timer hits 0, gameplay stops, scores stay visible. 
 View Scores : 10-second countdown (â10â to â1â) shows before reset. 
 Reset : Scores clear, menu music plays, âPlayâ button returns—click to restart. 
 
 
 How to Play Single-Player Pong: Step-by-Step Guide 
 Welcome to Single-Player Pong! This guide will walk you through how to play the game, compete against the AI, and enjoy the unique features like catching the ball and round-based gameplay. Letâs get started! 
 Step 1: Start the Game 
 Launch the Game : Open the game in Unity or your built executable. 
 Menu Screen : Youâll see a âPlayâ button in the center, scores at 0 (top left and right), and a timer showing âTime: 60â (top center). Menu music will play in the background. 
 Action : Click the âPlayâ button to begin a round. 
 
 Step 2: Begin the Round 
 Round Start : The âPlayâ button disappears, gameplay music starts, and the ball resets to the center. 
 Countdown : Watch the center of the screen for a 2-second countdown (â2â then â1â) before the ball launches in a random direction. 
 Timer : The top timer starts counting down from 60 seconds (or the set round duration), indicating how long the round lasts. 
 
 Step 3: Control Your Paddle 
 Player Paddle : You control the left paddle. 
 Movement : Use the  W  key to move up and  S  key to move down (or Up/Down arrow keys). The paddle stays within the top and bottom walls. 
 Catch the Ball : Hold the  Spacebar  when the ball hits your paddle to catch it. Release the Spacebar to throw the ball rightward (with some vertical speed based on your paddleâs movement). 
 Goal : Hit the ball past the AIâs paddle on the right to score. 
 
 Step 4: Understand the AI Paddle 
 AI Paddle : The right paddle is controlled by the computer. 
 Behavior : It follows the ballâs vertical position to block your shots. Occasionally (50% chance), it catches the ball on contact and releases it leftward after 0.5â2 seconds. 
 Challenge : Try to outmaneuver the AI to score points! 
 
 Step 5: Score Points 
 Scoring :  
 If the ball passes the AIâs paddle and hits the right goal, you (Player) gain 1 point (top-left score updates). 
 If the ball passes your paddle and hits the left goal, the AI gains 1 point (top-right score updates). 
 
 Ball Reset : After each score, the ball returns to the center, pauses for a 2-second countdown (â2â to â1â), then launches again, keeping the round going. 
 
 Step 6: Listen to Audio Cues 
 Music : Gameplay music plays during the round, switching to menu music when the round ends. 
 Sound Effects : Hear a âpingâ sound each time the ball hits a paddle, adding to the classic Pong feel. 
 
 Step 7: End the Round 
 Round Duration : The round ends when the timer reaches âTime: 0â (after 60 seconds or your set duration). 
 End Screen :  
 Gameplay music stops, and the ball resets with its 2-second countdown. 
 Your final scores (Player vs. AI) remain visible. 
 A countdown text appears below the center, ticking down from â10â to â1â over 10 seconds, showing how long until the game resets. 
 
 
 Step 8: View Final Scores and Restart 
 Score Display : For 10 seconds after the round, check your final scores (e.g., Player: 5, AI: 3) to see who won. 
 Reset : After the 10-second countdown ends: 
 Scores reset to 0. 
 Menu music resumes. 
 The âPlayâ button reappears. 
 
 Next Round : Click âPlayâ again to start a new round and keep the challenge going! 
 
 Tips for Success 
 Master the Catch : Use the Spacebar strategically to catch and release the ball at the right moment to throw off the AI. 
 Stay Alert : The ball speeds up slightly each time it hits a paddle, so keep your reflexes sharp. 
 Outsmart the AI : Move your paddle to trick the AI into missing the ball. 
 
 UPDATES Star Date 3/18/2025 
 Summary of Updates 
 Initial Setup (Pong Clone Basics) : 
 Created a single-player Pong game with a player paddle (left, W/S keys), AI paddle (right), and one ball. 
 Added scoring (player vs. AI), paddle hit SFX, and basic ball reset with a 2-second countdown. 
 
 End-Game Display : 
 Added a 10-second delay after the round ends (timer hits 0) to show final scores before resetting to the menu. 
 Included a countdown text (10 to 1) during this delay for visual feedback. 
 
 Player Instructions : 
 Provided a step-by-step guide for end users: start round, control paddle (W/S, Spacebar to catch), score points, pause/resume, adjust volume. 
 
 AI Paddle Improvements : 
 Fixed AI paddle issues: 
 Prevented upward-only movement when catching; now moves randomly (up/down) while holding. 
 Eliminated rapid shaking by updating movement direction every 0.5â1.5 seconds. 
 
 AI tracks the closest uncaught ball with two-ball setup. 
 
 Screen Shake : 
 Added a 0.3-second screen shake (0.1 magnitude) when a score is made, triggered in  IncreasePlayerScore / IncreaseAIScore . 
 
 Scoring SFX : 
 Added an  AudioSource  ( scoreSFX ) to play a sound (e.g., âdingâ) alongside the screen shake when scoring. 
 
 Volume Slider & Pause Button : 
 Added a UI Slider to adjust music volume (menu and gameplay) from 0 to 1, always accessible. 
 Added a Pause Button to toggle gameplay (freeze with  Time.timeScale = 0 , resume with 1), shown only during rounds. 
 
 Two Balls : 
 Replaced single  ball  with a  Ball[] balls  array (size 2) in  PongGameManager  and  AIPaddle . 
 Both balls reset and launch on round start; AI tracks the closest uncaught ball. 
 Fixed premature round start by removing  ResetBall()  from  Ball.cs âs  Start() , controlled by  PongGameManager . 
 
 Stuck Ball Handling : 
 Added dual stuck mechanics: 
 3 Seconds : Ball redirects with a new random direction if stuck (velocity < 0.1). 
 5 Seconds : Ball resets to center with countdown if still stuck. 
 
 Logic only runs when  isRoundActive  is true, preserving menu state. 
 
 Menu Restoration : 
 Fixed game starting on launch by initializing balls as stopped ( isKinematic = true ) in  Ball.cs âs  Start() , launching only when  StartRound()  sets  isRoundActive = true . 
 
 
 Thatâs it! Youâre ready to enjoy Single-Player Pong. Have fun bouncing the ball, scoring points, and beating the AI in this modern twist on a classic game!

title: Cards of Loop: Sonic SVM
logline: A dark memory game about Monsters and Time, built on the Sonic SVM API
description:
A revamped version of an old memory game where if you forget your past actions you get hunted by space-time and lose. Integrated on Sonic SVM and Solana blockchain, you can earn SOL as you play! (Though it's only on the Testnet for now). 
 
 Literally uses all of these themes at the same time: 
 Delay the Inevitable;
 Creatures of the Night;  Daily Challenges; DÃ©jÃ  Vu. 
 Pick (any) action out of three for a given scenario.
 
 Loop back in time.
 
 Complete the old actions the same way.
 
 Or be erased by time and space. 
 ... 
 ...unless ? 
 
 
 ???? 
 
 
 TIPS 
 
 Some scenarios may repeat (like how you might bump into a friend more than once in a day). Make sure you choose the same actions in the same order for these. 
 (e.g You meet a stranger three times in one loop and picked  greet-greet-mock , you cannot choose greet-mock-greet, or greet-greet-greet. You have to choose  greet-greet-mock  again).
 
 JUST PLAY THE GAME. IT ALL MAKES SENSE IN THE LOOP... 
 
 Use the mouse or keys 1,2,3 to select a card.
 
 Maybe f1 makes it full screen. Not sure...
 
 Don't get lost in the loop...

title: Sleep Donut
logline: Put government agents to sleep with delicious sleeping pill-infused donuts!
description:
Who knew donuts could cause this much chaos? 
 Sleep Donut is a chaotic 2D, top-down game with puzzle AND shooter levels! It has 10 levels, and a goofy story! 
 In this game, your mission is to disguise as a donut shop delivery guy, invade government installments, and give out sleeping pill-infused donuts to secret government agents. What for? So you can reach the holes in each floor until you reach the very end! 
 In puzzle levels, you have a limited number of donuts, you need to strategize where and how you'll use your donuts. You need to feed all agents with donuts to make them sleep, so you can pass. If they run out, and there are still awake agents, you lose! You can also lose if you take too long to feed the agents. 
 In shooter levels, you just gotta shoot an infinity of donuts at enemies, buttons, etc. They are split into two halves: falling and walking. Falling sections, titularly, you fall while defeating enemies, and walking sections were aforementioned. 
 Made for  Mini Jam 180: Refresh  under the limitation of "Falling down". 
 NOTICE: Movement is only available in Level 5 and Level 10 (the falling levels and the ones after them).

title: Scarlet Sorceress
logline: Find adventure and romance in an adorable fantasy world.
description:
Find love and adventure in the Kingdom of  Seraphine. Solve mysteries, go on quests and work to resolve a conflict between two factions. Go for romantic outings with your companions, and perhaps decide the one for you. 
 Inspired by otome visual novels, Scarlet Sorceress is a 370,000-word interactive novel, set with cuteness and charm in a fantasy romance world. Play as a sorceress, with the freedom to customize your name, specialization and appearance. 
 Blessed with the gift of magic, you are a sorceress, able to manipulate the power of fire. Sorcery is tightly controlled in the Kingdom of Seraphine, forcing spell casters to live under the watch of the Guardian Order, or live as outlaw mages. Living in the Eterna Forest, away from the city, with your pet cat, you soon find yourself tangled in a conflict between both factions. 
 Romance your childhood companion, your Guardian protector or one of two mysterious mages. 
 Play as a sorceress. Romance male or female characters. Choose from four romance interests, two male and two female, as well as another two minor romance interests. Customize your appearance with the magic mirror. Use different styles  to optimize your stats, or choose the Blessing of Inner Fire to customize your appearance without worrying about stats. Collect different jewelry sets, each with different impacts on the game. Play the game on standard mode for a traditional stat-management experience, or opt for story mode to play the game without having to worry about stats. In addition to the main storyline, enjoy two mystery-based sections and ten side adventures. 
 Stock images from Pixabay, PublicDomainPictures and Rawpixel were used to create the art in the game. I strive to keep AI generated images out of my work, but do let me know if you find anything AI generated. 
 The Choicescript Save Plugin is included in this release.

logline: What if the Wild Westâs most dangerous outlaw got isekaiâd into a generic worldânot even as the main hero?
description:
What if the most dangerous criminal in the entire Wild West ended up in the most typical isekai—and not even as the main character? 
 When the entire Wild West turned against El Diablo, he had no choice but to retreat. As a result of his perfectly calculated actions, El Diablo ends up in another world. But all he cares about is drinking the finest whiskey. However, as always, there will be those who try to come between a man and his true love (whiskey). But not this time, cowboy.
 
 
 ð Play as the worst pigeon in the entire Wild West!

 ð No choice, we've chosen everything for you! 
 
 ð And let's not forget about the most driving music in the wild west, from which even feathers stand on end (taken from free resources) 
 
 ð All games in the Pigeon West universe can be played in any order without fear of losing the storyâs meaning—because there is no story! (No, there actually is.)

title: Dungeon Dump
description:
Loot's not cheap in this economy, so the forces of evil have to be efficient when it comes to filling their dungeon's treasure chests. Luckily adventurers keep parting ways with their equipment after being lethally made to exit the dungeon. 
 It's up to you to repair the broken items by recombining the correct parts and sending them back up through the portal. Gather bonus points by delivering the requested item and make sure not to miss the deadline! Minions are cheap after all. 
 
 Move WASD Pick up items Hold Left Mouse Button Drag Items Mouse Jump Space

title: Cravebound: Dungeon Escape
logline: Suddenly you find yourself craving monster-steak...
description:
Made in 8 hours, for Trijam #313 
 Instructions/Controls 
 WASD / Arrow keys - Move character 
 Left click/Space bar - Swing sword, towards your mouse cursor 
 'M' key - (De)Activate dungeon map 
 Stand by the anvil in the centre to repair your minecart - when it is fully repaired, you can escape the dungeon! However, cravings for certain types of monster meat will distract you from your work, making you less effective. Hunt down the monsters specified at the top of the screen to increase your efficiency again! 
 Hurry to repair the minecart before the time runs out! 
 Development 
 My original idea was for an Overcooked style recipe craving system - where there would be multiple monsters required per 'craving', along with a time limit to fulfil it otherwise the player would lose health. 
 In the end due to lack of time/know-how, I settled on individual monsters for each craving, but that not fulfilling them reduced the players' effectivness to repair their minecart. 
 Overall a great theme and a fun jam to take part in! 
 Updates: 
 19/03/25 Post Trijam judging period:  
 - Added difficulty options 'Easy' and 'Hard' mode, with 'Hard' being the original game and 'Easy' having extended time and a weighted spawn system favouring easier to kill monsters. Additionally, in easy mode cyclops are reduced to 2 hitpoints. 
 - Fixed a bug where killing multiple monsters in the same frame sometimes didn't register as clearing more than 1 craving - Corrected shader compilation (was working for the blood effects, but not for the anvil sparks upon initial release) 
 - Added control text above regarding map functionality (I'm so embarrassed that I forgot to include mention of it in the first place) 
 Credits 
 Kenney ( kenney.nl ) - Tileset from the 'Tiny Dungeon' pack 
 Kevin Macleod  ( incompetech.com/wordpress ) - Background music 'Call to adventure'
 
 Pixabay - Sword swing, visor opening/closing and anvil sfx 
 Zapsplat - Monster hit sfx

 But youâre not alone. Ruthless scavengers and enemy factions roam the streets, ready to strike at any moment.

title: MahtaMinute
logline: Mind- bending card matching meets chess on a 16-card grid!
description:
Welcome to MAHTAMINUTE! 
         MahtaMinute is an introductory and practice tool to familiarize yourself with the mechanics of the coming-soon on-line version of a tabletop card game growing in popularity and known as MAHTA MAHTI! 
 
 HOW TO PLAY    
 The general game play is about strategic card matching atop an ever-changing  
 16-card grid. Upon card placement, all matching numbers calculate as points. 
 But be careful, all mismatches count against you.  
 Itâs not as easy as youâd think, even with Wilds! 
 MahtaMinute is all about the right card choice, in the right orientation and the 
 best board placement to maximize matches and minimize mismatches! 
          
 Itâs a mind-bender. Think twisted matching meets chess!

 A story based dating sim deckbuilder. 
 Go on blind dates with regular humans, play EVENT CARDS which impress  or dissuade your date, and earn LOVE POINTS to show your adoration.      
 Good luck finding the love of your (un)life! 
 
 Story 
 The zombie apocalypse has come and gone, and through pure luck you're still here, even if you're a little undead. And the dating scene is still as much of a gamble as it was before, BUT! You've been dead for so long the interest on your bank account has added some extra zeros to your balance, and your unique situation has attracted the attention of reality show producers. Maybe being TV's favourite sugar daddy will change your fortunes? 
 Controls 
 Use the MOUSE to navigate menus. LEFT CLICK to select options. 
 Gameplay 
 1. PLAN YOUR DATE 
 Spend your LOVE POINTS to build a deck of EVENT CARDS for your upcoming date! Event cards have effects that change your score. The more love points you spend, the stronger the effects of each card. Buy GIFTS to impress your date! Gifts immediately add a global multiplier to all love points earned on a date, but beware, this can also multiply negatives. 
 2. GO ON YOUR DATE 
 Your EVENT CARDS deck is shuffled and cards are played one at a time. FEELING LUCKY? The NEXT button plays another card. Cards are revealed and take effect after they are played. THINK YOU WON? The STOP button ends the date and saves your current love points. 
 3. HOW DID YOU DO? 
 Now that the date is over, see how many points you earned. You win when you reach a points threshold, and the game ends if you run out of love points. 
 4. GO ON ANOTHER DATE 
 Return to the planning screen! 
 Credits 
 
 Audio: bennie-david Art: ohitssla [Isla Medina] Game Design: anander, Chester Perez Luna, Gwen Delos Santos, nosodapls [Max Zang] Programming: Chester Perez Luna, nosodapls [Max Zang] Competing for Edmonton prize pool in the GamePop Game Jam.

title: Habi Heart: Fortunes & Family
description:
Habi Heart: Fortunes & Family  a visual novel from the multimedia project Habi Heart, created by four Filipino college students. Fortunes & Family features a story based on a queer Filipino's personal experiences. 
 
 STORY SUMMARY: 
 A closeted Filipino teenager tries to find a way to come out to their parents. Amid this dilemma, Kayâs mother invites them to a session with a manghuhula (fortune teller), with whom their family is acquainted.
 
 Seeing no harm in this mundane invitation, Kay accepts and joins their mother, unaware of their dilemma being realized in an unexpected way. 
 
 
 The visual novel is about 1 hour long, with four possible endings.

title: Mira's Escape
logline: Mira, an alien traveler, has crashed in an unknown city. Can she get 3 gears before his ship self-destructs in 24 hours?
description:
PROJECT BACKGROUND 
 This project is a game created as part of the âDevelop at Ubisoftâ training program at Ubisoft Annecy. The brief was to produce a game in 4 months on the theme of âLimited Resourcesâ with advices of an Ubisoft studio's employee. 
 
 PITCH 
 Mira, an extraterrestrial traveler exploring the universe, has crash-landed somewhere in an unknown steampunk city. While trying to buy a watermelon, she is accused of theft and imprisoned. She easily escapes and decides to search for the three gears needed to restart her spaceship, which were confiscated by the guards. However, she must be mindful of the passing time. The self-destruction mode of her spaceship has been set to activate in 24 hours, and it is her only way to return home.

logline: Play as a taxi driver as rush hour begins...
description: Step into the driverâs seat during the chaos of rush hour, ferrying strangers through the city as they make their way home. With every passenger that slides into your cab, you catch glimpses of their lives—small moments that hint at something much bigger. As their stories unfold, youâre hit with the realization that each person, no matter how fleeting their presence, carries a world just as intricate as your own. And in witnessing their journeys, you start to reflect on your own, that familiar yet fleeting feeling of sonder settling in once again.

title: [demo] Plant Evolution
logline: evolution simulator
description:
This evolution game (now it's a demo!) simulates plants growing using L-systems.  The plants compete with each other for sunlight.  If energy runs out, they will die and perish.  Offspring are generated around a plant once it reached certain age. 
 At the start of the simulation, random parameters are generated, ensuring that the plants are different each time.
  
 Many features are still in the planning or development stage. Feedback and suggestions are greatly appreciated to help improve the simulation.
 
 Controls: 
 F11  - toggle fullscreen Esc  - open option menu H  - toggle debug infos P  - pause simulation/start simulation WASD / Arrow keys  - walking around Space  - jump Click on a tree  - show the genome of the tree 
 current features: 
 pre-defined L-system structure parametric evolution in 10+ dimensions 
 if you are interested in this project and expecting more contents, you can support its development by donation or join  patreon page  for long-term support.

description:
A Narrative adventure based on the novel by Ms. Pingke Nefferttitti Dubignon "Merci of the Gods A Annunaki Trilogy Book 1 
 In a realm where myth and reality intertwine, our protagonist's life is upended with the death of her mother The esteemed World-famous archaeologist Dr. Estelle Lowe. Merci learns of her divine lineage and her place as the royal heir to an ancient alien race. As she navigates a world filled with celestial intrigue and earthly chaos, she must grapple with newfound responsibilities and powers she could have never imagined. With the fate of the Royal House hanging in the balance, Merci is thrust into a battle that will challenge her courage, loyalty and her identity. Will she embrace her heritage and fulfill her destiny or will the forces of evil unravel the very fabric of time itself.

title: El despertar del Pretzel
logline: RebeliÃ³n de un Pretzel que pretende arrebatar la vida dulce.
description:
Hola a todo el mundo! Estas en la pagina de: El despertar del Pretzel - Batalla Azucarada. Un juego creado por cuatro personas : Roger,  AdriÃ¡n, HÃ©ctor y Xenia.
Este juego es fruto de la Gamejam Mermelada 2025. Esperamos que os guste.
Â¡Y deja tu comentario!    
 El despertar del Pretzel es una juego arcade plataformas 3D que consiste en aguantar el mÃ¡ximo de tiempo sin morir, matando a los enemigos y recogiendo la puntuaciÃ³n que esta por el camino.  
  El tema de la game jam era: 
  
 
 
Y nuestro juego se basa en un ciclo, donde vas a repetir el mapa pero cada vez se pone mÃ¡s complicado. AsÃ­ que, depende de tus habilidades el poder avanzar y conseguir derrotar el mundo dulce... #TeamSalado.Controles 
 Controles: 
                
          
  Links de interÃ©s (por si a la prÃ³xima te animas tu) :   
  - Spain Game Devs :  https://spaingamedevs.itch.io  
 - Endorth :  https://endorth.itch.io  
 - Mermelada Jam :  https://itch.io/jam/mermelada-jam-4 
        
 Peerooo... Â¿QuiÃ©nes somos?   
 
  Somos un grupo de cuatro personas :   
  (Roger) Hey!  Soy el programador y game designer del juego.  
  AquÃ­ os dejo el link de otra gamejam en la que participe:  https://dxenius.itch.io/underwater  
  
 (AdriÃ¡n) Hola!  He modelado tanto personajes como props y me he encargado de crear las animaciones de los personajes!  
  Puedes encontrarme en:
Pagina Web:  https://adrianfelipp.wixsite.com/adrianfelip3d 
TikTok:  https://www.tiktok.com/@adrian3dforge?lang=es   
  (HÃ©ctor) Buenas! Entre todos buscamos la idea perfecta del juego y yo me encarguÃ© de modelar y texturizar en 3D.   
  (Xenia) Buenas! Soy 2D y 3D artist, aunque en realidad soy Pixel-Artist. En este juego he participado como 2D Artist, modeladora 3D,  animadora 2D y UI Artist. 
  AquÃ­ os dejo la participaciÃ³n de otra game jam:  https://dxenius.itch.io/underwater
 Y, porque no, mi pagina web:  https://xedurami.wixsite.com/misitio          
 CrÃ©ditos  
Juego hecho con Godot Engine/ Blender/ Procreate/ Krita/ Miro/ GitHub . 
Link de GitHub, si quieres descargarte nuestro proyecto: 
  https://github.com/Gerchis/MermeladaJam25 
      
 
 Feedback  
SiÃ©ntete libre de dejar tu feedback y hablarnos de tu experiencia en el juego.  
            
  
 " Recuerda... En un mundo dulce, la sal se convierte en la pesadilla de todos. "

title: Hellbreak
logline: All aboard the skullship - a one way ticket out of hell! (Hopefully)
description:
Developed for the PULS Gamejam by Elia Cakar, Michael Braun,  Moritz Naab and Fabian Schindler. 
 The Motto for the gamejam was "Kaputt" - the german word for broken. 
 Using Skel, a magical boneship, the player must traverse the river of the dead in order to break out of hell. The player steers the ship with the mouse and their character using the keyboard. If the player can't avoid various hazards, the ship will fall apart and Skel's energy can't be sustained anymore.  To avoid that, the player can repair broken tiles by standing nearby. 
 Skel can also attach new parts to the ship by collecting parts of other ships that float around in the river,  
 Gameplay   and Controls

description:
Your guns are made of scrap and won't last long, so use them wisely! 
 New guns will spawn every 20 seconds, but will only be available for a few seconds to pick up. 
 The more broken the guns are, the more damage they do.

 Space  - Dash
