title: Meowfunction
description:
Controls :  W/A/S/D - move, LMB - interact 
 
 Step into the paws of a broken cat in a world that feels out of sync. Wander through a cozy yet mysterious environment, where everything seems a little... off. The world glitches in unexpected ways, and itâs up to you to explore and uncover whatâs really going on. 
 - Short, atmospheric gameplay 
 - Solve peculiar puzzles to piece things back together 
 - Uncover the strange and unsettling nature of this glitchy reality 
 Can you make sense of this twisted reality, or is the glitch too deep to fix? Made for a  PULS game jam . Credits : @ cifoZ , @ anethical Assets used : https://pop-shop-packs.itch.io/ https://cupnooble.itch.io/ https://www.pngkey.com/download/u2q8q8w7y3t4u2q8_crack-pixel-art/ Sounds :

title: Broken Lights
logline: Jump & run game with a twist. Made for the PULS Game Jam
description:
Oh no!  The  lights  are  broken !  
 This puts a whole new twist on the classic platformer genre because you canât see anything in the level. Luckily, thereâs the occasional lightning strike—and you also have a few matches to briefly illuminate the scene. Just enough time to use your paint bucket to mark key spots and find your way. 
 The game  Broken Lights  is my interpretation of the " kaputt"  theme for the PULS Game Jam 2025. It was developed solo within 48 hours. The only third-party elements are the rain shader and the music by Ozzed. All other assets were created by  mago  during the Game Jam without the use of AI.
 
 Controls 
 Action Keys 
 
 Movement WASD 
 Jump Space 
 Use Matches F 
 Restart R 
 Paint Mouse1 
 
 Credits 
 Source code is released by NimbleBeasts under MIT:  https://github.com/NimbleBeasts/Broken-PulsGameJam25 
 Music: Ozzed  https://ozzed.net/   
 For complete license information please have a look at the LICENSE file.

title: Cell Control
logline: Dans un laboratoire, le joueur incarne un chercheur qui travaille sur les cellules souches.
description:
Attention : la version navigateur a des problÃ¨mes de graphismes ! PrÃ©fÃ©rez la version Windows :) 
 
 CONTEXTE DE LA CRÃATION DU JEU 
 
 Ce jeu vidÃ©o a Ã©tÃ© rÃ©alisÃ© lors de la Scientific Game Jam â Printemps 2025 (Ã©dition Lyon) du 14 au 16 mars 2024.
   
 Pour soutenir notre jeu au Coup de CÅur du Public 2025, vous pouvez voter pour Â« Cell Control Â» !  https://forms.gle/oVoBxXvjDXBxV8PY7 
  Lien vers les autres jeux de la jam :  https://itch.io/jam/scientific-game-jam-2025/entries 
 
   
 L'Ã©quipe se compose de :     
 NoÃ«lla GROSSI : Scientifique Titouan Vaillant : Game Designer
   AdjamÃ© Tellier-Rozen : Programmeuse
   Selenn Lamson : Programmeuse
   David Brunel : Artiste 3D
   Vincent BONNET : Artiste 3D
   Benjamin Quellec : Sound Designer
   
 
 BUT DU JEU 
 
 Dans un laboratoire, le joueur incarne un chercheur qui travaille sur les cellules souches. A partir dâun Ã©chantillon de sang dâun patient, il va fabriquer une cellule souche, la multiplier puis la transformer en cellules spÃ©cialisÃ©es. Le but du jeu est de maÃ®triser les diffÃ©rentes Ã©tapes du processus, tout en gÃ©rant des situations de stress, des erreurs de laboratoire et un temps limitÃ©. Chaque niveau reprÃ©sente un nouveau type de patient.    
   
 QUâEST-CE QUâUNE CELLULE SOUCHE ? 
 
 Elle est Ã  lâorigine de toutes les cellules qui composent notre corps. En raison de leur origine embryonnaire, ces cellules peuvent se dÃ©multiplier et se spÃ©cialiser pour former tous les tissus de notre organisme. La recherche dans ce domaine Ã©tant trÃ¨s encadrÃ©e, on est maintenant capable de fabriquer des cellules souches en laboratoire Ã  partir de cellules dÃ©jÃ  spÃ©cialisÃ©es, on les appelle les cellules souches pluripotentes induites (IPS).
   
   
 PROTOCOLE EXPERIMENTAL (Tuto) 
 
 Ouvrez les portes du laboratoire de cellules souches…   
 Votre premier patient vient dâarriver, il est atteint dâune maladie qui affecte les muscles. Pour mieux comprendre sa maladie, il faut pouvoir lâÃ©tudier en laboratoire. Câest lÃ  que les cellules souches entrent en jeu…   
 Voici son Ã©chantillon de sang. A toi de jouer pour transformer cet Ã©chantillon en une cellule souche.  
 
 DÃ©pose ton Ã©chantillon dans      la machine Yamanaka et verse les 4 gÃ¨nes nÃ©cessaires Ã  la transformation. 
 
       Explication scientifique : Â« Les 4 gÃ¨nes (OCT4, SOX2,   KLF4, c-MYC), connus sous le nom de facteurs de Yamanaka, du nom du chercheur   japonais qui a mis au point cette recette et obtenu un Prix Nobel en 2012   pour ces travaux, permettent de transformer une cellule spÃ©cialisÃ©e (diffÃ©renciÃ©e)   en cellule souche. Â»         
   FÃ©licitation tu as obtenu ta cellule souche !  
 
       Explication scientifique : Â« Ces cellules aux   propriÃ©tÃ©s Ã©tonnantes ont la capacitÃ© de se multiplier Ã  lâinfini et de se   transformer en nâimporte quel type de cellules spÃ©cialisÃ©es dans le   corps. Â»         
 Une cellule câest bien… mais il en faudrait des millions.  
 
 Pour      dÃ©multiplier ta cellule souche, place-lÃ  dans le duplicateur.
 
 STOP ! Tu en as largement assez ! Il va falloir maintenant transformer tes cellules souches en cellule spÃ©cialisÃ©es. 
 
 Ajoute      la sauce molÃ©culaire indiquÃ©e pour produire le bon progÃ©niteur.
 Faites      chauffer dans lâincubateur pendant le temps nÃ©cessaire. Il ne te reste      plus quâÃ  spÃ©cialiser ta cellule !
 Si      besoin ajoute une deuxiÃ¨me sauce et câest partie pour une deuxiÃ¨me CUISSON      ! 
 
 Note : Attention tes cellules sont fragiles et rÃ©sistent peux Ã  lâair libre. Utilise si besoin le congÃ©lateur pour conserver tes cellules.
   
 FÃ©licitation ! Tu as rÃ©ussi Ã  crÃ©er une cellule spÃ©cialisÃ©e. Tu vas pouvoir la livrer Ã  diffÃ©rents laboratoires. 
       Explication scientifique : En utilisant les cellules   souches issus de patients, les chercheurs sont dÃ©sormais capables de   reproduire les caractÃ©ristiques de la maladie en laboratoire !
    Utiliser des cellules souches permet aussi de tester   plusieurs mÃ©dicaments, avant de passer   chez l'animal, puis enfin chez l'Homme.     On pourrait imaginer dans le futur pouvoir combiner ces   diffÃ©rents types de cellules et fabriquer des mini organe !  
 
 
 THESE DE NOÃLLA
   
 Dans ma thÃ¨se, jâÃ©tudie une maladie qui affecte les muscles, jâutilise donc des cellules de patients, que lâon transforme en cellule souche pour les multiplier Ã  lâinfini et on les diffÃ©rencie en cellule musculaire pour Ã©tudier la maladie. 
   
  Plus dâinfo avec cette interview de NoÃ«lla pendant la Game Jam :  https://videos.pair2jeux.tube/w/vVUjfVvt3n6DTUtjrFm2QF

title: Vision Painter
logline: Vision Painter is a first person Unreal Engine Jump and Run game about colors and the loss of them.
description:
This game will destroy you -- just like it destroyed us while making it.   
 Use the colored abilities to progress and maybe even chase some of the the gray away yourself... but just what if that is all that you can see? 
 Feel free to share your frustrations and your highscores in the comments.  
 Ours: 4:30. Beat us. 
 Made for PULS Game Jam 2025 Made in Unreal Engine 4.23

title: Fazbear's Rusted Warehouse (Full Release!)
logline: old project : D
description:
Here you guys go : D 
 This game is based on a powerpoint i made in elementary school and have now adapted into a "full game" 
 I'm actually happy that this project is finished! 
 
 freddy - Close the window if he's there 
 Bonnie - close the door if he's there 
 chica - put on mask if she's in the office 
 foxy - press the snapshot button to move him back to his previous state if he's moved 
 
 Children Boiler - Press the laugh button to make them go back to their previous state if they've moved 
 Mimic - Press the shock button next to the vent in which the mimic appears in 
 Afton - Flash the light where he'd be on each side of the office 
 
 Stress - can be maintained by playing the radio in the first office and make sure it doesn't trip and turn off and in the attic, switch the music to the other one if it's been playing for too long 
 flashlight -if you used it too much, go to the music back computer and recharge it. 
 
 Have fun!

title: Pearl Plunder
logline: Pearls await, but so do the sharks---dare to take a dive? ð
description: Control the character by using directions W,A,S,D. Look around via mouse. Left Mouse button shoots an ink bullet (Holding mouse button down will let you shoot longer. , Right Mouse button sprays ink where you are with wider range and effect. Ink stuns sharks that are chasing you if you get too close.  Spacebar lets you dash around even faster and maybe get to places you normally could not. Those pesky blowfishes are hiding something... title: Rhyme God (The First Rhyme Training Game Ever)
logline: A rhyme training game for rappers trying to learn how to rhyme fast.
description:
Rhyme God: The first ever rhyme training game! 
 ð­ Dive into a world where words are your weapons and rhymes are your shield! ð¡ï¸
  
 Embark on an epic journey through the realms of language in  Rhyme God , where your quick wit and vocabulary are put to the ultimate test. Are you ready to become the Rhyme King?
  
 ð  Features: 
 
   ð® Two thrilling game modes: Classic and Story
  ð Battle quirky bosses from a Duck to the  Final Form Ultra Corrupt King ð§  Test your rhyming skills against the clock
  ð Watch your score soar as you chain rhymes together
  ð Climb the leaderboard and prove you're the ultimate wordsmith
  
 In Story Mode, face off against a cast of colorful characters, each with their own unique word challenges. Can you outsmart the Rapper's beats or tame the Wolf Man's howls?
  
 Classic Mode puts your skills to the test in a race against time. How many words can you rhyme before the clock runs out? With each victory, the challenge grows, but so does your mastery!
  
 Perfect for word lovers, puzzle enthusiasts, and anyone looking to sharpen their linguistic prowess. Rhyme God is more than just a game â it's a journey through the power and playfulness of language.
  
 ð Download now and let the rhyming revolution begin! Who knows? You might just become the next Rhyme King! ð

title: Guild Stampede
logline: is a game battle that can generate random Stats like(Atk dmg, crit, Element,  Effect and many more.) to build your Guild
description:
Game Info 
 Guild Stampede  - is a battle game that can use the 7 element to get your advantage or disadvantage during in battle. When the battle is begin the unit start attacking who is the closest range this targeting can be change depending on unit effect. The unit have a 5 type  Warrior, Cleric, Mage, Archer and Gunner   
 Gameplay 
 * Select 6 unit on your unit zone and play it to your field 
 * After you and enemy have 6 unit you can start the battle now 
 * When the battle begin you and enemy starting to decrease (LP) Life Points after the unit is defeated. The LP decrease is base on your unit original HP  
 * When the battle end and you and enemy still have LP you can select your unit again 
 * When the LP is reach to Zero the game is end. Whoever still have LP left is the winner

title: The Gambling Rooms
logline: A backrooms style game set in a rat-infested casino. Gamble with your remaining life/
description: Welcome to the casino! Time is money here, and when you run out, you're dead! There is no way out. Stop looking! Controls:  WASD / Left joystick = move Mouse / right joystick = look around Space / right bumper = action button / jump Content Guide (Spoilers, read after initial playthrough or if you get stuck) Lucky machines (red arrow) can be played if you jump on the seat and press jump to spin the slots again - there are two possible outcomes: you get fruit and money OR you get bombs and all rats will pathfind to your location for the next 10 seconds. There are 10 lucky machines in the casino and they change everytime you play slots. Coins can be picked up to increase money. Every 2 minutes or so a "jump scare will appear" Banner messages after the first 3 are random and happen every couple of minutes. Neither the banner messages nor jumpscares have bearing on gameplay Finally, the rats are saying "give me yo cheese" Credit: sounds from freesound, images from hippopng Made for the Gamepop 2025 game jam at the Edmonton site

title: Elefant im Porzellanladen
description:
Deutsch/German: 
 Ernest der Elefant, hat den ganzen Tag lang feines Porzellangeschirr eingekauft und dabei vÃ¶llig das ZeitgefÃ¼hl verloren. Er hat gerade bemerkt, dass der Porzellanladen in drei Minuten schlieÃt! Um nicht unhÃ¶flich zu sein oder den Feierabend des Ladenbesitzers zu stÃ¶ren, muss er sich beeilen, um noch vor Ladenschluss den Ausgang zu erreichen! 
 Steuere mit WASD  und bleib hÃ¶flich! 
 ------------------------------------------ 
 
 English:  
 Ernest the Elephant has been shopping for fine china all day long and has completely lost track of time. He has just realized that the china shop is closing in three minutes! In order to not be rude or disturb the store owner's evening, he must hurry to reach the exit before the store closes! 
 Control by pressing WASD and stay polite!

title: The Station
logline: Just a typical subway ride...
description:
After a long day, you take the subway home. The train is late, but everything seems normal—until the doors close. Among the passengers, one man starts acting strange... There's nowhere to run. 
 Features: 
 Average playtime: 5â10 minutes
 
 Four original endings
 
 PSX retro style
 
 Original story
 
 Streamer-YouTuber friendly: non-copyright sounds
 
 Completely translated to Portuguese, Spanish, Turkish and Polish! 
 Controls: 
 Movement: WASD
 
 Run: Shift
 
 Interact: E
 
 Next dialogue/Move objects: Left mouse button

title: Retropair
logline: Be a retro console repair shop owner!
description:
It's not all that glitter is gold Half the story has never been told                                 ~ Led Zeppelin 
 Ever dreamt of owning a cozy retro console repair shop in a sweet, buzzling smalltown? 
 In  Retropair  you play as a repair person without money troubles: you are known in the neighbourhood which is inhabited by many gamers, and it's not uncommon for them to fall for buying a retro console or finding a long-lost but much beloved device in their attic. 
 And of course, the wheel of time or wear hasn't stopped at the darlings. So every now and then someone comes to see you to get some part repaired. And while there, they of course tell your their entire life's story. Controls 
 This game can be played with mouse & keyboard only.
 Binding Action Left Mouse Button Grab/Release Device Right Mouse Button Grab/Release Part Mouse Scoll Wheel Switch Viewpoint Spacebar Advance Visitor Monolog 
 Gameplay Your job is to accept your customers' consoles, repair them and give them back. The repair process involves deconstructing the console, identifying broken parts with diagnosis tools and replacing them while building the console back together.
 
 Your central tool is the cursor, with which you can pick up, move and place consoles or console parts. Press the right mouse button to pick up a single part of a console, such as a power button, top hull or eject mechanism. Press the left mouse button to pick up the compound object, without detaching any part.
 
 Parts can only be placed into specific slots on a console, so take care you get a context UI hint when placing a part on a console! If the part doesnât slot in, it wonât be connected to the console.
 
For diagnosis and utility you have four devices at hand: a TV, the  RetroScope 3000Â® , the  Bottomless Pit  and the  Trash .
 RetroScope 3000Â® 
 The RetroScope 3000Â® can scan exactly one piece of hardware for functionality. It doesnât consider any parts attached to it, so in order to confirm that a system is fully functional, you will have to remove all parts and test them individually.
 
 Your trusty TV 
 The TV can confirm that a console is up and running. It canât test plastic parts or individual chips, only the mainboard and anything connected to it. Plugging a part to the TV can have one of these outcomes:
 
 Nothing happens. The part youâre testing doesnât contain a mainboard.
 Blue screen. The TV is on, but doesnât receive a video signal. Is the mainboard broken?
 Black screen. The TV received a black video signal. This most likely happens when the system works, but there isnât a game cartridge plugged into it.
 Light blue screen. The system is running! Hooray! Bottomless Pit 
 This is where broken parts go, never to be seen again.
 
 Trash 
 The trash is a nigh-infinite source of parts. They might be broken, they might have parts missing, but they might also work perfectly.
 Credits Team: Katharina "StumbleDuck" Broswik ( itch.io ) 3D Art, 2D Art Daniel "Faulo" Schulz ( itch.io ) Code, Tech Art, Game Design Gregor SÃ¶nnichsen ( itch.io ) Code, Writing, Environment Art, Game Design Third party: 
 XELU () Key Icons (CC0) MJType ( https://www.dafont.com/honey-salt.font ) Font: Honey Salt (Personal Use) Grant Morrison ( https://www.dafont.com/gsmfont.font ) Font: GSM Font (CC0) SilverIllusionist ( https://freesound.org/people/SilverIllusionist/ ) SFX: Password Fail (Attribution 4.0) Omiranda14 ( https://freesound.org/people/Omiranda14/ ) SFX: SFX_InventorySounds_QuickSound(Attribution 4.0) thisusernameis ( https://freesound.org/people/thisusernameis/ ) SFX: beep3 (CC0) SlotThailand ( https://freesound.org/people/SlotThailand/ ) SFX: select_pattern4.ogg (CC0) ScottyD0ES ( https://freesound.org/people/ScottyD0ES/ ) SFX: Tone12_Menu_Select (Attribution NonCommercial 4.0)

The Pinecrest chemlab exploded badly. Build shelter to survive the toxic mist!

 Now check out the surrounding buildings to see what they offer in resources. Tap and see. Select a resource for your drones to farm. Primarily this will have to be the material for your current task. But perhaps you have time to loot some more before the mist rolls in?

title: Random shop
logline: Buy and sell different items while uncovering misteries of a dark past
description:
WARNING: This game is currently under development, including its itch.io page. Characters, items, storyline, and features are subject to change in the final release. You may encounter bugs, glitches, typographical errors or missing translations. Any feedback is highly valued. No special requirements—try out  Random Shop  on any browser with mouse or touchscreen support. For the best experience, playing in full-screen mode is advised. Random Shop  doesn't include any in-game ads or purchases. 
 Please note: This game may contain flashing lights or patterns that could trigger reactions in individuals with photosensitivity. 
 Thank you so much for visiting this game! This is my first released game, and I'm excited to share it with you!   This game's demo is fruit of my everlasting passion for videogames. All sprites and story dialogues are made by me. Please enjoy, and feel free to share any feedback to improve the final release. 
 Overview 
 Welcome to Random Shop  , a unique shop management game where, as the shopkeeper, you'll have to buy, sell and combine different items to meet your customers' needs. 
 Managing the store won't be as easy as it looks, unreliable suppliers mean you'll often have to rely on luck to stock certain items while also managing limited inventory space. Customers won't care if you have abundance of one particular kind of item. 
 The game features an interactive tutorial, in-game tips, a range of gameplay personalization settings, support for two languages(English and Italian) and an exhaustive in-game guide filled with anything you could ever need to know. 
 Personalization 
 Customize  your workspace to reflect your style. Choose from different slot and door aesthetics to make your shop truly your own.   
 
 Image of available door styles as of 25/01/2025 
 More personalization options will be added in the full version! 
 Make your job easier with extra inventory slots or machinery to combine items, increasing exponentially their selling value. 
 Story 
 Your choices shape the world around you.   Certain customer requests will influence the storyline based on how you respond. Accepting or refusing a character's request might trigger different events, altering the narrative and impacting the game's world. So think twice about whom you side with—every decision carries weight. 
 Exploration 
 Many locations will be added later with development 
 Don't worry, you won't be stuck behind the counter. Step out and explore  the areas surrounding your shop at any time, and without even having to worry about thieves!  Exploring locations like the forgotten forest will enable you to unlock extra items, uncover clues about many characters' fates or influence the game's story by changing the very stakes at play.

Tombs In Time is a Short First-Person Horror Survival game made with unity. 
 Your only mission is to survive being locked in with a demon guarding the area, simply find the keys and open the corresponding locks to advance to the graveyard, where the demon is vulnerable... 
 And just like that with 2 lightning strikes you can escape the soul eating demon. 
 HAVE FUN AND SURVIVE!

title: Overtime
logline: Make sure to finish your reports before 5PM or else...
description:
You applied for RetSam Corporation and it's your first day on the job. Your manager gave you an easy task to finish before 5PM but you finished it too fast so he decided give you more work. The workload is too much for you and you have to stay for overtime so you decided to argue with your manager. 
 
 About the game 
 Overtime is a 2D typing  game that was made in 3 days for Indie Dev Game Jam #6.  The player must finish their tasks before 5PM or they will need to work overtime. You can argue with your manager regarding the unfairness of the overtime work.

title: Android XML Layout To JFrame

The Android XML 2 Java tool is a innovation tool that automates java android development. This program converts your android XML layout into JFrame. JFrame is a java based GUI. 
 Which should I choose? If you want to convert your android source code into JFrame, this is the right program. If you want the standard app that writes all java programs for you, after you finish your XML designs, then you should go to the Android Layout XML 2 Java page.  
 
 -Offline 
 -No Data Collection 
 -Unlimited Use 
 -Deluxe 
 -Convert Your Android XML Layout To JFrame

title: Bit.Breaker
logline: A fast paste shooter were you break the game with you hacker skills.
description:
----- ------------------------------------------Story------------------------------------------------- 
 Bit.Breaker 
 The game is rigged. The system is against you. So why play fair?
  
 As a rogue hacker, you dive into Bit.Breaker, an "unbeatable" security simulation—not to win, but to tear it apart. Every enemy, every obstacle, every rule is just bad code waiting to be rewritten. Hack the battlefield, turn the system against itself, and break the game piece by piece. Buff yourself, nerf them, and watch the simulation struggle to keep up.
  
 They built it to be unbreakable. Letâs prove them wrong. 
 ----- ----------------------------------------Controls---------------------------------------------- 
 WASD - Movement LMB - Shoot/Select Shift - Dash R - Reload E - Hackmodule LMB / Scroll wheel - Scrolling in the Hackmodule 
 ----- ----------------------------------------Disclaimer-------------------------------------------- We had some issues with the ending, Wave 13 was origninally our last wave for the game, so now from here thank you for playing we hope that you had a lot of fun and leave us a comment how you liked our game! We interpreted the theme as you being the hacker playing the game and you break the game (using the hacker module). This gives you an advantage and allows you to play in a way that the developers never intended. 
 
 ----- ------------------------------------------Credits----------------------------------------------- 
 Submitted to the Pulse-Gamejam 2025 with the theme "kaputt/broken" by:
 
 -MrMemo (Coding) 
 
 -Luco3003 (Pixelart) 
 
 ----- -----------------------------------------Used Assets-------------------------------------------- 
 
 https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/audio/music/electronic/the-8-bit-jukebox-lite-music-pack-70436 
 https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/audio/sound-fx/keyboards-and-typewriters-173188

logline: Don't get caught!
description:
OVERVIEW: 
 Remember the thrill of ringing doorbells and running? In this game, you and a friend take that childhood prank to a creepy hotel... but something is very wrong. 
 Nostalgic, spooky, and full of tension—this game will make you rethink those childhood pranks.

 Have a fun playthrough!!

This is a game about a little square who just wants to climb a mountain, but keep on getting interrupted by lava. Try to reach the top as fast as possible!

logline: Repair the equipment of your allies to fend off the goblin invaders as long as possible!
description:
Feldschmiede 
 In  Feldschmiede  (German for "field forge") you play a blacksmith and need to repair the equipment of the warriors who try to defend the incoming goblin invaders. The quality of your work decides how long the equipment can withstand in battle. 
 
 
 This game was created in 48 hours as a submission for the game  jam  "PULS GAME JAM" . The game was developed using Godot Engine and GDScript. All assets, besides sounds and music, were created by me during the  Jam. The sounds and music are third-party assets from several  paid bundles.

title: Foxrio: Playtest (PULS JAM 2025)
logline: Guide Foxrio through the broken realm of the Skylands, while listening to the two devs bickering in your discord call!
description:
Jammers, read before playing! 
 ADJUST THE VOLUMES BY ACCESSING THE PAUSE MENU!!! (via Escape, Tab, P, Menu (Controller)) 
 ------------------------------------------ 
 Intro 
 ------------------------------------------ 
 Welcome to the "playtest version" of  Foxrio , a "goofy" platformer created during a  the 48 hours PULS GAME JAM . Guide Foxrio through the broken realm of the Skylands, helping him to evade trouble and jump your way to the [Very important quest item]. (Almost*) everything was made in those 48 hours!! 
 This playtest version includes:
 
 2 semi-funny  devs to listen to while you are testing their latest game. 4 !unique levels  to explore.
 Fluid controls  for: well uh- platforming.
 A vibrant, handcrafted world,  void of any personality! :D 
 Weâd love your feedback to help us improve the game! Let us know what you think in the comments or via the feedback form.
 
 ------------------------------------------
 
 Controls 
 ------------------------------------------
 
 Walk: WASD
 
 Jump: Space
 
 Pause: Escape, Tab, P, Menu (Controller) 
 ------------------------------------------
 
 The Team 
 ------------------------------------------
 
 Stead (UK): Visual Art, Story, Level Design 
 Tidali (GER): Code, Audio Design, UI Design, Jam Page Design 
 ------------------------------------------ 
 Fun Facts 
 ------------------------------------------ 
 Foxrio is a play on Fox and Mario 
 Mechanics Tidali coded, that didn't make it in the final build: 
 Speeding up infinitely while walking Kicking a wall to boost yourself into the opposite direction (this was implemented and felt good, but the level designer chose to not use it smh). Basically anything that made his hard labour of making a working rigidbody2D worth, such as bouncy or slippery surfaces. 
 
 * Every asset, piece of code or sound was made by us after the start of the jam and we are EXCEPTIONALLY proud of that! (Sounds were made by hand (mouth) by Tidali! :D) 
 EXCEPT!:
 
 The background music ingame, that was made by Tidali for another project long before  the jam, the  ambient wind from pixabay  used for our Game Off 2024 Game  Ryans Drive  and the grass footsteps from  this Ocular Bundle .

title: Contrary Casino
logline: Gamble your Stats?
description:
Story: 
 You play as a police robot that must investigate a shady casino,  following a string of missing gamblers.  This casino, named the Contrary Casino, is one with a terrifying reputation. In the past, it was the talk of the town. But following a huge loss of the house's end, it was never the same. It was closed down temporarily, and that time is when the casino's owner snapped. They figured that gamblers valued life and money equally. And since "life" is being fed into the slot machines, they could come to life as well. Following the re-opening every gambler that lost from this casino was never heard of again; naturally, people stopped going out of fear. Investigations revealed nothing, so police and casinos citywide teamed up: Send the luckiest gambling police robot to the Contrary to beat the house for good this time. 
 Gameplay 
 Your wallet represents your health, so avoid running out of it. The enemies: 
 
 
 
 
 won't make it easy and will attack you to (ironically) prevent you from gambling, they will steal from your wallet if you get attacked, so be careful! Now how to get stronger? You can gamble on the green tables with the exclamation mark and can bet on various of your stats, be careful you could lose it all! Another way to get stronger is to beat the enemies and rewards from it, each enemy has a different minigame so the rewards will be based on your performance! 
 Get as strong as possible, and make it to the boss! 
 Controls: 
 WASD to Move Left Click to Attack (Has a long cooldown so be careful) Shift to Dash  (In Coin Minigame) Left Click to drag coins (In Dice Minigame) Left Click to swap, Right Click to lock 
 Credits: 
 coloredasterisk : Programming and Art 
 jukmifgguggh  : Music and SFX 
 CandyAndy77 : Writing and Inspiration  
 Only Premade Assets Used are the fonts:  https://www.1001fonts.com/karma-font.html 
 Made for the Game Pop! Game Jam at the U of C site 
 
 
 
 Note: Your attack range is pretty small, so figure out a way to attack them better
 
 "What do you mean you have a billion speed and can't move?"

 Currently only day 1 of Devoted Vampire is released. About  
 Rarely do residents go out at night because they fear for their lives. Police often leave this area alone due to its connections to unknown people of power. It is the perfect hunting ground for a vampire such as yourself.  
 However, after seeing blood in your apartment's hallway and a cop showing sudden interest in your turf you will need to put extra effort into finding your prey.

logline: Outrun your past. Avoid the void.
description:
aVoid  is a passion project I'm developing to learn and experiment with game programming and design. It's a simple yet challenging platformer with  six levels (for now) . 
 Your goal?  Reach the green portal to complete the level. But there's a catchâevery time you finish a run, your past movements are recorded, creating  a void  that you must  avoid  in your next attempt. With each repetition, the challenge grows as you carefully plan new paths to victory. 
 How many times can you avoid yourself? 
 
 ð§ In Development... 
 The first version ( v0.1.0.0 ) is still a work in progress and  does not include sound  yetâbut it's coming soon!

In  My Little Balcony Garden  kÃ¼mmerst du dich mit Werkzeugen wie GieÃkanne, Pinzette und Giftspray um die Pflanzen auf deinem Balkon, um sie vor dem Sterben zu bewahren.

        Have you always wanted to take care of broken balcony plants? If so, then this game is just the thing for you!
     
 
        In  My Little Balcony Garden , you take care of the plants on your balcony with tools such as a watering can, tweezers, and poison spray to save them from dying.

title: Re-
logline: Puzzle game using clones
description:
In this immersive 8-bit style game, you will have to solve puzzle to escape an old house. To achieve this, you will need to use your own ghosts to solve puzzles. Will you have enough coordination with yourself to escape ? Let's find out !  
 We hope you'll have fun playing this game. We putted a lot of effort creating this so you can enjoy it ! 
 
 Team 73. 
 
 If you need hints (spoiler) : 
 
  You have to hold interactions ("E") in multiple places to let you time to do things that the interactions unlocks. 
 
 
 
 
 More hints (spoiler) : 
For each problem, you have to hold one or two interactions to unlock something that another yourself can do.
Make sure you hold interactions long enough to give you time to explore the map to find what each problem unlocks what (items or modification of the map).
 
 
 
 
 Well... 
 
 
 Solution : 
First you have to get out of the first room by taking the keys in the drawer. Next you have to interact with both shelves at the same time in the library to unlock the office. In the office, you will find something to light up the fire by searching in the desk. Then, you light up the fire and take the keys to unlock the laundry room where you have to interact with the electrical cabinet and the laundry machine. you can then take the keys and go to the bottom bathroom where you have to interract with the toilet paper. That's the first part. You need to interact with the other toilet paper at the same time in the top left bathroom wich can be unlocked by interacting with the clock wich is just next to the bathroom door. When you finally interact with the two toilet papers, a grey key spawns next to the exit and you can leave !

title: ONE MINUTE LEFT
logline: A speedrun game made for the untitled game jam #107
description:
Made for the  untitled game jam #107 
 
 â WARNINGâ  this game has very loud sound, its better to not play with the headphones too louds  "WOOOOOOW THANKS SO MUCH A LOT I DIN'T KNOW ABOUT THAAAAT"  
 
 Story 
 the protagonist that you controlling is Michael, Michael is kinda messy to deliver because he almost crashes but one day, the boss says that he need to deliver a pizza to a kids pajama party but on the middle of the way, he crashes of a rock of a size of an atom and then he need to get money to fix his motorcycle and to split up with the boss, while on the walk, sometimes your boss talks to you that hes getting late, but you are so but sooooo busy that you can't even hear him somethimes 
 but there all the call quotes 
 1st call: "MICHAEL WHERE ARE YOU, YOU ARE IS TAKING TOO LONG" 
 2nd call: "MICHAEL IM NOT JOKING, WHERE THE HELL ARE YOU?" 
 3rd call: "oh gosh, i should not call from that pizza because is tAKING TOO LO-" 
 4th call: "MICHAEL, IF YOU DIN'T DELIVER THAT PIZZA I'M GONNA FIRE YOU, no seriously im GONNA FIRE YOU... litteraly!" 
 
 gameplay 
 
 the game starts with the timer running out, thats the title of this game  "AWWWW MAN REALLY??"  anyway, no matter that when you die or beated the game, it will still run and theres 15 (or 29 if you entered on the lap 2 portal) levels/rooms to pass so its very easy right.....RIIIIGHT????? well, there are some parts that you will slip and die... oh yea i almost forgot that when you die just wait to the timer run out and then when the timer run out, you can play it again with a technique 
 
 controls 
 
 Press A or D to control michael            Press W to jump                                              Press E to dash 
 and 
 Press R to reset 
 inspiration 
 most of things like the controls and the charather was based from Pizza Tower 
 and that death cutscene was like based from Garn47 
 Aaaaannnnd thats all folks, i hope you enjoy the game and bye!

title: Bobot
logline: Yikes you crashed try get yourself out of this mess
description: You are Bobot, the pilot of a one-man piloted vessel resembling an UFO.  You are accompanied by an advanced AI generously supplied by your mothership. Honestly, itâs not that useful, but it still wonât resist commenting on your every action  with an annoying, sarcastic undertone. Out of unfortunate circumstances,  you are flung out of your ship and crash on a medieval planet,  losing an arm and a leg in the process. title: Revive & Repeat
logline: Death is not in the cards.
description:
Revive & Repeat 
 My first game, inspired by  FORWARD: Escape the Fold  by Christophe Coyard. This is a  card-based roguelike RPG , where every decision brings you closer to victory—or defeat. 
 Features: 
 Tactical gameplay  â choose your path, combine artifacts, and adapt to new challenges. 
 Instructions: 
 
   When you level up, you receive 1 point for upgrades in the lobby.
  Every second level, a new ability becomes available for selection.
  An ability activates automatically when the required mana amount is reached. Enemies with a red outline attack first. If you encounter issues with progress or gameplay, you can perform a full reset in the game settings. 
 Two game modes: 
 
   Abyss  â an endless survival challenge.
  Quick Mode  â a story-driven adventure. Character progression  â collect artifacts, upgrade your abilities, and prepare for the final battle. 5 biomes filled with dangers and bosses  â can you clear them all in a single run? 
 Credits: 
 Card elements: Sebastiaan van Hijfte, Cainos 
 Can you survive the entire journey without failing? Test yourself in Revive & Repeat!

La jugabilidad evoluciona de 2D a 3D a medida que Tyler enfrenta sus miedos mÃ¡s profundos, culminando en un enfrentamiento con Blurryface, la manifestaciÃ³n de su ansiedad. Con un estilo visual surrealista y una ambientaciÃ³n sonora inspirada en la banda Twenty One Pilots, el juego busca generar empatÃ­a y conciencia sobre la salud mental.

Steve was born with the ability to transform into a block due to inheriting his great grandfatherâs DNA. He is the only one who can break through the capture gates that his great grandfather created. title: Cave of cards
logline: GamePop2025 submission page
description:
This is a game jam submission by a group of 3 people for the GamePop 2025 gamejam. The theme is Lets go Gambling! Which made me think of the treasure dungeons in FF14, so we decided to create a arena wave shooter where after you finish a wave a card mini game would appear where you would use the circle infront of the two cards to guess if the card on the left is lesser or greater than the card on the right, if your guess was correct it would give you an advantage for the next wave, if you failed, it would make the wave harder. 
 Controls: 
 Primary mouse: Fire 
 Movement: wasd, Space jump 
 Advance to next level: [2] Bunny hopping makes you go zooooooom. 
 Gambling mechanic is current not fully implemented, so advancing for further stages is bound to a button. If you think the card on the right is greater than the one on the left, you would go into the circle to change it to an up arrow. If you think the card on the right will be a lower, than select a down arrow. The card game will disappear 10 seconds after its finished. 
 Our group consisted of an architect, 2nd year software developer and 1st year game programmer. Everyone was quite new to using unity. 
 Since we had limited experience we used premade assests and focused on building something with those assests, we used assests from: 
 loafbrr MinesAndCaveSet on the unity store 
 Kenney - for the circle on the ground and used assest forge to create the cards 
 Kitkays skeleton pack on itch.io 
 Tallbeard - background sound 
 sfxr - sfx 
 JDSherbert - UI SFX pack 
 We are submitting for the edmonton prize pool.

Included this in my 3 random horror game video!Short but not bad at all for what this was! Definitely a challenge avoiding looking at the creatures while going up or down the stairs. Made a video on it.

A very dark, a bit relatable story with a fantastic execution - darkest game that you've ever done. The premise of the game seems so simple - walk down the stairs and collect your mail. Nothing seemed obvious once I left the apartment. The monster design is unique, a bit spooky, but the most haunting part for me might be the last sequence, before the character decides to "open the package". With that said, I think the only complaint that should be noted is the warning for people, who will play the game, because it deals with a specific topic that's not user friendly. Otherwise - peak horror. Best of luck with the future projects Daniel, can't wait to see more from you. This is your year mate!
thank you very much! I am glad you liked the game. I think you are right about warning, I should add it to the game's page
I really enjoyed this game the overall look is great and I can't wait for more.
yay the stairs are fixed!
I Feel Like Iâm being watched
nice
After checking the mail, I'm still unable to go back up the stairs. I relied on the watchers killing me to progress, but when it gets to the point that no one is there, im soft-locked
Perhaps there was a bug with wrong stairs collision. I just upload a version with some fixed bugs, it should work now fine
Really godd game keep up the good job, but you should fix the stairs
thank you!oh, you are right about the stairs, probably I didnt notice that

The game is good but the one problem i had is that when your walking the stairs, the text would show up, but you would keep walking and most likely run into an introvert (im assuming thats what they are), whether you were pressing any buttons or not until you clicked something. Just something i thought id write about.
yes, thank you. I have figured out this bug and I will upload a fixed version in a few hours :)

description:
----ESPAÃOL----
 
 Ay! Chancla! Es un videojuego donde el jugador personifica a un niÃ±o llamado Juanito, lleno de energÃ­a y curiosidad que tratarÃ¡ de escapar de MarÃ­a, su madre, luego de haberla desobedecido y cruzar la lÃ­nea de respeto hacia ella. En un acto de disciplina, MarÃ­a decide dar reprimenda a su hijo con su famosa chancla y, en un abrir y cerrar de ojos, Juanito se encuentra corriendo a toda velocidad por su vecindario, esquivando obstÃ¡culos y desesperado por evitar el golpe de la furiosa chancla. 
----ENGLISH----
 
 Ah! Chancla! is a video game where the player takes on the role of a young boy named Juanito, full of energy and curiosity, who tries to escape from his mother, MarÃ­a, after disobeying her and crossing the line of respect. In an act of discipline, MarÃ­a decides to reprimand her son with her famous flip-flop(Chancla), and in the blink of an eye, Juanito finds himself running at full speed through his neighborhood, dodging obstacles and desperately trying to avoid the blow of the furious flip-flop.

title: Capuchin Adventures
description:
Capuchin Adventures is an exciting fan-made game inspired by the popular mechanics of Gorilla Tag. Set in a vibrant world filled with unique challenges,  Capuchin Adventures  takes the iconic tag gameplay to a new level with fun, creative twists and an adventurous spirit. Players take on the role of agile capuchin monkeys, navigating through immersive environments using natural climbing, jumping, and swinging mechanics.
  
 With a focus on exploration and teamwork,  Capuchin Adventures  lets players engage in fast-paced tag matches, dodge tricky obstacles, and team up for epic multiplayer adventures. The game offers various themed maps and zones, from lush jungles to mysterious caves, each designed to test your speed, agility, and strategic thinking.
  
 Whether you're a competitive tag player or just looking for some casual fun with friends,  Capuchin Adventures  brings a fresh and exhilarating experience to the Gorilla Tag genre. Race to outmaneuver your friends, become the best at tag, and discover hidden secrets along the way. Get ready for endless hours of fun, challenges, and laughter in this playful capuchin-themed world!

title: Skyy Tribes 2
logline: A hack-n-slash  type side scroller with many territories to claim with your soldiers.
description:
Game Description 
 A fun hack n' Slash that follows and builds on Skyy Tribes. The second game of the series takes you on another mission to cut down the enemies of Moon at Midnight and claim all the territories nearby. 
 Expanding your claim of the land. Recruit new allies and improve the quality of life for your citizens, providing resources for them to build a better village. 
 Controls 
 Skyy Tribes 2 is played with the keyboard only. Use the directional keys to move around. Up and Down switch your current battle lane (1, 2 or 3). Press  Z  to attack and  X  to defend. 
 There are a few things you can interact with in the background, just move into the upper battle lane and Moon Chief will interact with them automatically. 
 Some World Lore 
 The Skyy Islands are where the inhabitants live. They are long juts of land that sit between clouds. The upper and lower levels of the islands are connected through tall, strong, main veins. 
 No one knows where the top or bottom levels are, but as far as anyone seems to know, the 'surface' is just a huge ocean. 
 Character Profile 
 
 
 
 
 Moon Chief This is a little about the Character. 
 
 
 
 Golden Skyy Spear This is a little about the spear. 
 
 
 
 Special Thanks 
 To all the consistent players 
 
 Play The Series 
 Skyy Tribes 1 [Itch] 
 Skyy Tribes 3 [In Development]

title: Tiny Gear, Giant Fear - reupload
description:
Tiny Gear, Giant Fear 
 BR Puls Game Jam Submission (Mar 2025), theme: "KAPUTT" (=kaput, broken, defective) 
 Note: Late submission due to file size upload issues... 
 Files to download  for anyone who wants to run it locally (WebGL doesn't like our pixel display shader)
     
  Our games repo, take a look ;) 
 
 You play a little robot that is falling apart and loses his abilities  with every hit. He is fleeing from a big robot that is trying to  destroy him! Beware of the trash piles in your way as well! With skill  and a bit of luck the bot can reach the recycling bins just in time before the crasher dismantles you into bite sized pieces...  
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Controls: 
 
 
 WASD-Movement 
 Q - Shockwave: Destroys trash in a small radius around the player 
 Shift - Bash/Dash: You become faster and destroy your surroundings... Until you lose your  shield, then you only become faster 
 
 This small game was created for the first "Puls GameJam" from  Bayrischer Rundfunk . Our first game jam.

title: Heavenly Meadows
logline: Visual novel
description:
Welcome to Heavenly Meadows! 
 
 This is a small project by  Wand of Pixels , a new startup from Peru. We are a group of friends from diverse backgrounds, learning about game development and creating experiences that leave a lasting impact on players.
  
 We began our journey in January 2025, and weâre excited to present our first project:  Heavenly Meadows .
  
 Set in a medieval, magical world on the continent of  Thyresa ,  Heavenly Meadows  is a prestigious academy where students refine their magical abilities. While renowned across the magical world, the academy harbors dark secrets within its walls.
  
 Our protagonist is a new student, abandoned by his parents and taken in by the academyâs headmistress. At first, he experiences a seemingly normal school life—until everything changes.
  
 Join  Alfina, Liefi, and Francis  as they embark on thrilling adventures in this enchanting world!
  
 This is just the first step in our journey, and weâd love to hear your feedback to improve our writing and development. Let us know what you think!
 
 Features 
 4 chapter game 2 stories and posible love interests 
 Multiple Endings! 1 bad ending 2 good endings You will have to find which one is our prefer ending!  
 Dark story. 
 
 
 Content Warnings 
 Death and sacrifice (mentioned) 
 Lets know the team! 
 
 Wand of Pixels!  A new group from Peru, ready to create games and learn new skills!
  
     Maru Ichiro:  Writer, founder, and visual novel enthusiast! Has played countless VNs! He also works on music and composes some songs.
     Menita_dev:  Programmer, composer, and soon-to-be mother and wife. She learned to code from scratch and is determined to build a career in IT after transitioning from social work.
     KingPotatoe:  Project manager, editor, and soon-to-be father and husband. He decided to follow his dream of creating a video game company. A psychologist by profession, he aims to develop a psychological game that feels like a safe space.
 
 Warning! 
 Because we didnt have enough budget, we had to use IA art for all the scenes and characters. We plan to hire and artist  based in our progress.  I hope you can understand. 
 
 SFX 
 Menita_dev 
 From Pixabay:  Musictown,  makesoundmusic, Lexin_Music, NoCopyrightSound633,Tim_Kulig_Free_Music, JuliusH, TurtleBeats, epic_musictracks,  Jeremusic70, VitMatNotes, trtasfiq, NeoMmusic, Universfield, Nesterouk.

title: A House, Alone (demo version)
logline: A haunting psychological horror where a house twists with grief, and reality warps with every step.
description:
Step into the eerie remains of a recently abandoned house, where solitude, loss, and fear manifest through the Five Stages of Grief. As you navigate a repeating room, reality begins to warp—each iteration distorting the space, unraveling its story piece by piece. Objects scattered throughout the house hold fragments of its past, waiting to be uncovered. 
 Designed as an immersive psychological experience, this game focuses on atmosphere and emotion, blending a lo-fi, VHS-inspired aesthetic with haunting audio to heighten tension and unease.
  
 Inspired by indie horror and suspense titles, we crafted this project with a passion for deep psychological immersion. Developed in Unity 3D, this game offers a short but intense journey into the unknown.
  
 ð¹ Psychological horror with a strong narrative  ð¹ Dynamic environment that changes with each iteration  ð¹ Lo-fi, degraded visuals inspired by VHS horror  ð¹ Immersive audio design to amplify fear and tension
  
 Can you face what lingers in the house… or will it consume you?
 
 
 DISCLAIMER:  This game was created as a   demo project by two students in 2019 for a Multimedia Computing class as part of the program for the Bachelor's in Multimedia Art and does not reflect a fully polished experience.

title: Ochre Heart
logline: Free your caverns from the infection that is running rampant in this metroidvania.
description:
Find the source of the infection to free the caverns from its grasp. But beware -- you may need its power to defeat the corrupted creatures that stand in your way. 
 -- 
 Save the caverns 
 Ever since the Ochre Sap appeared, things have been falling apart. The Custodians no longer keep their domains, corrupted into inaction or violence. 
 Only one Custodian remains unmarred. You. Make your way to the source of the infection and destroy it. 
 Explore the domains 
 Travel through the domains crumbling under the Ochre Sap, and discover ways to get stronger, whatever the cost. 
 -- 
 Notes: 
 Gamepad and keyboard supported; controls shown in-game The game saves your progress when you rest at statues; so if you softlock yourself somewhere we forgot to block off, you can quit and load in again (from the pause menu [Esc]) and it should respawn you at the last statue you rested at. There are 7 hearts to find, some more hidden than others. But you don't need all of them to beat the game; collect a handful for progressing, and the rest if you'd like to explore and discover. 
 Known issues: 
 For some people, releasing the analog stick on the gamepad while moving will flip the platypus in the other direction. If that's happening to you and it bothers you too much, there's a Windows build (named "(Deadzone)") that has a much larger deadzone, which seems to solve the problem. 
 Credits 
 Adam Wilson  - Music & SFX Cannice  - Art & Animation Lead (did the vast majority of the art in the environment) Jaco van Hemert  - Coding, Game design, Level design, Art & Animation (did some VFX and one or two level assets)

title: Kaputt Factory
logline: 1 vs 1 krushing competition on a crazy recycling factory !
description:
You're a lawful employee of the Kaputt Factory. Your job is to krush objects to meet the quotas. However, only one employee could become the Krusher of the Month ! 
 This could be you... or your working neighbour if you don't pay attention. 
 Krush the right objects, send the dangerous ones to your competitor and be the first to meet the quota !  You have to. You need to. 
 Welcome to Kaputt Factory ! 
 This game is a local 1v1 party game, playing on a single keyboard. 
 This game was made in the context of the PULS Game Jam, hosted by  https://bayerischer-rundfunk.itch.io/ 
 
 The theme of the jam was Kaputt. The game was developped in Unity, and here is the things we used to create the game faster : 
 - ChatGPT for code 
 - Claude AI for shaders  
 - Epic Toon FX pack 
 - Fake Point Lights URP 
 - Differents Sounds FX found on the internet 
 
 Members of the team : 
 Victor CHIOREAN : Game design, code 
 Philippe JOUSSE : Game design, code 
 Oscar CHENEVIER : Game design, code 
 Yoan AGOSTINI : Game design, Shader art, VFX art 
 Lucien DELMAS : Game design, 3D art,  musiic composer

SumÃ©rgete en un reino de fuego y desesperaciÃ³n. Un clÃ©rigo, atormentado por un pasado de amor y pÃ©rdida, se enfrenta a hordas de horrores infernales para salvar un pueblo consumido por la oscuridad. EmpuÃ±a la misma magia que desatÃ³ el caos, runas forjadas por el amor de una bruja por su hijo, ahora atrapado en el inframundo. Features:      - 3 Tipos de runas de ataque para combinar. 
      - 3 diferentes tipos de enemigos que se protegen para derrotar con las runas. 
      - Tematica inspirada en un mundo magico y oscuro, usando una mezcla de Harry  Potter con Lord of the Rings.

title: Block Combo Crunch
logline: Block puzzle game inspired by 2048
description: Block Combo Crunch is a free offline game thatâs perfect for passing the time and challenging your brain with fun block puzzle challenges. The goal is simple yet enjoyable: solve block puzzles by sliding and merging the same blocks to clear the board and achieve high scores. Mastering the art of strategic block placement will make the block puzzles even more satisfying. Whether youâre looking to relax or test your mind, Block Combo Crunch offers the perfect balance of fun and brainpower with blocks! With two exciting game modes—Classic Mode and Challenge Mode—Block Combo Crunch delivers hours of block puzzle action. This offline game enhances your logic and problem-solving skills while providing a satisfying, relaxing experience.

title: reforge
logline: Forg's tower was shattered and now he has to collect the broken parts to restore his home.
description:
It is a nice Summer day. Forg is brewing his mage jam. Suddenly his tower gets destroyed and breaks into multiple peaces. Now he has to start his dangerous journey to bring back these parts and restore his home. He has only his faithful magic wand who helps him to survive the dangers on his way. But the destruction also broke the wand. And so it is unpredictable what happens when he use his wand. 
 Enjoy playing and accompany Forg on his journey. 
 
 Full supported language is German. English and Polish are also available but the comic strips are German only. This game was created during the game jam event from Puls. All arts and music are self made except of the ambient sound "Ambience of a Forest Wind Birds Insects Less Presence". This one was taken from  https://www.zapsplat.com/music/ambience-of-a-forest-wind-birds-insects-less-pres... .

title: Project G.A.I.A
description:
This game was created for Puls Jam.
 
 Unfortunately, this is an older build, as the latest one just finished one minute after the jam deadline. Still, we'll be uploading the newest build as soon as possible. 
 You can download the latest build for windows here: https://mega.nz/file/aoglxJRS#xVEsLfhZmX8SRFJaSry6I1Q3PRQSbz0gtYvLYhNu8CQ 
 Controls: 
 WASD:  Walk E:  Interact (Pick up capsule and put in placement-points) Escape:  Pause Left Click:  You can Left click on the Map. Right Click:  (Hold) Inspect picked-up Item Q:  Throw Item 
 
 Core Gameplay Features: 
   Mix & Deploy Capsules:  Craft experimental weather-controlling capsules and carefully insert them into launch mechanisms. But handle with care—one wrong move and theyâll shatter.
  Live Disaster Management:  Monitor an advanced map system for real-time catastrophe updates. Input coordinates manually to launch countermeasures before itâs too late.
  Time-Sensitive Decisions:  Every 30 seconds, a new catastrophe emerges. If four remain active for too long… itâs game over.
  Fully Interactive Base:  Operate control panels, input data, press buttons, and pull levers. Every interaction has weight, every mistake has consequences.
  Dynamic Soundscape:  Every storm comes with an audio warning—alarms, radio broadcasts, and sirens will keep you on edge.
  A Dark Conspiracy:  Your job isn't just about stopping storms. Cryptic corporate posters, unsettling announcements, and a growing sense of paranoia will reveal a sinister truth.

title: Shattered
description:
Shattered 
 is a Bullet Hell Game that was developed for the ARD Game Jam. 
 The goal is to destroy the core that holds together reality. 
 By damaging the core the reality - and therefore the playing field - crumbles into pieces. 
 The core must be hit by charged shots. A shot loses its charge when leaving or entering reality.

title: Berti's Factory Escape
description:
BERTI'S FACTORY ESCAPE 
 Game made for the PULS Game Jam 2025, Topic "Kaputt" 
 Help the lion Berti escape from a factory overrun by a rogue AI, but be careful: the AI forces you to break one of the game's mechanics on every new escape attempt! 
 To escape the factory Berti must find the exit 3 times. 
 The AI might do whatever it can to give you hard time and mess with the texts. If you can't read something, you'll just have to guess! 
 Assets Credits are listed below as well as within the "asset-credits.txt" file. Non listed assets were created by members of the team. 
 Controller Support might not work, depening on the browser used.

 Um aus der Fabrik zu fliehen, muss Berti 3 Mal den Ausgang finden. 
 Die KI versucht dir mit allen Mitteln das Leben schwer zu machen und kann die Texte im Spiel stÃ¶ren. Wenn du etwas nicht lesen kannst, musst du einfach raten!

title: PUTKAT
logline: A fast-paced but also kinda cozy-feeling micro puzzle game, that you can literally finish in under a minute!
description:
Got a minute to spare? Then this game is perfect for you! 
 PUTKAT 
 This game was created during the very first  PULS Game Jam  in 2025 with the theme "Kaputt" which is German for "broken" or "tired"/"exhausted". 
 Thank you for checking out my game! 
 PUTKAT  is a fast-paced but also kinda cozy-feeling micro puzzle game, that you can literally finish in under a minute, and is about things that are and aren't "Kaputt".

title: An Educational Game about Pinecones
logline: A definitely-not-horror homage to early 2000s educational software. Seriously, this is definitely a normal game.
description:
Learn about pinecones. 
 Welcome to a 2000s era educational nature program about pinecones, narrated by a famous nature documentary narrator. Absolutely  nothing  strange going on here. 
 An homage to 1990s-2000s era educational video games, as well as Planet Earth/nature documentaries. David Attenborough is my hero. 
 
 Content Warning 
  Unsettling imagery and audio.
 
 
 Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·â¢  FEATURES  â¢Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â· 
 Learn about pinecones Enjoy 5+ interactive pinecone activities! Learn everything you could want to know about pinecones 
 Accessibility Feature:  Click on the checkbox to enable subtitles/closed captioning (no audio descriptions)! If it is enabled in the middle of a voiceline, it will wait for the next voiceline to show the subtitle. 
 
 
 
 
 Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·â¢  CREDITS  â¢Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â· 
 Kimya Taheri   - Game Concept/Design, Audio Design Ben Hecker  - Programming, Game Design Media: Background Music:  Drivin' from Animal Crossing A few sounds from Freesound.org with some mixing and editing. Images from old Windows XP image archives as well as nature websites for the pinecones. 
 
 Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·â¢  INFO  â¢Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â· 
 Engine:  Unity Date:  September 2024 Time to Make:  1 Day, plus another day later for creating a subtitle system Made For:  1 week rapid prototype project for a studio game class, NYU Game Design 
 
 
 Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·â¢  CONTENT NOTE  â¢Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â· 
 Important note:  this game uses a TTS software that recreated Sir David Attenborough's voice. I am strictly against genAI tools for image generation, as well as deepfake technology that ruin people's lives and livelihood. As an artist and occasional voice actress, I take deep offense to its use, especially for commercial, profit-generating purposes. Full disclosure: I marked this game as containing AI because of the tool I used for the voice narration. No other AI was used.  
 This assignment was originally made for a project for uni, and was supposed to pay homage to early 2000s educational games, as well as Planet Earth and similar nature documentaries I grew up watching on the BBC, hence why I felt it was necessary for the design of the game to include this voice. The professor also approved its usage since this is an experimental game. I was using it for light-hearted, comedic, non-commercial (you cannot donate to this page), and educational purposes. That being said: if anyone contacts me wanting to take it down for using the likeness of Attenborough, especially if its someone within his circle, I will take the game down out of respect. I'd like to think he'd find this funny, though! :) 
 
 Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·â¢  AUTHOR'S NOTE  â¢Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â· 
 Decided to pay homage to the super weird educational games I grew up on in school! 
 Our prompt involved pinecones so I did research into how pinecones work and what role they play in their treeâs life cycle. It was absolutely fascinating! In the end, I found a  lovely video produced by Headspace  that summarized the cycle neatly, and used it as the basis for my pinecone descriptions. 
 I wanted the game to feel simple, similar to how 1990s-2000s educational games felt. These games made up the bulk of my childhood, and while they were fun, they could often be absurd or condescending, with no consistency for difficulty. I wanted to capture that in this game so I wrote all of the voicelines for the narrator/teacher sound condescending and convoluted, even when you get the correct answer. I also made the game overly simplistic and used the background of a Windows XP desktop and the illusion of its UI to capture this old-school feel (I also used its startup and shut down sounds). I thought it would be funny (as this entire game is a bit of a joke) to have the game slowly turn into horror, with the sound effects, music, and narrative slowly devolving and becoming creepier over time.  
 Lastly, I wanted to pay homage to the nature documentary genre. I grew up on Sir David Attenborough documentaries on the BBC, and wanted to find a way to incorporate him. I was also inspired by the  âPokeEarthâ series on YouTube , where a VFX creator has taken to creating realistic documentaries of PokÃ©mon, and he originally began the series by using audio from David Attenboroughâs documentaries, with the occasional TTS voice to say PokÃ©mon and other specific words. I didnât have enough time to clip and splice pieces of voice clips from âThe Green Planetâ series he did several years ago, so instead I used a TTS voice based on his voice to capture the nature documentary feel.  
 
 Fun Tidbit:  Worked with Ben to create a system so I could add subtitles manually! Only realized once I presented my project to the class that none of the international students could understand what was being said, and a handful of native English speakers couldn't understand it either because they weren't used to the British dialect, haha!!  
 
 Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·â¢  KNOWN BUGS  â¢Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â·Â· 
 made in a few days so anything is possible, lol

title: Ricky The Runner
logline: Endless Side Scroller Prototype!
description: This game is currently in prototype stages being created by university students for a mobile game development project!  Please leave any comments that will help improve on our game, anything is appreciated!  Please fill out this quick google form to give us crucial feedback!  https://forms.gle/C88Qz9PkVKbK4Wm1A COMPATIBILITY This game can be played on windows and android devices WHAT IS IT Ricky The Runner is a side scroller game which took inspiration from other games such as Super Mario Run, Dinosaur Game, Jetpack Joyride...  As the player it is your goal to gain as many coins as possible without falling off of the screen. HOW TO PLAY (Mobile) Jump = Tap Screen Double Jump = Tap Screen again after Jumping once HOW TO PLAY (Windows) Jump = Left Mouse Button Double Jump = Left Mouse Button again after jumping once FUTURE PLANS In future we are focusing on implementing rogue-like elements into the overall gameplay, improving on replay ability and encouraging unique runs!

title: Perfection
logline: Find the imperfections in the pattern
description:
Repair the patterns to restore Perfection! 
 A satisfying little puzzle-like game where you need to figure out which part of a given structure makes it imperfect - makes it "Kaputt" in a way. 
 The game should be intuitive, you don't have to read this. But if you're struggling: Click on the part of the structure that seems inconsistent, misaligned or unfitting. You can also just click on parts randomly if you're stuck - there is no penalty. If you want to know all the keyboard controls from the get-go, press  Esc ,  Q  or  E  to open a menu containing the level selection as well as a list of all the keyboard controls. 
 The game was developed in 48 hours as part of the  PULS Game Jam  2025 with the theme "Kaputt". 
 I used Unity and the following additional assets/tools: 
 DOTween (HOTween v2) by Demigiant Feel by More Mountains GUI - Mono Round by Layer Lab Modern UI SFX - sound pack by Cyberleaf Studio Odin Inspector and Serializer by Sirenix Pro Sound Collection by Gamemaster Audio Universal Sound FX by Imphenzia vFavorites 2 by kubacho lab 
 I also briefly used Inkscape.

title: Whiskerium
logline: point-and-click space scifi mystery
description:
Introduction 
 Embark on a point-and-click adventure to unravel the mystery onboard! 
 You are a cat on a futuristic spaceship in the distant future. All humans onboard have disappeared, but how and why? This demo features the first scene of the mystery. 
 How to Play 
 Point and click on different objects in the scene to see how they interact. Your goal is to help the cat escape the cryo chamber! 
 The game currently comes with the first level. I recommend using a desktop to play. Stuck?  Click on "hint" in the top-right. This hint is specific to your current step in the puzzle. After the game jam is over and judging has concluded, I plan to add more levels! 
 Acknowledgements 
 
 Music by: Shaydow (License code: EU5I6QQ...3MSA)
 All the art is hand-drawn and animated by me! Most importantly, this includes the isometric cryo chamber that you see in the game. The sound effects are either created by me using various objects or are modified versions of sounds from freesound.org

title: JANITORS Demo
logline: Step into the shoes of Bazza, the galaxy's top cleaner, in this fast-paced FPS roguelite.
description:
Suit up as Bazza, the most elite cleaner the galaxy has ever known. When robot infestations threaten humanity, world governments don't call the army—they call  The Janitors.  
 Dive into the chaos of this sci-fi FPS roguelite, blending the intensity of bullet hell with the thrill of first-person combat. Blast through endless waves of mechanical nightmares, dodge their deadly projectiles, and turn their mess into your masterpiece.  
 Key Features:  
 Bullet Hell, Reimagined:  Experience the frenetic, split-second dodging of arcade classics in a fully immersive FPS format. Endless Mayhem:  Each run is a fresh challenge of mayhem in a chaotic fight for the high score.  Upgrade Your Arsenal:  Collect resources mid-battle to unlock powerful upgrades, devastating new weapons, and special perks to suit your playstyle.  Mechanical Chaos, Human Precision:  Hone your reflexes and aim in order to survive ever expanding waves of enemies.  Roguelite Progression:  Die, learn, repeat. Bring your newfound knowledge and tools to the next run and aim to clean deeper than ever before. 
 Are you ready to mop up the galaxyâs filthiest secrets and leave a pristine battlefield in your wake? Itâs time to grab your mop (and your gun) and join  The Janitors ! 
 Alpha release demo for the upcoming Janitors: Horde Survival game.

title: Crystal Catch
description:
ð£ Crystal Catch â Puls Game Jam 2025 
 Step onto the frozen lake, where serene beauty meets thrilling challenge. In  Crystal Catch , you have  10  minutes  to catch as many fish as you can — without breaking through the ice!
  
 The gentle glow of the  Northern Lights  dances faintly in the sky, adding a touch of magic to your icy adventure. Stay calm, cast your line, and carefully balance your movements. Every successful catch inches you closer to a high score, but every wrong move could send you plunging into the freezing depths. Crystal Catch  was developed as part of the  Puls Game Jam 2025.  Built within a limited timeframe, this charming ice-fishing adventure invites you to test your skills and patience on thin ice. 
 ð®  Controls â How to Play Crystal Catch: 
   Move:  Use  W, A, S, D  to carefully walk across the ice. Watch your step — the surface is fragile!
  Fish:  Press the  Spacebar  to cast your line. Hold it to reel in fish, then release to catch them.
  Store Your Catch:  Once you've caught a fish, walk close to the  Storage Crate  to automatically place your fish inside.
  
 ð¡  Tip:  Keep moving and balancing your steps to avoid falling through the ice!
 
 Will you master the ice and prove yourself as the ultimate angler? Or will the crystal-clear waters claim another victim.

description:

Plusieurs Ã©vÃ¨nements dans l'univers sont susceptibles d'Ã©mettre des perturbations dans le continuum d'espace-temps. title: The WinForms of Isaac
logline: The Binding of Isaac Boss Fight fan-made recreation in WinForms
description:
The WinForms of Isaac is a fan-made recreation of a 'The Binding of Isaac' Boss Fight, but using WinForms. 
 The game only consists in the fight with a well-known Boss using part of Isaac's classic arsenal. 
 ð ï¸ Setup 
 Just download the binary file from the here or from my  GitHub Page  and play! 
 ð® Project Usage Explanation 
 There is an in-game controls aid, which pops up a window with all the game's controls by pressing the  C  key. 
 These are the controls: 
 
 W,A,S,D: Move the Character. 
 Arrows: Move the Attack. 
 E: Place bombs. 
 Space: Accept/Skip. 
 Escape: Exit. 
 
 ð About the Project 
 This is one of the projects I made while studying for my Programming degree. It involved creating an object that bounces off the screen's edges and changes its direction accordingly. 
 This project is merely a school prototype and does not attempt (nor succeed) in replicating the original game's gameplay, visuals, or audio quality. Its purpose is solely to demonstrate that a fairly simple game can be created using technology not specifically designed for gaming, such as WinForms. 
 
 All the sprites of the game are made from scratch, based on the original game's textures. 
 You can  buy the original game  to support their great work! 
 
 ð Releases 
 There are no real plans to enhance this project to make it closer to the original material, but some updates may come in the future. You can also visit my GitHub as this project was published as a Open Source with a  Apache 2.0 Licence , so anyone can use the code in it. 
 If you find any non-intended functionality, error or enhancement, please report it to the  Issues Page  in the GitHub page.

title: Break Point
logline: Game Jam
description:
I made this game for the official  Puls Game Jam 2025  with the theme:
 "Kaputt"  
 Instructions:  
 
 Select a starting Weapon then battle against the strongest swordsmen. Each element is strong, weak, and resistant against other elements. Refer to the chart to understand the RPS system!  
 The  Hammer symbol  represents how many times you can swing that weapon, once it hits zero, it is gone forever! The  Sword symbol  represents your power, AKA how much damage you deal. 
 You can hold a maximum of 3 weapons, 2 in your inventory and 1 equipped. You will  NOT  receive rewards if your inventory is maxed out.  
 Oh and BTW, if you run out of weapons mid fight,  GAME OVER! All weapon  Names ,  Element Typing ,  Durability  and  Power  are  randomly generated .  Same goes for the Enemy list.  
 How it plays into the theme:  
 My game fits the theme of  "Kaputt"  because the weapons have a durability that cannot be repaired. Once the weapon runs out of durability, it is permanently destroyed. 
 A special thank you to Zel Zahid

title: Barrel Run Outside Edition
logline: Run through the land which has dangers lerking ahead.
description:
ABOUT 
 A college project to learn how to make games in JavaScript engine. This game is inspired by Donkey Kong with its gameplay where you jump over barrels. A sequal to the  Barrel Run  but with a few twist! Smaller barrels, random maps, more details and even more! No map is the same! Always something new, there is around 1,353,366,092,800 combinations!!!
 
 It is infinite gameplay until you eventually lose. Every new level it gets harder as more barrels spawn.
The barrels have a chance to spawn at a random interval. The game ends when the player's health is 0. You have shields to help you survive as long as possible, you regain shields after you lose a heart. I added a video of my video essay. It is very cringe and it sounds like I'm dead, I am not. 
 INSTRUCTIONS 
 Click PLAY in Main Menu! 
 Head to the right side and enjoy the views!
 BE CAREFUL WITH BARRELS OR TRAPS OR HOLES IN THE GROUND!
 Don't lose!
 How many levels can you reach??? 
 MOVEMENT UP ARROW  - To jump
 LEFT ARROW  - Move left
 RIGHT ARROW  - Move right FUTURE There is no plans in fixing bugs or developing this idea any further. There some major issues which can be fixed by relaunching or some that you have to accept.  There was fixes to make this work on itch*** 
 CREDITS 
 Player Sprites 
 Tiles & Decorations 
 Sounds: Ouch 
 Jump 
 Fail/Death 
 Success 
 Pickup 
 Barrel Breaking 
 Ambience 
 Barrel Rolling 
 
 Images: Tent Shield

description:
Grompula is waved based shooter where the goal is to survive as long as possible. There is also a story level with a series of secret objectives inspired by Call of Duty: Zombies style easter-eggs, which culminates in a boss fight. 
 
 Features 
 20 Weapons 
 9 Abilities 
 6 Trinkets 
 2 Arcade maps 1 Story map (episode) 
 
 This is the first game I released back in 2018 on Steam, and am uploading it here just for some additional visibility. I made it over the course of a summer while initially learning game development. It was a great experience, and it was epecially cool seeing people I didn't know uploading YouTube videos of it. 
 
 Here is  the Steam version  if you prefer that. 
 
 Here is a link to a  walkthrough for "The Lab" map  that someone posted on the game's Steam community page!

title: Crying to Elliott Smith Simulator
logline: 2:45 AM is emotionally devastating.
description:
Do you guys know Elliott Smith? You should. 
 
 Elliott Smith is an American singer-songwriter, Oscar nominee for best original song and the person I could have been in a past life. If you ever watched Goodwill Hunting and wondered what that beautifully sad song that kept on playing was, you've got Elliott Smith to thank for that (and the song is called Miss Misery). 
 This game is a tongue and cheek 'simulator' representing how it feels like to listen to his seminal album, 'Either/Or', or at least how it felt to me. 
 
 Hope you enjoy, and hope that this will get at least one person to listen to Elliott Smith.

title: The Early Bird
logline: Wack-A-Mole with worms and birds. Wack-A-Worm.
description:
Preface/Disclaimer  
 This was a mini project made for a local Makerfaire. This is uploaded mainly for archival reasons, but those interested are welcome to play themselves. I don't plan to continue with this project, but expect more fleshed-out games in the future! 
 About 
 You play as a Robin trying to eat as many Worms as  possible within a time limit. There are 3 different types of Worms  you'll come across. See how high you can get your score within  45 seconds ! ( Think you can beat my score of 57?) 
 Worm Types 
 Normal 
 A  Normal  Worm is as titled, the basic Worm type. They are the most common Worm, being worth 1 Point when eaten. 
 Sick 
 A  Sick  Worm looks similar to a  Normal   Worm, except being lower to the ground with a green hue. These are not  as common, but they will stay in their Hole for longer, compared to  a  Normal  Worm. If eaten, you will  lose  2 points, so avoid them if you spot them!
  
 Velvet 
 A  Velvet  Worm is a very unique-looking Worm with a dark velvet (basically blue) color. These are on the rarer side and are worth 3 points compared to 1. However, Velvet Worms are much  faster than a  Normal  Worm! If you see one, it's likely already retreating back into its Hole. Catch them when you can!
  
 Note: Your sound isn't broken, there just is none. Sorry.
