title: Discussion Culture
description:
This is a game about how discussion culture sometimes seems to work in today's political climate. 30 individuals meet to discuss their views, and it is your task to guide them. But be careful! The steady stream of news influences how people feel, and if any of them feel neglected or upset, consequences might be... not what you expect. At all costs you must avoid that the overall opinion becomes too divided, or the world could break apart. 
 Controls: 
 WASD  to move. 
 SPACE  to interact with people. Interacting works as follows: interact with one person to select them. Interact with a second person to make them talk with each other. 
 
 Bugs:  As submission are locked for now, we currently can not fix any bugs. We will still point them out here, so you may have a better idea of what is going on. 
 A small fraction of characters may be invisible on spawn. On some browsers, the game will crash when a Game Over is triggered. Since the game is over at that point anyway, there is not much impact of this. However, you would have seen a short sequence of the world breaking apart. Later news messages may be bugged as they start coming in faster and faster. This is a purely visual bug. As you may notice, the game name shown in the bottom right is different from the intended one. Apologies for this, one of our team members thought it would be funny at the time... 
 
 Credits: 
 Lucas: Programming, Design Marcel: Programming Nico: Additional Help 
 Assets used (from the Unity Asset Store): 
 Synty City Synty City People FEEL Epic Toon FX SOAP Total Music Collection Ultimate SFX Bundle Mega Animations Pack 
 AI used: 
 ChatGPT and GitHub Copilot for Coding ChatGPT for generating the News Texts .  We wanted the news articles to be satirical while showcasing the perspective of both sides, hence we used AI as a neutral instance. 
 Additional disclaimer: 
 The game is a satirical take on how politics may sometimes turn out in today's social climate. Rather than offending anyone with this showcase, the game's intention is to encourage questioning this view. Any references or similarities to real events are purely coincidental. We support individuals of all backgrounds, ethnicities and ages, encouraging them to embrace the gift of democracy and engage in friendly discussion.

title: Ursid
logline: Watch the stars, solve puzzle, follow a story about father and son.
description:
Ursid  is a zen puzzle game inspired by the constellations and the beauty of their imaginary pictures.
 
 In the role of the little boy Aster, players will  freely explore  the star sky,  connect  the stars,  find out  the hidden images, and gradually reveal an emotional  father-son story  while counting down to the moment  the Ursid Shower  appears.
 
 
 
 Features: 
 A total of 40+ handcrafted detailed levels.
 Non-linear level solving progression. Players can freely choose the levels they want to solve, which follows the main story.
 
 
 
 Familiar connecting dots mechanics, which is refreshed by adding the challenge of hint numbers. Sometimes to find out a constellation needs a little bit of imagination!
 Cozy and meditative atmosphere with a heartwarming story about father-son relationship.

title: DR Shogi
logline: Simple shogi board that can be useful for game practice.
description:
This is a personal side project that I started in the hopes of learning game development. 
 It is a Shogi board game that can be used to play, or to reproduce matches. By default, all moves are validated, so you cannot do any illegal move. This feature can be disabled in the game options (press the escape key). 
 Source code is available here:  https://gitlab.com/lowpolyfire/dr-shogi

title: An Arm and a Leg
description:
This game is an entry for the ARD Puls Game Jam 2025 with the theme being "Kaputt" (=broken). 
 In An Arm and a Leg, you play as Robo who had an unfortunate accident and lost all of it's limbs! Help him find them and unlock new abilities with each arm and leg you find. 
 Controls: 
 W and D to move 
 Space to Jump 
 E to use abilities 
 1 to equip a leg 
 2 to equip an arm 
 Disclaimer: 
 We were having massive time-related issues and could neither finish the game nor polish the existing mechanics. If the UI is not displayed you have to try out the buttons until you find the right one. Normally the player character would display how many limbs he got and how many unequipped limbs are available. The sprites for that exist but did not make it into the final game. The leg mechanics haven't found a way into the game as well but can be used to exploit this test level and probably get you stuck somewhere. 
 Credits: 
 Programming: TheMetalStorm, sqli, Linda Rogner, Lena Born 
 Art: Linda Rogner, Lena Born  
 Sounds and music from  https://freesound.org/  (CC0)

description:

title: Corpse Grinder
logline: Grind to survive
description:
Game Jam Project for the Mermelada Jam 2025
 
 In this twin-stick shooter, you would need to kill zombies to keep getting ammo to survive. We got the idea based on the theme of a never-ending cycle of killing, grinding, and getting ammo based on the jam theme and its modifier: Cyclic. There is never Enough, as you will always struggle to get ammo to survive.
 
 
 
 Controls with gamepad
 
 Left Joystick -> Movement
 Right Joystick -> Camera
 Right Trigger -> Shoot
 X on Xbox gamepad or equivalent -> Reload
 Left Trigger next to a corpse -> Grab
 Pause -> Pause Menu
 A on Xbox gamepad or equivalent -> Accept menu option
 
 Controls with mouse and keyboard
 
 AWSD -> Movement
 Mouse+RightClick -> Camera
 Mouse Left Click -> Shoot
 R -> Reload
 F -> Grab
 Esc -> Pause Menu
 
 CREDITS:
 
 Sound:  Cosa Custode 
 Game Design:  Anxo  &  Miguel 
 Animations:  Vanesa Vega Models:  Adrian 
 Third Party Assets Used:

title: Tashi goes to exile
description:
Tashi goes to exile is a one screen high score game. The wizard Tashi has been exiled from his home country because he mixed the chillie (ema) in the soap.  
 Now all the people of his land are having lots of itches. He has been given a magical bubble blowing dart pipe be a friendly deity so he can repair his mistake.  
 He has come to the magical land of Bhutan where he has to collect the tasting powder to remove the negative effects of the ema. But the tasting powder is being guarded by Mara the evil spirit in the land.  
 Can Tashi collect enough powder and redeem himself?

title: Split Survivor

description:
In Split Survivor, you play as a Slime that must survive against hordes of monsters. 
 Beware of your health, when it goes 50% or below, you will split in half! Each of the split halves have their own  weapons, so you gain a damage boost but they have half of the base HP. 
 Each divided part can also be divided in two under the same conditions as above. 
 When a slime already divided 2 times, it will dissolve when his health goes down to 0. 
 Try to survive as long as you can!

title: Tilted Tennis
logline: A competitive paddle and ball game, with a twist!
description:
Welcome to Tilted Tennis, a competitive paddle ball game where the camera moves and spins with the ball! 
 Disorient Your Friends 
 Play with or against your friends, spin the ball as you hit it towards their goal to try and catch them off guard and win the match. But if you want to defend your goal be prepared to get disoriented yourself keeping track of which way is up. 
 A Variety of Maps to Choose From 
 We have many styles of maps available for play, from air hockey to volleyball style, featuring different configurations for 1-4 players and beyond, including team based maps and solo practice maps. 
 Custom Map Support 
 If you can't find what you're looking for, you can build your own map too! Our built-in map editor will let your make the custom map of your dreams. Not the creative type? That's okay! You can download maps from other users. We have a map sharing channel in our  Discord . Please note that this version of the game on itch.io does not include a Steam key, and therefore does not integrate with the Steam Workshop. 
 Online and Local Play 
 Play with your friends locally! Play with your friends over the internet! Play with some friends locally, and others over the internet! Our flexible lobby system will allow you to play the way you want. Including LAN and UPnP lobbies for cross-platform play. 
 Rollback Netcode 
 Utilizing rollback technology, in Tilted Tennis you'll get a near seamless online play experience. Neither you nor your friends will experience input latency while your connection is stable. 
 Version Differences 
 The itch.io version of Tilted Tennis is cheaper than the Steam version and does NOT include a Steam key. The price difference is to account for the 30% revenue share that Steam takes, but also means this version lacks any Steam specific features, such as friend invites, public lobbies, and Workshop integration. But this version should be able to join friend lobbies hosted from the Steam version, and vice versa, utilizing UPnP. If you are interested in getting a Steam Key bundled with a  DRM-free copy, you can do so via our website:  https://kittensaresoftware.gitlab.io/tiltedtennis/ 
 As a DRM free release, it's possible to share the included file with your friends for online multiplayer. You have our permission to do this (not like you needed it, such is the nature of DRM free) but just be considerate and don't overshare. If you are planning on doing this, we would appreciate it if you would pay extra to account for the extra copies. Recommended: $16  - if you intend to share with 1 friend $28  - if you intend to share with 3 friends

title: Lock in
logline: Crawl your way out or create some distance from all the unnecessary medias of today and lock in to achieve your goal!
description:
Main objective: 
 Obviously it's to have fun but if you want to win the game, you must  collect shattered 'lock in' pieces ! 
 Controls: 
 "WASD/Arrow keys/LeftShiftKey" for movement, "ESC" to pause the game, and mouse to aim if you have auto-aim off. 
 Additional information: 
 Books can provide buffs! Enemies have a variety of annoying tricks ensure that you won't win the game, all of them will damage you if you are near them. Smartphone - It will chase you twice its moving speed. Tablet - Has a wider detection range. Laptop - It will shoot projectiles that have different effects! Pause - All of your movement will be turned off for half a second. End - Instantly kills you. Shift - Teleports you in a random location. Monitor - Inflicts confusion to the player for half a second, confusion will cause the player to move towards the nearest enemy and won't let you attack. Be wary of corrupted floors, it will reduce your movement speed when you're on top of them. You can modify the auto-aim feature when you press 'ESC' while in-game. 
 Technical Details: 
 If you want to ensure that the whole game covers your screen, you could press 'F11' first before you launch the game. 
 Credits: 
 BGM by:  nene 
 SFX by:  Kenney 
 Fonts:  Brackeys 
 Code, Design, Art:   Local Hermit 
 Special Thanks: 
 To my family, friends, and the wonderful game dev community. 
 
 Have fun playing  Lock in , let's strive to achieve our goals together!

title: El Juego Del Gambometer
logline: Escape the scrap yard... By gambling.
description:
GAME ONLY WORKS IN FULL SCREEN!! 
 Click up to 3 cards to select them. After selecting cards, click the "End turn" to roll the die. Even numbers result in positive outcomes, odd numbers result in negative outcomes. 
 The health bar and shield bar on the left are yours, the right are your opponent's. The meter on the right is your  GAMBOMETER,  which increases for positive dice rolls and decreases for negative dice rolls. When it is full, your next attack is multiplied by 10x! Note, this can also mean you take 10x damage, so gamble wisely! :) 
 Submitted to GamePop 2025 for the  Edmonton Prize Pool . Created by Lucia Hernandez-Echevarria, TheKamiOfH, Gerard van Genderen, and Jonathan Fjeld 
 Unfortunately, the game is not FULLY functional, but we have submitted our prototype nonetheless to show our progress! 
 Check back some day, we might have something. :) 
 STORY: 
 You are a degenerate gambler, you are thrown into a robot scrapyard by robot loan sharks. You've gambled away everything and only your miserable life as a scrap worker remains… 
 But by chance you find a robot with a Gambometer, a unique device that allows you to deal damage using playing cards and dice. 
 You must use your new found powers to beat your scrapyard overlords and achieve the freedom… to go back to the casino. CREDITS: Mix and Jam's tutorial video for creating a "Balatro Feel":

title: Natural Shenanigans
logline: Natural Shenanigans
description:
Welcome to Natural Shenanigans 
 
 Game Overview : 
 
 Here and this game, you have pathways to different experiences in life.The paths you choose are multichoice, and depending on your answers, you can either live a lovely, happy , wealthy life. Or you can die in many ways
 
 There are about 3 secret pathways and they can either lead  you to  your death or you will find yourself in a great scenario that you might enjoy!
 
 The whole purpose of this game is to have an entertaining but interesting  way of living life through certain decisions you make.  GO OUT THERE AND DISCOVER THOSE SHENAIiGAN!!! 
 
 Game Title :  Natural Shenanigans
 
 Genre:  Comedy , Adventure , Multichoice Decision
 
 Platform  : Pc
 
 Target Audience  : People who like comedy and simple choice games
 
 Important Characters  : Yourself
 
 N/A Gods / Religions or Cultures 
 
 N/A  Factions 
 
 The story is simple. You start with nothing but the choice of Car or Boat. Once you make your decision youâre taken to different pathways of life and the basis to this game is to not die and find the best life for wealth and pleasure. Goodluck , Have fun

title: My Little Magic With You
logline: A visual novel with a warm, storybook-like atmosphere.
description:
ð Important Notice: This game is only available in Japanese. 
  This visual novel is written entirely in Japanese and does not include English translations. Please keep this in mind before downloading.
  
 We appreciate your interest! If you are studying Japanese or enjoy playing Japanese-language games, we hope you have a great time! ð
 
 
 âMy Little Magic With Youâ is a heartwarming visual novel with a gentle, storybook-style aesthetic. Featuring hand-drawn illustrations full of warmth and charm, this game takes players on a cozy, magical journey.
 
 ð Story Summary 
 The protagonist,  Ruruka , is a young witch apprentice witch living alone in the forest.
 
 
 One day, she encounters  Seina , a star child who has fallen to Earth.
 
 
 As they begin living together, their days are filled with warmth and happiness… but something is about to change.
 
 
 ð About the Game 
 A linear, choice-free story  that can be completed in  30 to 60 minutes .
 Free to download , but available in a  Pay What You Want  format.
 Immerse yourself in a  soft and whimsical world , brought to life with delicate, hand-drawn artwork.
 
 Step into a world of small magic and quiet wonders. Hope you enjoy this gentle tale!

title: Nemesis
description:
A game made during the 5th edition of the GameJam "UpsiJam" which has the theme "Split". 
 Blu wants to escape.  But wherever she goes, she is followed… or rather, her nemesis, a double that mimics her every move with a slight delay.
  
 In this game,  every decision matters . Reach the end of each level before your reflection catches up to you, and use the environment to your advantage:  
 Wall-jump Activate switches to open doors Navigate moving platforms 
 
 But hurry…  your  Nemesis  wonât wait . One wrong move, and it all starts over.
  
 Can you escape your own reflection?

title: BasketBaluba
logline: Pixel rockin' basket(-ish)ball!
description:
BASKETBALUBA 
 Another one-button game from the masterminds behind "Europixel Song Contest". Did we say one-button? We meant two-button, as in this multiplayer game you now get ONE BUTTON EACH for no extra price. Well, actually it's all free anyway, so.... But anyway... 
 FIGHT FOR A TRIP TO SPACE AND THE HONOR OF WEARING THE GOLDEN HEADBAND 
 All you have to do is find a friend, family member, heck, even grandma can play this with a smile on her face. Just make her hit either the A or L button and you're off. Also, remember - it's only a game and actual physical contact while playing should be avoided. Remember, even if it might not look like it, grandmas can hit hard! 
 --- 
 CREDITS
 
 This game was made by PixelBerntsen (programming, graphics, sound) and Response (music). We are old school and appreciate big pixels and blip blop sounds.

title: Sokoban in the Ruins 2nd
logline: This game is a classic puzzle game (Sokoban)
description:
This game is a classic puzzle game (Sokoban). 
 I made it with Godot 3.6.0 
 I hope you enjoy it. 
 â  How to play 
 Move  Press Arrow keys or click directional buttons 
 Reset Press R key or click icon 
 Redo  Press Z key or click icon 
 Undo  Press X key or click icon 
 Next  Press Enter or click the icon 
 Quit  Press Q or click the icon 
 â Game Introduction 
 Norrea history 458 years. During the reign of King Lucius, the world was said to be in turmoil and a state of national disaster. Unlike his predecessor, King Albus, the wise emperor, King Lucius was mediocre, but good enough as a peacetime king. However, when the world became chaotic, he was unable to make appropriate decisions and stopped listening to anyone's opinions. Frustrated by this, the Witch of the North divides the seven regions of the country of Norrea (Fadra, Izur, Tiral, Nanion, Oolong, Auris, and Nords) with a barrier in order to urge King Lucius to step down. It is said that Princess Flora was sealed in the Norse temple. \nOnly a wise man who can unravel the difficult questions posed in her ruins can break the barrier and save Princess Flora. Era was waiting for the appearance of a wise man. 
 â Notice 
 Please carry the stone statue to the designated stone slab. The rules are as follows. 
 ã»Masonry can be pushed but cannot be pulled. 
 ã»Only one stone structure can be pushed at a time. 
 ã»Carry all the stonework to the stone slab. 
 ã»There are 36 puzzles in total. 
 â Features of this game 
 - You can play at any level. 
 - You can reset, undo and redo. 
 - Use the tutorial mode to find the route. 
 - Beware of pitfalls. 
 - Supports 10 languages. 
 â  About in-game materials 
 We use materials from the following people: 
 Sample Project

title: Fish & Chips
logline: Something fishy's going on at this card table...
description:
Created for the Canada GamePop 2025 jam. Submitted for Edmonton prize pool. Fish & Chips is a game about getting the most points possible. You and four opponents have three turns to accumulate a valuable hand of playing cards, by either drawing and discarding a card, passing your turn, or trading your card with another player. Multiple cards of the same rank will multiply their scores! 
 The game is controlled with the mouse. Press a button to choose an action. To trade with other players, hit the trade button, then select one of your cards, the one of your opponents', and then click on their face to finalize the trade. 
 To discard and draw a card, select one of your cards, then click the draw button. 
 Special Thanks: 
 CardEase Jazz Music by MFCC

 Made for Trijam in about 3 hours, excluding playtest time. 
 Share what you got in the comments below! 
 Try to find all the endings, there are 4!

 -250-280 points 
 -280-300 points 
 - less than 250 points

title: Slashvival
logline: Slashvival is a third-person action RPG with roguelite elements.
description:
Slashvival is a third-person action RPG with roguelite elements. Use swords to fight mutant creatures in a medieval low-poly world. Survive intense battles and rescue your family in this thrilling hack-and-slash adventure! 
 
 
 About Slashvival 
 Slashvival offers an intense survival experience in a medieval fantasy world where every day brings a new challenge. Face procedurally generated enemies, unpredictable climates, and scarce resources as you fight to protect your family.
 
 
 Key Features 
 Engage in epic battles against powerful bosses, upgrade your character's abilities, and discover new strategies with each playthrough. With a blend of rogue-lite mechanics and hack-and-slash combat, Slashvival provides endless replayability and excitement in a low-poly environment. Survive the night, and face whatever the next day brings.

title: Kaputt
description:
Back in french, at medieval era, people used to play a card game named Kaputt, the rules are simple: 
 - Each player have a full deck of 52 cards. 
 - 3 cards are drawn each round. 
 - The players can chose if they want to trade 1, 2 or no cards (click on the cards to select/unselect). 
 - At the end of the round all 3 cards in player's hand will be discarted. 
 - The objetive is to score more points then your opponet (or reach 10 points first) 
 - Points distribution: 
 Sequence with same suit = 5 points 
 3 of kind = 4 points 
 Sequence (without suit) = 2 points 
 3 cards of the same suit = 1 point 
 ------------------------------------------------------------------------- 
 
 Sequences with A work from both sides Ex: A 2 3 or Q K A. 
 The code was all made with inputs to Copilot AI. 
 The word Kaputt comes from french "etrÃª capot" which means something like "without tricks in a card game", so I decided to use this reference to create this card game that consumes your cards after each round until you whole deck extingushes (Kaputt). The idea was to have an animation for your cards to be pulverized each round, which would reinforce this idea, but due to some mistakes I made at the beginning some stuffs end up not being added. Have fun :)

title: Broken Brain - Web
logline: "Broken Brain" is a surreal and emotional exploration game.
description:
Controls 
 WASD  - Move F  - Collect Memory Mouse  - Camera Shift  - Sprint 
 Disclaimer 
 I had to translate the whole game in the last hour from C# to GD Script since Godot 4 didn't allow for Web export.... the web version, even though running local, is missing the fog, the FMOD audio, and the camera controls. 
 Description 
 "Broken Brain" is a surreal and emotional exploration game created as an entry for the Puls Game Jam. It delves into themes of repressed emotions, trauma, and the complex process of healing. 
 Players take on the role of a character navigating the labyrinth of their own mind, represented by a haunting, visceral landscape of blood-like veins. As they journey deeper, they collect fragmented memories—each one a piece of a forgotten past. These memories awaken buried emotions, forcing the character to confront the pain theyâve long avoided. 
 Used Software 
 Engine:  Godot 4.3 Art:  Crocotile3D, Blender, Aseprite, Pixel Composer Audio:  FMOD Studio, Ableton Live 11, Splice

title: Ice Enough?
logline: Drop ice in the cup!
description:
Made in roughly 18 hours for minijam 180, I was a bit irresponsible with the friday/saturday time, then was off my game with the sunday/monday time as a result. Good lesson to learn! 
 The general idea was a game where you drop ice in a cup to fill it up to the correct amount via displacement, and try to drop the ice in the correct location so the cup doesn't overflow. Overflowing isnt implemented so you're really just dropping ice-cubes in a cup! They fuze together when in the liquid and they're of equal size.  
 You drop the ice cubes into the cup via mouse click.

title: Mirror Exorcist
logline: Bullet hell but you need to use mirrors to damage enemies
description:
The game was created for the 9th edition of WSEIcraft and placed 8th out of 24.  We had about 18 hours to develop the game. The theme was  "Reflection." 
 
 Mirror Exorcist  is a bullet hell game where, instead of directly shooting at enemies, you reflect an energy beam off mirrors to deal damage.
  
 The goal of the game is to achieve the highest possible score, which is recorded on the leaderboard. 
 The game may be buggy on weaker PCs , but we might release a patched version soon! :)

title: Beyond
logline: Can you bear the burden of what lies beyond?
description:
Awaken by the sounds of terror, you find uncomprehensible sights on your ship. Uncover the mystery of what happened to your crew, venture into the unknown. Will you be able bear the burden of what lies 
 
 Beyond 
 
 Controls 
 A/D - Move 
 Hold Left shift - Move Slowly 
 E - Interact 
 R - Restart after death 
 
 Jam 
 Made in 5 days for  ð¦ð¦ Chili Code Jam #2 
 Theme - Space science fiction 
 
 Team 
 Programming + Art : SeeOne 
 Music + SFX : Razorflip https://razorflip.itch.io/ 
 
 Resources  
 
 Some SFX were taken and heavily reworked from here 
 https://www.zapsplat.com/ 
 
 Note 
 Windows version has better graphics, controls and runs smoother.  
 
 [SPOLIERS] 
 Help 
 Please do not read if you want to play the game yourself, this is a help section; 
 Your goal is to finish quests while avoiding the monster, the monster hears your footsteps, so you should only move slowly when you are in the same room as him. Quest 1 - Go to the upper bridge room and turn back instantly. Quest 2 - Go to the escape pod. Quest 3 - Find 3 gearboxes : Crew quarters, Landing deck and engine bay. Quest 4 - Go in the escape pod and turn on its alarm using the console. Quest 5 - Go in Lower bridge and interact with the big console.

title: Crabs & Cocktails
logline: A yaoi love story between a himbo lifeguard and a handsome, southern bartender.
description:
Special Note from the Meant to Bee Studios Team! 
 We will not be taking donations for our games, but if you feel so inclined please consider donating to the Maui Strong Fund in relation to the wildfires in Hawaii. 
 
 Resources/Info: 
 
 https://www.kitv.com/news/lahaina/how-to-help-those-impacted-by-the-maui-fires/a... 
 
 Fund: 
 https://www.hawaiicommunityfoundation.org/maui-strong 
 
 Makai and Rhett have two things in common, they both work at Cloudville beach, Makai as a lifeguard and Rhett as a bartender.  
 They also slept together. 
 
 Makai and Rhett both want to see each other again, and as luck would have it they are able to.  
 As they both have to work together to plan Cloudville Beachâs annual Luau, with the help of their two best friends: Lola and Sunny.
 
 Will this be the hottest summer yet? Or will it go down in flames?  
 
 30K words (7 Chapters + Epilogue) 
 SFW Romance (but plenty of mentions/jokes about sex) Split POV of our 2 leads Rhett and Makai!  This is a kinetic novel so no choices or branching paths. 4 Gorgeous CGs!
 Original artwork throughout made by real people!
 Original soundtrack!
 Partial voice acting!

title: Aporia in the Dark
logline: Escape room puzzle game
description:
Aporia in the Dark is an escape puzzle game, heavily inspired by the we were here series and escape simulator. goal is simple, just solve the puzzles to escape. there are 5 puzzles in total, played in any order as the player wants.  
 Estimated clear time: 1 - 2 hours 
 Art assets used: 
 
 Low poly Dungeon Pack by Synty studios (seriously their assets are op as fuck)
 
 Music used:
 
 Hollow Knight OST - White Palace
 
 
 notes: 
 my largest solo project yet, it was made as part of my final year project. obviously a ton of work, super proud that the game could come alive. 
 cant not mention its predecessor norohana which paved the way for aporia in the dark. key technical differences are the increased use of 3D clues and puzzles as opposed to norohana which used 4 combination locks on a 2D canvas. 
 mega thanks to the playtesters who had to suffer through earlier versions of the game

title: Letter Lemmings
description:
Letter lemmings are like lemmings, but they love to eat letters! 
 Made for  Mini Jam 150: Refresh 
 Type a word and press play, lemmings will spawn in, each designated a letter. They will drill matching letters. Your goal is to get the lemmings into the portal at the bottom of the screen! 
 You don't have to write real words (unless I add it in) but please do try to think up real words that work! 
 The levels haven't been made with any solutions in mind, I would have liked to come up with better level designs! 
 Credits: 
 alphabet sounds -  https://freesound.org/people/dersuperanton/sounds/434731/

title: Voidcrawl
logline: Avoid the traps to get to the exit! Time is ticking!
description:
Voidcrawl 
 The first thing you're able to see is a switch. You flip it. You start to hear a clock ticking. You should hurry! 
 Avoid the traps to get to the exit and see the light of day again. Only the cunning will find their pathways to freedom. 
 
 Fullscreen is strongly recommended. Press F or click on the fullscreen button on the bottom right corner of the game window. 
 Enabling audio is strongly recommended. 
 KB Controls: 
 Movement: WASD or Arrow Keys. E and Q to strafe 
 Flip Switches: Click on them when you're close. Or press Space 
 `M` to toggle mute 
 Controller Controls  (Xbox controller as example): 
 D-pad to move. `RB` and `LB` to strafe.  
 `A` to flip switches 
 Made by Lucy and AttentiveColon. We made all the visual and audio assets, except for the sound effects.

Society is broken - can your art fix it?  Spray graffiti with hopeful messages to change your city - but donât get caught by the cop bots.
 
 A creepy billionaire has taken over your city and flooded all public spaces with advertisement doubling down on bullshit & hate. Imagine a different future in your graffiti art and bring joy and understanding back to society. That is - if you donât get caught.

title: Battle of Destruction
logline: A Pulse Game Jam 2025 Game
description:
Bot-Survival-Arena  is a fast-paced  top-down pixel game  where survival and high scores are key. Control a tank,  collect items , and fight enemy bots to earn points. Bots can also grab items, leading to unpredictable battles where you  destroy each otherâs equipment and weapons . 
 But the battlefield is full of dangers— deadly lasers sweep across the map , eliminating everything in their path.  Strategic item use, quick reflexes, and smart tactics  are essential to survive.
 
 
 
 Can you withstand the chaos and claim the highest score? 
 Controlls:
 
 WASD to move
 
 SPACE to boost 
 Left /right Mouse Button to shoot

title: Spelunky Classic HD
logline: Modification of Spelunky Classic
description:
Spelunky is a cave exploration / treasure-hunting game inspired by classic platform games and roguelikes, where the goal is to grab as much treasure from the cave as possible. Every time you play the caveâs layout will be different. Use your wits, your reflexes, and the items available to you to survive and go ever deeper! Perhaps at the end you may find what youâre looking for… Donât be afraid to die! But also donât be afraid to live! Happy Spelunky-ing!
 
 
 !NB The HTML5 version, which you can play in a browser (and on macOS), is significantly different from the downloadable version and more buggy.
 
 
 About this version 
 This is a modified version of  Derek Yu's  game  Spelunky Classic . Based on the source code published in  Humble Weekly Bundle: Play and Create with GameMaker  (not original 1.1 release). 
 New features: 
 
 
 builds for different operating systems 
 different aspect ratios (originally 4:3) 
 touch input 
 support for translations 
 proper in-game menu 
 better gamepad support 
 
 
 If playing in a browser: 
 
 
 The PWA version  that can be installed for offline use (e.g., on Chrome OS) is  here . 
 To open/close the menu without breaking fullscreen, use 'Tab' instead of 'Esc' 
 
 Contributors : 
 
 nkrapivin  - bugfixes and improvements to gamepad support
 
 grheavy  - Spanish translation
 
 SpenÄjo  - Esperanto translation
 
 Gabriel Albuquerque Ferreira  - Brazilian Portuguese translation
 
 
 bakustarver  - Ukrainian translation
 
 
 LeRetardatN  - French translation
 
 
 
 Source code and more builds on  Github 
 If anyone is interested, you can translate the game into your language.

title: Data Stories to disrupt and delight
logline: Learn to make your own data story!
description: "Data Stories to disrupt and delight" is Part Two of the Data Story  To Disrupt and Delight: Teaching Archaeology Through Narrative . These open educational resources guide you through developing your own data story or other data-driven teaching through narrative product and are available for use in classrooms or self study. This work is the result of the  Data Literacy Program  of the Alexandria Archive Institute / Open Context. You may submit an open peer review of this and the other parts of  To Disrupt and Delight: Teaching Archaeology Through Narrative   here .

title: Super Donuts
logline: Roll through 8 worlds and over 50 stages!
description:
Super Donuts 
 ð© Roll around and rescue  the stolen Baby Donuts across 8 worlds and over 50 stages! ð© 
 
 Note - For the time being, I've removed PC downloads of the game. Various errors were occurring and I can't find an easy fix. Once I've figured out the root cause I'll re-exort them. For now, please enjoy the browser version! Thank you for your patience, and enjoy the game! :) 
 
 Controls 
 Move: Left / Right (A / D)
 
 Enter Level: Space (W / Up / Enter)
 
 Jump (in bonus levels): Space (Up)
 
 Reset Level: R
 
 Pause: Esc (Shift) 
 
 Gameplay 
 
 Super Donuts is a momentum and physics based 2D platformer without a jump button, mixed with the exploration and challenges of classic 3D Collectathons!  
 Each level has a set of baby donuts to find, collect them all to open the exit. 
 There's also three extra extra challenges per level: 
 Find the hidden Secret Sweet Collect all 100 sweets Beat RetroBreak's Time Trials 
 Each of these challenges will add 25% to the level completion, beat them all to get 100% and a flag next to the stage. 
 During your adventures through Sweetzerland, you''ll also encounter  a colourful cast of characters, feed them a certain amount of special sweets to unlock fast paced bonus stages. 
 As you beat the challenges, the board next to the level will update showing your progress, if you manage to get 100% completion you'll see a flag next to the stage too. 
 If you beat everything, there's an exciting prize to unlock! 
 
   
 
 
 Note from the developer 
 This game has been a labor of love over the past ten years! I began working on it back in 2015 when bored at work one day, eating doughnuts. (I prefer the American spelling though...)   
 I made a prototype of the game in a weekend and thought it was a fun idea, little did I know that 10 years later I'd still be working on it! 
 The game was originally released in 2017 as a mobile game for iOS and Android, but this brand-new PC version is a complete overhaul!  
 Everything has been completely revamped and re-programmed, including: 
 Redesigned levels New graphics, enemies, boss fights, sound effects and UI
 Improved physics for tighter controls
 Two new gameplay modes, unlocked later in the game Extra challenges exclusive to this release Author time trials for every stage Special 100% completion bonus 
 I hope you enjoy this game that I've poured so much time and love into over the past decade! 
 Want to know more about the development of the game? Here's a making of video: 
 A Decade In Development, My Game Is Finally Finished! 
 ð© ð©ð©ð©ð©ð©ð©ð©ð©ð©ð©ð©ð©ð©ð©ð©ð©ð©ð©

 Will you expose the mastermind behind the forum, or become their next target?

title: Boarding
logline: Boarding
description:
Boarding, Plundering, Endless Fighting... None of that happens here, Hop aboard this adventure, where the pressure is high and the stakes even higher! Boarding your peers and and others has never been easier before!  
 
 Controls:  
 WASD to walk.  Hold F to board a Door. Hold F to Refill Planks 
 
 Gameplay: Board the doors of the houses around, try to avoid the keen eyes of the local police. Each plank gives points, but be warned, the police will take them down when they are discovered! If the Police notices you boarding a house, WHICH IS HEAVILY ILLEGAL ON THIS ISLAND, you will be arrested! 
  Put your Highscores in the comments! 
  GAMEX Jam submission by Dylan Fliski and Aleksander Mikolajczyk.

title: A-G-NO-SYS

A medida que exploras este entorno incompleto y extraÃ±o, te enfrentas a fragmentos del sistema que buscan evitar tu escape, pero sin mucho esfuerzo. Sin embargo, cada enfrentamiento tiene un costo: en lugar de fortalecerte, pierdes conocimiento y comprensiÃ³n del mundo que te rodea, provocando que el mundo se sienta mas incompleto o destruido.
  
 Tu Ãºnica opciÃ³n es avanzar, aunque con cada paso la realidad se distorsiona mÃ¡s y la derrota se vuelve inevitable, es el desconocimeinto e ignorancia paz o un completo caos . 
 MecÃ¡nicas BÃ¡sicas Combate por turnos : Enfrenta tres enemigos antes del combate final contra el  Jefe del Nivel .
  PÃ©rdida de conocimiento : En lugar de ganar experiencia, Ghost se debilita con cada enfrentamiento.
  Historia inmersiva : Un mundo digital defectuoso donde la desesperaciÃ³n y el destino juegan un papel crucial.
  
 No es un juego sobre ganar, sino sobre descubrir cuÃ¡nto puedes entender antes de perderte para siempre en el sistema.

title: Back to the origins
logline: Prevent humidity from becoming extinct by its own creation
description: One of the creators of humanity's greatest utopia, considered the father of human evolution, finds himself in a situation of near extinction of humanity due to a possible error in his creation.

title: Heroes Suck
logline: Defend your dungeon against an onslaught of heroes as they try to steal your precious loot.
description:
Defend your dungeon against an onslaught of heroes in this physics-enabled tower defense. Build your dungeon tile by tile, placing deadly traps to protect your loot. Upgrade your defenses and powers as you amass wealth and unleash havoc on these cheese wheel-stealing 'heroes'. 
 
 Build your dungeon , your way. Place tile by tile, and fill your dungeon with deadly traps to keep the pesky heroes away from your loot. As you level up, you gain the ability to place more and more tiles to further grow your dungeon. 
 
 Unleash havoc  with your traps. With physics enabled, send heroes flying around - or even play bowling with their bodies! You can even light them on fire or electrocute them. What fun! 
 Unravel the mystery  of the stolen cheese wheels in a plot against the town by a secretive guild of heroes. 
 Defeat powerful foes  that cast an array of magical powers. It's oh so worth it to fell these baddies, because they drop some seriously good loot. 
 
 Expand your town  to increase your potential. Unlock and upgrade buildings like the Forge, Scriptorium, Town Hall, and more. The villagers are happy to help you in any way they can to get their precious cheese wheels back. 
 Learn new powers  and barrage your foes with them. With only 4 slots available, you must be strategic with your selection. It's extra satisfying to blast the heroes around - especially into each other. Collateral damage is totally a thing here! Use your abilities wisely and you can cause some serious chaos. 
 Grow your power . As you're beating up heroes, they'll drop their loot for you (how generous). Take your well-earned loot and use it to further power up your dungeon! With an array of masteries that improve the damage of your traps, allow you to build more tiles, improve your gold and item find, and many more - you can be sure there's plenty of options.

title: Finn vs The Evil Broccoli
description:
Be little Finn and try to meet the Emperor of Glitter City. But watch out, you're being chased by evil broccolis. Try to defeat the Brockolis by destroying the wooden crates and survive long enough. 
 (you can find more detailed story information in the game by watching the intro) 
 The game was programmed within 48h (less than 10h to be exact) as part of the Pulse GameJam 2025. by one person 
 I hope you like the game

 - The map has no outside collision

title: Most Peaceful American Argument
logline: Bullets solve problems.
description:
Duel shooter except your bullets  
 ricochet and destroy obstacles! 
 
 
 Story 
 In the  Most Peaceful American Argument  you play as an American cowboy who seems to have gotten into
    a confrontation with your identical twin brother. This scoundrel had an affair with your wife, and you are not going
    to let him get away with it! You and your brother ready your weapons for a duel, but as you start shooting, it seems
    like everything that could possibly get in the way of your bullets keep getting in the way. From cactuses to station
    wagons, it seems like universe is trying to prevent you from winning your duel, but you will prevail! 
 
 Controls 
 
 
 
 Player 
 Move (up and down only) 
 Aim 
 Shoot 
 
 
 1  
 Up arrow, Down arrow  
 Left arrow, Right arrow  
 Forward Slash  
 
 
 2 - Used in Multiplayer 
 W, S 
 A, D 
 Space 
 
 
 
 
 How to score points 
 
 Kill the other player to gain  1 point  
 
 
 Players have  2 lives  - shown by the hat on their head 
 2 lives - Hat on 
 1 life - Hat off 
 
 
 
 
 A player respawns with 2 lives and a short invincibility period 
 
 
 Find the treasure floating around and get a power-up! 
 
 
 Game modes 
 
 
 
 Single player 
 Description 
 How to win 
 
 
 Shoot The Dummy 
 Target practice 
 Practice gamemode 
 
 
 Duel It Out 
 Play against an AI enemy- 3 levels with increasing difficulty, complete a level to immediately progress
                to the next 
 Score  7  points before the AI enemy, or have a  higher  score when the
                 timer runs out  (99 seconds)
             
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Multi player 
 Description 
 How to win 
 
 
 Two player 
 Share the keyboard and play against a friend, or foe! 
 Score  7  points before the other player, or have
                a  higher  score when the  timer runs out  (99
                seconds)

title: Pong
description:
G ame features two paddles and a ball, where players control their paddles to hit the ball back and forth. The goal is to score points by making the opponent miss the ball. First to five points wins the game. 
 It is one of the earliest arcade video games, originally released in 1972 by Atari. It is a two-dimensional sports simulation that mimics table tennis.  
 
 Controls:
 
 W, Up arrow: Move up 
 S, Down arrow: Move down  
 Escape: Pause the game

title: StarLocked
logline: StarLocked
description: StarLocked was the first major game made in school for me and the team I worked with. It is an FPS platformer, where the goal is to collect three colored keys make your way out of the locked space station. The keys are hidden throughout the map, some more hidden than others. Can you find them all and make your way out? This game was a team effort, by the team Silent Zebra Studios, of which I was a part of. I worked mainly on the Enemy AI for this game. This was created in Unity with free assets on the Unity store. This was our first time making any sort of game inside an engine. We think it came out great, and hope you all enjoy it too!

title: Mecha Eternal
logline: You are the last remaining operator of an mega-factory. Save humanity!
description:
DISCLAIMER: It's our first game (have mercy), and we sadly didn't finish in time but the core gameplay loop works. 
 HOW TO PLAY: You need to build the Robot as shown on the right top screen. Detach parts (hover over the limb) from the Robots and put them in the Storage underneath the conveyor to reattach them as needed. (remember the emergency code ;) ) 
 LORE:  The year is 2701. Earth is locked in a never-ending war against a rogue AI. The last city of humanity is on the brink of collapse, and the mega-factory is working tirelessly to prevent this, producing robots without rest as a countermeasure. You are the last remaining operator of one of these mega-factories. Save humanity!

title: SHORT KING
logline: 5 Days, 4 companies, one huge payout.
description:
THIS GAME IS NOT COMPLETE 
 5 Days, 4 companies, one huge payout. 
 A loose cannon consultant gets pulled back for one final job. His targets? The four fastest rising companies on the stock market. Yippee!, Wellness Foods and Natural Produce, FRANKS TREADMILLS AND BALLISTICS LLC , and Moins Pauvre. His method? Risking it all on short selling to tank their share price till it's Kaputt. Welcome to the high octane world of  SHORT KING .  
 This was our first game jam, were a team of friends from Australia! Had so much fun making the game and fell in love with game development in the process. Thanks for checking us out and hope you have a laugh playing it!  
 
 Lead Programmer, Game Design - Adam Ates -  @Sludgy  on discord.  
 Programming, 3D Modelling - Jordan Brinkley -  @Jawds _ on Instagram

title: Forget The Brakes!
logline: We'll be Multi-Track Drifting
description:
A game about driving a train without brakes by Multi-Track Drifting 
 
 
 
 
 
 Two train engineers are working on building their own machines! But they forgot to add the brakes! But they will be multi-track drifting their way through the railway. No stopping required! 
 
 
 
 
 CONTROLS 
 
	Hold 
	 I and K   (as well as  Up or Down  arrows) to switch rails with the front boogie of the train. 
 
 
	Hold 
	 W or S  (as well as  E or D   for our french players) to switch rails with the rear boogie of the train.
 
 
 Spacebar   and  Return   to accept,  Spacebar  pause/unpause and  Escape  to quit or back.
 
 
	Use the mouse to interact with the menu.
 
 
 
 
 CHANGELOG 
 
 
 2.2 
 
 10/03/2025: 10th year anniversary update Made the game pay-what-you-want. Thanks for everyone who bought the game and supported us this last 10 years! Resubmitted Android and iOS versions, both now available for  free  on  Google Play  and the  App Store  respectively (including working leaderboards). Added 26 new difficult track presets Improved title screen visuals Improved camera interpolation Improved background generation Made a non-google play apk available for download for previous purchases and purchases over 1$ (still contains Google Play Games API for Google leaderboards) 
 
 
 
 2.0 
 
 08/07/2019: Working on new content version Updated WebGL & standalone builds to match mobile versions WebGL version is now complete(!) Optimizations 
 
 1.0 
 
 
 30/06/2015: Post-gamelab update Added GUI switch Reworked tutorial animation Improved the game's performance-demand Fixed rail where train could get stuck Fixed bug where it would keep telling the player they won when winning 12/06/2015: First public release 
 
 
 
 
 Download the mobile versions to access the leaderboards* 
 *Web, Linux, macOS and Windows versions do not have leaderboards 
 
 ABOUT 
 
 Presskit 
 
 
	A game by: 
 Ferran Bertomeu  &  YenTing Lo 
 
 
	Check the (old)
	 Devlog  here:
 
 
 http://forums.tigsource.com/index.php?topic=43503.0

description:
Save your ship from sea monsters, which will attack on night, before your ship is KAPUTT! 
 You can remove some water with your bucket and empty it near the flagpole. Fix leaks and scratches and kill the intruders! How long can you survive?  This Game can also be played with a Controller the controlls are:  Left Button = attack; Upper Button= fill/ empty bucket; Down Button = use ladder; Right Button = Fix scratch/leak

title: Survival of the Cubest
description:
Survival of the Cubest is a challenging, action-packed game. Play as a cube-shaped blue  slime, trapped in a
    temple of  red slimes who are all out to eat you!
    Each bite is fatal and can mean difference between life or death. Utilize unique slime properties and your own fatal
    bite to overcome your adversaries.
 
 Features 
  Slime Skills 
 
 Mass Change: Taking damage or consuming enemies can increase / decrease your size! 
 Consume: close ranged attack that can consume smaller enemies and grow in mass  
 Slimy Throw: sacrifice some mass to throw sticky slime residue at enemies to slow them down 
 Bait Throw: sacrifice some mass to attract the attention of enemies with a radius  
 Absorb: thrown slime and baits can be reabsorbed to regain mass  
 
 Enemy: The Red Slime 
 
 Take on slimes of varying sizes. 
 Large slimes may be slower, but their size more than makes up for it. 
 Typical slimes are quick, especially when they close in for a bite. Be on your toes!  
 Their fatal bites will reduce your size, and increase their own. 
 
 Controls: 
 
 WASD - movement direction control 
 Mouse - camera control 
 SPACE - close-ranged attack to eat smaller slimes 
 Left-click HOLD - charges up a slimey throw 
 Left-click RELEASE - launches a slimey throw 
 Right-click HOLD - charge up a bait throw 
 Right-click RELEASE - launches a bait throw 
 
 . 
 . 
 . 
 Thanks for checking out the page!

logline: horror puzzle game
description:
where are the lights? 
 where are my parents? 
 what's happening 
 . don't be afraid. take a seat on the floor and enjoy your games. 
 . i won't hurt you 
 
 
 An entity has trapped you inside your House, and your only respite is the TV screen and your video games. 
 The objects in your House seem to have an effect the game - some in more obvious ways than others. 
 (Try to see where the game level resembles parts of the house....) 
 
 Controls 
 WASD to play the games on the TV screen. E to use items. Click objects to interact with them. Click arrows to move in the House. 
 
 ------------------------------------- 
 Built for Week 4 of Manchester Metropolitan University's  Game A Week  course.
 
 The theme was  The Puzzle Box.

title: A Quiet Forest
logline: Shhh.... Don't make a sound
description:
Shhh.... Don't make a sound! Sneak your way back to camp without alerting the Ghosts! Solve puzzles and play tricks on the creatures of the dark in this forest that rearranges itself every night. 
 Controls: 
 Move - WASD Slow Down - Hold L-Shift Throw Rocks - LMB Throw Bombs - RMB Restart - R Pause - Esc Adjust Music Volume - Up & Down Arrows 
 
 This project was near completion over a year before it ended up published, and it was intended to be my first completed game, but it ended up getting abandoned. After finishing "Trapped Innside", I decided  to return and reboot the project in Godot 4 with a slightly smaller scope. A level editor is planned for a future update to make up for the low level count.

title: Strange Cravings Restaurant
logline: Entry for Trijam #313: The 3 hour game jam (https://itch.io/jam/trijam-313)
description:
Strange Cravings Restaurant 
 Welcome to  Strange Cravings Restaurant , where you play as a krab running an undersea diner that caters to the bizarre cravings of deep-sea creatures! Your goal? Fulfill as many strange orders as possible before time runs out—while managing a chaotic kitchen conveyor system.
  
 Food arrives from the kitchen on  four food mats , but not everything is part of the current order. If itâs the wrong dish, quickly recycle it to save money. Drop food on the floor, and youâll lose cash! Inspired by classic  Atari 2600 arcade gameplay , this fast-paced challenge will test your reflexes and decision-making. Can you out-earn the other krab restaurant owners and become the ultimate deep-sea chef?
  
 How to Play 
 ð¦  Move  â Use the arrow keys to navigate.  ð½  Serve Orders  â Deliver the correct food to earn  $10 .  â»  Recycle  â Dispose of incorrect food for  $1 .  â Dropped Food  â Lose  $5  per fallen dish.  â³  Time Limit  â You have  120 seconds  to make as much money as possible!
  
 Credits 
 ð® Developed by:  Diego Giacomelli  ð Sound FX by:  Peter Wayne  ð¹ Created for  Trijam #313 â The 3 Hour Game Jam  ð­  Theme:   Strange Cravings

title: Cauldron Cravin'
logline: Brew potions for your strange, evil master!
description: Controls: Mouse only! Drag and drop ingredients into the cauldron, then click and drag the lever down to create the potion. Use the bars above the ingredients to discern what ingredients are good for which craving! You can throw away ingredients by dropping them on the trash can. Currently, there is no win or lose condition, and the ingredient traits are somewhat arbitrary. Entry for TRIJAM #313! Didn't get as far as I wanted to as far as making an actual game, but I'm happy with the visuals of the hand and how tactile the picking up / dropping feels. Three hours is not a long time!!!

title: Project Banana
logline: GTAG Modded Fangame
description:
Project Banana is a Fun Gorilla Tag Fangame to use mods and chill in! 
 DISCORD:  https://discord.gg/h7DEvEf7dF

title: Refresh At A Snail's Pace
logline: Refresh this Snail with water welled up in their leaves within the six levels of this falling-oriented platformer!
description:
**Refresh the page if player control is lost. Please refrain from clicking out of the game to prevent this issue.** 
 Play as a snail simply trying to refresh themselves as they try to reach a leaf filled with some fresh water.   
   -Avoid enemies by being patient and sticking to walls!  
   -Use gusts of air from within the ground to get over ledges! 
   -Six short and fun levels! 
 This game was made in under three days during Mini Jam 180. The theme was refresh and the limitation was falling down. This was my first game jam; it was very fun. All assets used were created by me. 
 Thank you for dropping by. This project was made for Mini Jam 180 in under 3 days. 
 KNOWN BUGS:   
 
 -Colliding with corners for a repeated period of time will  result in  the player character becoming stuck around the eye stalks.  Game Restart is required (Press  "R").  
 
 -Idling around the corner of ledges for a prolonged period   may result in the player character becoming stuck. Game Restart is   required
 (Press "R").  
 
 -Sometimes music will not loop.  
 
 -HTML build may cause a small visual bug on start-up due to a transition issue.  
 
 -HTML build has an issue where the player may lose control of the player character when clicking out of the game.

title: Pond Defender
logline: Defend your pond from unhealthy bacteria and humans
description: Game created in civis jam 2024

title: This Can't Work!
logline: Two devs. One game jam. Zero chance of success.
description:
Two devs. One game jam. Zero chance of success. 
 
 Forget polishing your own project! Your only goal is to sabotage your opponent's work by any means necessary. Keyboard slamming? Dirty tricks? Relentless sabotage? Absolutely! And when the dust settles, who knows if anyone will actually finish their game? 
 This ain't just a game jam - it's all-out war! Double-cross your rival, hatch sneaky plots, and pull off every cheap trick in the book. Fair play? Forget it! Why would you work yourself into the ground when you can just bury your opponent instead? Just remember: this can't work! 
 
 How to Play 
 Player 1: Move with WASD, interact with Left Ctrl 
 Player 2: Move with Arrow Keys, interact with Right Ctrl 
 
 Credits 
 Made in 48 hours for  Game Jam ZlÃ­n 2025 
 Creators 
 Programming 
 
 LukÃ¡Å¡ Urban 
 Samuel Slovak 
 
 Visuals 
 
 VÃ­t Å vÃ©da 
 
 Audio Design 
 
 Å tÄpÃ¡n KÅikava 
 
 and this one has worked on just about everything 
 
 OndÅej Siuda 
 
 
 Our thanks also go to  PolyPerfect ,  Flying Rat Studio ,  Vision Game ,  UPPER  and others for organizing this event. 
 
 Fun Facts 
 
 OndÅej managed to drink over 20 cans of redbull in one day during the whole production (he's still alive) 
 Apart from the music, all the sound effects are the product of Å tÄpÃ¡n's mouth 
 LukÃ¡Å¡ forgot to go to school on Monday due to sleep deprivation 
 
 This Can't Work! by LukÃ¡Å¡ Urban, OndÅej Siuda, Samuel Slovak, VÃ­t Å vÃ©da, Å tÄpÃ¡n KÅikava 
 I've made builds for linux and mac as well, but I'm not able to test them right now. If the native linux version doesn't work for you, there is an option to run the Windows version of the game using Wine. Whether the game works on mac will remain a mystery, at least until someone writes it in the hate comments. - Love, LukÃ¡Å¡ <3

title: 35 Seconds Left
logline: Save as much as you can before your house burns down.
description:
Save as much as you can before your house burns down! 
 WASD or arrow keys to move SPACE to pick things up and throw them E to escape (doesn't work, instead just pauses timer. The game goes kaputt [crashes] if I try to make it open the end screen lol) 
 The game keeps track of how many people and items you save. Unfortunately when I tried to show this the game kept crashing so you will never know. Have fun throwing things (and family members) around your house until you burn to death! 
 Created by Cademon, Jamie, and Bekah.

title: Delivery Goblins
logline: Wreak havoc in a multi-tasking button-mashing fashion.
description:
Control a squad of goblins up to no good, wreak havoc as you pop, scratch, and smash delivery packages to cause huge profit losses to the infamous delivery corporate. 
 Smash buttons in a chaotic multitasking fashion, and break as many packages as possible as you upgrade your squad and climb the leaderboard. 
 This game was developed during the GGJ 2025 
 Credits: Art - Zizou Programming - Paolo "Polka" Iovino Music - Jayolite

title: Get Down, Mr Human!
logline: Catch a bullet for humans
description:
You are a robot doing your daily tasks when you suddenly encounter a human about to be shot. According to the first law of robotics you must do everything in your power to protect humans but there is little time.  
 " Get down, Mr Human! ", you yell as you throw yourself in front of the bullet... 
 
 How to play: - Move mouse to aim - Press  [Space]  to lunge forward -  [Q]  &  [E]  to decrease/increase the game speed -  [R]  to reset the level 
 Absorbing all bullets will succeed the level. Absorbing a bullet will knock you back, use this to your advantage. A bullet or you colliding with a human will fail the level. 
 Created for the Puls Game Jam 2025 
 Assets used: - Gun shot sound:  https://freesound.org/people/martian/sounds/182272/ - Wilhelms scream: original WIlhelms scream

title: Riega la Nota o Aplasta la Bichota
logline: Â¡Juego cooperativo de ritmo! Escoge entre matar insectos o regar tu planta para hacer que crezca.
description:
Sois dos cientÃ­ficos que quieren hacer crecer plantas a travÃ©s de la mÃºsica. Hay difernetes  Facundos  que te ofrecen mÃºsica tradicional de su cultura, que debes tocar bien para hacer crecer sus respectivas plantas. 
 Pero ojo, no todo es regar, tambiÃ©n debÃ©is protegerla de insectos y plagas extraÃ±as.  
 Â¡Es muy importante que lo hagÃ¡is todo a ritmo! Si no, la planta no crece y se nos acumulan los insectos D: 
 Coged un teclado y un ratÃ³n, y Â¡lanzaos a experimentar! 
 
 Instrucciones para aÃ±adir mods: 
 - En la misma carpeta donde se encuentra el ejecutable, crear una carpeta con el nombre "GodotMods", dentro de esta carpeta irÃ¡n todas las canciones que queramos meter al juego. 
 - Crear una carpeta para la canciÃ³n que queramos meter (el nombre da igual) 
 - Dentro de la carpeta tiene que haber necesariamente 3 archivos: la canciÃ³n que queramos reproducir en formato OggVorbis(es importante que sea ese formato, se puede exportar con esa extensiÃ³n desde audacity), el nombre del archivo de sonido serÃ¡ el nombre que se muestre en el juego. En segundo lugar es necesario crear un archivo "enemies.txt" que contenga en la primera linea del archivo los beats por minuto de la canciÃ³n en formato numÃ©rico. Y por Ãºltimo es necesario un archivo "notes.txt" que tenga en cada linea los instantes de tiempo en los que aparece una nota (ej: 2.54 2.54    Esto indica que la nota se generarÃ¡ en el segundo 2 con 54 dÃ©cimas), este archivo se puede rellenar manualmente o mediante el uso de labels de audacity (una vez puestas las labels en una pista, se pueden exportar a un archivo .txt desde el propio programa de Audacity) 
 Si todos los pasos anteriores se cumplen, la canciÃ³n aparecerÃ¡ en la lista de canciones disponibles. 
 AdemÃ¡s, el programa crea un archivo "score.txt" donde guarda todas las puntuaciones de los jugadores para cada canciÃ³n, para borrar los datos de una canciÃ³n basta con borrar dicho archivo de la carpeta del mod correspondiente.

title: Claire's Blender Museum
logline: An interactive portfolio
description:
Welcome to my Blender Museum! This is a showcase of all my 3D modeling work from the past year or so. It includes school assignments, personal projects, character modeling, and even some animated exhibits! 
 Walk up to each exhibit and inspect the placard to learn more about it, like when it was made, what I made it for, and what I learned during the process.

title: Record Breaker
logline: Developed by Tyler O'Byrne and Edwin Ouyang
description:
Developed by Tyler O'Byrne and Edwin Ouyang 
 In Record Breaker you take on the role of a record company in the music industry. Will you break into the industry and make a fortune? Or perhaps craft the most diverse catalog in the business? Only time will tell!

title: Like new but better
logline: "BruchstÃ¼cke, Gold und ein bisschen Chaos â reparierâs wie ein Profi (oder tu so)!
description:
!(Sorry this game is unplayable)! 
 In  Like New but Better  reparierst du kaputtes Geschirr mit der traditionellen Kintsugi-Technik â oder versuchst es zumindest. Setze die Scherben zusammen, verziere die Bruchstellen mit goldener Farbe und erfÃ¼lle die manchmal fragwÃ¼rdigen WÃ¼nsche deiner Kunden. Aber Vorsicht: Nicht jedes Teil passt so perfekt, wie du denkst. 
 Steuerung: 
 
   Maus  : Linksklick  â Drehen und anpassen
  Rechtsklick  â markieren 
 Story  (Aus ZeitgrÃ¼nden nicht implementiert): 
 Intro und Tutorial (wird beim Spielbeginn angezeigt) 
 Endlich ist dein Tag gekommen. Nach drei DiplomabschlÃ¼ssen, einem Doktor im Ingenieurwesen, 20 Jahren Berufserfahrung und unzÃ¤hligen Nebenjobs hast du endlich genug angespart, um deinen Traum eines eigenen Kintsugi-Ladens auszuleben.
   
 Du kaufst dir eine 20 Quadratmeter Wohnung in der fast nicht existenten Innenstadt des kleinen Dorfes Keramos. Hier soll dein Imperium entstehen. Die Ausgangslage ist optimal. Mit 450 Einwohnern, die alle ein Faible fÃ¼r Keramikobjekte haben und keiner Konkurrenz weit und breit, bist du dir sicher, schon nÃ¤chstes Jahr in der Liste der reichsten Menschen aufzutauchen.
   
 Mit dem riesigen Kapital, dass du angespart hast, musstest du keine Kompromisse eingehen. Die besten Werkzeuge und Materialien waren schon in deinem Keramazon Warenkorb. Die Deko penibel ausgesucht und bereit fÃ¼r den Import aus Japan. Sogar einen Kintsugi-GroÃmeister, mit goldenem GÃ¼rtel, hast du als Mitarbeiter anwerben kÃ¶nnen.    
 Leider hast du dein gesamtes Geld in KryptowÃ¤hrung investiert und in deiner alten PC-Festplatte aufbewahrt, die deine Mutter vor 2 Wochen weggeschmissen hat. Dieser winzige RÃ¼ckschlag hÃ¤lt dich aber nicht von deinem Vorhaben ab.
   
 Letztes Jahr ist dein reicher GroÃvater verstorben und als einer seiner 32 Enkel, durftest du dir was aus seinem Erbe aussuchen. WÃ¤hrend die anderen sich, komischerweise, um seine Uhren- und Autosammlung gestritten haben, hast du die wahren Perlen entdeckt. Den massiven und robusten Schreibtisch, der selbst den zweiten Weltkrieg Ã¼berlebt hat und das Regal, welches all die Ã¶den Uhren zur Schau stellte. Ein VisionÃ¤r, wie du, erkennt natÃ¼rlich den wahren Wert eines Objektes und weiÃ ihn zu nutzen.
   
 Der Schreibtisch dient dir in deinem Kintsugi-Laden nun als Arbeitsbereich. Hier entstehen all die Wunder, die du vollbringen wirst und all die SchÃ¶nheit, die du erschaffen wirst.    
 Das Regal wird das Podium dieser SchÃ¶nheit, wÃ¤hrend du darauf wartest, dass der Kunde das Meisterwerk abholt.
   
 Bevor du deine Fertigkeiten der Welt zur Schau stellst, geh noch mal in dich und mach einen Probedurchlauf. Es ist nicht so, als hÃ¤ttest du es nÃ¶tig, schlieÃlich hast du schon mindestens fÃ¼nf Kintsugi-Tutorials auf KeramaTube gesehen. Es dient lediglich zum AufwÃ¤rmen.
   
 Die SchÃ¼ssel, die dir vor 5 Minuten beim Instantnudeln machen aus der Hand gefallen ist, bietet sich perfekt fÃ¼r diese Ãbung an.    
 WÃ¤hle mit dem Mauszeiger KeramikstÃ¼cke aus und markiere sie mit deinem inneren Auge, also mit Rechtsklick.
   
 Such nach weiteren StÃ¼cken, die an den Rand des ersten StÃ¼ckes passen kÃ¶nnten. Dass die StÃ¼cke zusammengehÃ¶ren, merkst du daran, dass sich dein sechster Sinn einschaltet. Ein nerviges GerÃ¤usch, das dich schon durch so manche Puzzleturniere gebracht hat.
   
 Wenn du keine passenden StÃ¼cke findest, solltest du die StÃ¼cke aus einer anderen Perspektive betrachten. Aktiviere dein Adlerauge, mit Linksklick, um dir ein KeramikstÃ¼ck genau anzusehen und es zu drehen.
   
 Hast du mehrere Teile zusammengesetzt, musst du sie nur noch miteinander verbinden. GlÃ¼cklicherweise hast du noch genug Kleingeld in der Tasche gefunden, um den entsprechenden Klebstoff im ein Euro Laden zu kaufen.
   
 Eigentlich mÃ¼sstest du an den Klebestellen mit Goldstaub rÃ¼bergehen. Aus KostengrÃ¼nden machst du das erstmal mit einem goldenen Marker, zumindest bis die erste Million in der Tasche ist.
   
 Sobald du fertig bist, kannst du dir dein Meisterwerk noch mal von allen Seiten anschauen und anschlieÃend auf das prÃ¤chtige Regal stellen.    
 Danach kannst du direkt mit dem nÃ¤chsten Auftrag weiter machen. Schau dafÃ¼r in dein Notizbuch.
   
 Es kann passieren, dass du im Arbeitsprozess durch ein Klopfen unterbrochen wirst. Das wird hÃ¶chstwahrscheinlich ein Kunde sein, der seine Bestellung abholen mÃ¶chte. Auch wenn er deine Konzentration unterbrochen hat, versuch freundlich zu sein, denk dran, du hast einen Kintsugi-Laden und er nicht.    
 Okay, jetzt reicht es aber mit den SelbstgesprÃ¤chen. Rann an den Porzellan!
   
 Kurzer Text vor Level 1 
 
 Die Instantnudeln-SchÃ¼ssel (Tutorial)
   
 Ich glaube ich sollte noch mal in mich gehen und den Ablauf durchgehen.
   
 Zum GlÃ¼ck zerbrechen bei mir stÃ¤ndig SchÃ¼sseln.
   
 Kurzer Text vor Level 2 
 
 Die Tasse (Leicht)
   
 Mein erster richtiger Auftrag. Ich wÃ¼rde ja sagen, dass ich aufgeregt bin, wenn die Kundin nicht meine Mutter wÃ¤re und ich sie nicht gezwungen hÃ¤tte den Auftrag einzureichen.    
 Kurzer Text nach Level 2 
 
 Mutter: Hallo mein Kind, du hast mir 30 Nachrichten geschickt, dass die Tasse fertig ist. Wow, das sieht wirklich interessant aus.
   
 Ich bereue zwar ein wenig, dass ich sie nicht weggeworfen und mir einfach eine neue gekauft habe, so wie ich es eigentlich geplant hatte. Aber nun habe ich ein tolles DekostÃ¼ck fÃ¼r die freie Stelle hinten im Regal.    
 Kurzer Text vor Level 3 
 
 Die Vase (Mittel)
   
 Ein Kunde hat mir diese Vase zum Reparieren gegeben. Er hat irgendwas Ã¼ber seinen Vater erzÃ¤hlt, ich war aber so aufgebracht Ã¼ber seine StÃ¶rung wÃ¤hrend meiner Mittagspause, dass ich ihm nicht richtig zugehÃ¶rt habe. Den komischen Sand, den er mitgegeben hat, kann ich aber super als Streckmittel fÃ¼r den Kleber benutzen.
   
 Kurzer Text nach Level 3 
 
 Trauender Mann: Die Urne sieht nun tatsÃ¤chlich viel besser aus als vorher. Mein Vater wÃ¼rde sich bestimmt freuen, in einer so schicken und edlen Urne seinen Frieden zu finden. Ich sehe Sie haben den Deckel versiegelt. Das war eine gute Idee von Ihnen, so geht nichts mehr verloren.    
 Kurzer Text vor Level 4 
 
 Die Statue (Schwer)
   
 Diese groÃe schwere Statue wurde mir von einem MÃ¶nch, zumindest sah er so aus wie einer, vorbeigebracht. Das ist die bis jetzt grÃ¶Ãte Herausforderung. Er faselte was von Ebenbild und Reinheit. Ich war da aber bereits in Gedanken daran wie ich das Objekt in was wahrlich wunderschÃ¶nes verwandele, und konnte nicht richtig zuhÃ¶ren.
   
 Kurzer Text nach Level 4 
 
 Komischer MÃ¶nch: Wie kÃ¶nnen Sie es W… bla bla bla. Das ist Blasphem … bla bla. Ich sagte das Ebenbild darf nicht verun… bla.
  (*Du erwischt dich selbst wie du dein Werk bewunderst und den MÃ¶nch ignorierst* Ich sollte aufhÃ¶ren so oft in Gedanken zu schweben und den Menschen zuhÃ¶ren. Egal, er scheint, nachvollziehbarerweise, so begeistert davon zu sein, dass er ganz aufgeregt ist. Ich lasse die Zwei mal alleine. Zum glÃ¼ck lasse ich mich im Voraus bezahlen.)

title: SPooL
logline: SPooL, a splity twist on billard
description:
ð§What is Spool ? 
 Spool (Split pool)is not an ordinary game of  billard. It's a roguelite game when you play a living slime! Your goal ? Clear the table before enemy balls countdown hits 0 ! But there is a twist ! Every time you shoot your slime it splits in half ! Make sure to merge it back in order to be heavy enough. 
 â¡ Roguelite Progression 
 Losing is not the end... It's just the beginning ! Each atemps offer you the possibilities to stack up coins to unlock upgrades, making your slime stronger for the next rounds. 
 ð ï¸ Upgrade Your Slime! 
 ð More Speed  â Slip across the table faster! ðª More Weight  â Smash through obstacles with force! ð° Higher Coin Value  â Earn more from each coins! ð§ Slicker Movement  â Slide more easily for shots! ð¯  Aim Assist  -Precisely shoot enemies! 
 ð¹ï¸ How to Play? 
 
 ð¾ Meet the Team 
 Valentin , Baptiste &  Tom Dedicated to Yannis ð¤

title: Deck Dungeon Die
logline: Retro rogue-like: form poker combos, master risk & reward, conquer dungeons. Your fate is in your hands.
description:
Embark on a retro-inspired card game rogue-like adventure where every step in the dungeon tests your sanity. Drawing inspiration from legends like  Slay the Spire ,  Balatro , and the classic card game  Scoundrel , this journey pays homage to the spirit of retro gaming while forging its own path.
  
 Dive into a world where strategy meets chance as you collect and play cards to form poker-style combos against fearsome monsters to earn gold. Explore eerie corridors and hidden chambers filled with peril and mystery. Every card you play and every risk you take could mean the difference between fortune and oblivion.
  
 Uncover dark secrets and unexpected treasures in a dungeon that challenges both your wits and your courage. Your destiny is crafted with every shuffle of the deck—will you master the art of the card and claim your legacy, or will the dungeon consume you? The choice is yours, and your fate lies in your hands.

title: SCIENE IS A LIE
description:
After a tiring laboratory day, you're quietly watching television at home in an exhausted state. Annnnd  "Good evening, dear viewers" 
 -RMB to Change Gravity  -Shift to Run -E to Interact 
 
 
 ---CREW--- Baran Ãifter - Unity Developer, Game Designer Yaren Karaman - 3D Artist, Level Designer 
 --- WARNING --- If you experience issues with Windows Defender, download another version.

title: Geosplit
description:
The shapes protecting your hearth have been split away. Collect them back and throw them at your enemies while scoring as much as you can. 
 How To Play: 
 [WASD] Move the player [E], [R] Rotate the player [Mouse Click] Shoot This game was created entirely in 42 hours during the upsi game jam in Neuchatel, Switzerland. We created everything from scratch expect for some sounds that were taken from open source banks. The theme of the jam was "Split".

title: GameX Jam 2025 Submission
description:
Unfortunately didn't manage to get the game fully working. Only started work on the Jam submission less than 24 hours before the initial deadline. 
 Music is from Sea of Thieves (2018) Assets: Low Poly Tropical Island Lite - Just Create -  https://assetstore.unity.com/packages/3d/environments/low-poly-tropical-island-l... title: "RESET" - A prologue
logline: Five people going through a time loop. The catch is that two of them aren't experiencing time linearly.
description:
Five people wake up in a closed space. 
 Again. 
 And Again. And Again. And Again. 
 The catch is that two of them aren't experiencing the time loops linearly. 
 Potential Trigger warnings :  
 
 Implied suicide, implied self harm. A lot of swearing and smoking is involved.
 
 Controls :  
 Standard RPGMaker with one point and click room. 
 
 Hi! Hello! I've never made a game before! Heads up this is held together by duct tape and hopes and dreams, so apologies for how awkward it may be! 
 This dinky little prologue is only 10-15 minutes long with numerous typos and bugs. 
 That being said, I hope you enjoy the premise, the art, the music and the vibes. Thank you for having me!

title: 2025_03_18 Pong
description:
This game is Pong but you can slightly influence the ball's upward and downward speed using the w/s keys, up/down keys, or left/right click. 
 It's not a good game but it's the beginning of a long term project I'm starting where I make a simple game every day to learn and get better at game dev.

title: Slot Override
logline: Gamble away your life savings and discover what happens when you hit the jackpot!
description:
Step into the electrifying, neon-drenched world of Slot Override, a high-stakes slot machine simulator set in a futuristic cyberpunk universe. Here, the air is thick with the hum of holographic advertisements, the glow of neon lights, and the promise of untold riches. In this world, the line between man and machine blurs, and the thrill of gambling is amplified by cutting-edge technology. 
 This game includes:  
 Symbol-based scoring: different symbols can be rolled such as (cherries, bananas, and sevens), and each one has a unique effect such as score bonuses and multipliers!
 Progressive rounds: each round increases the difficulty by increasing the target score - to overcome this you can purchase upgrade modifiers!
 Streak bonus: getting 3 of a kind or more can further increase score, encouraging strategic betting
 Shop system: spending money for upgrade modifers enhances gameplay
 Win/loss condition: players can progress through the rounds, win the game, or run out of money and lose
 
 Try and get through all 5 rounds! 
 Bonus Easter egg for hitting 5 7's! 
 All assets were hand drawn, audio and sound was either bought or from free libraries. 
 Credits: 
     
 Art - imbretirl, samanthaliu Sound - Ovani sounds, The Costco Guys(5 big booms), Pixabay freesound_community (fake cash register), mixkit (slot machine wheel) Font - dafont.com (name: 04b_30) Programming - imbretirl, samanthaliu, boba_7

title: AI Combat
logline: A Prototype of combat AIs that are capable of dodging and countering your attacks
description:
Combat AI was a prototype project I created so I could learn how to make AI and get a better understanding. During my first sprint of development I looking into the the basics and learned about behaviour trees, AI Controller, AI Perception and stimulus sense and already the AI toward the player as well as reacting the projectiles the player shoot at them and have animations also implemented. 
 The second sprint was a bit of catch up to where I intended to be but I managed to have the AI capable of dodging and countering already, the way I got where the projectile was to the player was by using the AI's viewpoint and the projectile's location to make a point that is checks four sections that decide if the player is front, right, left and back and with this I also made a front and back roll task that allows the AI to disengage or close the distance. 
 The third sprint is where I implemented the attack and also started to use GDC talks as a reference to my design such as Spider-Man's  talks on AI which gave valuable information on how I could solve some issues like enemies building up and making AI that don't overwhelm the player. like by getting the closest AI character and indicating they can attack but if hat isn't completed after a while another character take's that role.    
 In the end this project was the result of trial and error and if I tried and made this from scratch I believe I would have a much better outcome.

title: Promise Me, You'll Live
logline: VN Created in 4 Days for Velox Turbo
description:
âYou keep your promise, I'll keep mine.â 
 
   This game was created in 4 days for the Velox Turbo jam (2023) 
       In the moments between life and death, a promise for second chances can be found at the crossroads. 
 
       Petitioners come to the crossroads seeking a promise for more time. To take care of their loved ones. To not fear death again. You, as the Keeper of the Crossroads, have a simple enough job. You offer promises in exchange, and bind these promises so that the souls can be collected. 
       But now someone else has found your crossroads, and wishes to exchange promises. Someone  alive. 
 
 
 
 References to death, murder, abandonment, adultery, and abuse. 
 
 
 
 
 'Reaper.' 'Crossroad devil.' 'Demon.' 'Death incarnate.' You've been called many things, but none are quite true to what you are. The holder of thousands of promises and second chances, you are a dealer in promises. They make theirs, you make yours. As long as they keep up their end, you'll keep yours. 
 
 But is there more to you than being a dealer of promises and hope? 
 
 â½ 
 
 
 
 A living man who wanders into your crossroads, seeking promises. He's definitely not your traditional clientele, and the more you see of him, the more sure you are that he has ulterior motives for coming to your crossroad.
 
 â½ 
 
 
 The voice inside your skull, the claws at your back, and sometimes the large shadowy manifestation that appears in your crossroads to make sure you meet your quotas. You know he collects the souls you collect with your dealings, but what he does with those souls are anyone's guess.  
 â½ 
 
 
 
 Spirits that have come to the crossroads between the inhale and exhale of their last breath to deal for a second chance. Some are worthy, and some aren't-- it's up to you to decide. 
 
 
 
 
 
 11 riddles with 1 worded answers Hints and answers available in-game. 3 Endings 1 Love interest 3 CGs Original soundtrack Partial voice acting Dyslexic font options Gender neutral MC 
 
 
 After selecting "You propose a different promise." while making a deal with Lidia, if you answer the riddle correctly the game will break.  Either choose to enter the riddle incorrectly or rollback and choose "You will accept the terms she presents. They're lopsided, but they're her wishes." to continue and complete the story.
