title: Belly Flop
logline: simple C64 platformer
description:
Belly Flop 
 For the Commodore 64!   
 Nuclear War has wiped out all life on the surface of planet. But life persist. Freshly crawled from the ocean, this floppy fish is ready to re-colonize the land.  
 Living on the land seems to involve a lot of falling down flat on your belly.  Watch out for radioactive dust particles.   
 The goal of this game is to get to end of the level, all the way to the right, without getting killed.    
 Controls: 
 Web emulator: Left & Right  Arrow keys to move Space  to start / restart game.  
 Note:  you may need to mouse click inside the game window once, to enable sound and controls.  
 C64: Use  Joystick 2 Left & Right  to move Fire  to start / restart game.  
 Post mortem: 
 This is my first game for the C64, written entirely in assembly language. The code for  game mechanics and all graphics (sprites, screens) were  all made over a weekend for MiniJam #180 . A lot of  code for screen scrolling, basic sprite handling,  16 bit integer math & other infrastructure was written  before the Jam. But, oh boy, did I do a lot of debugging! 
 I'm also really happy that I found the C64 emulator from Floooh's awesome Chips project. I made some really simple changes to the source code to load a PRG file from the start, and it's perfect for hosting on Itch.      
 The game itself is really basic and simple. Just one small level. No animations. Writing a game in assembly for a weekend jam is a bit too much really. Still, i'm pretty happy with how far I got.   
 The music is probably the best bit in the game, but I just took it from the internet. See Credits.  
 Credits: 
 Code & graphics: kwikrick 
 Music:  Man Oil  by  Jeguri  ,2024 Zymosis   
 Tools: 
 C64 emulator: Chips by Floooh.  https://floooh.github.io/tiny8bit/ 
 Kick Assembler:  https://theweb.dk/KickAssembler/Main.html#frontpage 
 Relaunch 64:  http://www.popelganda.de/relaunch64.html 
 Petscii   Editor:  https://petscii.krissz.hu/

title: I Got This

description: Navigate the challenges of teenage life and type 2 diabetes. I GOT THIS is an interactive, first-person, educational story that follows a young teenage girl who discovers that she has type 2 diabetes, one of the fastest growing diseases in the US and around the world. Told in a real-world setting, I GOT THIS focuses on the causes, symptoms, prevention, and social aspects of the life-changing disease.  MORE I GOT THIS was created by UC Berkeleyâs The Lawrence Hall of Science in 2015 with funding from the National Institutes of Health, in collaboration with the UCSF Benioff Childrenâs Hospital Oakland, and using advice from curriculum developers at the Hall and Tufts University.

You're a homeless man, trying your best to get drunk. But the upper class has it all, you can't get to it...  Or can you?

    Turrets will track your mouse pointer until you deploy an AI unit that enables auto-aim. Additionally, certain objects (like turrets) can be rotated using the  R  key when placed next to two walls.

title: Finares DEMO
logline: Finares Chapter 1 Demo
description:
Please remember that the game is still in active development and this is only a demo. 
 The Game 
 You are Ares, a stray dog who returns from an adventure only to discover that all humans have disappeared. At first, you don't worry too much, but then a mysterious female dog appears in your village, and everything changes... 
 Discover notes, diary entries, newspaper clippings, official announcements, and more to uncover what happened in the final days before humans vanished. Each chapter is an open-world setting filled with secrets waiting to be explored.  
 Use your nose to follow trails and reach hidden locations. Rely on your companion's abilities to interact with the world—opening doors, picking locks, restoring power, finding passwords, and solving puzzles. But beware: Interacting with human objects is exhausting for dogs. Your companion will need regular breaks and distractions to regain her strength.  
 The Dogs 
 The main characters in this game are all dogs, of course, and I'll introduce you to the most important ones here: 
 Ares as himself 
 
 Runa as Fina 
 
 ... as ... (not in the DEMO) 
 
 This Version 
 This free demo only includes Chapter 1. The other chapters are mostly developed but not completely finished yet. Don't worry, I'm working on it. I would be very happy to receive your feedback!

title: Phantom Leap (AMIGA - WIP)
logline: A classic Amiga jump and run puzzle game
description:
Phantom Leap â The Great Forest Adventure! (AMIGA - WIP)  
    
 A winding path cuts through the deep forest, hidden among moss-covered ruins and ancient trees. Legends speak of untold secrets, hidden treasures—and countless dangers. Only the bravest adventurers dare to enter, seeking to uncover the mysteries that lie within.
  
 As a fearless explorer, you leap into this adventure, jumping over deep chasms, climbing towering platforms, and searching for the hidden paths that lead to valuable coins. But beware—the forest is teeming with strange creatures that don't take kindly to intruders. Furious mushrooms hop aggressively in your way, trying to stop you at all costs. And theyâre not alone! Other mysterious beings lurk in the shadows, ready to challenge your every move.
  
 But you're not defenseless! With a daring head stomp, you can defeat enemies and clear your path forward. However, not all creatures go down so easily—some are quick, others are tough, and a few guard secret passages that only the sharpest explorers will uncover.
  
 Every coin you collect brings you closer to the top of the high-score list. But it's not just about reaching the finish line—true masters explore every inch of the forest, uncover hidden areas, and break records. Will you be the one to discover all the secrets and claim the number one spot?
  
 Leap into action and find out—only in  Phantom Leap !  
 
 Phantom-Leap-V1_1WIP - Fix for the game: 
 Unfortunately, the previous version crashed. I have uploaded a new version in the hope that it will work again. Unfortunately, I no longer have an AMig to test because mine is defective. The game ran on Winuae without any problems. I hope the problem is solved now  
 Phantom-Leap-V1_2_WIP: 
 Teleporter tubes renewed (I hope they are now easier to recognize)  Added more coins to level 1  Added level 1 tutorial (not a nerdy tutorial but I explained some features in the game to make it easier to recognize) Level 2 small fix on a platform (now you can't fall through anymore) Character's outlines have been changed from dark red to black.  Level two at the end made the teleporter more visible and made a coin under it  fixed some bugs  
 Note: 
 Phantom Leap  is still in development. Currently, there are only four playable levels, but more content and challenges will be added in future updates! Stay tuned for more adventures!  
 
 Minimum Requirements (real Amiga Hardware): 
 Commodore Amiga 500 (512 KB Ram extension)
  Kickstart 1.3

title: Eclipsia Chronicles
logline: The balance of light and darkness is in your hands...
description:
One day, Helia Town is visited by the princess. But, when she's kidnapped by a mysterious dark sorcerer named Malazra to carry out his evil schemes, Taiyo must step up and become the hero! With the help of your allies, and the guidance of Trila, a mysterious voice coming from the crystal on your bracelet, you'll travel the world to find the three orbs. 
 Along the way, you'll meet various friends and foes. There's Violet, a shy girl who's new to fighting, Captain Caravela, an old pirate captain who loves treasure, Camilla, Malazra's lackey who can turn invisible, and Nightshade, a woman who wants the orbs for her own mysterious reasons... 
 Will you be able to collect the three orbs and save the world? Adventures and mysteries lie before you... 
 
 Credits 
 This game was created with the RPG Maker VX Ace engine. 
 This game also uses scripts which were created by the following authors: 
 Ace Status Menu, Ace Message System,  Ace Battle Engine, Enemy HP Bars, Gab Window, Slippery Tiles, Activate Common Events - Yanfly 
 Venka's Bestiary - Venka

title: Laberinto Chulongo El Arbol Repongo
description:
Hace siglos, en lo mÃ¡s profundo de las catacumbas de  Nova Roma , la familia  Magister  dejÃ³ un secreto olvidado por la historia:  el Arbor Vitae , un pergamino que contenÃ­a la genealogÃ­a de la familia mÃ¡s influyente del Imperio. Pero este no era un linaje cualquiera, pues entre sus nombres se hallaban grandes emperadores, gladiadores legendarios y figuras de dudosa seriedad, como  Antonius Navarrius ,  Magiter  Pressmanius ,  Virginia Misculare , y la enigmÃ¡tica  Encarnita Gabius . 
 Con la caÃ­da de Nova Roma, el Ã¡rbol se perdiÃ³, y con Ã©l, la gloria de la dinastÃ­a  Magister . Sin embargo, una profecÃ­a dejÃ³ escrito que un descendiente digno descenderÃ­a a las catacumbas y reunirÃ­a las piezas del  Arbor Vitae  para restaurar el honor de su linaje.
 
 Ese descendiente eres tÃº.
 
 La misiÃ³n 
 Armado solo con una  linterna de aceite y un pergamino en blanco , debes explorar el  laberinto subterrÃ¡neo , desentraÃ±ar los enigmas de las criptas y encontrar los fragmentos del Ã¡rbol genealÃ³gico. Cada sala oculta  inscripciones, acertijos y trampas  dejadas por los antiguos guardianes de la historia.
 
 Algunos espÃ­ritus de tus ancestros aÃºn vagan por las catacumbas, ofreciendo su sabidurÃ­a. Otros, sin embargo, han olvidado su deber y se han convertido en  sombras burlonas  que tratarÃ¡n de confundirte con trampas y falsos linajes.
 
 El destino de Nova Roma estÃ¡ en tus manos 
 Completa el Ã¡rbol, descubre quiÃ©n eres realmente y  decide el futuro del linaje Magister :
 
 Â¿RestaurarÃ¡s la gloria de tu familia?
 Â¿ForjarÃ¡s un nuevo destino?
 Â¿O quedarÃ¡s atrapado en la oscuridad de las catacumbas, olvidado como los demÃ¡s?
 
 La historia la escriben los vencedores...

title: Haunted House
logline: El juego de rol de terror rÃ¡pido
description:
Haunted House es un juego de rol donde las propias reglas ayudan a  crear el ambiente. Son reglas completas pero de estilo Ã¡gil, breve, que  permiten jugar aventuras de misterio, terror y crimen.  
 Este manual  bÃ¡sico incluye todo lo necesario para crear personajes y enemigos, asÃ­  como enfrentarse a todo tipo de situaciones peligrosas, incluyendo  combate y magia. Pero el plato fuerte son dos bloques de reglas: las  creadas recrear el ambiente de pelÃ­culas de terror y las pensadas para  crear aventuras en solo media hora. Las primeras incluyen normas para el  miedo, huidas a ciegas, accidentes mortales, locura, perderse y  separarse del grupo, asesinos en apariencia invencibles, desgracias que  se veÃ­an venir desde el principio y otros motivos para no quedarte a  solas en la oscuridad. Las otras son un conjunto de mecanismos para  crear partidas rÃ¡pidas, incluyendo motivaciones, argumento, mapas,  enemigos y obstÃ¡culos en un lugar encantado en solo media hora.  
 Esta  descarga incluye tambiÃ©n la hoja de personaje en un pdf separado, el  documento de erratas y el tema musical instrumental "coraza", del grupo  de rock "Las Madres", pensado para sonar al final de cada partida de  Haunted House, a modo de tema para los tÃ­tulos de crÃ©dito.

title: A Little Inconvenience
logline: Every roadblock to you is just a little inconvenience...
description:
"Love always begins with a flicker." 
 Darius' life was zapped of any meaning and feeling. Everything that  used to make him feel something, became nothing. To cope with it, he  stopped by the Quick Stop to pick up a cheap beer. That's when he was  greeted by an angel: Sabrina. Her serene voice, her undeniable beauty,  and the way she carried herself... Upon seeing her, Darius' heart  started to beat again.
     
 That was one year ago, and although Sabrina doesn't remember the day, it's Darius's most treasured memory. Every day, he comes to visit her, dawning the same bag she gave him the day they met. He wishes to repay her for giving him his life back: himself so they can always be together and make each others' lives better. But when someone threatens that possibility, Darius is willing to do whatever it takes to ensure his angel remains his... 
 
 
 
 
 
 While A Little Inconvenience does contain any sexual content, because of its inherent dark nature it is aimed at a 17+ audience. With that being said, here are the content and trigger warnings that are featured in the demo and/or full game. Please play with caution. 
 NOTE: Due to this being an ongoing project, this list can be added to. 
 A Little Inconvenience's Content and Trigger Warnings as of 3/2/25 
 Blood Flashing or flickering lights (Can be disabled in the options!) Grotesque discussion of cutting up fish (i.e. blood, fish guts, their smell, etc) Kidnapping Manipulation Murder Stalking Unhealthy obsession 
 
 
 Renameable protagonist 8k+ words Accessibility Options Set up your accessibility options during the first time set up and adjust them any time in the options menu! Font Choice (Default, Atkinson, OpenDyslexic) Self-Voicing (Can also be activated by pressing V) Screenshake Toggle Flashing Lights Toggle Sound & Image Captions Adjustable font size Multiple scene variations depending on your choices and Darius' behavior 4 CGs (With 2 more in an upcoming update!) Alternating POVs A  soon to be dead  goober of a boyfriend A nice  yandere  man who wears a bag over his head  who totally won't kill you or your loved ones, if you manage to piss him off enough! 
 
 
 
 Project Lead, Writer, Programmer : Kristi " HusbandoGoddess " Jimenez Sprite Artist, Title Screen Artist, Concept Artist :  Mole CG Artist :  ktswulf   Editor, Sensitivity Reader :   AlwaysJMB Proofreaders :  Rachel H. Rameau ,  Morgan of Job at Place 
 Logo Artist :  Hadara Madrak Food Artist :  Floramisu Promotional Artwork :  Saleha Chowdhury GUI :  Static Horror GUI Theme  by ess-vn-assets Backgrounds Obtained From :  Minikle  ( DLSite ),  min-chi Music Obtained From :  DOVA-Syndrome ,  Peritune SFX Obtained From : Pixabay, Zapsplat
 Ren'Py Ripple Transition :  Feniks Ren'Py Speech Pauses :  KigyoDev Ren'Py Auto-Highlight :  Wattson Caption Tool :  npckc Emotes :  TORaIKI Thank you to my patrons for their support! : Pyonkotchi 
 
 
 As of right now, players can see a glimpse of A Little Inconvenience's story and its characters. As the game takes shape, one final demo will be released and then it'll be the full version which will be a commercial product.  The price for the final product has not been determined. 
 
 If you would like to support the development of A Little Inconvenience, and help me maintain my gig as an indie game developer, consider donating a few bucks here, on Ko-fi, or subscribing to my Patreon. Every bit of money I earn goes towards helping me as an individual and my projects.  
 Ko-fi  |  Patreon 
 
 Consider  leaving a review  + spreading the word about my work! It helps out the game a lot with reaching more people. 
 
 Follow me on Bluesky  |  Follow me on Tumblr

 Under Your Skin (18+) by HelloYinny

title: Wisdom Quest
logline: Help Sylvia to recover the lost spell books from the haunted castle.
description:
Explore the Haunted Castle 
 Enter a gloomy, abandoned castle that was once home to an ancient society of witches, until they were turned into monsters and ghosts.  Control Sylvia, a young wizard who unknowingly carries the legacy of an ancient lineage in her blood.  Recover the ancient books of wisdom and discover the spells you can cast. Survive the monsters and prepare for the final battle. 
 Face Dangers in your Journey! 
 During your journey through the abandoned castle, you'll face various ghostly enemies who will try to stop you. Shoot them or hit them with precision. 
 Use your powers! 
 You'll need to find ancient scrolls to fill your Wisdom bar. More scrolls, more power. Fire spells and eliminate enemies, or regenerate your health. Use your Wisdom wisely. 
 
 Controls 
 W: Move up A: Move left S: Move down D: Move right Mouse:  Target 1: Activate hit with the stick (Close attack, no Wisdom) 2: Activate magic bullet (Shoot, use Wisdom)  4: Activate healing (use Wisdom) Left Click: Use the hability you activated

title: PIPEDEMONIUM (EARLY DEMO)
logline: Psychological Horror Plumbing Game
description:
Psychological Horror Game about plumbing in an abandoned hospital. 
 "My name is Kiel. I work at a plumbing service. I was tasked with fixing the piping systems of an abandoned hospital. I had a brother, who tragically died at a young age. And I want to uncover the truth.. How everything happened. How I became like this. How I almost gave up on life, and how.. Did he leave.." 
 
 You play as Kiel. A plumber tasked with fixing the piping systems of an abandoned hospital. He had a brother, who died unknowingly. You learn more about the hospital as you make your way to the piping systems. Where it all happened. 
 
 The game currently only offers 4 maps. 3 campaign maps, and 1 Testing Map. 
 EVERYTHING IS SUBJECT TO CHANGE! 
 
 Made with Godot Engine 3.6, GLES2 Video Driver.

title: Do Up
logline: A parkour game inspired by old Minecraft maps.
description:
Do Up  is a parkour game inspired by recent viral games and the classic Minecraft parkour maps.
  
 To make up for my limited artistic skills, I opted for a prototype-style artistic approach, using the excuse that itâs a grand intellectual experiment as part of the game's lore.
  
 I still have a lot of work to do to improve the experience as the player climbs through the map. I feel like itâs too difficult and the map is too short, so Iâm posting it here on itch.io to gather feedback.
  
 For those who managed to finish it, it would be interesting to know how long it took you to do so! 
 I added support for multiple languages, so thereâs a good chance it will be available in your language too! 
 
 Minimum Requirements:  I have added various graphical options to make the game accessible to everyone. The only requirement is that your GPU supports the Vulkan renderer.

title: No more Bubbles
logline: Pop, pop, pop, you just can't stop.
description:
If you like the game please consider the kickstarter so I can buy the licences required: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/bengaunt/no-more-bubbles 
 Join the discord here: https://discord.gg/kfJ6q6h 
 This is almost in a finished state, please read the "incomplete" instructions before playing. Although it's fairly obvious. Updates will appear depending on user interaction and requirements and the below. 
 HOW TO PLAY: 
 On starting the game, bubbles will float up to the top of the screen. If any bubble reaches the top of the screen it will cause you to lose a life. If all your lives are lost the game is over. 
 Click/Tap on the bubbles to Pop them but be careful any miss clicks or taps will result in the bubbles starting to speed up and increase in number. 
 Every now and again bonus bubbles will spawn. 
 +5 and +10 will add the respective value to your score. 
 Lighting will pop all bubbles on screen and any in the bubble bath about to appear. 
 Skull - Unknown? 
 Duck will spawn a rubber duckie that will swim across the screen, popping bubbles as it collides with them. 
 Snail will start to slow down the bubbles, this is not instant. 
 Heart will give you an extra life. 
 Be warned, the bubbles will start to get faster as the level progresses. 
 After a while a boss will appear and and you must defeat them by surviving the extra bubbles they will spawn. 
 Good luck 
 
 
 Things yet to add: Real Animations!!! Boss Bonus and Animated titles Online High Scores (Local only at the moment) Better Music More mayhem Titles of people who supported, when and if. And the final polish and anything you want.

title: Interview with an Ichthyologist
logline: A Pulp Horror Comedy Choose-your-path Adventure
description:
Work in progress 
 Brace yourself for 5 minutes of premium 1930s pulp horror comedy schlock! 
 You've managed to land an interview with the illustrious Doctor Phineas Eelman, legendary ichthyologist and infamous recluse â the first interview he's granted since returning as the sole survivor from his disastrous expedition a year ago! 
 But something is rotten in the crumbling Eelman family Castle… 
 Will you live to write your tell-all exposÃ©, or will your plucky reporter windup fish food? 
 The game only takes about 5 minutes to beat, but there's a bajillion different endings. (Seriously, I kind of lost count. Did I mention that you can shield surf down stairs like Legolas?) 
 Anyways, try it out. 
 IF YOU DARE. 
 I started this as a writing test for a prospective employer and enjoyed it so much that I kept filling it out. It's still pretty rough around the edges, but I'm enjoying it quite a bit. More endings to come!

title: 7 Precious Chances
description:
7 PRECIOUS CHANCES
 
 RECLAIM THE KING'S TREASURE!
 
 The dragons have taken over the castle and stolen all the kingdom's treasures! As the brave prince, you must dodge fireballs, outmaneuver these greedy beasts, and take back what rightfully belongs to your family. But beware - you only have seven precious chances to survive!
 
 FEATURES
 
 Two-Stage Action: Run across the bridge dodging fireballs, then navigate the treasure room to collect valuable loot!
 Simple Controls: Jump, crouch, and strafe to avoid danger as you venture deeper into dragon territory
 Escalating Challenge: Face increasingly difficult dragons as you progress through the castle
 Retro Aesthetic: Enjoy vibrant 16x16 pixel art with a limited color palette that changes as you progress
 Score Attack: How much treasure can you reclaim before losing all seven of your precious chances?
 
 STORY
 
 The Royal Court has been driven out by a hoard of dragons. These greedy flying lizards have taken over the Castle and are hoarding all of the family's treasure. The King laments, begging for someone to take back what has been stolen.
 
 You are the Prince, bravely raiding the castle to take the treasure back. Despite being just a normal human, you are nimble enough to jump and duck to dodge the dragons' fireballs. Can you recover the kingdom's wealth and restore honor to your family name?
 
 GAMEPLAY
 
 BRIDGE STAGE: Cross the dangerous bridge while dodging incoming fireballs from the castle's dragon guardians.
 
 TREASURE ROOM: Navigate the top-down store room, collecting treasures while continuing to avoid dragon attacks, then make your daring escape!
 
 With each successful raid, you'll loop back to the bridge to attempt an even more challenging run. How many treasures can you collect before your seven precious chances run out?
 
 CONTROLS
 
 WASD/Arrow Keys: Move (strafe left/right on bridge, all directions in treasure room)
 Space: Jump (bridge stage only)
 S/Down Arrow: Crouch (bridge stage only)

title: Dragonskeep
logline: A whimsical card game about being the best dragon shopkeeper!
description:
To play this game, you must own  Tabletop Simulator  on Steam.  
 Then, click  here  and click 'Subscribe' while logged into your Steam account. :) It will add Dragonskeep to your list of Tabletop Simulator games! 
 The rulebook is included digitally in the Tabletop Simulator game, or you can download the rulebook as a PDF below. 
 ~ 
 What is Dragonskeep? 
 Dragonskeep is a whimsical, strategic card game that transports players into a fantastical world where dragons run their own item shops. Players take on the role of  dragon shopkeepers , each managing a unique item shop filled with oddities and magical wares to attract a variety of customers.
   
 You have only one year until the annual street festival, a gathering where dragon shopkeepers from faraway lands come together to showcase and sell their goods. Make your home-dwelling proud by offering up rare goods no other dragons have and establishing yourself as the greatest dragon shopkeeper that ever lived! 
 ~ 
 This game was created for a Game Design class in December 2023. :)

title: Path of the Ronin æµªäººã®é
logline: Your master was murdered and you have been stripped of your rank as a samurai.  The Path for revenge is set.
description:
Premise 
 Your master was murdered and you have been stripped of your rank as a samurai.  
 The Path for revenge is set. 
 ... 
 Tutorial 
 Remember your masters training: 
 
 To hit your enemy, you must keep the right distance. A and D to move left or right 
 
 
 While you have exactly the right distance to your enemy, your focusbar will light up green and you will be able to strike unharmed. 
 
 
 
 Wait for the right moment, plan your attack. Only the final strike will count. LEFT-CLICK to visualise your attack when the line appears yellow 
 ... 
 > If you attack at the wrong moment or from the wrong distance, your enemy will punish your mistake! < 
 
 
 Your enemy will not wait for you to act. Watch his movement closely and learn when to dodge his attacks. SPACE + A or D to evade 
 Now, avenge your master, restore his honor! 
 
 Credits: Code and Music by  @Liam-kl Art and Music by  @Christopher-Gr OST on Soundcloud

 What is Dish & Deal? 
 In  Dish & Deal , players must serve customers by completing their meal orders. Every dish successfully served earns  money , but failing to complete an order means  losing money, so every choice matters!
 
 The game features:
 
   Strategic meal serving  â Complete as many dishes as possible before running out of options.
   Power-up deckbuilding  â Unlock and use special abilities to influence each round.
   Risk & reward system  â Every dish is a gamble; play it safe or go all in.
   Four unique food pools  â Start with three pools of meals, and if you're skilled enough, unlock the  ultimate challenge  where all food types are combined! 
 
 The game is in early access and will be released on Steam in early summer 2025. Steam keys will be given to those who purchase it here.

title: Barrel Run
logline: Run through a mysterious cave which has dangers lerking ahead.
description:
ABOUT 
 A college project to learn principals of Unity. This game is inspired by Donkey Kong with its gameplay where you jump over barrels. It is infinite gameplay until you eventually lose. Every new level it gets harder as more barrels spawn and more bigger ones spawn. The barrels have a chance to spawn at a random interval and random size (small or big), random power-ups spawn to help the player (health and hammer). Use hammer to smash barrels to not get yourself concussed. The game ends when the player's health is 0. I added a video of my video essay. It is very cringe and it sounds like I'm dead, I am not. 
 INSTRUCTIONS 
 Click play in the Main Menu! 
 Go through as many levels as you can!
 Don't lose!
 
 MOVEMENT 
 W/Space  - To jump 
 A  - Move left
 D  - Move right FUTURE 
 There is no plans in fixing bugs or developing this idea any further. There some major issues which can be fixed by relaunching or some that you have to accept.  
 CREDITS 
 Player Sprites Tiles & Decorations Sounds: Ouch Jump Fail/Death Success Pickup Barrel Breaking Ambience Barrel Rolling

title: Ultimate Racing
logline: Racing cars
description:
Simple and challenging game for car racing lovers. Choose from two racing circuits and two cars. Each racing circuit has its own challenging turns and straights. Race against competitive AI cars accompanied by exciting background music. One of the cars the HyperCar is very fast and 4WD. It is a high polygon car with three different views (both cars has three different views). Inside, hood/bonnet and behind the car are the available views. The other car a muscle car (also high polygon) is RWD and has its own sound and is more challenging because it drifts easily.  Both cars have damage sensing technology that makes the car damaged in the body of the car if it hits other cars or barriers at a specific speed/impact-force. 
 You need to have a relatively modern computer with a not to old graphics card. My recommendation is an Intel Core i7 or comparable computer. The graphics is advanced and require and relatively new card. Nvidia Geforce RTX 4060 or newer. The more recent card the better the frame rate (fps).  You need Windows 10 or Windows 11 to run the game.

title: L.E.A.F.
logline: Metroidvania where you can use the seed abilities of your gardening robot to modify your environment
description:
( /!\ Controls are shown in screenshots of the game  /!\ ) /!\ We are aware of a bug near the end of the game that causes significant lag when picking up a certain upgrade/ability. We sincerely apologize for the frustration this may cause. We will do our best to fix it and upload a patch as soon as the jam's voting period ends. This game was made during the  MVM 27 Game jam 
 Plot: Woken up by a mysterious entity called L.E.A.F, you play as an old gardener robot in a forest lost and defiled by the remnants of humanity. Your goal is to explore, fight the evil machines and heal the forest! The journey will be long, but who knows what you will find along the way? 
 
 Key features : 
 
 A 2D Metroidvania action adventure game with a shooting combat system Unique seed system to interact with your environment Get various upgrades choice as you cure the flora More than 10 enemies to discover Original visuals mixing cartoon and flat design

 Emberstaff Studio: 
 Game Design , Programming and SFX Martin Beaussart 
 Narrative Design and Programming David Brevers 
 Art direction & Animation Marthilde Dochy

 Additional UI asset Kenney   Musics: Ovni sounds humble bundle tier 3 pack

title: The Fae King Is My Roommate
logline: âSlice-of-Life Dark Fantasy Romance VN
description:
The Fae King Is My Roommate 
 Slice-of-Life Dark Fantasy Romance VN 
 
 WARNING  for  DARK  fantasy themes, including being spirited away by a fae (dubious consent), attempted lies and manipulation, mentions of NPC deaths, medical experiments on animals and people, suggestive themes (consensual), drug and alcohol use, strong language. 
 
 Summary: 
 Your peaceful life as a hermit is rudely interrupted when a âdelicate young manâ gets himself caught in a mutated Venus flytrap. 
 Will you save him, or let him be eaten? That is, if he even needs saving in the first place. 
 
 Features (Demo): 
 - Customizable protagonist (name, sprite) 
 - Around 5k words, for about a half hour playthrough 
 - 1 CG and 3 item images 
 - One (1) definitely-not-a-Fae Romance Interest  - âBobâ 
 - A dog 
 Rating: Mature (see warning) 
 
 Characters: 
 MC  - A local hermit.  Youâre studying botany, minding your own business, and trying not to step into any wayward mushroom circles on your way back from foraging.  
 âBobâ -  A man whom you definitely havenât been seeing wandering around the forest before. Since youâve been taught manners, you also ignore his unnaturally sparkly eyes, and his talking dog. Itâs only polite to tactfully ignore anotherâs oddities.  
 
 Sir Albert the Brave  - Bobâs loyal and faithful  valet  pet corgi. 
 
 
 Credits: 
 Engine: [ Ren'Py by Tom Rothamel ]
 Writing: [ PDRRook ], [ Dom ]
 Art Assets, GUI Design: [ PDRRook ]
 Coding, GUI Coding: [ Dom ]
 Music and SFX: Nicolas Jeudy of DARK FANTASY STUDIO, Ovani Sound,  Joel Steudler
 Fonts, Free for Personal and Commercial Use: [ Fredericka the Great ], [ Atkinson Hyperlegible ]
 Leaf Transition Stock Videos: [ Vecteezy ] 
 
 Disclaimer: 
 This is the  official  Itch.io page for the  Demo and (future) Full Game  of the "The Fae King Is My Roommate" game.
 
 Any version of the game downloaded from a different page (besides the official future Steam page) is not ours and was redistributed without permission.
 We are not responsible for any malicious software or viruses that may appear when visiting and/or downloading from sites having non-official distributions.
 Streaming is only allowed for the  DEMO with commentary  added to it. Streaming the FULL game is  NOT  allowed. 
 
 Links: 
 [ Carrd ] [ Tumblr ] [ Bluesky ] [ Kofi ] Individual Studio Carrd: [ PDRRook ], [ Dom - The Cottage Workshop ] 
 
 FAQ: 
 Q: When will the full game be released?
 A: Since we're working on this game in our spare time between work, weâre unable to provide a concrete release date. It will be, however, announced in a devlog and on our [ Tumblr ] and [ Bluesky ].
 Q: Will there be a Steam release?
 A: Yes. More concrete information will be announced in a devlog and on our [ Tumblr ] and [ Bluesky ]. Please do bear in mind that Steam offers only the desktop version. If youâd like to play the game on mobile (Android), purchase the game from itch.io.
 Q: Will the game be paid?
 A: Yes, this game is a commercial project. The final price depends on the number of assets, script length, coding time, and additional costs like Steam fees and licenses.
 Q: Will there be any 18+ spicy NSFW  content?
 Maybe. If there is, it will be in a separate stand-alone Extra/DLC build, NOT in the base game itself, due to restrictions Steam has for 18+ content.

title: Heart Hunter
logline: A rouge-like game where your health, ammo and inventory are all in one place as hearts!
description:
Heart Hunter  is an 8-bit, top-down, rouge-like combat game where you fight mobs and harvest their hearts! Each time you get attacked or try to shoot, you lose one of your heart. 
 Different enemies drop different hearts with special effects (or not). The effect is triggered when hearts are shot or hit the target.  
 Wisely manage your hearts because they are your ammo, health bar, and also your inventory! 
 Characters 
 I don't have a story for this game (yet), but I can tell you about the mobs! 
 Lancer fun fact: the pronunciation of "lancer" resembles that of "blue"  in Chinese! drops  Librarian He spends too much time in between the bookshelves. Now he can only walk horizontally. FYI, it's contagious. drops  Spiger A spider with a pig's nose on its head. Well, here's another linguistic fact: half of the Chinese word for "spider" is pronounced exactly the same as that of "pig". drops    Citrus Liluton A flying orange with creepy eye. Oh, just so you know, the two black lines on its forehead are not eyes. Librarian helped drew that for her with a marker. drops    Pokob Walking beaker with mysterious red liquid in it. Kind of makes you wonder, huh? Is it  p aint  o r  k etchup  o r  b lood? drops    
 Controls 
 Move:  press W, A, S, D to move around Shoot:  left-click to shoot your rightmost heart Punch : right-click to punch, short-ranged and not very effective, but the knock-back sure can help Select bullet : press Q/E to select a heart to shoot (the selected heart will look slightly larger) 
 press Ctrl/Command + Q/E to quickly select the first or the last one of your hearts scroll your mouse wheel to quickly select a heart you want 
 Language 
 Heart Hunter now only supports English and Chinese. English is the default. If you want to switch languages, press  Ctrl/Command + L . 
 
 
 Credit & Copyright 
 The characters' and effects' sprites are drawn by me with Resprite. The rest of the assets are from different sources, stated as follows. 
 Heart Images 
 All the heart images used in this game is originally from the open-source Operating System  SerenityOS  emoji images 
 Copyright (c) 2018-2023, SerenityOS Developers. Copyright (c) 2022-2023, Gegga Thor <xexxa@serenityos.org> All rights reserved. 
 This resource is licensed under BSD 2-Clause license. 
 Music 
 Music is from  Freesound , listed as follows. 
 https://freesound.org/people/EVRetro/sounds/583613/ https://freesound.org/people/orginaljun/sounds/531459/ https://freesound.org/people/Victor_Natas/sounds/642313/ 
 Credit goes to EVRetro, orginaljun, and Victor_Natas 
 Sound 
 Sound effects are from  Freesound , listed as follows. 
 https://freesound.org/people/Volvion/sounds/324088/ https://freesound.org/people/jeckkech/sounds/391660/ https://freesound.org/people/Mrthenoronha/sounds/507703/ https://freesound.org/people/JohanDeecke/sounds/368326/ https://freesound.org/people/Breviceps/sounds/450617/ https://freesound.org/people/Tissman/sounds/456168/ https://freesound.org/people/sound_and_fury/sounds/652659/ https://freesound.org/people/julius_galla/sounds/195772/ https://freesound.org/people/Fupicat/sounds/538148/ https://freesound.org/people/Jagadamba/sounds/253847/ https://freesound.org/people/7103/sounds/575784/ https://freesound.org/people/EVRetro/sounds/533034/

title: Gamble Sword
logline: Gamble you way to victory
description:
Submitted for the Calgary Prize Pool for GamePop 2025 
 Left click for main fire, Right click for alt fire. 
 Ctrl/Shift - Crouch 
 Space - Jump 
 Your are given a swing type and an effect type each round. Destroy all the enemies with your random abilities to progress. 
 You can deflect projectiles with your swings. 
 You also deal more damage the faster you go. 
 Also, wallrunning is a net-positive. You will ALWAYS gain some speed while wallrunning. 
 There are some waves, and each wave has some enemies. When you beat a level, the music will have a low pass applied and an exit will open up at one end of the stadium. (just check the outside perimeter) Another movement tech: Walking allows you to turn around fast. So if you hold in the direction you are going, and turn your camera smoothly, you can completely redirect your velocity. This is useful at high speeds, just uncrouch (while holding W and looking where your going) and turn your camera to change your direction. Then quickly crouch again to keep your speed! Another Another movement tech: Grabbing onto a wall only takes into account the direction your holding. You can abuse this to turn around really fast! 
 Swing Types: 
 (BASIC) Basic Attack
   (LONG) Long Swing
   (GUARD) Guard then Swing
   (QUICK) Quick Stab
   (BLASTER) Quick swing with long cooldown
   (CHARGE) Charge swing 
 Effect Types: 
 (LAUNCH) Hitting walls and enemies will launch you
   (STUN) Any enemies you hit will be stunned
   (EXPLODE) Explosive enemies on death
   (COMBO) Each consecutive hit boosts damage
   (SPEED) Each hit gives you a speed boost
   (FOLLOWUP) Landing one hit allows you to pull out a second quickly. The second has more damage and knockback.
   (RAGE) Taking damage will double your damage and attack speed for a while 
 (Sorry for how unclear it is of what abilities you get. I didn't have time to implement that) 
 Assets Used: 
 https://freesound.org/people/BennettFilmTeacher/sounds/486234/ 
 https://opengameart.org/content/adventure-theme 
 https://www.fontspace.com/pixelated-elegance-font-f126145 
 https://stocksnap.io/photo/business-man-JJUUYMLKOC 
 Tools used: 
 Audacity, JFXR, Unity, Blender, Kirta. 
 I also used my own "in-house" first person movement script 
 
 ONE FUNCTION was AI! ONE!

title: Capture the Crack!
logline: Card Deckbuilding Roguelike
description:
DISCLAIMER: This is a first prototype and heavily WIP 
 Draw Cards to progress the game and try to capture the Crack. Every Card has a base power and many have special effects.  
 To capture the Crack, you have to reach  at least  the same attacking power as the defense has. If one card is not enough, they are added together. However, only the card that actually captured the Crack (the last card) is allowed to defend.

 PREMISE:  
 One day, you discovered the SuperStar Engine, an artifact of infinite power. A lot of bad guys get wind of this and are on their way to shoot you down and take that SuperStar Engine for themselves (oh no)! Looks like you have no choice but to fight your way out of this predicament using the power granted by the SuperStar Engine (and maybe thwart a cult along the way)...

title: House of Yokai
description:
House of Yokai is a 3D first-person game inspired by Minesweeper. There will be 2 rooms in the game, and each is a different version of Minesweeper.  
 Player can press  WASD  to walk around and  E  to interact with the environment. F to pause the game. 
 Rules: 
 Our game is basically a 3D Minesweeper, with the same rules for all rooms. Players need to avoid the hidden mines and escape safely from the room.  
 Players uncover squares on a grid, avoiding hidden mines.  Numbers on revealed squares indicate adjacent mines.  Players use logic to deduce safe squares and flag mines.  The game is won when all non-mine squares are uncovered.  Clicking on a mine results in a loss.  
 Members: 
 Jiaqi Li, Andressa Zhu, Xin Zhou, Yidan Zhang

title: SauteorFaute
description:
Falling is the cause of rising. 
 Does it hurt? Impossible, you fell on sand.
 
 SauteorFaute  is a punishing game where you need to jump to reach the end. This game is nothing more complicated than that: two keys, one to move forward and the other to jump. Not hard, right? Well, you're wrong! This game will challenge your jumping skills. But donât worry, youâll have all the time you need to think about your strategy... when youâve fallen.
 
 This world has always been hidden beneath a mysterious sky. In reality, we know nothing about this world: only dunes as far as the eye can see and a ceiling that hides most of the sky. But then, what lies behind this false ceiling? Perhaps magnificent treasures, or floating islands like in fantastical tales... One thing is certain: to discover it, thereâs only one way: jump.
 
 Warning: This is a trial version. The full version is available on the Steam platform. Link in More Information / Links /  Steam .

title: RUN RUN ADORA!!
logline: Take a quick jog next to the sunset and see how far you can go.
description:
The game is not intended to be played in fullscreen. The fullscreen button has been added for you to be able to enjoy the game regardless of your display settings. 
 About this game: 
 RUN RUN ADORA!! was made as a gift for the streamer Adora Bunny and is an endless runner with the goal to achieve the highest score possible by running and collecting various collectibles. 
 Controls: 
 All you need is to use is the left mouse button or alternatively the space bar to play the game. 
 List of collectibles: 
 Collectible Description Image Coins A common floating coin. Collecting it adds  10 points  to your score. Coffee Mug A rather infamous coffee mug. Collecting it adds  25 points  to your score. Jar It's a normal jar with a cute ribbon on its side. Collecting it adds  50 points  to your score. Takoyaki A delicious snack with a nostalgic taste. Collecting it adds  100 points  to your score.

title: Burning Out (Pre-Alpha)
logline: Online Co-op Horror Maze-Escape Game
description:
Multiplayer Horror Maze-Escape Game 
 In  Burning Out , a multiplayer horror maze-escape game, you and 3 others are trapped in a monstrous dark maze, armed only with fire. Light your way with your torch to unveil the mazeâs secrets, all while trying to keep contact with prox chat, but be warned… you may not be alone. Your time is ticking: once your fire burns out, soon will you too.       
 
 Mechanics 
 Movement is simple, with WASD, Space jump, and Shift sprint. However, itâs essential to move carefully. The faster you move, the louder you are, but the slower you move, the more fire you waste. Not to mention the risk of encounters. You have 2 hands for inventory slots. Picked up items are managed by swapping hand dominance. 
WASD movement, Shift sprint, Space jump 
 
 Items 
 Every item has a unique use case. The torch (given) is essential to seeing in the darkness, but they burn out. Flames eat away at the wood, and the torch may blow out if handled poorly. The only constant source of fire is the central hearth, but it too, may burn out. 
 
 Multiplayer 
 Youâre not alone here… because you have 3 friends! Areas will require you to work together to access; others, only one of you may enter. Stay together to share a flame, or disperse to cover the halls. Just donât get lost alone. Use proximity chat to make yourselves known. Or donât. 
 
 The Maze 
 The maze is huge. Structured as what seems to be a colosseum of disorientation. Massive walls, scaling ladders, drop zones. Loops, dead ends, crossed paths. Repeating patterns, long hallways, dead spaces, strange structures. Not just do corners obstruct your vision, but the dense fog reeks. Why are you here? 
 
 The Team 
  Burning Out  is brought to you by... 
 PETER YOON ------------------- Web Developer, Gameplay Design, Combat Design 
 MALACHY KENNEDY ------------------- Design Lead, Systems Design, Gameplay Engineering, Writing CONNER WOOD  |  ArtStation ------------------- Lead Artist, 3D Environment, 3D Props, 3D Character/Creature, Shaders and Materials, Lighting, VFX/Particles, UI/UX JOEY JARA ------------------- Audio Lead, Technical Sound Design, Network Engineering, Audio Engineering BRANDON RETANA ------------------- Lead Programmer, Network Engineering, Tools Engineering, AI Engineering ALEX MADAS ------------------- Core Design, Level Design GHASSAN ALHAMDANI ------------------- Gameplay Engineering

You Are A Cat is a first-person cat simulator, where you can live out the luxurious life of a cat.

title: One Piece dating sim
logline: It's your first day as a transferred student at Grandline High School. Try not to mess things up.
description:
About 
 It's your first day as a transferred student at Grandline High School. And this is a dating sim.  As if I need to complain anything at this point. 
 Downloading is highly recommended for a better gaming experience.  The game is in active development, right now there's only Zoro's route .  
 Since Zoro's route is finished and released, you can fill out this form to let me know what other routes you'd like to see in this game:  
 https://forms.gle/Qx68DbnCwXSbTKA1A 
 If you have any questions you can ask them  here  or in the comments.  
 Features 
   16 CG (for now)  ~19k words (for now)  Many choices Multiple endings Customizable MC 
 One Piece is the intellectual property of Eiichiro Oda, Toei and Shueisha. I do not own any rights, except for my art and script. This is just a fan game, as you see.  
 Other stuff 
 Well, if you have nothing else to do, don't really want to play this game, or have already played it, then you can read this, I guess. 
 To be honest, this game was planned as a really short and simple dating sim with just Zoro. I never thought it would become as big as it is, with endless possibilities for expansion. It seems that I love One Piece a little bit too much. So it took me almost a year to complete this one route, as I had no experience in game development at all. But now, when I replay this game and think about how to expand it or make it better, I think it's worth it. So I'm going to keep working on it as much as I can. That's all I have to say... Dismissed! Go and do something useful.

title: The Return of Pluto
logline: Restore Pluto's planetary status!
description:
HOW TO PLAY: 
 Goal: Destroy all of Pluto's moons so that it can be considered a planet again.  
 If you die, you'll keep your upgrades and resources, so keep trying! 
 Press  and hold space to shoot Use the arrow keys or A/D to rotate your space ship Use left-shift to rotate more precisely Zoom in and out with the mouse wheel Press 'R' to open the shop Destroy blocks to collect resources. Use resources to purchase upgrades in the shop Don't run into the moon Look out for aliens! Once you've destroyed an entire planet, move on to the next one! Make Pluto a planet again! 
 ATTRIBUTIONS: 
 Everything was made by me in 1 week for the Chili Code Jam (#2) except for the following: 
 I made two of the music tracks a long time ago My 10-year-old son made the third track during the game jam. The main game font is from Google Fonts. 
 NOTE: 
 
 
 My apologies for not making this playable on the web.   I'm still trying to resolve the error that is preventing the web version to run.

title: DuoDash
logline: DuoDash game
description:
Escape the Crash: A Race Against Time 
 In this thrilling survival adventure, you play as Blue and Orange, the only survivors of a plane crash caused by a mysterious and unstable substance. After the crash, the duo is exposed to the dangerous energy of the substance, granting them the ability to dash at supersonic speeds. But thereâs a catch: the longer they stay near the wreckage, the more they risk being consumed by the negative effects of the substance.
  
 Now, they must race against time, dodging explosive dangers and fighting against the harmful forces within, to find safety before it's too late. Can you help them escape the wreck and make it to safety in record time?
  
 Challenge yourself to beat the clock and share your best times with us! How fast can you get away from the wreckage? Post your top scores and see if you can be the fastest survivor.

This project was going so well until i ran into build issues and had to lower a lot of settings, i'm honestly not happy with this result but i've learnt important lessons for future projects.

title: Rhythm Reckoning
logline: Master the rhythm, defeat the bosses, and save the world from eternal silence in this intense rhythm-based action game!
description:
ð  Rhythm Reckoning: The Beat of Battle  ð
 
 Step into a fast-paced rhythm-based action game where your timing and reflexes are put to the test!  Rhythm Reckoning  challenges you to defeat powerful bosses by completing Quick Time Events (QTEs) in sync with a dynamic soundtrack. The faster and more accurately you hit the notes, the stronger your attacks become. But beware—every missed beat weakens your defenses, and failure could cost you everything.
 
 ð®  Your Mission: 
 
 Fight : Press the correct keys ( A ,  S ,  D ,  F ) in time with the music to execute combos and deal damage to the boss. ð¹ð¥

 Win : Keep up with the rhythm until the boss's theme music reaches its climax. If you can survive until the song ends, you win! ð¶ð
 
 ð¥  Why Rhythm Reckoning? 
 
 Dynamic Boss Battles : Each boss has unique attack patterns, visual designs, and a theme song that evolves as the battle progresses. ðð¼
 Interactive Soundtrack : The music only plays when you interact with the QTE, creating a tense and immersive experience. ð¤«ð§
 Progressive Difficulty : As you defeat bosses, the game becomes more challenging, with longer combos, faster timers, and stronger enemies. ððª
 Stunning Visuals : Vibrant, dynamic visuals that react to your performance and the intensity of the battle. ðð
 
 ð®  Controls: 
 
 QTE System : Press  A ,  S ,  D , or  F  in sync with the music to execute combos. ð¹ð¯
 Health Management : Deplete the boss's health before yours runs out. Missing combos damages your health. â¤ï¸ð

title: ***IMMEDIATE HIRING*** Salvaged Property Assistant (Customer Experience)
description:
***IMMEDIATE HIRING*** Salvaged Property Assistant (Customer Experience) 
 Job Description 
 Andromeda Station  is seeking a highly motivated team player for our  S.P.A.C.E (Salvaged Property Assistant (Customer Experience))  position. This role reports to Terminal AEâs Lost and Found Counter on Floor -13 in a full time capacity, 88 hours a day/17 days a week.  Come join our stellar crew, in the greatest cosmic airspace on this side of the galaxy! 
 
 Responsibilities
 
 Must identify and deliver items to travelers in an instant.
 Must be fluent in every possible language that travelers may approach you with. Every single one.
 Must have a warm and friendly demeanor (non distinguishable facial features OK), as you will interact with countless intergalactic travelers.
 
 Qualifications
 
 Highly developed observational skills. Ability to listen with confidence and poise. Self-motivated, patient, and career oriented. Open-minded with a passion for learning a wide-range of skills that will carry through a variety of career paths. Naturally outgoing individual who thrives in human and alien interaction alike. MFA preferred. 
 Compensation
 
 What?
 
 APPLY AND START TODAY!

title: The Unleashing Longings
logline: Will you succumb your cravings or will you avoid the Hunger?
description:
Controls:  Just use the arrow keys. Have fun! (Tip: Control is key. So, don't go too slow nor too fast). 
 Story:  Follow the right path or succumb to your cravings. It's your choice. But I warn you, player. In the end, you will suffer the consequences of your decisions... Don't say I didn't warn you ;) 
 Background:  This short game is an attempt to merge microfiction, interactive fiction, and literary experiments for the "Strange Cravings" Trijam #313. The game can be played in 2-4 minutes maximum. It has 2 finals. 
 Note1:  I donÂ´t recomend to use the virtual pad on mobiles. Itâs poorly implemented becasuse of the short time and the controls of the virtual pad are extremely difficult to use. 
 Note2:  Collisions with walls don't stop momentum (I forgot to do that, hehe). So, to change direction, be careful if you hit walls at high speed ^^!!

title: Gladston Valley
logline: Small town. Disappearances. Love. Loss.
description:
â  CONTENT WARNINGS â   
  Gladston Valley is intended for  mature audiences , and includes:  
 explicit depictions of violence, gore and death
 strong language
 mild suggestive themes loud sounds, flashing images, and jump scares 
 The following list includes more specific triggers which may potentially be a spoiler for the game. The game is best played without spoilers but in case you want to be safe  click here .
 
 SYNOPSIS... 
 Two friends reunite amidst a disturbing string of murders in the small town of Gladston Valley. The crime scenes are gruesome, leading many of the townspeople to believe a monster lives in the valley. 
 Torches and pitchforks are drawn as the bloodshed feeds into a growing unrest. At the precipice of disaster, only Leo knows what is truly going on. 
 DEMO FEATURES
 
 Cinematic story with lots of CG's and cutscenes Horror/suspense/toxic romance ~8.4k words 
 Created in 2 months for  Monstrous Desires VN Jam 
 FULL GAME FEATURES
 
 Ending CG's, more polished art and GUI ~20k words
 2 Endings, impactful choices 
 CREDITS 
 Art, writing, programming: Ladymeowsith  
 SFX: Pixabay, UNIVERSFIELD, imagne_impossible, SoulProdMusic, Soul_Serenity_Ambience, Freesound.org, minecraftgamerlr

 Bomb Types 
 ð¥  Standard Bomb:  A regular explosion with a small blast radius.  âï¸  Ice Bomb:  Freezes everything in its blast radius for a few seconds.  ð¥  Fire Bomb:  Has a slightly larger explosion radius than the standard bomb.  â¡  Lightning Bomb:  The explosion travels instantly along open paths, hitting everything in its way.  ð£ð£ð£  Triple Bomb:  Places three bombs at once with the  largest  explosion radius!
  
 Power-Ups 
 Collect power-ups scattered across the map to upgrade your bombs! Once picked up, the next bomb you place will have  special abilities  before reverting to the standard bomb.
  
 Gameplay Features

title: Lost in Space
logline: You were left behind. How long will you survive?
description:
You've been left behind on a unpowered Space Station. The oxygen is depleting fast and there are things in the shadows... Find oxygen tanks  and  search for the exit of each level  while avoiding the extraterrestrial horrors.  How long can you survive? 
 Controls and Gameplay: - Arrows or WASD to move the camera - Mouse wheel to zoom in and out - Right Click to Move - Left Click to shoot - Esc to pause -  Blue bar  represents   oxygen and keeps depleting. - Red bar  represents health and decreases  when damaged Credits - Tilemap and spritesfrom  https://trevor-pupkin.itch.io/ - Fonts from  https://amorphous.itch.io/  and  https://ggbot.itch.io - UI from  https://wenrexa.itch.io/ - Shaders from  https://godotshaders.com - Some sound effects from  https://pixabay.com/ - Soundtrack from  DDM Known Bugs - The levels are almost ok, but the mapping is far from 100%, so there are some strange wall generation. - The Aliens and pickups (oxygen) are also sometimes spawn inside the walls or too close to the starting point. - The dark empty floors are not colliding. - There is some problem with the menu shaders, maybe something about GLES3 web support. - Sometimes the Alien animations do not work propperly and sometimes the explosion does not affect the player. Notes - The aim was to learn Godot Tilemaps, procedural generation of levels, pathfinding and better understand shaders. - The original idea was play with a squad, and not only one character. - The aliens can see a close space, hear a larger area, but the original idea was for them to also smell and follow the path of the character.

title: RoC-eX: Robotic Cave Explorer
logline: Unearth the truth about what happened in cave system #0393
description:
RoC-eX: Robotic Cave Explorer 
 Dive into the experience of piloting a robotic scout  through what appears to be an ancient cave system leading down to the  centre of the Earth. With the help of advanced sensors, guide your robot  explorer along dark tunnels and caverns, avoiding obstacles, collecting  relics of aeons past and, hopefully, discover what happened to its  predecessor.
  
 We hope playing the game will teach you about how sensors  work, how they are used in reality and perhaps give a glimpse into the  mind of the robot. With luck, this can show how exciting it can be to  work in robotics!  
 Mickey Li, Julian Hird, G. Miles, Valentina Lo Gatto, Alex Smith and WeiJie Wong (most from the  FARSCOPE CDT   programme of the University of Bristol and the University of the West  of England) have created this educational game as part of the  UKRAS festival of Robotics 2021 .  The game has been designed to teach you about how sensors work, how  they are used in reality and perhaps give a glimpse into the mind of the  robot. With luck, this game can show how exciting it can be to work in  robotics.
  
 As the authors suggest, you can check out the DARPA Subterranean Challenge  (video)   (website)  (not affiliated) for an example of the real life version of this game.
  
 The game is hosted on  this website .  The site is secured and no data is collected when playing the game  (apart from if you decide to fill in the anonymous feedback form). The  source code for the game is available open source  here on Github . Enjoy!
 
 A talk from Professor Jonathtan Rossitor and Dr Mickey Li with some background to the game and a game walkthrough as part of UKRAS 2021 is available here:  
 
 Extending the game 
 
 This game is build using the  Godot Engine . Simply clone or download the zip of the project and open up using the godot editor.
  
 License 
 
 This project is licensed under the MIT License. See  License  for further details. We just ask that you link back to the original game!

title: The Awakening of The Bleak Dimension
description:
This is a Demo version.  Final version will be released soon. 
 
 Travel through six distinct areas, each with its own unique biome and enemies, in a journey filled with dangers and rewards. To progress, youâll need to strengthen your character in two ways: 
 Leveling up by defeating enemies. 
 Forging powerful equipment by finding blueprints hidden in chests. 
 Each new area is more challenging than the last, requiring strategy and preparation to face the terrors of the Bleak Dimension. 
 
 
 The Camp serves as the game's central HUB, where youâll find NPCs offering essential services for your journey. Here, you can: 
 Upgrade equipment. 
 Enhance your healing Elixir. 
 Swap characters as needed. 
 
 
 Choose from three distinct combat styles: 
 Melee 
 Ranged 
 Magic 
 The game features nine characters, three from each class. Initially, only three are available, while the others can be unlocked by meeting certain conditions. 
 
 
 Venture out to find rare blueprints hidden in chests and bring them to the blacksmith at the Camp to craft new gear. Loot prioritizes items for your current class, ensuring continuous and efficient progression. Available equipment includes: 
 Swords 
 Staves 
 Bows 
 Shields 
 Armor 
 Accessories 
 As you collect all blueprints from an area, chests will start offering gear for other classes, encouraging exploration of new regions. 
 
 
 The Elixir is your main healing resource and can be enhanced with crystals collected throughout your journey. Use the Alchemy Table at the Camp to increase both healing potency and maximum charges. 
 
 
 Each new piece of equipment forged unlocks a unique skin to customize your character. Weapon skins are earned by crafting specific weapons, while character skins are unlocked by completing armor sets. 
 
 Face increasingly brutal challenges, uncover hidden secrets, and become the hero who will seal the Bleak Dimension forever! Are you ready for this journey?

title: Project Crow
logline: A 4 Key Rhythm Game
description:
What is Project Crow? 
 Project Crow is a solo-developed proof of concept 4-key rhythm game intended to support both built-in maps and user-created levels.  
 This project was conceived as an experiment in creating a fully-traditional rhythm game to contrast with previous projects rhythm-game adjacent game play. It also serves an exploration of the usage of FMOD in rhythm games and how it can be leveraged to play both music from pre-built banks and user files. 
 How can I adjust my game? 
 Project Crow support several quality of life features such as note speed adjustment, offset adjustment, and controller rebinds. These options can be found in the settings menu, which can be opened via the ESC key in the main menu or by pressing the Options button. These settings can be reset via the System Panel. 
 How does importing work? 
 Project Crow loads .crow files from the Import Folder of the game.  This folder is located in the AppData\LocalLow folder under WarspitefulGames/ProjectCrow.  Alternatively, while in-game, the system panel in the settings menu contains a button for opening directly to this directory.  
 An example file has been provided below the game download to demo. After downloading ClearBlueSkies.crow,  drag the file into the Import folder. You must close the game and re-open for new imports to be processed. 
 What are the future plans? 
 The goal of this project was to have a prototype ready for GDC 2025. As such, there are a few items of interest that are planned but were cut for scope at this current iteration. Hold notes are the next immediate interest. Following that, the next step for this project is the creation of a charter, intended to remove dependence on external programs for mapping. Once this is complete, 6K key support will be provided as the limitation for this comes from the mapping side rather than the implementation side. 
 Additional Notes: 
 Music has been graciously provided by provided by dante gofar and  Eric R Franklin   ( Bluesky ), re-used from an old Game Jam in 2023.

title: Color Match Memory
logline: How fast can you complete the puzzle?
description:
https://medium.com/@tmaurodot/creating-color-match-memory-a-journey-in-game-deve... 
 Here's a brief description you can share: 
 Updates for my memory match game. Iâve just added three timed difficulty modes (Easy, Medium, Hard) and a chill Free Play mode with no timer—perfect for relaxing or challenging yourself. Iâm super excited to share this update with you. Play, and letâs see if you can beat Hard (60 sec). 
 How to Play "Color Match Memory" 
 Objective  Match all 8 pairs of colored cards as quickly as you can! 
 Instructions 
 Start the Game : Click the "Start Game" button to begin. Youâll hear the menu music fade out and game music kick in. 
 Flip Cards : Click any card to flip it, revealing its color. Click another to try for a match. 
 Match or Miss :  
 If the colors match, the cards stay flipped. 
 If they donât, they flip back after a brief pause. 
 
 Win : Find all 8 pairs to win! Youâll see "You Win!" with your time (e.g., "Time: 32.15 seconds"), hear a victory sound, and watch the cards disappear. 
 Loop Back : A 10-second countdown starts, then the "Start Game" button returns for another round. 
 
 Controls 
 Just a mouse or touch input—click away! 
 Who Itâs For 
 "Color Match Memory" is a game for almost anyone: 
 Casual Players : Itâs simple to pick up, with no complex rules—just click and match. 
 Kids : The bright colors and straightforward gameplay make it a fun brain teaser for young minds. 
 Puzzle Fans : If you love memory challenges or classic card games, this offers a quick, satisfying fix. 
 Speedrunners : Beat your own time or challenge friends to find all pairs faster. 
 Developers : Aspiring coders can see how a small game comes together—check it out as inspiration! 
 
 Itâs perfect for a five-minute break or a lazy afternoon. Whether youâre 5 or 95, thereâs something here to enjoy.

title: Ping Out !
description:
Overview  
 Ping Out ! est un jeu de ping-pong tactique au tour par tour oÃ¹ les joueurs planifient leur stratÃ©gie et mouvements en essayant dâanticiper ceux de l'adversaire, le tout avec une esthÃ©tique mignonne et minimaliste.
 
 PrÃ©sentation du sujet 
 
 Aymric ERADES est un scientifique travaillant sur la collecte de donnÃ©es de match de tennis de table pour aprÃ¨s traitement, prÃ©sentÃ© Ã  un entraÃ®neur des tactiques efficace en fonction dâun opposant spÃ©cifique.
 
 But de notre jeu 
 
 Ping Out ! est un jeu minimaliste qui souhaite montrer au joueur que le tennis de table nâest pas quâune affaire de performance physique, mais aussi dâun dÃ©ploiement dâune stratÃ©gie sous forme d'enchaÃ®nement de frappe spÃ©cifique et rÃ©flÃ©chie dÃ©pendant de son adversaire.
 
 Comment jouer  
 
 Dans Ping Out ! tout se passe avec la souris et dans un  temps donnÃ© par les frappes de son adversaire.
 
 Lorsque son adversaire effectue une frappe, la balle est projetÃ©e avec plus ou moins de vitesse de son cÃ´tÃ© de la table. Le joueur devra profiter de ce temps plus ou moins important. Le joueur devra cliquer sur les cases adjacentes Ã  son personnage et ainsi se positionner pour rÃ©ceptionner la balle. Attention car chaque clic fera avancer la balle ! 
 
 Une fois bien positionnÃ© le joueur pour choisir de frapper en coup droit ou alors en revers, lÃ  encore si le joueur dÃ©cide de se positionner en coup droit ou en revers cela fera avancer la balle.
 
 Une fois positionnÃ© et que le joueur a dÃ©cidÃ© sâil voulait frapper en coup droit ou en revers le joueur dÃ©cide du type de frappe. 
 
 Toutes les frappes ne se valent pas ! Directement tirÃ©s de la vÃ©ritable technique du tennis de table Ping Out ! introduit 3 types de frappe : 
 
 Le  TopSpin , laisse peu de temps de rÃ©action Ã  lâadversaire, trÃ¨s efficace si lâadversaire utilise un  CoupÃ© , mais facilement contrable avec un  Block 
 Le  CoupÃ© , une frappe qui permet de contrer efficacement le  Block , mais nâest pas adaptÃ© face Ã  une frappe  TopSpin 
 Le  Block  est une frappe dÃ©fensive, parfaite pour rÃ©agire rapidement face Ã  un  TopSpin , mais dÃ©muni devant les frappes  CoupÃ©es . 
 
 Pour chaque frappe utilisÃ©e dans le bon timing et contre la bonne frappe le joueur fera monter sa jauge de âSMASH !â, une fois celle-ci complÃ¨tement  remplie, le joueur effectue automatiquement un smash et remporte le match
 
 Mais attention, pour chaque frappe mal choisie et dans le mauvais timing câest la jauge de smash de lâadversaire qui se remplira… 
 Team  
 
 Aymeric ERADES, Nicolas ASRI, Doris MOCANU, Lisa RANAIVOSON, Arthur DELEYE, Camille SABY, Tristan WALGER, LÃ©o ARTHAUD.

title: Strange Cravings
logline: Roll Around And Cultivate Mass At The Park

title: The Lost Temple of Gold (Atari 8 Bit) by Eric Carr
logline: [BASIC 10Liner 2025] [EXTREM-256]
description:
The Lost Temple of Gold - BASIC 10Liner Contest 2025 
 Author:   Eric Carr 
 Language: FastBasic 4.7 
 Platform: Atari 8-bit 
 Category: EXTREM-256 
 Video:  
 Requirements: 
   - Atari 8-bit 800/XL/XE or Altirra/Atari800 emulator 
   - Joystick 
 =================>> About <<================ 
 This is a puzzle adventure game, inspired by the PC DOS game Paganitzu. It includes five room designs borrowed from the original game plus new rooms of my own design, to form a mini adventure that will fit in a 10-liner. 
 =================>> Story <<================ 
 You finally have found it - the hidden entrance to the fabled LOST TEMPLE OF GOLD! If the rumors are true, a vast mountain of gold awaits you at the deepest chamber of the temple.  
 Unfortunately, danger lurks around every corner! Relying on only your wits and quick reflexes, can you navigate through all of the obstacles and reach the fabled treasure?  
 Only time will tell. Good luck! 
 ===========>> Starting the game <<=========== 
 Start the game by booting TEMPLE.ATR or TEMPLE.XEX 
 ===============>> Game play <<=============== 
 - Use the joystick to move your player around the room. 
 - Your goal is to collect all of the gold bars. This reveals a door. 
 - Enter the door to advance to the next room. 
 - If you get stuck, press [R] to restart the current room. 
 - If you die, the room will restart. 
 - You have unlimited lives, due to unexplainable temple magic. 
 =================>> TIPS! <<================= 
 - If you are stuck in a room and just can't seem to figure out how to proceed, remember this tip: the humble boulder is key to solving most of the puzzles. Try to think outside the box and interact with items in different ways. There is always a solution, sometimes two! 
 ==============>> Tools Used <<=============== 
 - FastBasic 4.7 Cross Compiler - Compile BASIC to XEX 
    https://github.com/dmsc/fastbasic/releases/tag/v4.7 
 - Visual Studio Code - Editing the .BAS file 
    https://code.visualstudio.com/download 
 - FastBasic Debugger for VSCode Extension (I wrote it to help debug FastBasic) 
    https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=EricCarr.fastbasic-debugger 
 - Atari FontMaker - Defining chars as block sprites 
    http://matosimi.websupport.sk/atari/atari-fontmaker/ 
 - Altirra 
    https://www.virtualdub.org/altirra.html

title: SoundSpace+/Rhythia Clone
logline: Aim to songs
description:
Gameplay: 
 Aim to music on and off the 3x3 grid. Reverse engineered from Rhythia ( https://www.rhythia.com ), a community driven project inspired by the roblox game soundspace, originally known as blox saber. I haven't picked up any Godot so I recreated it in Unity. Missing most customization settings and still in basic stage so it can be adapted. My intent is to convert this project into a VR dance game that utilizes two foot cursors for controls, and the freeform reading style of Rhythia replacing a traditional dance mat. This strikes me as something that hasn't been explored by VR dance games like dance dash or feet saber, and I think it could have some fun mechanics worth developing. I plan to post progress of that project soon, and will link it here  as it's updated. 
 Controls: 
 Mouse: Aim 
 Click: Select

 Kaputt O.S.  is a 2D shooter where you help a quirky and  totally  trustworthy installation assistant install the cutting-edge  Kaputt O.S.  on your computer.
  
 Battle through a system swarming with  corrupt files, firewalls, and suspiciously aggressive security programs.  Explore its deepest corners, avoid  accidental  deletions, and reach the  Kernel  to finalize the installation…  forever.

title: Do the Units (Week 4 - Puzzle Box - No Combat)
logline: Do the Units is a relaxing puzzle game with a dynamic grid. Solve puzzles, undo actions, and manage space, no combat.
description:
" Do the Units " is a dynamic and engaging puzzle game created in Unity, developed as part of the Week 4 assignment in the Rapid Game Prototyping course. The game features a grid-based system where players interact with units to solve puzzles, manage resources, and avoid game-over scenarios. With intuitive mechanics, undo functionality, and a clean user interface, this puzzle box game provides a relaxing yet challenging experience. The game is built around the theme  "Puzzle Box"  and the modifier  "No Combat" , offering players a serene puzzle-solving experience without the need for combat or fast-paced action. 
 Key Features:
  
   Dynamic Grid System : Units are spawned and placed on a grid, requiring strategic thinking to solve puzzles.
  Undo Action : Reverse moves when you make a mistake to keep solving without penalty.
  No Combat : A relaxing puzzle experience with no combat mechanics, focused purely on problem-solving.
  Clean UI : An intuitive, easy-to-use interface to navigate the game.
  Sound Effects : Relaxing sounds and background music enhance the player experience.
  
 Dive into the world of puzzles with " Do the Units " and test your logic skills while enjoying a calming, no-combat gaming experience!

title: ReConnect IV
logline: Greatly expanded four-in-a-line gameplay!
description:
MAY TAKE A MOMENT TO LOAD 
 ReConnect IV is a remake of the classic Four-In-A-Row game, now featuring several new modes and options to enhance the overall gameplay! All new additions are listed below. 
 This game is more focused on the gameplay styles than being an overall polished video game, so don't expect any animations or sound effects. 
 New Additions: 
 Five game styles :
 Normal: traditional 4-in-a-line gameplay. 
 Grav: in addition to dropping tokens from the top, you can now drop them from the left. Any tokens dropped from the left will "drop" to the right, ignoring gravity. Duel: rather than dropping tokens from the top, you can drop them from either the left or right, with a centre line acting as a gravity source. Elim: traditional 4-in-a-line gameplay, but when a row or column is filled it gets cleared from the board. Slots: traditional 4-in-a-line gameplay, but every turn the columns are spun like slots in a slot machine. Increased player count : Rather than being limited to the traditional 1v1 gameplay, ReConnect IV features up to  24 players . The board size scales with the number of players. Evil mode : Togglable on or off, in evil mode rather than the sole winner being the first to get 4-in-a-line, that person is the  sole loser . Works best with low player counts, or in Slots style. 
 Credits & Assets 
 Programmed by Donian Designed by Donian Ivy Hedge Ivy Leaf Kenney Fonts Lora Font FreeSans Font Medieval Sharp Font

title: The Paths is Clear
logline: Clear the paths, gather resources, and survive nightly raids.
description:
You inherited an old cabin deep in the woods from a distant relative. With only 10 days before your vacation ends, you must clear the overgrown paths, gather resources, and fend off nightly monster raids. Chop, craft, survive—can you finish in time? 
 
 How to Play: 
   Move:  WASD / Arrow Keys
  Chop trees, gather fruits, and break stones:  Left Mouse Click
  Interact with the bed and crafting bench:  Left Mouse Click
  P:  Pause/Unpause M:  Mute song 
 Your  energy  is shown in the top left corner. Some actions consume energy—recover it by sleeping in the bed.
  
 At  night , survive enemy attacks.
  
 You have  limited arrows —craft more at the crafting bench before heading to bed!

title: Planet Miner
description: Head up to the terminal to start! Unfortunately losing doesn't reset the game properly, so just refresh the page and you should be good to go! *If you're having issues placing turrets, make sure you have enough currency and click a spot on the map in the corner before buying!* Defend your sentient mining ship from aliens trying to stop you from extracting the sweet sweet resources from their home planet by shooting and building defenses.

title: Plush Rangers
logline: Adorable Plushie friends and mutated hordes in this fast paced auto-battler/Survivors-like.
description:
Assemble your team of adorable Plushie friends and lead them against mutated hordes in this fast paced auto-battler/Survivors-like. Collect relics, earn merit badges, discover secrets, rescue friends and take out the trash. Portal across the park's many biomes, visit challenge levels and more are coming to the game! Can you defeat the growing menace of the evil Mother Ducker? 
 Plush Rangers is currently in a pre-alpha state. The current functionality shows the core gameplay loop and the art style we are aiming for. We are releasing new builds almost daily (that can possibly break!). Please share any feedback or ideas. 
 
 We will be announcing more details on the official demo and upcoming timeline soon! 
 
 
 CONTROLS 
 Keyboard/Mouse 
 Move -  WASD/Cursor Dash -  Space/Right mouse button 
 Gamepad 
 Move -  Left stick Dash -  B (XBox)

title: Preston's Hourglass 2: Prestons Personal Hell
logline: Time. Twas. Ticking.
description:
You are once renowned researcher Preston Ramirez, Creator of a device called âThe Hourglass.â Through the past 40 years, youâve been fast asleep, and your mind is one fucked up place... 
 
 Do you recall all those people you killed? How your wife left? The process of building the "Hourglass?" Well, one thing is for sure... 
 
 You fucking ruined it all, and now the manifestation of your anger and murderous tendencies, Psycheston, is planning to take over. 
 
 Collect all 8 remnants of your memory to escape your slumber, but beware, sometimes your mind can be the most dangerous catacomb of all. 
 
 Cast: 
 Psycheston voiced by Himself 
 'Preston's Ex-Wife' voiced by InterpretConnor 
 
 Now that it's been a day, I'll make this clear: This mod was not made by Dreadful Studios and was purposefully designed to be as hoax-ish as possible. This mod was actually made by Canhead Studios/Fan The Can and was made both in hopes of showing that Preston still has interest in it, but also to send a love letter to the original game (Link Here:  https://dreadfulstudio.itch.io/prestons-hourglass )
